review: Grand Theft Auto V evolves nearly every mechanic that was in the previous Grand Theft Auto games. As far as driving goes the vehicles have been greatly improved with Rockstar running more complex physics on them. The cars can even hold to the ground slightly better. The driving mechanics feel more like a racing game particularly the Midnight Club series compared to Grand Theft Auto IV's rocky boat like handling system. The shooting mechanics are better in terms of the feel of the mechanics and larger compared to the melee mechanics in the game but that doesn't mean that the melee combat won't be fun as it as been improved over the previous titles as well. Weapon selection has now also been changed. Instead of the old way of selecting through all the weapons there is now a Weapon Wheel which is similar to the one featured in Red Dead Redemption another game made by Rockstar Games. Grand Theft Auto V draws inspirations from many different Rockstar titles in the past including Max Payne 3 Midnight Club Manhunt and Red Dead Redemption.There are many unique features in the game one of those features is that when the players are playing as one of three protagonists in the game the other two are out living their independent daily lives and you will be surprised by what you find the characters doing when you switch back into them. Another unique feature is that the character swapping feature is executed in a Google Earth styled manner and was displayed during a Game Informer demo which was showed to have ran smoothly and without lag. The PC PS4 and Xbox One versions present an exclusive feature the first person mode The whole game can be played through the eyes of the protagonist. This gameplay mode presents a whole new way to play the game. Cars have detailed interiors different from one another shooting is like that of an FPS game.New activities have been added such as yoga triathlons jet skiing parachuting tennis golf and scuba diving. Random events have also been added to the game and can appear any time while the player is exploring the map. The mobile phone has returned from Grand Theft Auto IV but is now only used for calling the player's contacts surfing the web and quick saving. Giving people the middle finger is another new feature the player can use while in a vehicle (which Rockstar recommended you do in various locations around Los Santos to see the outcome of this effect depending on where the player is at they will get different reactions from pedestrians).Rockstar has also made changes to the pedestrian mechanics some pedestrians can be seen at the bus stops in East Los Santos and the same people can reappear in Rockford Hills working in the gardens of the opulent mansions. Some minor mechanics that help convey the environment and appearance of Los Santos occur at certain times of day such as a sprinkler system being turned on in the morning in wealthy areas like Morningwood.The map is larger than Grand Theft Auto San Andreas Grand Theft Auto IV and Red Dead Redemption combined. After some calculations by members of GawdAlmighty.com that would equal to around 27.5 square miles/71.2 km2 when land and sea are combined.

Spawn system is . Killed a guy multiple times only to have him spawn 30 seconds away and had to try and kill him again until eventually he blew me away.Gameplay was average graphics were excellent and the cars looked dope. Save yourself some money and wait the 2 3 weeks before this bad boy gets a special.

review: Its GTA unless you've been under a rock for the past 20 years you've probably got a good idea what your getting and the game its self is a work of art and is Excellent but here are my bad points some of which really ruin the experience.The loading screens I bet at least a third of my game time has been taken up by loading screens feeding me adverts while I wait for the matchmaking to commence...The rewards apart from the latest heist most of the rewards are pretty mediocre specially when the time to load the missions(or get back into the world after) is taken into account making it a lot more time consuming to make any real income or to just get the basic fun factor of the game.Timers part of the rewards complaint I guess but these have made me turn the game off and walk away so many times I bought the car business let me sell however many I want without a 20minute cooldown between each sale you even have to wait if your sale fails! I had to go and steal them all I don't see the need to limit my fun selling them and once again ruin my game experience and if the timers were removed the rewards part wouldn't be so bad...Leader boards I don't understand why most of the people on them have not been banned with all the 1second race times! they should be scrapped! Stat recording/viewing on profiles should be reconsidered as well since R* can't manage cheaters very well it would be less incentive for them the explode lobbies if they didn't have a k/d to pad out and keep track of...And back to Timers! they don't even reset when you leave the game for a bit and return please end this madness lazy people will still be lazy people and buy your sharkcards and you'll end up with more people playing for longer instead of just logging in selling a car and then ing off to do something else because the cool down for no reason has spoiled the game.To the people that say well sell a crate while you wait I don't want to do crates I don't want to do coke or weed or guns I like selling cars in free roam and these timers are only in place to try and increase sales instead they players off and ruin what should of been one of the best experiences online. Saddest part if we got a little more for our money and the game wasn't ruined in my opinion by the above I would of probably bought a shark when Doomsday came out because it really was great content and that deserves our support. But crippling our progression to try and entice us into buying cards no thank you and it will only end in people in the end leaving the game and your brand.

review: SummaryName Grand Theft Auto VCreator Rockstar StudiosPrice $70Micro Transactions YesIn a Series YesGenre Action AdventureSub Genre Third person ShooterGraphic Style 3DSounds ExcellentReplayable Yes 10/10Long ReviewGrand Theft Auto V is a huge open world game that runs in a series of amazing games that have been poraised by many reviewers. GTA V as its commonly reffered to has endless replayability with a campoaing that goes for tens of hours and other events that will keep you attached to the gtame for what feels like forever. It also has a high amount of customization with a detailed car customization a h8uge range of clothes haircuts tattoos and gyms and other activities to increase your skill or ability in certain areas. As well as there being an amazing single play mode there is also and online multiplayer mode. GTA Online is an equally as fun mode where you can group up with your friends in 16 player lobbies and do lots of cool and fun activities from grocery store robberies to races to different jobs and even full scale heists which takes time to set up. GTA V is one of the best games ive ever played and would highly recommend this game to anyone who can afford it or run it.

review: I am glad that the development team decided to go all out on this port and put themselves in the shoes of their characters! Watch as they rob you off your money when you realize that this game is as buggy as a rotting corpse. You will get problems such as crashing due to 'Failed Initialization' Saving failed Rockstar services are currently unavailable and the classic 'Request timed out'. Then watch them help other companies rob you more off your money by requiring a ridiculous amount of memory that a poor man's 8gb RAM cannot handle. Then if you feel like they haven't molested your wallet enough watch them drain the life out of your credit card by selling you ridiculously expensive 'shark cards' that will quickly go down the drain after buying your first high end apartment and luxury car. Or you can grind your way through the heists which is plagued with glitches random headshots troll eight year olds and... lahhhggggggg. But hey at least they promised to fix it later right? Right?But if multiplayer is not for you then feel no despair for this game also sports a single player sandbox with an engaging story line. You may play as Michael de Santa an American dude with a disfunctional family and rob people of their money or play as Franklin an African American dude with a disfunctional family and rob people of their money. But if those two feel too tame for you you may plas Trevor Philips a crazy Canadian dude with no family and rob people of their money. Feel free to feel anxious about the heists that the game promised the players will be free to do however they choose. Then feel free to feel betrayed as those heists hold your hand through a scripted set of predictable events that you totally have no control over. But if those heists don't do it for you there are fun side activities like parachuting racing and the extremely weird Strangers and Freaks side missions that feel like they ripped off from Saints Row. Annnd there are also some action packed activities like doing yoga towing cars for a living and watching movies by yourself!Look at all the properties you will only be able to buy at the end of the game when you're finally rich due to the money you get from all your heists unless you play the stocks market. Watch how Rock Star teach you how to make it big in the stock market by killing your competition destroying the products of your competition or downloading an app that tells you exactly what time to sell your stocks.So join Michael Trevor and Franklin in turning the city of Los Santos into a hell hole filled with robbery murder mass murder genocide homicide arson torture and drugs. Or create your own ugly character and join a million other people turn Los Santos into a hell hole filled with robbery murder mass murder genocide homicide arson drugs and laahhhhggg. Give Us Money V! Oh look i'm about to finish Pacific Standard! 1.25m babyyy... wait what? Failed Initialization?! F***! F***! F***! Fix this s***! You shark selling c***s! C*** sucking g****rds!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Open World (The game features a large map bigger then Red Dead Redemption and GTA IV's map together!)Cons Plenty of crude humor (unless you like that sort of thing.) review: I am done pretending this game is okay it's not and people only like it because it is "Edge theft Auto". Let's start with the Online aspect. It's an abomination not because it is nopt a fun mode well I guess that is why. It's not fun because the community is well you thought the community on "Call of duty" was bad? This AMPS IT UP! No one does missions they simply go and kill low level characters with Miniguns and the other OP weapons Rockstar decided to give their jackass online community. Please either make the weapons open for everyone and quit making players have to level just so they can get some overpowered weapons. They can get tanks and bomber jets. Which equals your game being ruined. The community is the RUDEST I have seen since "Counter strike GO" sexism racism hackers and much more.I shot a guy in the head with TWO clips from an AK47 before he died I WAS POINT BLANK SHOOTING HIS HEAD and it took two clips to kill him. The hacking is REAL in this game You can NO LONGER mod which was the only saving grace to this garbage franchise. 3/10 for the online. To me the story is the typical "Let's be criminals" mantra and that crap.I can't even beat the second mission it's just uninteresting without mods. 3/10 for the edgefest story. Rockstar was MUCH EDGY with this game. Don't buy this unloess you are max level online if you plan on playing online. I know I will get thumbs down but thios game is just. The online would be fun if not for A.) The community.B.) The hackers.C.) The trolls who DO NOTHING but ruin the game for others and laugh like the subhuman mongrel they are.D.) Just not fun with mods being banned. Mods would of been the reason I kept this. How do I end my EULA I want a refund.

review: Really don't see why people are complaining about this not being on sale during the Monster sale. This was just released and most new releases dont get discounted during steam sales they did extend the extra ingme money with the Shark cards which isnt a bad thing. This is a fantastic game that the PC community waited a very long time for. Rockstar did an incredible job of optimizing this and it looks and plays great even on lower end PC's. Singleplayer is really fun with a great story and with 3 main characters it never gets dull. Online does have its challenges with the assorted griefers out there but if it gets annoying you can always find another session or even play solo in the online campain and still be able to level up and make money. Only complaint i have is sometimes it does get a little laggy online but its torrerable. Big thanks to Rockstar for finally bringing this to the PC. If your a GTA fan this is a must buy if you never played a GTA game before this is a good one to get you hooked on the series. Highly recommended!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Please wait....... a little more.... loading review.......... loading story review....Oh you didn't want a story review you wanted to jump into online you must of mashed buttons in frustration or picked up your controller and nudged one this is story review...And its crap. The plot is so awful. A beautiful world and everything is so so so so so dull until Trevor arrives on the scene. Who cares about Michael and his family home. You want to shoot his kids and this is GTA ffs. You can't shoot them? No one would put up with their crap. What a Franklin only really here to cling on to some old San Andreas Grove street roots. And I hated Grove Street. Trevor is just ... well you'll see. But story mode is playable. Without a doubt. It is a great way to see this sandbox and how beautiful it is. Flying over it looking down at the houses. You will see that the guy who was copy and pasting house models was fired. It would be hard to find two similar houses in Los Santos. The detail is rather incredible. And I completed this twice on PS3 before coming to the PC version and seeing even more extras to detail it is impressive.But... loading.... Joining friends / crew server.....Looking for friends.... no friends.... Loading joining friends / crew.... Entering Solo Online.... what even is solo online... loading....Failed to join server....Joining friends server .... getting server info..... joining server timed out....Loading.... bored.... joined friends server... finally we can start to play online...You may of gathered there are plenty of load screens. But once you are in you can play for a time and have plenty of fun the amount of missions / heists etc is where this game does excel and keep you from boredom. Because there is nothing more stupid than being in a game where someone is in an armored car shooting at you and you can't do much back. But you will play with friends / crew members and then you will go to freemode to take a break and muck about or restart some missions because all you are being offered is death matches and races but you won't be in the same server and god knows you are going to be seeing 5 loading screens before you can get back to each other or not at all.Or you will be in a loading screen forever like limbo while you wait for everyone else to come out of theirs because yours seems to be hanging until they have all made it back to a server...And this has to be why the connections are so bad and you are desyncing so much watching people plough into car after car but they swear they have hit nothing the entire time except that wall where finally everything resyncs...The whole character transfer idea is awful. What A hole thought that up? Maybe in 3 months allow that when some people have gone from level 0 100 or w/e. But to let people start at 100+ so they everything? unlocked? Way to ruin the playing field. Saw one guy at level 1000 already.One thing I think is missing is crew cribs. I mean why would you want to all have a different appartment I would rather one crew crib where you have earn ya money and do it up rather than Rockstar making a few "IKEA" furnished homes. Of course then they would have to make a Bed Bath and Beyond Walmart where we could buy or steal goods from.

review: The only reason I'm buying this game is because it's actually have large modding community and currently the best GTA game Rockstar has ever produced I was heart broken when I heard that they banned modding and OpenIV slightly relieved when they just recently unbanned them because of fan backlash this left me speechless because this is the first time I aware that Rockstar/Take Two doesn't have a very friendly terms with the modding community and the majority of the GTA community as I thought they would be. From what I played that's true of almost everyone said that this is the best and most "realistic" GTA game that Rockstar had produced the content are very polished and you can spend a lot of time playing it further more being the very better and improved succesor of GTA SA and GTAIV and the story telling and other new mechanics and features are absolutely great and refreshing. But the only reason I became addicted to the games is modding I've been playing GTA games with various mods since GTA SA and GTAIV various mods that change the script and models of the games for your personal pleasing(although I prefer lore friendly mods so I don't go crazy on changing models. The mods personally I'm using usually are mods that make game more realsitic like Euhporia natural motion Overhaul Mod or NPC's of Lost Santos mod. It's not just an addition it's an extra polishment to the game that you always needs the moding in PC games has been my thing for TES series(Especially Skyrim) L4D2 Half Life 2 Garry's mod and other Soucemods it adds endless possibiity and endless more hours of addictive gameplay contributed by the creative and talented communities of gamming and modding that's why Steam created workshops for some games just for that reason(in fact some games are created because of the creativity of modding like Team Fortress 2 being the very succesion of a Quake's mod but that's another story). Anyway GTAIV and GTA SA being 2 the main foundation of GTAV(also with other Rockstar games) GTA SA being the concept and features while GTAIV sharing the Rage engine and features with additional original concepts that our latest GTA game itself excels combine into wonderful speciment of what we called "Grand Theft Auto V" even better that GTA SA GTAIV and GTAV both having a very large modding communities and mods. As for GTA Online haven't played it yet so I can't make a review on it I'm not expecting anything from it though.

review: LOVE this game! The Singleplayer campaign is worth it alone with enjoyable characters fun quests and the ability to just roam around and do what you want. The hilarious character of Trevor Phillips is reason enough to play a lovable psychopath with a heart of (tarnished) gold and the BEST dialogue.Online has its issues with the modders/cheaters/script kiddies(skiddies) always one step ahead of the anti cheat program but it is still a blast to play. Whether you enjoy pvping or PvEing with others it has everything Heists Races Death Matches customizing your own vehicles and weapons and more. They're always adding fun content from Bunkers with weaponized vehicles to Hangars with meticulously detailed aircraft.And don't believe the people crying about false bans. It simply doesn't happen. Just skiddies crying about being banned for cheating but not owning up to it.BUY THIS GAME!

review: Let me start by saying that I'm sort of a paranoid. When I saw all the claims on steam reviews about the ban I told myself I couldn't risk buying this game that I will somehow get banned. So then I started investigating as the computer scientist that I am and realised many things. I even went to the point of writing to RS themselves to ask a few questions about their system and make a few clarifications. Most of these claims are false. While false positive did happen (rarely) RS recognized their mistakes and rolled back the ban. All the "trigger" from the automated system are checked by a human check statistics and check how money the person makes compared to missions play time and many paramaters. So trust me all those claims on steam about being banned for nothing are falsed. They either modded themselves or begged modders for One of the best advices I can give you is lookup on the net as there is a list of programs's overlay that might trigger a false positive althought they are probably working on a fix for that. (Some programs includes Discord's overlay MSI afterburner's overlay FRAPS (and other recording programs) and a few others)Now GTA V is a great game. An awesome game sandbox style with a lot of freedom and many hours of replay value. But when you jump in the online world the awesomeness of GTA V really shines. With litteraly HUNDREDS of things to do constant updates and fixes and EVERY update being free it's understandable why it's one of the best title out there. Okay you'll find the occasional griefer or bored high level who will just kill you for fun but you can easily overcome that by changing sessions and there is many nice and helpful people around. This game is great especially with friends. 10/10 would recommend! 11/10 can't stop playing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It took me just under 40 hours to complete the main story with a couple of side quests done (all of Michael's and a few for the others) which is a pretty decent amount of time. The story itself doesn't feel as involved as with previous titles however and the pacing is something that I didn't really enjoy. For example you don't earn any meaningful amount of money until the final heist of the game which you can then invest via stock market manipulation doing assassination side missions. To me good pacing would've had half of the story trying to earn and the other half having the characters already made something of themselves. Getting a pile of money at the end of the game after the story and turning it into a bigger pile of money just isn't very enticing as there's no drive.That said it's still a solid Grand Theft Auto title with decent graphics (minus the forced blur during cutscenes regardless of settings) and lots to do. If you like sandbox games with a little story on the side then this game is definitely for you.

review: Preface I do not play GTA Online thus this review has nothing to do with that aspect of the game. This review only concerns the singleplayer portion.Pros + Massive detailed gameworld+ Three playable switchable main characters+ Wide variety of weapon clothing and vehicle options+ Heist missions though few are quite enjoyableCons Limited opportunities to earn money Most of the gameworld feels under utilized Story begins strong but degrades quickly "Kill 'em all" ending feels rushed and isn't as satisfying as it should beThe Bottom Line After nearly three years I finally sat down and got through this game once and for all and while there's a lot to like here I can't help walking away from it feeling a tad unsatisfied. All in all I'd quantify GTA V as having two major strengths but three significant weaknesses enough to put it behind GTA IV in my opinion.Right off the bat the player will be floored by the world which you're thrown into it's massive and I don't think there's been a game since GTA V that can match it's sheer size and scope. Honestly at first it's overwhelming and those who like to explore will spend countless hours doing just that. However it's not just the world's size that's impressive but also the amount of detail but into it whether we're talking about the city of Los Santos in the south or the rural northern region. It feels alive and is probably one of the most "real world" game environments I've ever encountered.The player then explores and sees this world through the eyes of not one protagonist but three an entirely new mechanic for the Grand Theft Auto series. While this can be a rather tricky way of going about things Rockstar did well in giving each of them a unique personality and flair that will appeal to every player. You've got Michael the "retired" Tony Soprano esque master criminal who tries to balance his desire to get back into the game with protecting his family and trying to be a better father and husband. Franklin then fills that role of the stereotypical hood with ambitions for something better. Finally Trevor is just psychotic and provides most of the games more absurd and comedic elements in many ways Trevor is the personification of the kind of person concerned parents worry their kids will turn into from playing Grand Theft Auto. In spite of their vastly different character types they work well together and really keep things interesting especially the relationship between Michael and Trevor.Yet while those two major elements make the game what it is there are areas that leave me wondering whether or not this game may have been a little too ambitious for the developers...Despite the game world's aformentioned positive aspects the reality is that between story missions side missions and activities the player only really gets a chance to explore or see a small fraction of this massive environment. This of coarse leaves most of it under utilized and creates a sense of wasted potential. On an entirely different note while the game sports a rather wide range of things to spend money on the player has a limited number of opportunities to actually earn any. Out of the small handful of hesit missions only two or three actually give the player a significant amount of cash and a majority of story missions give you nothing at all. This leaves only three other avenues of making money meticulously trading on the in game stock market buying property or spending an incredible amount of time doing odd jobs like driving a taxi or tow truck.The in game stock market is really only worth fooling around with in conjunction with Lester's assassination missions but those are of coarse limited in number and offer a total payout still isn't significant in the grand scheme of things.Buying property is also rather useless. The amount of money you have to spend to purchase property is incredibly disproportionate to how much you make from that property. For example you may spend $600 000 buying a place but only make $800 a week off it.Finally the third and final major flaw of GTA V is the progression of its story. During what I would call the "first act" where the player is introduced to and gets some time with each individual character the story is tight and works very well. But once all three characters come together things fall apart quickly as we move from one thing to another with almost no rhyme or reason. Characters come and go events and actions feel like they have no impact and at least one of the game's endings feels entirely rushed and unsatisfactory despite it being what one could call the "good ending".In the end GTA V is certainly a marvel. Rockstar delivers an experience like nothing else out there in only the way that they can but the reality is that there were missteps with this installment some major and some minor. The game is absolutely worth playing but in my opinion it's not as strong as the previous title in certain regards.Score 7 out of 10 Mr. Raspberry Jams
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Most of these major black communities were destroyed due to an unsupported accusation against one man. cruelty inflicted on african americans. . This novel showcases a few fictional instances of discrimination within this time period to give the audience a taste of racial inequality. Although racism and discrimination seem like a thing of the past it is still a prominent issue today. While we do not have extreme violent acts comparable to past events such as the riot in Rosewood in 1923 slavery nor any active discriminatory laws racial discrimination is still an ongoing issue. In a survey roughly 61% of Americans overall believed that more changes needed to be made to achieve racial equality. However 88% of blacks believed that more needs to be done to achieve equality opposed to 53% of whites. This shows that the demographic of blacks believe they are treated unfairly as the data shows a high percentage stating that equality has not been achieved. This enforces the idea of racial discrimination still existing today as no other group would know better than those who are inflicted with racial prejudice. Statistics also show that African Americans are three times more likely to be killed by the police than whites and 30% of these fatalities were unarmed compared to 21% of whites. In conclusion the evidence in my research shows that we still have much more to go until we can achieve equality.

review: Singleplayer i d really reccomend. But multiplayer. If you re some bad a$$ Veteran of gaming history Community compared to you are little kittens.Here s the case Some kid accused me of ha**ing just cause i constantly point blank headshot him and his friend 10 seconds from eachother in a team deathmatch. (Pistol)Then they had to grab snipers and RPGs to even the odds but that didn t help counter the odds against my heavy pistol (1911). The kid literaly stalked me into lobbies for revenge.Kids have some really big alttitude isuess in this game. I m starting to think they re having some sort of autism.Hell it even began with these feminist gamers.(The Hell with me if those were feminist at all). *Maybe dudes acting like feminists. Yes mai friend rumors are tru in guming most of em are males actually probably from LGBT region servers*.I was really expecting mature community... But here s one thing. How in the hell do monkey period teens get this stuff. I heard most of them get it disscounted from those sites like Penguin etc...GTA V community is dead... All you have left is these monkey period kids which you can beat with one finger.Then they go all like (Hackur Hackur Hackur). They need education and PC ban. Ruskies are okay but a little on edge sometimes. The rest of the community is dommed generation.Trust me collecting mature friends here is hard. Cause they re rare. I m kinda looking to form them all up then hit up a full lobby of the Dommed ones &amp Ruskies. Light em up. Show em what age is this game meant for. Teach em a lesson.Gunplay is pretty simple.... like totally simple it s got signs of console ripoff But even with mouse aim. Mouse aim yes simplest tool. These people. You got no idea how many times did they miss point blank with a shotgun Even an assault rifle. I can simply walk up to them and double tap R to bash em a little old fashioned way. Jeez these kids.Need Rifles with Optics Flashlight Grips Extended magazine and some other special needs of help Because they have inability to use weapons properly (Autism in general).The only thing these kids are effective is with sniper rifles and RPGs. They can t even fire with ironsights.And they get really angry once you start owning the lobby match. Like did i murder their braincells?Hell i even let the kid win one on purpose out of his many defeated rounds.Tank battles are the easiest it s like playing WOT for Babies. *( Autism edition )*Choopers &amp Planes can be a challenge.Boats are relaxing.And Races are buggy. Sometimes unplayable.Because of the P2P system.Long story short about P2P.There is no dedicated server.It s intregrated and being weighted on each player in the lobby.So if one of them has an bad internet. You will get the same result my friend... Not like Capitalism More like Communism.P2P will be the rise of Putin. Brace yourself Trump.Oh and the adversary modes And Overall all the modes in GTA. Are... I didn t ask for this... Why is it here? To much autism. It needs realism to it. Not a kindergarden playground. A real balanced playground. Actually the newest adversary modes are quite interesting but still lack realism to it. The older ones thought the racing thing and stuff... Forget it. It doesn t exist. And public lobbies. Players approach me like i have peasant vision. (Which i don t).Then once they fail at it they just keep chasing me with countless attempts to take me down.Oh guess who has to gain kills for the team? Me. Yeah this game can be totally dependent on you and sometimes less on your team. Second Case Those Pro Body armor to the teeth dudes who once start losing really bad then exit to keep their KDR in place. Hell what does it matter if one has Bad KDR? Your fame is hurt? You gonna cry now? Step up and fight man... this is kindergarden game and you ragequitting on it like its DayZ to you.About P2P system The servers intregrated. Meaning everyplayer getts a background check and server they are currently in cannot be protected from ha**s. Oh and yeah they have a microtransaction log.That s how they spot a ch**eater. If they spot that you got more than you have earned which bots ussually do they automaticaly punish you. But the server itself has no such protection and is basically valnurable.

review: Couldn't keep away from this game forever could we? Certainly ing can't in the city I live in! The entire place is practically gift wrapped in adverts and posters for the thing they almost outnumber the blokes in singlets and flip flops calling each other "cant." I had to go down to Melbourne for a bit and I was faintly relieved at not seeing any there until one of the trams rolled by absolutely plastered with the logos like it had gone at full speed through the last EB games convention.You know what I noticed though? A lot of the posters I've seen consist only of the head and shoulders of one of the characters with no attempt to sell the game or make any reference to its content just the title underneath 'cause they figure that's all they need. "Here it is" they announced grandly throwing the sheet off the swill trough and jumping back as the pigs all thundered madly towards it. Yeah I see what you were getting at now Amnesia!So GTAV then. The fifth Grand Theft Auto after 1 2 III Vice City San Andreas IV Chinatown Wars and all the other ones adding up not being one of Rockstar's strong points. GTAIV was of course the game that taught the world that gritty realism and tragic character drama have their places and that place is not the same place as the place where you can pile up all your dead prostitutes on the side of the road and then ramp off them into a big fire. I know you aspire to write stories with some complexity Rockstar and that players insisting on selfishly trying to have fun in your game must be very frustrating but you kind of brought this on yourself when you decided that "Tw " would be a funny name for an internet café.GTAV tries to cunningly hedge its bets by constantly swapping between three different protagonists in the hope you'll like at least one of them. But that smacks of gambler's fallacy to me it's entirely possible to toss three coins and have them all come up tails or indeed for two to come up tails and the third to shoot up your dog's and give your dog bowel cancer. Franklin is probably closest to being the protagonist protagonist 'cause he does the standard GTA straight man thing where he rolls his eyes exasperatedly at every random weirdo who thinks that flagging down passing pedestrians is the best way to put out a contract hit but meekly follows their instructions anyway like a passive aggressive husband. Michael by comparison is a very active aggressive husband who retired from bank robbin' to spend more time screaming at his family and breaking things. And then there's Trevor who seems to be an attempt to represent the standard mode of behaviour of a GTA player in that he's a filthy amoral psychotic with the innate likeability of an incontinent honey badger in a house kitchen an hour before the health department inspection.But my major beef is that none of these characters are likeable and it's not because they you know kill people and lord knows I can't throw stones in that department at least not 'til I've cleared the basement out. They're just poorly written and inconsistent which may reflect the fact that their dialogue was being written by enough people to choke a sarlacc. Franklin just comes across as whiny and Michael having realized that all his ill gotten wealth has done nothing to bring him happiness seems to think that the logical solution would be more ill gotten wealth!To that end we have the heist missions which is the big new feature after taking fat dudes on dinner dates didn't exactly ignite our pubes last time around. And it's not a bad concept you plan a robbery mission and do some recon and vehicle stashing tasks before the caper itself. Well I say "plan" you "plan" them in the same sense that you "plan" a Sunday drive down a one way street because like all the missions they bear the increasingly omnipresent Sandbox Paradox total freedom when outside missions and when inside total instruction following simulator that fails you out of ing nowhere because you got in the wrong car or went two feet the wrong way and the game just felt like things were getting weird. The extent of your input is picking which of two pre determined package tours to use and what crew members to bring. Their stats increase as you use them but since each one is only available for like two heists apiece in the whole game it doesn't mean a whole lot.The protagonists also have RPG style stats incrementing away in utter pointlessness levelling up your flight skill can mean the difference between planes handling like both your wings are stuck up a sumo wrestler's and handling like the sumo wrestlers put on slightly aerodynamic hats. I suspect that this is all preparation for the mechanics of GTA Online and how cunning of you Rockstar to hold off unlocking that until after I've submitted this review and stopped giving a two dollar blumpkin about the game. Well the joke's on you! I just moved house and my internet wasn't hooked up anyway! Bet you feel stupid now!But digressing back towards planes for a moment why did I have to go through a plane flying tutorial after a story mission in which I had to fly and land a plane? Had the sumo wrestlers expressed some dissatisfaction with my performance or is it just that this game is a mess? And not the "potato salad molestation charges" mess that was Saints Row but an engorged mess of unrelated and clunkily tutorialized features. Lots of story threads but no strong overarching one. Mostly "Character A pisses off Organization Y somehow and fends them off for a while until Character A slaps himself in the forehead and goes 'I just remembered I'm a murderer! Let's just murder whoever's got a nark on and then have a bath in his wife!'".Well just to appease those champions of emotional stability who have been burning crosses in the front gardens of unimpressed games reviewers I won't say there's no fun to be had. It's got some colour back into its cheeks and generally feels less like a fat old sheepdog has fallen asleep on the physics engine. I cringed a bit when it brought in buyable properties but they unlock more missions and gameplay so there's a point to it other than just soaking up unnecessary money as is the case in other sandbox games. There's not much that particularly made me go "Christ who thought that was a good idea?" like that dinner dating business last time. But then again there's also nothing that made me go "Christ who thought that was a good idea? Because they were totally right to think that and I want to kiss their big soppy face!"There's nothing that excites me that I can point to and call "the defining moment" it's just a whole load of people doing stuff which I admit is a fairly weak argument World War II was just "a whole load of people doing stuff" but at least getting your leg blown off gives you something for the next letter home "Dear Mum remember when my dance instructor said I had two left feet? Well I've managed to redress the balance somewhat. P.S. ING HELL AAAAARRRGH!!!" Yahtzee

review: I played now for 6 hours in total. All what i did is going from A to B. In between listening to some mission NPC dialog.. Dialogs that only are synched in english. Uhm i dont understand all and have to read the subtitles while i am driving the fast cars.. so i can concentrate on nothing.After finished a mission i am on the edge of the map and have to drive all back for starting a new mission. Again go from A to B.. The missions are still the same drive a new vehicle maybe shoot to something.Sorry but i had far more fun in JustCause3 than on this game.Finished another mission.. Ok lets look on the map ah there is a letter for a mission. Lets drive again to there (.. go from A to B..) .. Finally arrived then the message appears You must be Character blabla to start the mission .... ragequit. The game want me to change the character and drive again all the way to point B.. no thanks.Then ok lets try this question mark on the map. Side mission. Now the game wants me to do a race by foot against an annoying screaming NPC woman. Ehm.. boring. And annoying.Oh there was a weapons shop. There i bought a new pullover and it was auto weared. Then i went to a mission and the pullover was removed and i had again the oversweated ugly blue/gray default main character tshirt. Hm.. customization right?Population In the settings i have the most on high and the population on the highest. The world looks dead as hell. Very very few people are walking around the streets..For what should i tune my car. There are already a lot super fast sport cars on the street to steal. So why should i be interested to upgrade cars?..What is this game fun for. Driving from A to B? Make t on the streets? This game seems only to be made for teenagers. Back in the days i played through GTA3 GTA Vice City GTA Stories from liberty city GTA4+addons and had much fun. But on GTA5 The superlative perfect game did not take this lv up like the past games did back to the day.I played the previous titles on console. This im playing with the XBOX controller. But the controls now feels clunky and all seems sluggish when walking around.The only thing that i enjoy at the moment are the characters/stories in the main missions. EDIT After 5 more hours the thumb still remains down.Online Mode First time logging in i cant move and no buttons react.. Rage quit..The next day I was automatically joined in a Race Lobby (very confusing UI by the way). Uhm i didnt want to make racing but ok lets give it a chance. I hoped that the human counterparties give me some challenge. But no.. All could not drive the car like normal people and went to crash on almost every NPC car. In a dead city (again i setted up the popularity on max!).So i fast became 1st place and finished with a very very big leading distance. Uhm.. this is not fun.Physics Driving vehicles feels so stiff compaired to GTA4 and lower. Making the car roll on a crash is very difficult now. It does not feel like GTA.Why im still playing?I gave the game some chances due to its rating. And when i started to play with Trevor (after a forced long boring A to B gameplay with the other 2 characters) the game becomes better due to more action and a damn crazy new character. Why not from the beginning so?!But at the end this game for me is far overrated.PS Instead of giving this review thumb downs tell me what i can do to have more fun in this game.

review: The newest chapter of the Paper Mario story isn't just out of this world ... it's out of this dimension. What at first glance appears to be a 2 D sidescroller ripped straight from the pages of the Paper Mario universe soon turns into a 3 D action adventure that defies all video game logic. Fusing 2 D and 3 D perspectives not to mention RPG and platformer elements the game slips back and forth between dimensions. The action sprawls across eight worlds filled with traps puzzles bizarre mysteries and items that often draw themselves out of thin air. Oh and just because Mario's in the title doesn't mean he's the only star players also get to play as Peach and Bowser.

review: Trying to ignore the fact that modding this game is now "illegal" GTAV is a spectacular game with superb graphics (the best realistic graphics in any game) excellent gun play with good physics although whenever you reload the load the chamber every time as well so you dont get that extra bullet and excellent driving. I tried to mod my game once just to install GTA reloaded or something like that it was supposed to make the game realistic but i couldn't even launch the game. Multiplayer is fun too if you have a group of friends and are just tearing up the city. Heists and jobs are a hassle though because it takes 20 minutes to find anybody and then youre stuck with incompetent team mates who quit after a couple fails and then you have to wait another 20 mintues before another job. If you put forward the effort and the time you can afford that yacht or that jet or that car the other millions of cars that are millions of dollars.

review: NOTE EDITED 01/12/2017 with a GTA Online review at the bottom of this. GTA V is something that redefines gaming. Not having it in your library would be a big mistake as it's now very affordable and most of all totally patched up and good to go. The best part of it the thing that makes it difficult to go back to real life is that everything feels real. Most open world games are heavily scripted or full of emptiness or even both. What makes most of TES games quite boring after a while is that you don't feel like you're part of a living world a world that evolves without you. NPC routines are well knowned since TES Oblivion but never before has it felt so realistic. There are literaly thousands of people living their lives in GTA V and everything you do has a direct influence on their behaviour. In a realistic way not just as in "please get out of my house".Now the missions are what makes it coherent. The storytelling is excellent as well as the characters' acting. It's far better than most Hollywood movies.That's what it is in the end the game gives you the impression to live a blockbuster. Changing skin as you hop from a character to another could have been annoying but no all three of them are really enjoyable and I guess that most people won't consider it a turn off when they'll have to switch to M T or F for some new occupation.GTA V is full of variety full of fun every minute you'll spend playing it it's honnestly a gaming masterpiece that my only regret is to not have bought sooner.As a conclusion I didn't even try GTA Online yet and have no real interest in it. People who gave terrible ratings to the game because of servers being broken don't seem to understand that the essence of this game stands completely elsewhere. Being able to play with friends is certainly a plus but the sole fact of it having you postpone any kind of real life activity just for the sake of another highway race is what makes the GTA licence the state of the art in videogames since the release of its oldest iterations. The pro's simply obliterate any kind of complaint about its lack of this or its too much of that.A final word of warning this game is for ADULTS. And adults that don't fear seeing graphic violence prositutes prostituting bandits banditing and guns killing people. If you're not into living a movie like Payback from the inside move along to Just Cause 3 a good game that justifies any violent action by pouring some liberty sugar on it. GTA Online review OK so after I finished the game quite quickly to be honnest I thought I'd give GTA Online a shot. Because that's a turn off all the new content so far only concerns the Online part. No you can't buy more than a few places for each character in GTAV. Once you're done with it only the Online game will bring you new stuff. At a big BIG price.Morons. That's the main price to pay. GTA Online is like the best MMORPG ever but filled with morons. Only one out of a hundred players seems to listen to the instructions for a mission. "Go silent and stealthy" turns quite fast into "RUSH B!". You got it. So you'll spend most of your time watching stupid people doing stupid things with no sense of roleplay at all. And start missions over and over and over again. Till you can't bear them anymore.Otherwise it's quite fun. The heist setups are hard and could be a real challenge as in GAMING challenge if they were not played mostly by people who seem to be challenged by life. People rarely communicate while it would help a lot. No one seems to understand what the "say to team" button stands for.Oh and the servers are unbelievably crappy. It's infinite loading times disconnections and hookups all around. Not to mention lag when your team's from eastern Europe or USA while you're in France like me. We're all aboard the same f**ked up train.But all in all the game mechanics are incredibly fun. Oh sure you'll spend more time willing to kill your teammates slowly and painfully than actually playing. But anyway it's strongly addictive. Sincerely I don't even know why really but as soon as I'm done with this review I'll start the game again. And rant a lot.

review: What I really like about Grand Theft Auto is that it has a great free roam gameplay. I'm not a fan of the story mode but I do like it I really like the Online Mode though. You can play with your friends and do what you want. You want to infiltrate a military base and steal a jet? Then go on ahead and I advice you to play with your friends. You can go crazy on a rampage killing everybody and ramming npc's over while you see them fly off. But there are still bad things about the Online Mode. There are always hackers who could just troll you especially with Money Drops and you could get banned for something you didn't do unless you ask for it xD. Also you need a lot of money in this game if you want to fulfill the potential of Online Mode. It willl take some time doing it but also you need to level up fast if you want to unlock mods for guns and cars such as the minigun rpg GT Wing Spoilers and other sorts of stuff. You could also play a lot of different mini games such as the one part of the new Smugglers Run DLC which is Motor Wars. I particularly favor the Deadline Mini Game myself. Guess thats about it and even though this game costs a lot I'd say it is worth it. If your on a budget you should wait for a sale because there is a chance you could get the game for half the price. Thanks for reading and have fun playing!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Utter mayhem in multiplayer. Heists are amazing but there needs to be more of them. Luckily R* is releasing new content quite often so you'll never be bored.I've not played much campaign but I can say that a lot of people have good things to say about it. The three main characters are apparently quite easy to relate to even if you aren't a retired bank robber (did you see that guy on reddit? dang)All in all a solid game with a ridiculously fun multiplayer. Some server instability at times and it's a bit clunky to meet up with friends but nothing worth writing home about.

review: Well. where do I start? The game plays awesome on my pc. (4670k 8gb of rams and gtx 760) There's modders like in every GTA O but RockStar is doing verything in their power to enforce justice online. Which is good but it can also make the game dull. Sometimes modders do make the game interesting with snowball fights to the death or just flying in a car they're driving. Unfortunately just like there's good modders there's bad modders. They're are some modders that go godmode and kill everyone or frame users and kill the lobby in the name of a random user. (Modders aren't easy to comeby.) Over all this game gets a 9/10 It's never ending fun and with friends the fun wont stop.

review: A truly amazing singleplayer and multiplayer experience.Though many reviews you may read for this game will tell you that this game (or at least it's multiplayer) is bad I have a different opinion.Story ModeGrand Theft Auto V's Story Mode is honestly one of the best and most in depth campaigns that I have ever played. Not only is the story interesting the side missions will usually leave you eager to play more of them. The ability to play as three completely different people and make them work together in so many different situations is also something I believe was pulled off very well.It will keep you interested for quite some time.GTA ONLINEGrand Theft Auto ONLINE is an excellent concept and has (for the most part) been fulfilled in my opinion. Though I will admit I can see where some people are coming from when they claim that the prices are outrageous it just gives you a reason to enjoy even more of the game. Though GTA ONLINE can become rather boring if you're playing alone getting a few friends to play along with you (or making new ones) can make the game far more enjoyable to play.From doing street races and low level Contact Missions for your fellow (AI) criminals to becoming a CEO/President of your own Organization/Motorcycle Club. I believe GTA ONLINE still has a lot to offer players whether new or returning. Plus there are still more Free DLCs to come!It should be noted that other reviews will complain about a great quantity of modders/cheaters/hackers within GTA ONLINE or being banned from GTA ONLINE for no apparent reason. I (nor any of my friends) have not met many hackers especially within the past few months bannishments have never been an issue for me (or said friends) either. Though I'm not saying this hasn't happened to others I don't believe either are likely to happen much anymore as Rockstar has been trying to correct their anticheat and autoban services.ConclusionAll in all Grand Theft Auto V is a great purchase in my opinion. Though it may be better to wait for a discount if you're looking to find an excellent singleplayer and/or multiplayer experience Grand Theft Auto V could be the game for you!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Some quirks of GTA V you should really get used to Want to join a friend? Game says full session even though it's not. Want to join a queue for this full session? Boots you into a different 1 player session instead of keeping you in current. Want to join a heist? Game stops at gathering "GTA Online Info" forever.. then fails to join. Frustrated and want to kill yourself? Game silently deducts from your bank account but says it costs $0. Quick join? Nobody running any activity in all of GTA. Hosting a good well paying job? Nobody wants to join you. Good at any co op activity? You'll get a garbage team and fail 10+ times.. then everyone will leave. Want to afk and think you get 15 minutes idle time? If you lock windows to do it the game kicks you for being idle in 30s. Bookmark a job? You won't find it unless you browse to the exact specific category. Think you'll get better rewards if a job like a race is harder to win because there's more people playing it? Want to store a vehicle into a garage or sell it? Garage/shop suddenly blocked from entering by a random irrelevant event that started. Doing good in an event? Suddenly booted into empty public session and event cancels out. Granite bushes and street signs while street lamps snap like twigs. Voice chat best turned off.And last but not least.. I'm afraid of playing because hackers are able to actually remove your money from the game permanently and/or raise your level to 1k+++ so you get branded as hacker and get banned.An okay game if you've played 500+ hours. Otherwise you're just food for other players.

review: This game is very well done rockstar has outdone themselves with this game. Although if you are going to be playing multiplayer WARNING There are alot of hackers that spawn you money and then you cant do the game legit. This game is a hefty download and I would not get pc edition if you have a crappy computer. I reccomend you use the ASUS ROG with a 970m nvidia graphics card and a intel core i7 (message me on steam for my computers full specs) I have 0 lag in multiplayer using my laptop. I would not get a alienware if you are going to play games though it may look cool but its not. Besides from the awesome lighting that the aliemware has it cannot drive or do almost anyting in GTA 5 online and in singleplayer. It lags alot when you drive a vheicle and go fast it also lags when you start to shoot something or see a lot of explosions. Overall I would give this game a 9/10 because it does not get good gameplay if you are playing on a crappy computer.

review: Got a briefcase that people will kill me for so I decided to hide in the mountainsI decided to land so people can't tell I'm in a helicoper so they'll hike up a mountain then I'll fly awayThey'd have to go out of their way to get to me Someone has a jet.. So they're after me.. Good thing I can hide in a building After this guy came for me in a jet I came out and then shot him with a homing missle it hit so his jet was on fire and went down fired another round he ejectedHe parachutes down tried to kill me I shot him he must of crash landed and died parachuting so I got a kill.Then with great haste I got on my helicopter and flew away.He respawned on the mountain and is now stuck up there but he got a good view of me flying away.There are no cars or nothing up there so he legit is stuckSucker gotta walk. And no one got the briefcase from me so I won a 11grand10/10 would strand people on a mountain again.Cons I would mention would be bad flying system. Long loading times. Bad match making system. Not much to do in free roam so can get boring. Heists don't really pay enough and if a person leaves the entire heist fails and everyone gets kicked which is annoying.Servers seem to be plagued with modders right now.But cons aside if you're a GTA fan I do recommend this game and stranding people on mountains.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: since I've had succes with this method before I will now pit GTA 5 agasint 6 12 inch delux Pizzas.this game costs about 66 dollars. thats enough money for 5 and a half Delux 12 inch pizzas at my local pizza joint.thats 6 meals consisting of pizza. thats to much pizza.this game has entertained me for almost 200 hours with no signs of stopping. thats plenty of game for your money.those pizzas would keep me from dying of hunger.this game wont.pizza is rather fattening.this game wont help you stay in shape either though.this game looks prettier then a fresh pizzathose pizzas are made hot and fresh.this game is mildly dated but in a good way like a fine wine it gets older but never so old as to be unpalatable.if I devided that money between pizza and alcohol I could have a sizable party and get black out drunk serverly increasing my risk of liver cancer.I could throw a online party with this game which means I dont have to get drunk or risk liver cancer to have fun.this game has better musical taste then a pizza.music flavoured pizza hasn't been made yet.(get to work Black Mesa)this game is racialy diverse.pizza isn't even a race.this game is laugh out loud funny.pizza can't even tell bad nock nock jokes.inshort in my honest opinion you would be better served spending 66 dollars on GTA 5 then on 6 and a half pizzas.

review: DRINKING GAME! take a shot whenever I say GTA 5I recommend this game thats all I gotta say. If you wanna see my expirience with it then read on brother!This review is for people who have played GTA 5(take a shot) but spoiler free if your a rebelGTA 5(take a shot) has been around for ages. Everything to be said about this game has been said. So I decided to write about my expirience in GTA 5(take a shot.)For starters GTA 5(take a shot) has its own sort of charm but hadn't charmed me like the previous games in the series.The 3 protagonists in GTA 5(take a shot) are very interesting characters though I admit Micheal was probably the least GTA(take half a shot) material. The character who embodied most of the GTA spirit was Trevor. Trevor was a psychopathic funny and mad me sad on his last 'Strangers and Freaks' mission.As a speedrunner GTA 5(take a shot) is probably one of the easiest GTAs to speedrun however quite dull which earns it the monika 'KYS SIMULATOR' as in a speedrun of GTA 5(take a shot) you take advantage of the 'skip' system which lets you skip whole portions of a level.GTA Online is well...OK. Once I connect to GTA Online its quite alright...Until some random Polish kid starts screaming at you then mute everyone incoming. Playing GTA 5(take a shot) with friends is fun. For a period of time I used to play in the over world robbing gas stations dodging cops and all that classic GTA action. However I couldn't go 5 seconds without some going guns blazing at me only for me to sigh and riddle him with bullets. Alot of people complained about hackers in the PC version. But I haven't met any. GTA 4(Don't take a shot) had quite a simplistic multiplayer. But it was good to around in with your friends.The heists in single player were fun and had alot of diffrent options. However I hated the onlie heists as there was no option apart from chosing roles and cuts. The people I got put with were and couldn't play it at all!Overall this a good but flawed gamed. There is alot which I dislike however I put alot of time into it and gotta recommend it even though alot of my expirence was quite bad mkay?Now i'll say GTA 5(take a shot) a couple more times to make you so drunk you'll like my review and then die.GTA 5(take a shot) GTA 5(take a shot) GTA 5(take a shot) GTA 5(take a shot)

review: In the near 1000 hours I've spent in this game I've never modded. Modding was stupid in general I never cared about openIV or other like that and I still don't care about them now that they were shut down. In fact thank you TTWO for shutting them down. Sure "OpenIV was a modding tool for single player " but other players created hooks so they could be used online and ruining people including me from doing missions online. All the people upset about how these modding tools got shut down were probably the same asshats that would join an online server filled with 30 people and dropping bombs atop their heads and just cause total devistation. GTA V was one of the only games that had an Online feature and supported modding in Single player mode. That's the problem people could easily get online with mods. I saw a fellow idiot's review "You take our mods we take your income." Sit the down Gta V is nearing 80 million copies sold and the game being sold at a constant $45 their total income from this game alone grossed $3 billion. Sure you can threaten them by not buying any of their services but I honestly don't think they care. As I'm typing this there are 60 thousand people in game lol. Rest in peace to the modders and the people for using other people's mods. This game is going to finally be fun!

review: NOTICE I have completed the campaign and have barley done any online stuff!Review Grand Theft Auto V is an amazing game. It has a well written story which has an excellent pace and you never become bored. You always want to know what happens next. All the missions are fun and the graphics are purely beautiful. The controls are the best ever. This game also has a lot of detail. For example the three lead roles (Michael Trevor Franklin) all have different phones. Michael has and iPhone. Trevor has a Microsoft. Franklin has a Samsung. The game also does a great job of telling each characters personality. If you don't know yet Trevor is basically a psychopath so he has a broken phone screen a messed up trailer drugs snacks and other weird stuff on his bed and he has a beat up car. When I finished this game I was scared. Scared that I'd never play a game as good as GTAV.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is a dudes game.It's fun to just sit back and chill but still be focused on something. GTA is just that the story is a 9/10. It's got funny jokes taking the fun out of todays world great character with clear views and an ending (depending on which one you'll pick) that just sums it all up. If you got some money left over wait for a sale and you'll atleast spend 50 hours on this game.The online is like ehhhhh. It's addicting for sure which is why I'm still playing it but with no friends to hang out with it's boring as . On the Xbox 360 I spent 800 hours with my mates and it was a blast but I come to PC can't transfer my old character and basically that 800 hours is lost. I wasn't too thrilled. Plus Rockstar ban people on the daily.I'd say you buy this game for the story and decide what you think of the online. Gg.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is one of those games that will and did make a huge impact on the video game industry. One of my favorite games by far across both singleplayer and multiplayer.GTA Story Mode for me was incredibly fun for me. Players got to see a new perspective towards GTA games and Rockstar overall more than one main character. All of them tied into the same story incredibly different personalities and different pasts. GTA Online is a different story for me as I can imagine it for all of the other players. I found GTA Online just as addicting as Story Mode despite the modders and hackers and those out to ruin other peoples' fun. I played this game on the 360 and continued to the PC I loved and still love this game. If you're willing to look past the modders hackers and all around s in Online get this game.

review: Product received for free. GTA VI've been enjoying this game so much for the past few years on(Ps3 Ps4 and Pc). The single player is interesting but online play is where the fun at. Yes you do need friends to play it with. Put on your headset prepare your mic and play with a few friends and let the hours just roll away. Do a VIP CEO heist job racing or killing other player in the session if you and your friends are bored and want to do random stuff after a heist job. It's brilliant. If you don't have friend and play it alone you'll get bored fast because for money you need to grind the hell out of it. You need friends to at least make it bearable especially if you want to buy the expensive stuff in a non shark card way.

review: Single player mode is extremely fun and overall a positive experience. It was story rich and truly a sandbox game with each side quest different from the other. Graphics are stunning however for some reason my resolution was 3??? X 2???? but one day it just changed to 1080 x ???? and I couldn't change it back ever since. That made the graphics look a lot less crisp. There was a thick line and everything looked... off. But overall I have positive vibes toward this game... Now on to online mode...Online mode... Where do i start. The concept of gta online is a great concept but way too good to be true. Firstly half the people playing are whiney+salty leauge players. I start a heist a level 2 pops in and yells "GIF ME 30% I NEED MONEYS". Then we have the people who purposely troll and die on heists thus making us all restart. And dont get me started on the grinding part. To really get high up in this game you need to grind.... a lot. The pacific standard heist on hard gives 1.25 mil ( if you give everyone else 0%). It takes about an 1hour and a half to set up if your lucky and takes longer to finish the heist if you have crew members who refused to listen to you and buy heavy armour. And then we have queueing for heists. Unless you have friends to play with it is absolutely hell. Player joins player leaves. Wrapping it up I feel like GTA V was an incredible game for 60 bucks. Ive played about 80 hours on the game so far 75 cents/hour if you sum it up. If you only are going to play story mode go at it! But if your buying it because you saw some youtubers playing online..... keep your expectations low.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Still one of the best games ever made. Graphics still looks great maxed out at 4k next to more modern games with loads of customisation options to get it running really well on any pc with a 2Gb or greater card albeit at lower resolutions. (8.8/10 next to modern titles)Audio sound track is as expected with GTA nowadays nice variety and apt! (a solid 9/10)Gameplay enough free roam to keep you going in circles for a loooong time and enough 'mini' games etc to keep it fresh for a long time. (another solid 9/10 no real pushing of boundaries on this one)Story and characters 10 in my opinion entertaining hillarious (trevor vs the fence!!) the main story arc is a real page turner and you get to pick how it plays out.Recommended to everyone!!!!Compulsory Warning If you are male female undecided young old living deceased alien terrestrial red blue black white grey or some or all of the above then at least some of this game will definately either offend or tickle you!!!

review: I highly recommend this game for the story mode. Its insanely fun and beautifully done. One of the best games ever.As far as online I have spent plenty of hours online and it has given me so much entertainment. The thing is this issue with modding software. It happens way too often where you are in a server and someone is modding and causing problems. There is nothing you can do but report the suspected person or join a new lobby. This is highly frustrating that we have to deal with it on a daily basis in almost every server. Not very fun to lose a big sale because 6 random vehicles spawned on top over you and everyone in the server. This has RUINED the online experience!!!!Story mode is amazing and definitely worth playing worth the money. Online is very good if you can tolerate the modding that happens. Or the kids begging for free money. These are huge negatives for me in the online and I just returned with the new DLC after a long break. I recommend this game now for the beauty and story but I warn you the online experience will vary and you will likely find yourself jumping servers frequently to avoid modding and griefing. Grow up kids!

review: Ok so the story is pretty much well known considering its been out for two years. And finally it releases on PC with beautiful graphics and optimisations. The game runs flawlessly on my system. My spec are as follows.i7 4950kEVGA 780ti SC acx 2.016gb of Sniper Ram 1866hzRoG Maximus Vii heroSSD 250gb1tb HDDCorsair Graphite 760TH100i Corsair Liquid Cooling ExtremeMy computer is somewhat of a beast and runs all these 'next gen" games flawlessly without any problems. I was worried that this game would have terrible optimisations as most console ports are badly done but this caught me by surprise constant 60 fps and does not drop. I have experienced during a few cut scenes that it drops to 30 fps but I believe that this is a glitch and only happened on two or three occasions. I highly suggest to pick up this game. The price considering its a two year old game is a bit ridiculous and they should of made it at least $60 in my opinion considering the age but alas can't have everything your way. Highly suggest the pick up. GTA V online is where this game falls. Long loading screens wether you want to play with your friends finished a mission joining your friends session the loading screens are plenty and very long. I don't find online peticulary interesting nor fun to play. So take my 5 cents and do what you will. I would probably just finish the campaign and screw around in that. I loved the idea of heists and they finally brought it out but to my knowledge its for four people so unless you don't have four friends to play heists with its a pretty useless DLC (In my case don't have friends that play computer games but are console peasants). Pros Fantastic Optimisations 60 fps beautiful scenery and graphics Trevor PhillipsCons ing Lamar

review: Grand Theft Auto I loved Grand Theft Auto San Andres back when it was released on the PS2. In that game there was some questionable things such as woman on the streets for lack of a better term however that was easily avoidable. Grand Theft V Game is great visuals stunning however I have to not recommend this game. I do not recommend this game because the developers went too far with the sexual themes. These developers have to know that young audiences play this game they should not of put the sex scenes and all the sexual comments typically made by trevor in the game. It was and is 100% unnecessary. Now to all of those who will refute this with the age old arguement "but its ok to shoot and kill peoplez!1!?" This arguement has no wieght to it. In 95% of all video games your character is killing some sort of monster/ bad guys. Same principle in Grand Theft Auto with the guise of police outfits or civillians. Games do not need to have a "porn" like element to the game. I know a lot of people disagree with this view and that is fine. This is my review. This is my recommendation or rather non recommendation.

review: at first the story is interesting and the dialogue/interaction between the characters is entertaining. but eventually it just gets old and ANNOYING. all they do is complain and complain. and i mean nonstop. i'm someone who doesn't like to be around people who complain a lot in real life. and they're always screaming. so having to listen to this in a game... oh my god. even me complaining right now is out of my usual self. there are also a lot of dumb VERY slow side missions you have to do in order to progress the main storyline.AND when traveling in a vehicle i find myself looking down to the bottom left at the tiny mini map for GPS more than i am actually paying attention to the road. there should be an option to have a path showing up on the actual road. might as well make the GPS immersive if you're gonna have one at all. there's no mods for this either at least not that i've found.i want to play a game not look at a mini map the entire time. also i found the ending to be disappointing. it just feels very quickly wrapped up. for most of the game they're yelling and screaming at each other and then suddenly they're all nice and it's like what. because it's just so they can wrap things up with the story. then when you go online it's sooo ing slow. the loading times take FOREVER. the UI is also sluggish. AND i have a gtx 980 ti and a 5820k 4.3ghz with 32gb of ram so the sluggishness is not because of my computer. this may be "entertaining" for the first playthrough or at least most of it. but after that meh.if you ONLY had 60 bucks (plus tax) to spend on ONE game I'd choose MGSV over GTAV.was this even worth the 60 bucks? sure 50 hours i suppose i could argue it was worth it. but was it as enjoyable of an experience? no not really. especially when i compare it to the feelings i've felt playing something like MGSV. i STILL have positive memories of scenes and cinematics from the game. i even remember some of the melodies from the soundtrack. AND that game's story is UNFINISHED. it's so good in so many areas it makes me not care about the story being incomplete.

review: Great game so far this is my favourite game and it outshines all other open world games in each and every aspect optimisation is exquisite and storyline is quite immersive but the thing that separates this game from rest of the so called open world games is its multiplayer. This game is legit a boon to the entire gaming industry and has taken the term "open world gaming" to a different level its open world mechanics are undisputable unbeatable be it purchasing a home a boat a fancy car hire private militia or mercs to help you get rid of pesky situations and exasperating players or flex your military grade arsenal full of tanks AMV's mobile station etc right from purchasing liquor snacks cigars and all sorts of accessories that are used in our day to day lives like fancy clothes sunglasses ear rings necklace watches etc to governing a city and enforcing your own law in it using brute power against others through the virtue of your military grade rig and armoured vehicles GTA Online has it all you can also be a CEO build your own office have your own factory and clubhouse be a president of a motorcycle club or be a VIP who can hire other players as bodyguards control the mob dominate them or simply obliterate them GTAV has it all. It's legit a second life to me there is still so much to explore and so much to explain about how splendid mesmerizing addictive and extraordinary this game is i can keep on going but alas my words would'nt be enough to describe and highlight all the key aspects and facilities offered by this game GTA V is like an ocean and i am a mere sailor grab a copy today and explore it. )
