review: Well the gam is fun i would recommend that you buy the game. But thats if you can get past the modders and trolls in the game but there are easy was to get away from both and just be in a session with you and you friends and do you ceo or mc work but i mean rockstar and take two just pulled a gun to their head with the new 100% no mods meaning online or singleplayer i mean i could understand online of course because thats where they make their money. but single player was where people went when the got fed up with people online and still wanted to play the game and when you do 100% completion on the campaign then theres really nothing to do so mods were an escape from that limit. Also i see people complaining about the online being grindy well i only got a few things to say about that and its that it is supposed to be grindy and time consuming its ment to be hard to do thats why they make it so others can destroy your shipments and product. now dont get me wrong i get when i worked half a day with my friends to fill all my large warehouses and we go to sell and that one prick is waiting there just to destroy my shipment having wasted mine and my friends day but you know sometimes your not supposed to care about the money and your just supposed to have fun with your friends go do some races me and my friends go do deadline adversary all the races and all the other missions available and we have fun doing it and you know whats funny. its that by the time we get off weve earned a few million by the time we get off the thing is to not pay attention to the money and pay more attention to your friends and as i said if you want there are ways around being in an open session and doing your shipments with no one else in your session i mean its temporarry but you simply disconect the gtav.exe from any of the hardware or just disconect your internet for about 10 sec and reconnect or resume the process.Even with all the bad things within this game I still play it because me and my friends can still find enjoyment out of it and thats what every game is ment for is to have fun not sit there and obsess about money and getting the best cars i could care less about having those cars but do i have them yes because ive had the money for them and just decided to buy them and was i able to buy every thing for this new update as soon as it came out yes because i didnt focus on money because the trolls knew who to hurt the best and that is those who are only trying to make money and occasionally a random person so...i recomend this game to all and i hope you have fun with the gamejust remember dont take it to seriouslywell thats more than my two centsjust have fun and thats all i have to saywell other than if youve read this far thankyou for reading and have a wonderful dayEveryone is complaining that there are no single player mods (I didnt like this either). The reason they said no mods at all is because people would have their mods on in single player and then leave the mods on when going into multiplayer. This is the Rockstar comunity of users fault for modding online and forgetting to turn their mods off.

review: You know exactly what you're getting when you pick up GTA V. Lots of fun runnin' around murdering each other. It's a blast! Recently there's been an influx of negative reviews almost entirely because Take Two has (in a move to help curb the modders) forced a mod maker to stop distributing their mod. I've never used the mod no one I know has used the mod yet some of them are leaving negative reviews just because it's the thing to do right now.It strikes me as disingenuous. These same friends leaving negative reviews continue to play and have a good time. Oh well. If you truly ARE looking at reviews debating whether or not to purchase the game I (and probably the majority of people leaving negative reviews) would suggest you do! The story campaign is a great time but GTA Online is where the game truly shines. I've had nothing but cheeky fun times while carving out my little piece of Los Santos I'm sure you will to.

review: If you're complaining about OpenIV you're just being picky. I don't see Xbox and PS players complaining that they don't have mods.If you're complaining about the lack of single player content what would happen if they added SP DLC? You would just play through it then there would again be nothing to do.If you're complaining about having to grind so much then you just need to actually put your mind towards something and work.If you're complaining about modders which is currently the biggest issue then either play in a solo session or (my recommendation) make an empty public session. Hackers won't be bothering you if you're alone. "Be grateful for what you have and stop complaining it bores everybody else does you no good and doesn't solve any problems." Zig ZiglarSo basically stop complaining about what you don't like in the game and start enjoying what you do like.

review: While I do not fully agree with the forced shut down of "OpenIV" I will say that though their intentions were to make GTAV a long lasting enjoyable game by crafting amazing single mode mods that enriched the game well beyond its vanilla settings. These modders and skilled creators were the minority. The majority of the modding community especially in the GTA online feature abused modding packs to elevate themselves above other traditonal players and in some cases ruined the online feature for many "Normal" players.I'm sad that such a harsh action as been taken aganist a talented group but I am relieved that efforts are being made to stabilse GTA's online features.

review: Product received for free. Honestly just dont listen to the comments talking about how bad online is. Online is very well done and is a lot more fun with friends. No grinding is really necessary as online heists give you plenty of cash and are fun and easy to complete. You can also rob gas stations and some other businesses for around 1000 5000 dollars. There are also free good looking cars you can purchase on the internet(in gta of course). Anyways this is a very fun experience and can be very fun to buy just to mess around or to actually do something. Singleplayer has an amazing storyline and i was honestly sad when i finished all 69 or so story missions. This game will always hold a huge place in my heart. Definitely worth 60$ even though i received it as a gift.

review: I'll start out by saying that GTA V is not a bad game its decent.In my opinion a sequel has to be better than the prequel. In this case this is not the case.The only thing gta v exceeds in is graphics.Comparison to Gta IV Ragdoll is horrible Physics are horrible and fake Ai is no longer funny and became generic Gravity is horribly fake Main and side characters not notable ( Except for moLester ofcourse ) The map... oh god the map.. 1 small city with the size of the first island on gta iv and the rest is mountain and dirt with nothing to do Vehicle handling feels like saints row. Fake and made to be noob friendly Online is one big crap fest SP missions are not bad but definitely not better than the ones in IV There is no Niko. That's a bad thing. Vehicle upgrades are meh.I'm sure that if I took more time to think about all the bad thing about this game i came up with them.Just get IV.. it's way better than V in every way except graphics ofcourse.I still can't believe rockstar took so long to deliver this wanna be GTA.Let's all hope GTA VI will be much better. It can hardly get any worse.

review: Personally I've never really modded. In the end Rockstar owns the rights to the game purchasing the game does not give you the right to modify it. Given the situation and percentage on the community that hacks in online constantly breaking the rules of gta v online with not too much repercussions... I wouldn't be venturing very far to say that this is Rockstar saying enough is enough. Even if openIV was only for singleplayer it's disrespectful to dislike a company that has given so much content and entertainment to those that play it. My actual review of this game is that it is one of the best modern multiplayer and singleplayer games. It looks amazing and playing through the story is fulfilling. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone you can't go wrong with a rockstar game.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar truly are rockstars. I've been playing GTA since the original top downs and they just keep getting better. The campaign of this is fun and well varied but the shining star is the multiplayer.I've been playing this since release on the 360 the amount and quality of updates and free DLC far surpasses any other modern game I've played and they keep on happening! The variety of activities available in online both in free mode and missions is amazing there is something for everyone here. The recent Gunrunning DLC has prompted me to write this review.Personally this is my favorite car game at the moment it fills the void left by the lack of a true successor to NFS Underground 2 strangely enough. I love collecting the cars modifying them goofing around with them going on cruises and the racing ain't too bad either for arcade style play. I do prefer non contact racing people can be ramming jerks but that's a individual player issue not a design issue very thankful to have options. Speaking of community I love the random car meets that happen in online folks are pretty cool around here (and yes it's fun sometimes to have a few moments of vendetta against griefers). The more recent vehicles have more customization options which is always a good thing I'm frequently impressed by what they are able to work into such an already complex game. The lowrider hoppers are fantastic the trophy truck is an actual tube frame racer with body panels and long travel suspension that functions as it should there's even a donk. A well deserved shoutout to the specialty water and air vehicles they're all well done. Oh and of course this is GTA going on a rampage is fun though I sometimes wish 5 stars brought out tanks. There still are the lovely antics of a GTA setting with the absurd radio commercials and in lore media crazy characters crime related debauchery the whole enchilada. Rockstar hasn't lost their way and I'm happy that GTA is still GTA. I don't play games as much as some other gamers but this is easily one of my favorites. I frequently choose to play it instead of many of the hundreds of other games I own. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It really pisses me off that so many people went out of their way to post as many negative GTAV reviews after Take2's C&amp D of OpenIV. I personally wouldn't have cared much if the reviews weren't all like "Rockstar has always treated us like this is the last drop" or "GTAV is ruined now."Literally off.I'm the last person to defend billion dollar companies most of the time. And let me get this straight I'm against the actions taken by Take2 against OpenIV. But to go ahead and actively try to destroy the reputation of arguably one of the best games of the last decade is not at all warranted. Rockstar Games has a track record of making some of the most high quality games in the industry for the past decade and a half with GTA IV Red Dead Redemption and GTA V receiving a lot of care post launch to the point of giving us some amazing standalone DLC in IV Lost &amp Damned IV Ballad of Gay Tony and RDR Undead Nightmare. For Red Dead and GTA V they even gave us loads and loads of DLC for free. Rockstar also has been very friendly to the modding community with GTA San Andreas IV and V being just as famous for its modding community as for its singleplayer and multiplayer content. I highly doubt Rockstar agreed with Take2's decision to C&amp D modders to begin with which is now basically proven with Take2's lift of said C&amp D. Rockstar and its undeniably high quality products shouldn't be demonized for decisions their publisher made.The game is still amazing mods or not. Even though I'm definitely a cheap bastard I definitely think I got way more than my money's worth out of the $120 I paid for the experience over two platforms PS3 and PC. Take2 can't ruin my enjoyment of the game with their t. I'm definitely gonna be playing a lot more.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For those people who are looking at the score and thinking "mostly negative"? this is for 2 reasons. Take2 games (the publishers on GTA 5) removed a user created mod that got round security issues in GTA that allowed modders to come online and destroy the community.So before this mod was removed you would have a lot of people saying the campaign was great great story great characters etc but then say that the online part of the game (the reason why i bought the game) was full of hackers who would just kill everyone in the lobby in a single click making online unplayable unless your in a friends only or invite only and then you can not do everything....After the mod was removed people are now giving this game poor reviews due to the fact this mod was removed.So its got bad feedback from modders and none modders due to the timing of everything. So here is my option on the game mainly focusing online.I personally was not a fan of GTA SA probably because by the time i got to play it i was used to 1080p graphics however I did play a lot of GTA 4. So when GTA 5 came out (on Xbox 360 and PS3) I got the game and I loved it. The campaign as said before is amazing. They removed the realistic car driving and replaced it with something everyone can use. The game feels more flewed and they really used the map. So when it was announced for PC i was one of the ones who preordered the game.I was a bit disheartened when i needed to complete the prologue however the fact I could transfer my GTA online character over from Xbox I was then happy again. I was blown away at the graphics on this game even at low settings and even more at how the GTA Online game mode uses the GTA map so well (you really do use all of the map with most of it in the city).I am sorry to say there are microtransactions in the game however these are completely optional as they only give you in game money something that you can easy get in online mode.The community has always been mixed with some people just getting on with the GTA life and others who will chase you all over the map trying to kill you over and over again so when you turn to passive mode they go away and bother someone else.The online mode even free mode is extremely fun as there is so much to do with freemode challenges that appear a lot ceo jobs etc. and once you have done all of that there are the original minigames with new ones added every so often there are 5 different heists and more.I have managed to sinc 280 hours into the game mostly being Online. And I didn't have any friends who got the game on PC too so it should be even better then.This game is a port from the console however it stacks up very well as a port (as long as your not on a AMD based processor that's is FX series or lower Ryzen processors i'm not sure). And if you do find a hacker do exactly what you would do on any other game and report then and then move to a different lobby. I find a hacker 1 in every 20 lobbies it seems. They can be annoying but they are in every other game.

review: Let me preface this with Not all modders are bad. Some of them actually used Open IV for what it was intended for making awesome player created content. But as they say a few (or a lot in this case) bad apples spoiled the bunch. If you've been on GTA Online in recent months the unscrupulous modders have gotten out of hand. Every session had modders who would drop explosives on everyone in the session killing them or toggle Godmode or teleport everyone to one spot on the map and blow them up constantly or disable your weapons or delete 500K of your money every second or crash your game. It was getting ridiculous. You couldn't find a server without some modder ruining the fun for legit players. SMH at all the modding people throwing a temper tantrum like a 5 year old would and leaving these reviews. You did this to yourselves. You have forced Take 2 and Rockstar's hand. Please don't give me that "Nuh uhh I din du nuffin" bullcrap. Sharkcard sales are Rockstar's cash cow. I don't blame them for what they did. The modders were effing with their business. Where do you think all the FREE DLC comes from? GTA5/O is a great game. Top 5 game of all time IMO. Don't listen to these whiners. I just hope Rockstar and Take 2 can clean up and ban the cheaters from this game. If the past week is any indication of cleaning up the servers then they have already done a great job. Flame away whiners.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Modding is a privilege NOT A RIGHT.I find it baffling that people are condemning this game's reviews based on mod support. Furthermore they only stopped the usage of ONE mod tool that they found to be against their terms or dangerous to their IP...and need I say one of the best video game IPs of all time? Let the player base (100k+ at the time of this review on Steam alone) speak for itself non of the 35k negative reviewers stopped playing the game! And why is that? Simple...This game is fantastic. From the story to the multiplayer it is literally a damn near perfect game. On top of that all DLC is accessible to everyone and literally everything can be bought with in game cash. Who the hell could ever complain about this game? It's a blatant example of how to PROPERLY make and support a game.Playing the game as intended is incredible. Even after 170 hours on Steam and exponentially more on console I ing love this game. The constant stream of content to the multiplayer makes it endlessly playable. Asking someone NOT to experience this gem because of the support of ONE mod team is absurd and an irresponsible use of the review system.Instead of asking you not to support this game in some childish little protest I'd rather ask you to make the purchase on your own merit and based on the following Do you enjoy well designed and polished video games? Do you enjoy incredibly voiced and written story that is refreshingly entertaining even still in 2017? Do you enjoy open world and ever expanding multiplayer content? Do you enjoy character and vehicle customization on a deep level in all game modes?If your answer to any or all of those were YES then you will enjoy this game. Period.

review: I'll take the time to say thank you Rockstar and Take Two Interactive for sorting out a huge problem with the game. I know I'm going to get a lot of flak for this and everyone saying it's wrong to say so because they refuse to accept the reality of the situation.Thank you for stopping a mod / program that allowed people to bypass the security of the game especially online. All of you who are sending flak to the developers for stopping a hugely faulty issue let me tell you why.1) All of you are saying that there are a lot of hackers in the game. A bunch of those people are actually modders who used OpenIV to mod game files and allow themselves access to GTA 5's developer console / menu allowing them to do anything they wish in both online and offline.2) The creators of the mod OpenIV never cared about online play. They knew that online was a thing and a huge part of GTA 5 they knew that they had the option to restrict it for online play and not cause issues for Rockstar. They picked not too they released it without thought and allowed people to take it and start doing half of the things you see online.3) Rockstar is left with two choices. They either let people continue to do mods at the expense of their game other peoples enjoyment and their gaming experience. Or they stop this mod dead in its tracks and cut off a huge line of cheats that people abuse online.They picked the second option. Yes there will still be cheaters or hackers but not in a greater number anymore. You guys are all whining and crying about losing mods. They never said modding is illegal they never said people still can't use mods. They merely stopped a tool that allowed straight up access to Rockstar high level developer stuff including online stuff. You should be thanking them and come up with ways of doing mods WITHOUT having to use a software that includes cheating.

There are plenty of games nowadays that will focus on either multiplayer or single player but not have a quality offering in BOTH GTAV rises above.Currently a lot of entitled gamers are forgetting what an awesome game this is &amp because they hold Rockstar &amp Take Two to such incredibly high standards (High standards that the developer and publisher have earned due to being INCREDIBLE and offering AMAZING games) are slamming this game with undeserved poor ratings in a childish attempt to strong arm the developer/publisher into changing their position on a modding issue. It's a matter that belongs on the discussion boards NOT in the reviews.This is a good solid game. The single player is great the multiplayer is great the open world is amazing the freedom of vehicles is ridiculous the radio stations are great the DJs are hillarious everything has raised the bar. There is literally zero reason for any complaints as far as the quality of this game is conscerned.

review: This review is for the people who are curious about the game and thinking of buying this game.For singleplayer purposes Pros Great Story (nice character depth funny and twisted plot) Good graphics Long story (around 10 20 hours of story and more if you roam around)Cons Some objectives can be boringThats all i can think of.Now lets talk about Online experience.For starters i dont really care about modding.so i won't be talking about how "stopping mod support" decision changed the game.Pros Nice plot on heists Good co op or online teaming experience PvP available To earn money you can do heists you can do business(that contains stealing and selling) or motorclub business Mediocre character building optionsCons HACKERS.I'm not talking about some guy with infinite ammo.Hackers in this game have GOD MODE.Yes you read it right.You can find out hackers almost in any server(happens a lot).They can teleport you to somewhere and kill you.They dont get hurt they have infinite ammo they have infinite money.I mean come on wtf is this cr*p... You will see people begging for money in servers INFINITE LOADING TIME.Seriously it takes more than 10 minutes to connect to a server.Then it takes like 2 5 minutes more to find a suitable server or find your friend.If somehow your game crashes it will take the same process again.Result You can play it with your friends but be aware hackers can find you or you may wanna kill yourself for fun while waiting for the loading screens

review: In short to everyone who is hating on take two as of late. 1. Do the jobs to make moeny.2. Get over the loss of mods it was a needed sacrifice.3. If you don't like shark cards don't buy them. 4. Stop begging for money when you see a modder in a lobby. 5. Just because they removed mods does not mean the game is bad. 6. DO THE JOBS TO MAKE MOENY. 7. Enjoy them game as you always have when online. 8. Get over yourselves. I do regret the loss of single player mods I have never personally has any installed but I have played some before and enjoyed them. Rockstar and Take Two are trying to make the online community fair and cheat free. People will beg for money then cry when they are banned. Get over it this happened and it is likly it will never be reverted. Other than that this is an excelent game with many options on how to play. The money is easy to make after becoming a CEO the grind there is a little unplesant. But all in all 10/10 keep up the good work take two team.

Completed the main campaign three times now.

review: The PC game I've been waiting for since Half Life.Although this title has alreday been out for more than 2 years I am not writing this review based on the PS3 release nor the PS4 release (although owned and completed on both systems previously!). This game is the epitome of game development. I enjoyed GTA 3 and IV on PC and they were beautiful and stunning at that time but something about GTA V has got me feeling like Rockstar has raised the bar past even Valve's original Half Life BLASPHEMY! .Pros Stunningly realistic. Rockstar spared NO expense when it came to GTA V! feels looks and plays like a true living breathing city Attention to detail is second to none Gameplay mechanics and controls (keyboard mouse and/or controller) are fluid and optimized Story is so much fun you might play it twice (or more ...)! Evading police is actually more than possible now and fun! seemlingly limitless replay valueCons High 'Grass' or low FPS your choice! Police are telepathic and that detracts from the realism at times ... Even with extreme hardware system(s) still lag with Ultra 'Grass' Non destructable environment (I'm being petty) ... Crop Duster mission

review: Find a BMW. Steal it.While you are cruising around in your new sweet ride you see a Ferrari. You get out of the BMW and help yourself to the Ferrari.Then after circling around for a few minutes you decide you want to get on a motorcycle for a change of pace. You help yourself again to another bike.After the bike throws you off and you can't find it you climb into a tesla and cruise around in the pure electric car.Once again you have wrecked the Tesla in a crash. You then find a beautiful Maserati and take one out for a spin.And you somehow manage to crash it while robbing an armored truck. Once again you are ride less until you settle for a Ford GT.Finding the GT to be too common you hijack an Aston Martin to get that James Bond feel.And you crash it too.Then you fancy your eyes on a Bugatti. And take it. And now the cops are after you shooting and wrecking the Bugatti until you get wasted.And you wonder why the cops didnt chase you earlier.10/10

review: This is the GTA game that does everything and gets everything exactly right. It is a ing masterpiece especially with the movie maker and much improved graphics over the weaker console versions. Buy it. Buy it now.The plot? It approaches the low side of Scorsese or Tarantino quality in terms of crime drama. The graphics? Amazing. The sound? You know.The gameplay? Absolutely superb nearly flawless with one serious issue which I will explain.GTA V was unfortunately made first and foremost as a console game. If you don't have a good controller the combat can be difficult and the driving can be painful. The game is best played with a controller but I found it advantageous to switch between controller and mokey depending on the situation.Sniping? Machine gunning government goons from a stationary position? Go for the mokey. For everything else there's the controller. The insanely overpowered autolock ability in and of itself is crucial to your survival in combat so get used to it the gameplay was not scaled back to be normally playable without it. Unfortunately the game makes no allowances to keep you from targeting comrades with it which is just stupid in this day and age. Trying to play this game straight mokey is really difficult I don't recommend it.In virtually all other ways this game is perfect.

review: Stunning. Everything I hoped it would be.After this long wait for the PC version I was filled with hype until the last few weeks or so just with the delays and the dodgy Online sort of killed it towards the end but it's in my top 3 favourite games.It's amazing with it's profound detail and top end graphics (if you can run them). Even if you can only go up to medium this game looks great if you're not picky with your textures.The gameplay and feel is spectacular with it's responsive driving with weighty feel (until you flip your car and can easily turn it back up right with ease which isn't necessarily a bad thing) to it's top notch gun play all wrapped together with a damn thrilling story and multiplayer. I honestly feel I do not even need to make a review for this game as everyone already knows how good it is either from friends or YouTube videos I just felt like I should make one after packing in so many hours into it.PCMasterRace/10

review: Why do I rate this game horribly?A story mode everyone already knows since last year so SP is essentially useless and you would want this for online.(All of SP useless)Multiplayer awful load timeshorrible laghackers (tons)russians spamming both chat and their 1 ruble micsppl always trying to run you over (even in passive mode)a useless mental state that increases if you want to kill civilians for funexpensive as cars in onlineSo the mental state is basically supposed to put aggressive players with each other the thing is you can lose it quickly and its not good at representing the stupid people who kill you when you just wanna passively play with friends. I remember times when I was at the lowest possible mental state but was put in an online game with multiple RED people (Red being the highest state) I guess you could argue that they got it while they joined the session but why put ME in a session with all those people? IMO mental state is stupid as it goes up even if you want to have fun and say run over civilians like in SP.Load times are the second worst part of the game connecting to online is a ing nightmare and takes the longest amount of time possible. It doesn't help that your friends are not in steam instead they're supposed to be in the SOCIAL CLUB. Good luck opening that if your steam overlay is opened with the HOME key. or actually good luck adding anyone because the social club is so amazingly cryptic that its hard to even find friends you know on it!Finally the worst part. ALWAYS ONLINE DRM. THE MODERN DAY WAY OF SAYING YOU TO PAYING CUSTOMERS. SO YOU CAN'T PLAY SINGLEPLAYER OFFLINE YOU NEED TO CONNECT TO INTERNET TO PLAY IT OTHERWISE THE ROCKSTAR SOCIAL CLUB WILL DENY YOU ACCESS TO GTA V FOR NOT CONNECTING TO THEIR SERVERS.4/10 for its servers the game itself isn't bad but its not worth all this money when they are giving you something from last year essentially.

review: This game is generally fun once you have achieved most of the things that you needed like having tons of cash but it gets boring when you play solo as it takes a very long time to grind. If you have friends to play with you all the time sure this game is for you. But if you're not that kind of player unless you got this for story mode then GTA won't be as exciting. The story mode is a dynamic experience with well fabricated story as well as pretty much mission impossible in a game.There are some features I want to make clear that might not make your experience as great in online Customer service is absolutely useless Buying Shark cards is a waste of money Some of the community isn't that friendly.Anyways I suggest getting newer games as this one is getting incredibly outdated and god knows when Rockstar is gonna work on the many glitches instead of giving the game more loads. But that's just my opinion.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So I played for almost 1 and a half hour with a random person doing the Bogdan Problem Heist ( Finale )...1. We kept on repeating because my teammate always dies in the submarine part.2. After almost 1 hour we finally finished the submarine part and we can fly now to the dropoff and I'm so excited to get a lot of money. ( I'm still new and I'm level 8 )3. I went to the turret to defend our Avenger then this sh*t happened...3. This stupid and buggy game suddenly stucked at the black loading screen when I'm about to enter the turret control area.4. What's funny is I'm kicked for being idle in the session...Just wow...10/10 would not play again.P.S Seriously devs how about fixing your game first rather than adding useless stuff in the game. I'm trying to grind this game and it seems the game won't let me do it. In a day IRL it seems I can do only 1 good heist because all other heists are quitting teammates sudden crashes and very loooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggggggggg loading time. Please please please...FIX your game.

review: Offline gets old without mods.Online is fun if you or someone you know can inject the bank with a big load of money. Otherwise it's the worst grindfest I've ever participated in and that's before mentioning the people who will give you trouble for no reason at all it only takes one rocket from them to ruin the last five hours of your efforts.This is a fun casual game when there are no griefers around and if you take the enjoyment very very slowly. Not as slow as the grind takes though try to just discover one vehicle or two every day with the ton of money you've got from the mod menu. There's a lake fairly north in the map with three or four streams stemming from it go for a jetski run with a buddy or two. Take up some Motorcycle Club or Organization jobs on occasion to spice it up a little. Pick up the mini events in the lobby and see if you can manage the longest wheelie or furthest flight upside down.On the note of mod menus there will be many people who abuse them but on occasion some will use theirs to kick griefers or abusive mod users. Not everyone with a mod menu deserves to be reported.There's an obscene number of toddler minded people out there. Do not waste any time or effort on them. Report vote to kick and refrain from speaking to them. Anything you say can and will be thrown in your face with absolutely no reason or logic behind it._All in all yeah. Skip the grind via modding the bank buy and play with things slowly and stay on your toes with griefers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: very nice
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm loathe to recommend this game but recommend I will..but it has to be stressed that the recommendation is only for the SP mode. The SP mode is pretty awesome stories missions graphics are well done and I found myself genuinely being bothered for the characters (even if in reality they'd be sociopathic nightmares to one degree or another). You don't really get it from the advertising blurb but the main missions are pretty extensive (70+) with plenty of side missions most of which are not too shabby.Thanks to the good SP experience I decided to venture into GTAO. What a mess. GTAO lacks proper information as to how to navigate their system so that you're not constantly being bothered by others and Rockstar has intentionally made it that if you try to limit your online experience to solo play then it's pretty miserable..with repetitive missions and absolutely tons of grind (unless you pay of course). The only other options is that you go into public sessions with passive mode on but that limits what you can do..or that you tweak things to go into a public session then get yourself thrown out into a public session on your own (i.e. solo public sessions) though that is both annoying to do and frowned upon.Just to make things *more* miserable for the new players there's no balance in the public sessions and some of the vehicles / weapons for those who paid / played more are so incredibly OP as to make Saints Row blush.I'm sure if you have a few friends to play GTAO and limit it to them only it's a much better experience..but unless you do avoid avoid avoid..and stick to the SP.Edit I should mention that this was played on Proton / Linux doing so does impact framerate add occasional stutters and some instablity compared to the Windows version but was very playable.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I would reccomend this game as it is very enjoyful and entertaining but this error has ruined the game and if im going to have to reinstall everytime i get it i would'nt recommend paying 40 to spend more time downloading the game than playing it.

review: I just recently bought this game during a steam sale and it's been fun playing online but the connection is absolutely terrible. Half the time I'm teleporting across the map when I get in a car with other players. Just awful online optimization. Almost reminds me of the Computer to Computer host based system of Gears of War. Just awful connections. And no advanced server search or any way to find a server close to you. I found 3 new sessions in a row (10 minutes of loading mind you) just to get into 3 different games with Chinese people. I couldn't even sprint right. But when all the circumstances are right it's a fun game.

review: Stopped Loading around 63%. Found a workaround but no missions are showing and I can't switch characters. I give up.Regardless + hundreds of people no one to talk to + dozens of "things to do" nothing fun/relevant to do + Huge beautiful city Very linear story+ Great driving mechanics Lots of cars No reason to drive Just take a taxi to the next mission.+ Money Nothing meaningful to spend it on+ A bunch of phone contacts No one to talk toGTAV is an amazing technical accomplishment (when it works) but doesn't have much substance. Rockstar could take some tips from Bethesda and CD Project RED ... Why can't I join gangs?Lead gangs?Get involved in street politics?Become a drug dealer like in "Chinatown wars" Why aren't there more side missions?Steal cars and sell them Strip them Have people call me Fill orders for parts.Become a donHave random characters call me for assistance with domestic problems.Extort politicians Become a pimpHandle the girls Handle their Johns. Have more randomized events that I can deal with myself or let my squad handle Get reports on how it went.Let me handle their pay and deal with revolts or loyaltyWhy are there so many meaningless races?And flying trails?and meaningless distractions that don't affect my character ... or the game.I want to build something ... not just jump over hurdles in perfect sequence. Even if this game didn't stop working ... I probably wouldn't finish it.I'm not buying another Rockstar game until they start showing something new. Not just prettier versions of what they have already done.

Then they simply set up the game so you have to get Shark Cards in order to purchase anything new or worthwhile they put out. Buttom line get this game for the campaign and as for multiplayer you could take it or leave it based on the direction Rock Star is going at this moment.

review: Better and Better!I haven't played this on PC as much as i have on Xbox360 or even PS4. but my gameplay all together would be astoundingly high. this is easily the best GTA game yet with a super awesome campaign with almost too much to do and with modding its SOO good. the PC version is Sexy as hell! and first person is really enjoyable (going ape with a hatchet) lol. BUT... the BEST thing is multiplayer its one of the best RPG Racing FPS/3rdperson shooter action masterpieces all rolled into one very sweet package. you will never be bored and if you are you're doing something wrong. customisation is wicked combat is very competative and smooth. and if you play with friends its even better. storming free mode with a squad of loyal Phycopaths is just too good. The only bad thing is everything on multiplayer is expensive to a almost free to play standard but is fine really because the campaign is worth the initial purchase and if rockstar wants to make multiplayer slightly free to play with there FREE dlc then fine. Its just Brilliant!!!!!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What can I say? The game has just about everything or at least something for everyone.Best played with friends especially if you want to complete heists without lobbing your monitor out the window in a futile display of infantile rage. This rage will almost always be directed at one of two things.1) random people are terrible at communicating cooperating and just being helpful in general. 2) computer AI has some amazing accuracy and range capabilitiesGraphics top notch but might require some tweaks in order to find a balance between performance and qualityControls It's GTA. Nothing new here. Mouse + Keyboard for shooting/on foot a controller for some vehicles (chopper planes) seems best. If you want to drive AND shoot at the same time (accurately) mouse + kb is good. If you're just driving controller.Story it's Rockstar Ridiculous dialogue characters plot. Voice acting is amazing. Sheer amount of crap you can do in the game world that doesn't involve the actual story... just amazing.Online Be prepared to wade through griefers hackers morons etc. But don't let that discourage you massive amounts of hilarity and fun can be had when you get into a good game with a group of people that don't base their fun off of ruining everyone else's experience. Freemode is filled with this.You really can't run out of things to do in this game.. whether online or off Races (car boat motorcycle jet helicopter bicycle) tennis matches golf games arm wrestling darts skydiving/parachuting off roading armed robbery gang attacks deathmatch survival last team standing missions against AI.... You get the picture.The best part of the game is that some of the most fun you have is just PLAYING THE GAME. No clear objective no goal no job.... just messing around and letting your imagination run wild.Money well spent.Note LOTS of loading screens and online is really frustrating at times as you're always getting booted or your friends are. Can't connect half the time and again LOAD SCREENS. Srsly it's still a good game but.... wow is this poorly done.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is a blast. I have tried it on two different systems. One is an older desktop with componants that are several years old and the optimization allows me to play the game with default settings and it looks good. On my new gaming laptop it plays flawlessly at the highest settings with no detectable lag.. I have never seen graphics and details like this in any game. Everywhere you look there is detail. The world looks very close to real. The online portion is more robust than i thought it might be. There really is so much to explore and do in this game I can see myself racking up hundreds of hours on it. Is it worth paying full price for it? Yeah I would say it is. I would also recommend using a game controller. I went and picked up a logitech cheapo for 20 bucks just for this game. Crank up the graphics if your systm can handle it. This one is sweet.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Honestly I can't say there is much that I dislike about GTA V. I guess the only thing I don't like about it is that it feels like there isn't enough of a selection of music to listen to. Other than that I can't really think of much that I don't like. I definitely like the storyline and was a bit sad when I finally finished the game.I personally wish the story mode was a bit longer but none the less I do like the ending I got. They also came up with some very unique and strong characters and it is impressive how the GTA Team made the characters lives connect together throughout the course of the game.I would definitely recommend this game to others.

review: Just the perfomance alone deserves 5 stars. On my five year old rig it still runs 60 fps pretty darn steady. Every other hour there are a few dips but I can live with it! I even have most settings bumped up a notch above low/med. It's amazing. Alt+tabbing works perfectly fine (along with alt+enter). Considering I can't run GTA4 at a constant 30 fps even this really impresses me.I have only played online for about 15 minutes (which actually was a plessant experience).Overall it's a fantastic game in my opinion (story enviroment music gameplay freedom). The helicopter controls could be a little more advanced but other than that most vehicles handle very... Don't wanna call it realistic but "believable"! I'll cut this review short right here and come back later!

review: The game itself is amazing! It is fun as hell.In terms of performance it runs like a charm. I heard the 750ti was able to get a 50 to 60fps on high 1080p. The downside are the current drivers they aren't too get yet. It may take another month for AMD to release better drivers. Performance is good but stuttering and fps drops can occur they are rare though. There is also an issue with system ram. If you play for about 2 hours your ram will start to fill up. This maybe a slow memory leak. It sucks for those who have less than 8GB. Hell I have 8GB and this ram issue occurs within 2 to 3 hours of play.

review: So this is a game I was very excited to get on pc......now its like sitting in a drunk dentist's chair. Mind you I am pretty sure the game has been out close to 2 years on every system and on PC the launch is like the game was never tested at all. I have 4 other friends that have issues with me IE crashing huge lag online freezing losing items losing random cash missing saved cars and clothes stutter and framerate drops. Funniest thing is....there is a store to buy cash for online play...and I pray no one is dumb enough to buy it due to the fact that cars clothes and guns randomly dissapear rendering that real life cash for cash purchase the biggest mistake anyone could make. Usually I am a huge rockstar supporter but after my 5th crash today in solo (offline play) and uncountable crashes online...i want to take this digital purchase and smash in over my kne drag in out in the street ...and shoot it in the damn face. 60 dollars wasted at this moment and i hope/pray Rockstar or steam fixes this heap on donkey

review: Best game i have played for years and years...I am so speechless over how good a job Rockstar did on this game.I am beyond any doubt convinced that EVEN if games of this genre don't apply to your "type" of gaming you will bow in honor to how well this game is made. I will admit that even tho i never really played any of the previous titles in this franchise i must admit that they have done a better job for each release over the years... Atleast according to a big number of my friends that HAVE played all the prequals.Seriously no cons at all here and i can say that with confidence specially since i have completed the single player part and thrown a decent amount of time on the multiplayer part wich is if you don't mind me saying a FULL game by its self.I have gain such a respect for Rockstar that i might blindly and with out checking any reviews by what ever next game they develop. That is to say if they keep up the level of quality and content as they have done with this game.Like i said before the game is so good that even if games like this is not your cup of tea (usually) then i think you should find a way of trying it out so you can see what the hell im talking about or just trust me and buy the game if you have the correct speccs.If you somehow still are in doubt then wait a little while more and check out youtube for NEW pc only videos where people will be showing off the movie creator software that was included with this (PC) release so you can see what fun this game really brings to the table.I already felt like i got my moneys worth when i finished the single player campaign and before i even touched the multiplayer part. And wtf? Where are the bugs? I did'nt see a single bug even tho im sure there are some xD.DO NOT let the 4354 negative reviews effect your judgement in ANYWAY since they ALL are the result of people not able to install the game correctly due to and i quote from steam "Some customers are experiencing issues Installing or Playing GTAV due to a Windows User Account Name error. Click here for details on how to workaround the issue."There for there is no real bad reviews about this game ).100/10 Insane replayablility

GTA V on Steam is the best way to experiance the fifth installment of Rockstar Games trademark franchise with First Person mode you can for the first time in a GTA game explore the city of Los Santos and the metropolis of San Andreas in the best way. First Person mode is the best way to experiance Grand Theft Auto advanced graphics settings a dynamic control scheme for the PC community above a whole other wide range of features. Rockstars epic definetely deserves a 10/10 and a recommendation for download. It may be nearly 40 ($60 in US) but for what your paying its worth it and will be even more worth it when the Steam sales hit in.

review: I've played the PS3 release of GTA 5 and finsihed it. Now for my review of GTA 5 on PC The game isn't much different besides a few details most of them minor. ie more haircuts and horn sounds. Some nice new weapons added. The graphics look great but I guess that is individual to your rig. I really thought first person mode was going to be more than it is. Your view is restricted in first person also walking in first person is much different than in third person. it's more like a rushed tap dance. That being said it's a refreshing addition and many of the visuals have been tweaked to allow it. ie getting hit by a car beating someone up.

review: This is one of the best games I've ever played and is quite possibly my favourite game ever. So much about this game is just perfect (while there are multiple annoyances but the gameplay for me is just so outstanding that it really makes up for it. And the online is just amazing if a bit difficult to get money and RP. There is a lot of grinding involved unless you want to by shark cards (which are way overpriced). Although the grinding can be fun if you switch up the missions frequently and play a lot of heist with your friends. All round I'd probably give this game a 4.5/5 just because while it is probably my favourite game ever it certainly is not perfect. That award probably goes to Portal. UPDATE I was just banned from the online for no reason at all. Only for ten days but still super upset. I do still recommend this game as it is insanely fun but Rockstar support is The y won't answer a thing they say and they immediately closed my support ticket. UPDATE WHAT THE ACTUAL TAKE TWO YOU BANNED MODDING WHAT THE IS WRONG WITH YOU AAAAAAAAAAAAAA I seriously want to die. Take Two is screwing over the game with the microtransaction infested hell hole that is the online and it's awful. The single player was and still is fantastic but the online is screwing over the game so badly. Especially now that Take Two essentially got rid of all the mods for the single player. This is a super move and I would not recommend buying this game unitl OpenIV is back. This is such a thing to do and I hate it and you should too. It's just another way to force the grind and microtransactions on the players. And it's even worse when you realise that GTAV is the 4th best selling game in the world and has made billions yet they're still forcing money out of the people who have already spent $60+ on this game. t. Do not buy it.

review: I had goals in this game. Played a ton. Done a of heists to get that awesomely overpriced pegasus vehicle that I did many hours of Youtube research on. Until the great wave of "modders." Ever since these guys came along. This game was never the same. My willingness to do ANYTHING besides around and splurge my wealth on the most pointless things is gone. I heard a couple of rumours that R*'s been pumpin' a hell of a lot of anti cheat/modding into this game but all it's doing is killing everyone's fps. Seriously R*. Not. I repeat. Not a good start for your first...and maybe even last multiplayer attempt. The game's is great otherwise with its stunning graphics and details. It'd be better if I could see it all in a smooth panoramic mouse slide without a stutter here and there. Long story short. Recommending the game. Just make sure you got the internet of the gods and a graphics card to follow.

review: When I first got this game the moment on PC I was expecting a bit of a buggy mess but actually it's a lot better than I thought however you need a Rockstar Social Club in order to play single and multiplayer. There were some glitches here and there but doesn't pop up far too much. I managed to beat the single player without much problems whatsoever. However I beaten this game on console so I am more familiar with the controller in comparison to the keyboard. I'd recommend playing on controller mostly because some controls with some parts of the game that would be troublesome.Besides the bonus is that you get extra weapons once you are a returning player so if you link your Xbox or PSN account to your social club you get extra weapons However I should mention right now there was a glitch but I was the only one who got the "all in order" and "loyalty" achievement which gives you an extra 2 million together. The other three should've got it but they didn't. In case you don't know it's the achivement if you get all heists in order with the same players. you get an extra 2 million. However the first heist only allows 2 while the rest allows 4 players.I'd give this a 7/10 for multiple of reasons. First being that this takes place in San Andreas but the map is only one island I was somewhat felt let down that it was not the same map as the PS2 classic remade in HD sort of deal like GTA IV was taken place in Liberty City. I would love to get an apartment from Las Vegas pyramid building. Second being some parts needs to be fixed Hydra fighter jet with GTA Online needs to speed up when landing gear is away Radio needs to have volume enabled so I can listen to self made music more better the loyalty and all in order achievement needs to be fixed for the other players who didn't get it beside myself Third being The single player doesn't have difficulties but the checkpoints somewhat made it far more easier in comparison to the other games didn't feel as much classy and challenging as the games before..Anyway the game is fun and a lot of room to mess around with and having a lot of fun with money.. Oh I should mention that there is Microtransactions in this game that if you spend a bit of real money in exchange for a lot of in game money for GTA Online.

review: This game is incredible! Not only is it optimized for PC but the graphics and pretty much everything have made the PC version a definitive version. However there are a few quirks for this game at least for me. Also keep in mind most of these problems are specific to online. First is that the stocks for bawsaq in story mode seem to be broken (not moving) for now but I believe it will be fixed in a new update soon. The second is that transferred characters have a few problems on them notably the lipstick problem. However it can be fixed through a simple trip to the barber shop but even then it is an inconvenience. Those are pretty much the only problems. Overall this game was worth the wait and delays considering how polilshed it is. I do however believe that we will be seeing new features as well as performance optimizations from Rockstar in the next few weeks.

review: Took me four days to get it working but when I did I was and wasn't disappointed. I WAS disappointed by the graphics and shadowing. The shadows for me at least were pixelated and horrendous. The shadows went through typical textures and just was a massive turn off. Since there are so many shadows it's really hard to ignore them. They were so gross I just had to stop playing. Hoping that when I play it next the game fixes itself. I know for sure my computer should be able to play it with ease. As it can play each other AAA game out there without breaking a sweat. But for some reason GTA V is just like "LOL you Suck my I ain't workin' for you". The graphics for me at least were exactly like PS3/PS4 with no noticable difference. As the GTA series is my favorite game series alive I am going to recommend this. But a lot of people have been having problems. So be wary when buying this game. You could your pants on how amazing it is or you could thrash your keyboard on how big of a waste of money it was.

review: It's obviously not the players who are the problem. It's Rockstar.Everyone knows what to expect when you put thousands of people in a free for all without any structure or purpose. It doesn't take a tactician to know that it's going to be utter chaos. Money is all but meaningless in GTA because of Shark Cards and lax penalties for cheating. In fact the only penalty I see in GTA is the penalty on players using passive mode wherein they can't even use weapons to defend themselves against NPC's.There are such easy fixes like 1. Bring back the GTA4 style passive lobbies.2. Allow a hardcore (realistic) mode that excludes all explosives except regular grenades and doesn't allow you to shoot out of armored cars.3. Create more meaningful reasons to kill NPC bad guys and more co op events instead of all competitive.4. Release some social structure DLC's like gyms pool tables cards clubs maybe even basketball or skateboarding so that the world is more immersive and less boring5. Get rid of those ing planes!There are many other games out there besides GTA5 and not one of them is even close to the toxic cesspool that Rockstar's created and instead of fixing their problems and giving NORMAL people a reason to play they just isolate the normies into private servers and add things to make the game even more toxic. Rockstar is a multibillion dollar company. It's not run by morons. They're doing this on purpose.

review: Now this game has had mixed over its long life but i want to take a look at it over the years as a whole. GTA 5 on release was great things were balanced money was hard to get but was balanaced out as things wernt rediculously priced. I think the most expensive car was 1 or 2 mill at most. Now we look at today and the first thing you notice when you log in is the shark card and spend money shoved in your face. The game is so focused on wanting "YOU" to spend money to get in game items. Things have increased dramastically in price which is fine but which isnt fine is how hard it still is to get money. Rockstar has a problem with giving out money. Every method of money making that comes out that is efficient is either fixed or patched. One of the biggest ways to make money when i used to play was the pacific heist and after they patched the easy way to grind it i quit. Next i want to talk about the biggest issue since the game realased 5 years ago cheating.... Cheating is a big problem in the game and rockstar takes no actions to counteract the problem other than banning people which is extreamly inefficient as cheaters will just keep cheating. When you take a look at cheating as a whole when modders can drop you 200 million dollars why would you ever buy shark cards? Im gonna be completly honest your better off having someone drop you money as you dont seem to get banned from other players dropping you money. As rockstar seem to not give a you might as well. Better yet nce you do get banned you have no way to talk to rockstar (just like steam) everything is automated bots! Once your banend your done!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Online is excellent amazing and a shining example of multiplayer bliss.When it works.Depending on your internet and your friend's this could be an unmatched experience.Or Loading Screen Simulator.For me it works more often than not so I applaud it.The single player campaign is a mixed bag.Franklin is good.Michael is great.Trevor is a hipster.The characters are good the writing is excellent the shooting/driving is better than ever.However.Just like the age of America it seeks to satire its message is confused counter intuitve and contradictory. It spends too much time in some places and not enough in others.GTA IV was a hallmark of excellence in its social commentary.San Andreas retained that excellence in that same regard while being an over the top experience.Vice City was content to be a throwback to the 80's mob movie much like MGS 3 was to the James Bond franchise.GTA III was one of the first open world games ever made and rightly regarded as a te al wonder.GTA V has none of these accomplishments and very little focus in regards to what it wants to be.GTA Online works because it's very difficult not to have fun causing mayhem with your friends.The mechanics are polished the DLC adequate but there is little to no spark in the final product.No glimmer of artistic mastery that made Red Dead Redmeption so poignant.No novelty that made L.A. Noire so unique.Nothing that its predecessors brought to the table to lift them above and beyond the call of duty.GTA V is a great game but not a hallmark of its generation.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have to currently write up this review with not recommended. Pros .First person is beautiful and works great..Frames really are 60frames per second even with old computer hardware..The game world looks really aliveand that's about where I end my positives because of the Cons listed belowCons The BIGGEST issue is optimizing for frames per second is one thing. They completely forgot about optimizing for VRAM. If you thought Shadows of Mordor used a lot of vram. Or that Dragon Age Inquisition had bad performance. You have not yet enjoyed the horrors of getting in a car in GTA5.Frames drop to 10 15. But not because of fps optimization but because the hardware they claimed could run the game gets horribly bottlenecked by the vram cost of driving. This happens on even cards that meet the recommended settings. Not just the minimum. The game crashes constantly because of this issue. To make matters worse. That vram is still and issue even with reflections that look like they came right out of n64. Until they change this sadly this will remain a negative review even tho I'm sure the game actually would be great if you could play it. Having to buy a 4GB card to bypass the terrible vram usage is just not okay.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After multiple attempts to get the game to launch I have decided to accept Valve's offer of a refund.Issues affecting this decision 1. No direct contact with support to remedy issues2. Rockstar support requires social club membership for 30 days before being allowed to post an issue3. Multiple workarounds published none have been successful4. Rockstar social club accepted the steam activation code then claimed no games activated on the profile. No means of requesting support on this issue5. Multiple hours spent downloading redownloading and verifying local game files. No success.I understand launch day issues but for a game that has been in the top seller category on Steam for weeks now to have such an issue with no official instructions on how to make the product work well I wont gamble on the process getting better.Disappointed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: DISCLAIMER! You don't have to agree but hear me out. This is coming from someone who has played both online (console) and offline (with mods on PC).I bought GTA 5 on PC to use mods only offline being fair to those in online lobbies.I say no to this simply for the singelplayer as myself i like modding OFFLINE! and creating custom cars characters etc. I don't bother with online because of overpriced cars clothes and other unrealistic material. I love GTA 5 but the updates are so annoying especially for a person like me who wants to mod just offline and have fun alone. Sadly "take two" is trying to take mods out and force us to go online. This is really absurd considering that mods keep the offline portion of gta alive and well at this point i think i just might uninstall this game and forget about it at this point. Sad to say but i see Red Dead 2 being another opportunity for "take two" and their silly money hungry antics. Note that this coming from a person who played online on xbox also so i know the struggle of grinding constantly online to get money that goes very quickly just to keep doing heists that don't even pay much (take two's mission for shark cards). This is why i came to PC to play this game and be left alone offline but unfortunately this didn't work. i never played gta online with mods on PC because it's unfair to players just having fun in lobbies. Anyways yeah if you thought about buying this game only for mods (for offline purpose) that ship has sailed and is sinking right now as i type this. As usual have a cozy day/night where ever you're from and carry on as you were.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game its community and Rockstar themselves are absolutely awful. Let me tell you why.I played this game since it came out on PC and clocked in over 400 hours most of it online. Things were great when the game was new. Hardly anything was expensive everything was fun easy going and easy to obtain. Then once prices for everything skyrocketed hackers were introduced. They did everything they could to ruin the game for everyone else. For me they got me banned three times aka permanently. The prices for anything ranged from $25 to $10 000 000. The average price for anything ranged from $3 4 million. Even if you grinded a fast and high paying mission it would take you 2.5 REAL days of non stop grinding just to get a car. I was harassed and tortured and manipulated by hackers who destroyed the game. I never did anything to violate anything and yet I was banned three times for other people's mistakes. And now I am not allowed to go onto GTA Online EVER. I lost everything all 400 hours of my online grinding and I can't even try to get it back without paying another $30. I sent Rockstar emails I submitted tickets I talked to support and they all refused to give me any sort of sympathy at all. They all refused to restore my account or even give listen to my side of the story. Rockstar robbed me of $60 and I am proud to say that I will never buy one of their games again and will never support them. They've lost a loyal customer who has been with them since GTA 3. I strongly suggest that if you're even planning on getting this game please don't. You will be very disappointed. It is a complete waste of money and time. 2/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This title is worth beyond the price of admission. An excellent open world crime drama that will lead through countless hours of random run ins of the law side activities and sites to see. The world looks gorgeous and can lose countless hours exploring Los Santos and it's neighboring areas. If this is your first time playing this game on PC (which is the way to go for this title) then you are in for a treat with it's up to 4K visuals and smooth 60 fps gameplay. Epic soundtrack for all tastes and the list is endless of the detail the developers have placed into this project. GTA5 is a masterpiece of it's time and should be worth the time you place in. Rockstar Games has gone above and beyond to bring this title to the PC crowd which has been long worth the wait. This is a must own title especially if you have been on board with the franchise for a long time. If you are new to the series then you are in for a treat.

review: This game can be incredibly fun when you are not being terrorized by a cheater or hacker. But you cannot play online for more than a couple hours before you encounter someone employing cheats such as driving/flying vehicles which cannot be damaged. Or spawning a toilet and campfire onto your character's waist (which kills you from the fire). Or taking control of your character while you are playing. Or suddenly killing you with a bolt from the blue where magically no player is given credit for killing you.In theory you might be able to avoid the cheaters/hackers by playing in a Friends Only server. But Rockstar does not let you do anything interesting like run your businesses while in a Friends Only server. So you are stuck playing with random strangers which means that you WILL encounter a cheater/hacker before long. Heck when you go online it is likely to put you into a session which already has a cheater/hacker in it.

review: Gran Theft Auto V is an amazing game. I'd have to say the optimization for PC is among the best out there and this is only a week after launch. I can consistently maintain 60 fps on max settings with a rig that I have had for 2 years (Specs at bottom). I can't even recall having this game crash on me yet. The story for this game is set to be a classic as expected from Rockstar. You can see characters develop through the game which is something you would only come to expect from good movies. The controls take some getting used to but overall seem efficient. I am rating this game as V/V. The only time I am not having fun in this game is during loading screens.Specs Intel Core i5 3570k 3.8 Ghz EVGA GTX 780 16GB RAM 500 GB 7200 rpm HDD.

review: Single player is very good just can't say it for multiplayer. I have been wating for a good MP GTA game since the mod to GTA SA back in the day and GTA V has that potential but not the security of it. Lobbies are filled with underaged hackers and modders who more or less control the whole outcome of the action. There are min. 2 hacker on lobbies most of the time. They can take your GamerTag and use it to frame you for cheating and getting you in trouble with R*. If you have a bounty on you a hacker will teleport to you location and shoot you and then disapear or will teleport you to his/her location espacially if youre in a plane or chopper and then kill you. R* looks to be more forcused with getting more money out of paid gamers with their recent updates to the game then making a decent Anti Cheat software for us legit gamers who enjoy the fairness of the battle.Until this issue is resolved i would only buy this game for SP only or buy the consol ver. for MPOff topic Beside their lag in Anti Cheat they are also pulling off some shady marketing stuff to make it look like you are getting a good deal. A piece of advice DON'T BUY SHARK CARDS you are then supporting a company that has already gotten back there expensis within a week of the consol sale preorder and are now squeezing PC players for more money after purchase.

review: 10/10I am incredibly impressed by Rockstar with the release of this game. After all the first day release issues that many companies have had lately this game has none. Playing beautifully maxed out at 1080p locked a 60fps with no issues. I couldn't ask for better. Oh and it looks amazing console users should be envious. I wish I had a 1440p or 4k to run it to see really how great it can be but im am very pleased with 1080p. I did notice one issue. When i run msaa there is a pixelization error at the bottom right corner of the screen. A small square . Running 2x Msi 3g gaming r9 280 in crossfire. Also AMD released a new crossfire profile for GTA V but it doesnt seem to be utilizing both gpus to there max. Im only getting about 55% on both.Still hugely impressed Rockstar!! Cant wait to see what modders do to this game.

Unlike previous incarnations of GTA the character development is better than literally any other video game I have played to include RPGs such as Dragon Age. The only real downside to this game is that it is a 60 gigabyte download which limits people with slow connections.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Loading times. Connectivity.Cheaters. Even if this horrible clunking machine wasn't released in 2018 it is currently 2018 and there are far too many good games out there to be wasting time loading up GTA V. This is a game I might have gone through hell to play fifteen years ago when this sort of thing would be unique enough to warrant the waiting and patience especially in comparison with other games of the time. As it is no other game I can think of comes close to the horrible optimisation this title seems to possess. Sure many people don't have these problems. But then if half the players do that doesn't make it okay. That makes it pretty in the eyes of a lot of people who fork out for a loading simulator. (You know what I even bet there are people out there who wasted their two hour refund window just waiting for this game to load.)Also just as a side note I did manage to load in a few times it was fun for a little while then got tired putting up with those three things I listed right at the start of this review. And after that I absolutely do not consider the payoff to be worth the pain. Rockstar you gotta do something. Update the engine or whatever. There's an entire industry of developers that seems to be doing just fine by comparison ask them for help...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer The story is fine but boring and extremely forgettable. The usual "edgy" stuff like in previous iterations is still in it but it was badly executed. Most characters are pretty onedimensional or predictable that doesn't help either.Let's be honest you're playing this for the online mode. Multiplayer Even though there are regular patches to the online part of the game the core gameplay consistently remains the same. No big changes. The gameplay mostly consists of random mean players hunting you down just for the lols. The "passive mode" they then talk about locks you out of a huge chunk of the content. What bothers me the most are the shark cards. Funny they called them that cause they're pretty predatory. Effectively "Macrotransactions" asking you to shell out way too much money for way too little ingame currency. If you ever want to drive in a decent car or have a decent apartment you pretty much have to grind for several hundred hours or shell out another 100 bucks.I'd rather have the updates as paid DLC and the money payouts rebalanced.TL DR This game made me have a grudge on R* Games.

review: Going to rate this well because it is a great game and it has been since release.My gripes with it are with the way that Rockstar decided to take the online.I love free DLC great way to keep the community alive... However... They should not have added in flying bikes with rockets and all manner of stupid vehicles with gadgets and gizmos.Couple this with microtransactions to buy in game money to spend on ridiculously priced vehicles and you're looking at a form of pay to win gameplay.I say this completely based on the fact that when you're just simply messing around driving a car and minding your own business some little child that attacked his parents' credit card for online bucks decides to blow you up endlessly with a $4m flying bike.The addition of microtransactions demolished the entire prospect of ever having an in game casino because it breaches into actual real life monetary value gambling.Also the payouts on jobs decreased and this means making money from gameplay takes a day and an age even with businesses.I continue to play this game purely because I enjoy rocking around with my mates until we encounter the children of the world fueled by their off shore parent's accounts.Would've been nice not to have these elements in the game but hey ho Rockstar have to keep making money somehow to pay for all this free DLC.

review: NOTE This review is totally based upon my thoughts and only my thoughts. I'm not bias therefore this review will be raw and straightforward. Story I've owned this game on multiple consoles and recently purchased it on the PC. I guess you can say since owning about 4 copies of the game on multiple consoles is overkill. However the story is something that is special about this game. You get 3 different prespectives which most games can't solely focus on. Rockstar Games for sure nailed this game with a solid 10/10. At times you will be laughing since the characters (Franklin Michael &amp Trevor) are hiliarous in numerous cutscenes. I would without a doubt say this is one of the best Grand Theft Auto games in the series second to GTA San Andreas (over 200+ countless hours logged). Graphics As this game can be super graphics intensive even with the medium settings on it's still a wonderful game. I'd totally recommend having at least 8GB memory for this game as this game is a memory hog (totally worth it though). As my currenty configuration (i3 6100 + 1050ti 4GB SSC) on a 2560x1080 21 9 Ultrawide monitor I'm happly recieving 70 145FPS. I'd say on average around 90FPS. That's pretty solid. This game on the PC is totally worth every penny comparing to the consoles version's this game on the PC blows them away. 10/10Dislikes I don't really have any. This game is totally perfection. I honestly can't wait to see the next GTA cause this one it self is stilling copies left and right. Enjoy the game! It's there for a reason. EDIT As of 2/18/2017 there is a deal where you can get GTA IV &amp GTA 5 for $29.99. That's a steal!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's a great well made game that's clearly had a lot of time put into by people who know what they are doing. The campaign is a good mixture of funny and enticing and I'm looking forward to putting more time into the single player. Despite this it's not the best GTA ever made. I personally prefer the style of the other GTA's (San Andreas comes to mind) where you only play as one character as I believe you feel more connected to that character as they go through a story line. It wouldn't have been the same if you could actually play as Ryder or Wu Zi back in the day.The online is great fun the first few days of playing it with my friends was nothing but hilarious however once the excitement passes and you need something "more" to keep you playing I feel GTA V falls behind other somewhat similar games such as Altis Life on Arma 3. First of all as someone who preordered I received enough money as a gift to buy the best appartment and one of the best cars. After doing a few heists I could then afford the best car. Umm now what? Mindless races and missions are fun for a while but it could be so much better if there was more to spend your money on. Barely a month after the game came out and I haven't wanted to play online for a while.Overall I can see why many people love this game and definately recommend you to try it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
