review: Short v. Campaign a blastMultiplayer Playerbase is about 25% Hackers/CheatersCampaign Love it. Well developed story line funny charactors and great graphics. The ganes doesn't fail to express how large the map is. Flying and driving taken to another level. Now I see why it was needed to add planes to the large list of player controlable vehicals. 10/10Multiplayer Another work of art but not as flawless. Leveling takes time but not too much time. Higher level stuff requires better performance for more cash. But with Shark cards they threw that out the window. As long as you can't buy ranks from them the game will keep you occupied even if you have a large wallet. A large problem that as of now (5/31/15) there is an outrageous amount of hacks being used (traininers cheat engine DLL injectors Process Memory Edits ect.) Every other session I join has a hacker. Mostly them either blowing you up every sec making you commit suicide or spamming bags of money over your head. Though this can ruin the experience for most people if you find 3 friends to do all the heists with you will be fine. GETTING MONEY FROM HACKERS WILL NOT GET YOU BANNED. 5/10 (R* needs help with anticheat or turn on VAC for ffs.)

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: REVIEW Its very important to take this game as it is. An amazing singleplayer experience and an almost eqaully great multiplayer experience once you let go of the need to have and own everything. The main gripe a lot of people have is that there is so much content and it costs so much that they wil never be able to experience it all. Forget what you know about all the doomsday heists and owning a nightclub and simply have fun. Through doing this you will gain the money to buy cool stuff in time however if your always focused on it then you won't enjoy one of the most well made games of the decade. Just play the game and progress. Who cares if what you buy pales in comparison to other items in the game or that might be released. Just enjoy what you have and GTA V online is fun.TIPS If you want my advice play races and VIP missions and then get a company. It opens up a large revenue stream and has fun missions (import/export not cargo missions) You will earn money over time. If you have friends then divide up who will buy what so you can unlock all the content quicker.CONCLUSION Singleplayer is beyond amazing with a great narrative interesting characters and great gameplay/missions. Multiplayer is fun aswell as long as you take it as it is and enjoy it without thinking about the next seven million dollar investment. The community is fun although they do troll a fair amount and hackers/glitchers aren't very frequent. If you do run into one just join another session and alls well that ends well.RATING9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good single player story with lots of stuff to do until you 100% it and then decide to play online as online is the only mode that is still supported with this game. Then we come to why this review is a downvote which is the online experience is awful in its current state every lobby is filled with ethier trolls or hackers that can't be killed or have unlimited money and cheats and will kill you instantly with said cheats along with the ability to kick you from lobbies. Combined with the crappy customer support that bans players that dont even cheat and will not negotiate the ban even if it were to be a mistake. The online is also ruined by it being designed around shark card microtransactions as everything is so expensive and you earn money so slow you almost have to spend real world money in order to unlock any new features that are added in a reasonable amount of time. Final Verdict If you want a good singleplayer game get this on sale when its less than $15 $20 and if you are wanting a good multiplayer experinece just skip this game and spend your money elsewhere.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Roockstar off with the snow. It's neat sure but when none of the tires you have in game stop you from spinning out and it s up timed missions it's not fun. In fact it's ing game breaking. Disable it.Other than that good game. Great story and the MP is legit minus a few things.1 Tanks/Jets No need for those. A tank does not belong in a game like this. Same with Jets. That is not something a gangster is just going to know how to fly/drive. It's stupid it's broeken and should be removed. The tank especially because it's near impossible to kill someone whos in a tank without spending a ton of money on 10+ rockets/bombs. But of course Rockstar has to pander to the demographic of terrible players just like CoD and OP weapons because they want a bigger fan base so they add easy mode features.2 Modders holy modders Modders aren't anything new but it would be nice if Rockstar stopped being lazy as and actually did something about them. Either you're getting dropped from the sky to your death insta blown up or they are dropping a ton of money to you and instead of banning them Rockstar will just reset your entire account. Level cars guns crew rank every last bit. Not just money.3 Community Completely toxic. Rockstar for some reason didn't think to just make a mode where there's no PVP. No instead you have to disable all fighting ability and have no guns (boring) so people won't kill you. Oh you want to use your guns to do something like rob a store or do a gang attack? Too bad because if you disable passive the people following you around waiting for you to leave it will just shoot and kill you anyway before you can even access your weapon wheel. (Because tar decided that there needed to be a 10 second period after disabling passive where you can be killed but cant use any weapons again dumb as .)REVIEW EDIT Finance and Folony Update Tips It's ing broken. Rockstar is so hung up on micro transactions that they won't fix their feature thats been out for literally half a year. If you get a delivery mission where you have to fly a plane and drop packages just ing leave the lobby. You lose a good chunk of cargo (and money) but not all of it. If you don't there's about a 90% chance that after a delivery or 2 it won't show any more markers or wont count the deliveries you make.This is why my entire High School my entire work place and my entire friends group have refunded this game and aren't buying the next one in the series. I am probably going to uninstall and just advocare a boycott uyntil they actually listen to the people they are robbing (in real life of real money with micro transactions). ing fix your You are turning into EA and are going to come close to "worst developer ever." As of right now I am changing my reccomendation to "not reccomend" until they ing listen to the players and fix bugs they are making. I don't ing want new cars I want the game to work and not me over and make me lose a ton of cash I just spent hours maybe even days getting.

review: So I see a ton of people saying that they're getting falsely banned so I thought I'd throw my 2 cents in. It's never happened to me but I did hear of at least 1 reason as to why people do cop the hammer. On screen displays such as MSI Afterburners the show stats of GPUs CPUs and the like. Ensure you disable those before you play the game.Now then the actual review.The Singleplayer is a masterpiece plain and simple. The story is compelling bar a few missions and the world is large and full of things to find and do random missions given to you by random people who you can sometimes do and 3 characters to play with each with their own strengths.The Multiplayer is sheer chaos. Hackers run rampant beggars beg the hackers for cash to the point of madness trolls &amp griefers run wild attempting to ruin your day many MANY wrong people get banned and everything costs way too much. IF and that's a big #$%ing IF you can somehow get past those downsides the online mode is awesome. Same Singleplayer world but with your own custom character with businesses to run Night clubs to own and dance in (as of the latest update) heists to complete and too many explosively weaponised vehicles to choose from if you can afford them either with Mummy's Credit Card or by grinding for potentially weeks to buy them.If you aren't turned away at this point by the horrid #$% mentioned above buy the game on special. You should experience the Singleplayer Campaign and maybe attempt the online if you're brave. I wouldn't grab it while normally priced just due to the fact that Rockstars customer service and trashy Business Model are an affront to gaming itself.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I only bought it for the online. I played quite a bit on my brother's PS4 while waiting for release/payday. The pros and cons (online only) Pros Cars That feeling of having several pixels of power and the sound of your car as it zips by everything Missions are fun Ownership has meaning Soundtrack is pretty good Tons of ground to cover and fun to be had World feels aliveCons Hackers. Unfortunately this is functions in conjunction with the next point Counter intuitive menu system. While it has all the standard stuff and such there is no place to report someone who is hacking/harrassing/etc or it's not readily made available Command input in chat is also counter intuitive and when I try to go to world chat I can't figure out how Framerate drops can lead to some hideous scenery Payouts for jobs are unfortunately underwhelming when weighed against the overpriced stuff in the game. Either Rockstar has no grasp on the cost of things irl or they simply want to jew people out of their actual money. Rockstar I got bad news for you... Some players don't know what the Hell they are doing and unfortunately there doesn't appear to be a system implemented that prevents you from getting the idiots. Some cars are absolute garbage and unusable early game lose their appeal late game because you're driving a Sabre Turbo with maxed out everything. Overall a 7/10. Good idea functional and the fun that can be had almost makes the issues seem a non issue.

review: After playing the game for a few hours heres what i thinkPossitives A acceptible story i find enjoyable in the singleplayer.Some interesting features like robbing a store for money and the new FPS (first person mode) (Could use more variety of stores to rob though)Good variety of cars and modifications. Planes Boats and Choppers included.Graphics are acceptible.I like the new content and support R* is trying to give the game. New guns cars features and missions.The map is interesting to explore and heck out the sites now and then.Good customiseation for your online characters clothing to make him/her look quite unique from others which is very nice.Cons For the game to come out on PC and everyone be exited to mod the hell out of it...be wary. I belive some of the new updates previously mendtioned can break some mods and is really annoying to the players and modders to rework the mods to get them to work for singleplayer and R* needs to try and be a bit more accepting to the SP modding crowd.The Online is.........pffft dont get me wrong the online mode really shines when playing with friends on heists and can be good fun for you guys. it isnt much of a mode that you would play yourself though due to some a**holes and hackers who want to ruin your fun. R* needs a good way of stopping hackers and a**holes from harrassing the good players that simply just want to have fun.The spawning in freeroaming can be unfair at times if you get killed it leaves you open for a group of d***s to gun you down constantly and then activate passive mode and get called a p****y it can feel very anti social at times sepecially when there are objectives to tell you to simply KILL players who are just minding their own bussiness.And the best part of the game...the crap loading times. R*'s online mode was f****ed up at launch and it has improved BUT the loading times suck in this mode where its so grindy by yourself to just get that one chopper you love. UNLESS you buy their microtransactions the shark cards.Why would R* need more money after their success i have no idea dont bother with them its not as fun just buying in game money than it is earning it yourself R* doesnt deserve it through these things (even though it is very grindy i feel) i want to earn that badass chopper or jet through hard work not just buy it through microtransacions so people can just buy a hyrda and kill people in freeroam it kind of creates a Pay to WIn sort of gimic which im sure no gamer likes.And then there is this hacker problem I keep hearing about online. So far i havent seen any prove of any hackers yet maybe im lucky but I would not be surprised on the console versions i have seen hackers though so yeah i actually have seen some now I think about it. R* try and make your game fair for people who just want to have fun so we dont have to deal with thats damn b***s***.Sorry guys I like the game and the SP story but after that since some of R*'s updates can break the mods I heard it feels that even if you dont like online but you want to mod they screw that up so online would be the only thing that gets new content (Did i mention some vechiles are restricted to only online mode?). I find online fustrating to play on my own because how the community is (i am not saying you are all d***s im sure a lot of you are good people to play with its just i always get that one p***k in a attack chopper or laser jet killing evryone) If your hear for the mod you might have some enjoyment if it works just dont update the version of the game since it could corrupt them unless the mod authorse update them but if you intsall alot of mods like i do it will be annoying. The online more worth it? Despite what i said about it Yes actually (when it works) with friends or a good social group to play with (Just check out FunHaus on youtube they are awesome people to play with however there group might be full ( im sure there are over good groups that would accept you if they are nice) playing online on your own NOPE its just hell on your own.I personally would not reccomed this game unless R* fixes some of the problems with the updates breaking mods (they said themselves they were not against modding) and fix some of the online issues.

review: Repleneshed hope in life...I have put my final consensus first below it there is my initial release glimpse and my mid way review as well I would reccomend taking a look at them both for further information. There is also a video of GTA Online gameplay that I madeFinal Consensus In an age of commercial bound developers striving for profit over content replayability and fun I found Grand Theft Auto V. After giving up playing Watch Dogs from the disgustingly poor plot and unremarkable characters and finishing what I thought was a much better game at the time Shadow of Mordor in under 30 hours I was begining to believe that I was growing tired of video games and that it was time to put down the controller for something else. Fast forward a few months later and GTA V finally releases boy was I HYPED for this game. Hype aside after downing 8 hours in one day and finally hitting the sack the only emotion that I felt was dissapointment dissapointment in the entirity of the rest of the piece of gaming industry. Why you ask? Grand Theft Auto V was obviously crafted by the gods who else would release a game then completely redo it within 2 years changing nearly every mechanic about the game all for benefit? Who else would include a massive island (comparable to some Hawaiian islands) of content riddled with alleys forests subberbs factories deserts mountains and so much more meticulously detailed to the point that I was practiacally foaming at the mouth (Not many games are you able to look into trash cans and see every single article of trash). My god I havent even got to the vehicles... It seems like every other week there is an update that includes at least 3 4 new vehicles on top of the massive list of vehicles already available. Not only that but they released an entire MMO completely seperate from the game with complete character and vehicle customization an entire storyline with a HUGE amount of content and multiple events and social details... all included with the game FOR FREE. I haven't even skimmed the surface of what this game holds and I've sunk 85+ hours into it already. Content wise I would compare this game to Skyrim however it is FAR FAR FARRRR more detailed in terms of environment dialogue story creatures vehicles BUILDINGS PLANES CHARACTERS VOICE ACTING!!! Compare this game content wise and quality wise to any game and they pale in comparison. For instance The Witcher 3 (although the story is as good or better than GTA V's) has a massive world and great RPG elements and many enemies... it still doesn't have half the content of GTA V. I've beat that game in around 40 hours doing many side quests adventuring etc. GTA V on the other hand took me a whole 85+ hours to complete just the main story alone it was so much time that I had to cease playing so that it's greateness wouldn't taint my view of Shadow of Mordor Fallout 4 Dying Light and even The Witcher 3. I have to give this game a 10/10 because it is my favorite GTA game of all time (even above my previous favorite the original San Andreas) and it is by far one of my top 10 games of all time. First Day of Release Six hours down in one day last game that did that to me was Far Cry 3. Easily going to be one of my favorite games! Ill post a more detailed review when I get more hours into this!Update 6/18/2015 This is a great game by far some of the best graphics (if not THE best graphics) I've seen in a game. The story is rich the world is massive and there is TONS to do in it and the multiplayer is fun (yet frustrating in some aspects). One of the great things that Rockstar does is encourage players to get 100% completion (trough some special rewards) and this easily pulls me in and makes me spend large quantities of time playing. The multiplayer is especially fun when played with friends over skype etc. but can be frustrating when played with random players. Trolls are prevelant in this game as well as hardcore noobs which can easily cause a magnitude 10 migrane after failing a one hour long heist for the 20 somethingth time (LOOKING AT YOU PRISON BREAK). As a side note on this plane/helicopter pilots are the WORST!!! After making it through wave upon wave of enemies on the ground barely scraping through with near zero health with the finish line in sight after approximately ONE HOUR of gameplay suddenly the game stops and throws a massive depressing and extremely annoying failure sign at you because the pilot decides to try and do a barrel roll into the ocean at this point the game restarts from virtually the begining (minus a small car drive) and makes you redo the entire heist because someone can't keep their in their pants. It is because of this that I recommend to all of you PRACTICE your piloting skills so that you can do that aspect of the mission yourself and avoid the tragic fate that becomes of most heists. I will share a personal video below of a fraction of the instances in which this trolling has occured https //www.youtube.com/watch?v RDKjlThvCB0&amp feature youtu.be
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto 5/V. This game had amazing hype and a lot of high hopes. Do i enjoy it eh.....You see i had originally got it on the PlayStation 4 it was really fun good story no bugs whatsoever (no game breaking bugs at least) however Grand Theft Auto 5/V for PC is having a lot of issues.....Lets go through the Pro's and Con's of this game.First we can start with the bad stuff....Con'sGame continuisly freezes and lags(not due to heat i have a water cooler)Game sometimes doesnt follow my commands i hit W to walk he goes sideways. I try to stop running he keeps running and right into the police officer where he dies. FRANKY JUST CROUCH GODDAMNIT!Game requires you to disable GPU when hitting start and then enabling it before the games starts so it isn't running with integrated card.No matter how amazing your GPU is. If you play for almost 3 hours straight it will start having terrible errible lag and not stop.Also the game is having some startup issues that they had over 2 years to work on should this have been released NO! Should people have been more pateiesnt yes.Pro's No game is perfect but every game has it's up sides as well as the downsides.The game is beautifully animated and the graphics are pretty great.The game has a very nice well thought out story with amazing characters whether it be terrifying Trevor or Depressed Michael it's still a great game.THEY ADDED MORE CARS! With teh addition to new cars this game is even better than ever.The new director mode and movie maker is pretty amazing and user friendly. Takes some time getting used to but it's still very well addition to the game.The run down Yes Grand Theft Auto is a great game it was just rushed. And the fact that they had 2 years to make an un startable game is pretty dissapointing.... Also i never got my pre order bonus........Everythings fixed thats an old review

And to make things worse I have to periodically go into my task manager to close the "Social Club UI" that opens every time you launch the game and swallows up most of your CPU usage god help you if you forget too long cus oh boy I had 12 of em open before I realized what was going on and my computer slowed down like a rock. TL DR isFun game several bugs horrible devs. Buy it if it's' on sale for less than 35 cus it ain't worth more.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V series is Rockstar's open world sleeper hit. In the midst of the glamorous city known as Los Santos three protagonists are wanting to fufill the American Dream. Franklin a reforming black man wants to be separated from his less than progressive criminal culture Trevor a personification of Grand Theft Auto players everywhere is a pyschopath pervert and perp all in one wanting to lead a business and is a follower of the Altruists and Michael a man trying to escape his criminal past and his friends. The game has been improved in almost all departments including gameplay graphics tighter but unrealistic driving a ton of new vehicles and content and a huge conversion of how missions play. The gun variety is mostly strong but made somewhat mundane due to the handling of all weapons being the same little variation in recoil and stability of the weapon used and can now be played entirely in a dedicated first person mode in the enhanced version which is sold here on Steam this helps immersion greatly at the expense of reducing flexibility in movement.Modifications for GTAV are less than appealing for the multi player but are plenty for singleplayer (Take2 has returned their decision on restricting mods) and the options menu is detailed and thorough with an exceptional amount of customizable features to their game which is a delight to see but this game is still rated negative for many other problems. Major Criticism SP Gameplay is very hit and miss gunplay is not nearly as bombastic as it was in GTAIV or GTA SA.. NPC's auto aggro if you stand near them which is idiotic antagonistic and unrealistic. Cannot throw objects like GTAIV which could be used to ragdoll opponents. Severe lack of coherent narrative and mostly empty other half of Los Santos. Notably poorer scripting. Dan Houser does not know how to write intelligent characters at all proof? Michael engages in cuckoldry with a Latino man with his wife then proceeds to be ok with this behavior who he lets lest he get divorced. Franklin is a token black character with no nascent personality and remains the middleman in the latest entry. Trevor is a forgottable one trick pony character emphasising all of the mannerisms a common GTA player would do.Many of the minor characters deliver lines in bland rather expositionary expressions and over extend their lines. They do not deliver lines of any memorable kind or affect the storyline. The personalities are not as nascent as they were in San Andreas or IV. A lot of old characters are killed off who were from GTA IV further hurting the bond I can associate with the game. The game's atmosphere feels that of a cheesy 80's sitcom cheap and tacky rather than representing a world of corruption under the guise of a free life it feels forced than natural. On GTA O Worst multiplayer community I've seen in years of playing. Not so much as communication but rather the skills of players on premades who do not work as cohesively as one might imagine. No mods or dedicated to them online (thank you Rockstar for telling modders with a big middle finger Poes Law be damned). Aimbot lite as a form of aim assist you know it would be nice to be matchmaked with someone who actually can aim manually Rockstar!The single player and online modes itself feel unfinished as the rural parts of Los Santos have no new cities to discover and the missions are mediocre (as in spoon fed mainstream hold your hand bullshít and are semi linear). Cops are ridiculously overpowered with pinpoint accuracy and extreme persistence than before. Animals can also "call" the cops on you no joke. In any of the hiests expect frequent mission failures griefing (inside/outside of Passive Mode) drop outs and empty sessions.Single player content is remarkably short for the price and is designed for emergent gameplay but it fails at this due to the linearity of the storyline and it's designed around this awkward system which must be followed to a strict parameters which makes long missions not fun especially heists (SP/MP). Customization feels tacked on and doesn't influence statistics like it did in GTA SA taking away from the immersion of building your template character of Carl Johnson into avatar of your liking Trevor Franklin and Michael can't get fit fat or really skinny or change essential parts of their skills or utilize the statistics for making the game more interesting. No Casino estate is available in the game to gamble and purchase as property. Exploration is far worse than previous GTA's laking the ability to enter buildings like that in GTAIV.Rockstar North also has a track record for being incredibly shady including shark cards which don't get processed banning players for the actions of the modders scandalous pricing even after purchasing and confirming Shark Card purchases refusing to lower the price of the main game after 3 years and that includes DLC for online. There is no DLC for the single player experience in this game meaning the single player content is remarkably shorter than the multiplayer proof? Check all the DLC for the Singleplayer and compare it to Online's boisterous collection.The loading screens are a major problem especially online with incessant and incredibly long on a rig that can run Battlefield 1 Crysis and modded versions of many CPU/GPU demanding games on Maximum/Custom settings takes no less than 30 to 1 minute to load...but on GTAV Online this goes up to almost 3 4 to an ASTOUNDING 10 minutes on a Goddamn SSD! An additional extra dollop of time if you get kicked or someone in lobby by some idiot that decides to leave after failing a mission 5 to 20 times. "Exceedingly Postitive" as a ranking on the Store Page is deciet the game is a worse version of GTAIV and lacks the charm the modder's version of this in San Andreas of Online was far better handled than this.

review: GTA 5 is my top game for number of hours played because it is an awesome open world sandbox of fun. The game has single player offline storyline and a multiplayer online mode. The single player has a series of main missions and several side missions which can account for many hours of gameplay. Since the game is open world it is easy to get lost in exploring trying new vehicles or exploding random parts of the world.The multiplayer game is a game with a game within a game within a The open world mode has mini tasks as well as a choice to play hundreds of mini games. There hardly seems like a limit to the game with the number of different modes and matches you can participate in.Rockstar consistently adds new content (vehicles clothing game modes new gameplay etc.) on a monthly basis. I could hardly describe the number of different objectives and game modes within the multiplayer online mode of GTA 5. Some of my favorites are the heists motorcycle clubs deadline mode kill quota vehicle vendetta stunt races and the user made rockets vs. insurgents.GTA 5 is a blast of a time with friends and it feels like a few dozen games in one.

There is so much content that i just love replaying over and over again but as soon as i'm having so much fun and getting really into it i get the dreaded "everybody has left your session." Its just ruining the game for me a lot. Making it almost unplayable. Its been happening since release from what i'm hearing and now it seems to be much worse. Some days i'm able to stay in a session for at least maybe an hour. Then there are other days where i can't stay in any session for more than 5 minutes. Its breaking the game. And i hate to see a good game die from something as silly as this.

review: I found GTA V to be an enjoyable experience I found GTA Online to be both interesting and fun to play though just like any other online game the grinding just doesn't feel worth it even more angering was the ability to purchase shark cards to skip all the wait after having already purchased GTA V. I also found that GTA Online has many feautres that I felt should be added to singleplayer as without the storyline singleplayer seems quite barren and once you are rich there seems like there is nothing to do which is highly dissapointing. Back to GTA Online I felt GTA Online was constantly rushing me to blow millions that I didn't have yet pushing me torwards shark cards for example the phonecalls you get every time you login asking you to purchase something as well as the emails telling me it's the deal of a lifetime yet I get it every single time I login. GTA Online also genuinly seems like it tries to make ways to make money boring and repetitive without being too obvious. If you remove the blatant Shark Card advertising the constant modders annoying legit players common internet trolls the mundaneness of singleplayer the slow loading even on a top of the line PC and the constantly rising prices of GTA Online I would say GTA V &amp GTA Online were enjoyable experiences that will definetly have me coming back for more though I do wish Rockstar Norh would listen to its fans for once. I do not belive GTA V (Including GTA Online) is worth $60. I would pay $30 for GTA V (Including GTA Online) which I did. Do I recommend this game? Yes.

review: This game I like! Great voice acting and story line. The fact that you are playing three different characters in this little movie keeps you involved. Characters are distinct and react the way you'd expect them to. Graphics (especially with some of the mods) are amazing. Never really got into the online aspect. Tried a bit but as a newb felt a little overwhelmed. Might be nice if next time they give some of us players that are not great with PVP a few more options.

review: The mechanic works in all branches of Los Santos Customs excluding the location near Los Santos International Airport which is run by Hao. He also works at Beeker's Garage.The Mechanic is generally friendly although may be short with the character if they drive in and out asking "What's wrong with her now?" He may also say this when the player drives in. The mechanic like Hao can be killed but will respawn."You got some beef with the Ballas or something?" When the player installs armour."Stops on a dime. Seriously." Upon installing brakes."That's a hell of a ride." When the player drives in a super car."These tires are hardcore!" When the player installs bulletproof tires."They use this stuff on armoured cars you know!" When the player adds bulletproof tires.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The best way to describe this is as one giant meh. The fun times in it are awesome and full of dubious stunts and crazy times with friends or that rare awesome rando. The bad times are much more common on the other hand whether its being trolled by people using mod menus people in lobbies begging for cash drops the game freezing or crashing trying to load in after missions or while simply modding your vehicle in the mod shop. In any other game these frequent crashes would not be an issue but in a almost six year old game compiled with long online session load times its just absurd. If you have a group of three other friends than i strongly suggest this game if you have access to a large sum of money to buy in game cash buy this game if you want to hack or cheat and troll and get away with it buy this game. If you want to enjoy GTA like you used to stay away because this isnt that game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "You know I've been in this game for a lot of years and I got out alive. If you want my advice give the s# t up."I'll make it known here what I've told everybody else Grand Theft Auto V is absolutely amazing memorable and worth the ticket price for the Single Player Campaign alone let alone the Online aspects. The Evolution of Grand Theft Auto (GTA) hit a high note with GTA V's release boasting an Amazing Soundtrack Incredible Graphics and an insanely Action Packed Intense Cinematic Story Campaign.Grand Theft Auto V also comes packaged with Grand Theft Auto Online an MMO esque Los Santos. Rockstar Games keeps the online portion alive &amp active with Constant Updates Ban Waves of Cheaters and Occasional Rockstar Hosted Events. Personally I believe over the years of it's release it has become "too much of a grind" and has lost a lot of general enjoyment but Rockstars recent updates (as of 2017) have really brought Life and Love back to Grand Theft Auto Online.After release Rockstar Games talked of additonal Single Player Content but these plans have since been abandoned/not spoken of since which leaves me and many others disappointed. People want more content because the Single Player Campaign was simply stunning and superb.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Great game but public lobbies can be chaotic with modders and griefers making money is kind of hard with all the cool stuff like the cars guns and planes (to name a few). Another thing is that try to get friends to play it with you because from what I have seen PC is more toxic and unfriendly than PS4 or Xbox but it may be different for you. It's a fun game and if you are thinking about getting it just do it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm editing my review from positive to negative.The first couple of weeks the online was great. Some griefers here and there but that's the name of the game. Fast forward just a bit and the lobbies started filling up with cheaters. They fixed this issue for a bit maybe half a year ago but the issue is back.You are lucky to find a session without any cheaters. Everything in the game has gotten really expensive to boost the sales of shark cards (Rockstars microtransactions). It is nice to see them still support the game with new content drops but it is really hard to enjoy the content without a working anti cheat system in place.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Incredibly long loading screens an inflated economy modders and hackers all over the place NPC's eat bullets like its their friggen breakfast you uncontrollably go into a ragdoll with no way of recovering whenever you go up steep slopes there is official main menu that acts as a central hub for the game instead you only get the initial load up to a hub that you cannot go back to without restarting the game. Why is that important? Because their servers are so garbage that often times you just cannot get online and it will unload all of online and then reload your singleplayer instead of bringing you to a main menu thus doubling the already long laod times. Its rediculously fun when it works but that is so rare the game isn't worth more than 15$.Edit Sorry for any confusion this review is primarily about ONLINE. The main game is fun though in my opinion does not have much replay value.I have also discovered that you can get automatically banned for varying increments of time with NO explaination. I can only assume I was banned for recieving money bags online since I've heard of this happening and I did not cheat/exploit. Rockstar states on their website that they "will most likely not respond to most messages regarding bans". Great customer service. Fantastic.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: 'Ruining Your Fun Makes My Fun More Funning!'Singple Player Good game in Single player the story was well written for the characters the missions were challenging and entertaining. Few bits of missions that were very irritating with multiple deaths but once figured out you could get past them.Multiplayer Great fun if you can get a lobby that isn't full of 14 year old trolltards chinese spammers(no idea what they're saying it's just a bunch of squares) and guys that spend a of money to cheat in the game. Soooooo never. Everything you need to do in the game requires in game money to set up. You go out to try and make that money? Some chucklef**k comes along and screws that up. Got a shipment of crates to take to your warehouse? Some asshat in a chopper comes along and blows you up. Running to chase down an NPC in a gang fight? Some cheater locks your character in place and drops sticky bombs on you then teleports to your respawn location to do it over and over. Want to do this in a private/invite only server? Nope Rockstar says 'F**k that'. Any of the money generating activities are locked out.Long story short a great SP game by Rockstar with huge MP potential marred by the genetic detrius that should have been eliminated by natural selection/competent eugenics program.I recommend this only for Single Player since Trevor is amazing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'll swing by and sign the contracts alright? Just ignore the bodies!Let's face it is there anything cooler than heating up the coast in a muscle car at sunset while "Carry on Wayward Son" from Kansas is roaring out on the radio? Little or nothing. GTA V gushes over with details it literally throws them at you but in the end it's the comparatively small moments like this exhilarating trip along the coastal road which make a big whole out of it.GraphicsThe leap from Last Gen to Current Gen was powerful the one from the new consoles to the PC is not so huge anymore. At least not if you don't happen to have a 4K capable system at home. Nevertheless GTA V looks best on a PC. This is mainly due to the higher farsightedness and the crisper textures. As already mentioned with a good middle class computer you are well equipped to enjoy Los Santos.GameplayEverything should have been said about the plot by now and more than once. But for the sake of completeness and for all those who have lived under a stone in the last years here is a quick outline unlike in the predecessors we experience the story of GTA V with three different protagonists Michael Franklin and Trevor all criminals.Trevor and Michael are old pals (Michael calls Trevor his best friend at one point) who pulled off bank robberies together years ago. Franklin is a little crook who happens to cross Michael's path. Michael disappointed by his son sees Franklin as a kind of replacement offspring and takes him under his wing. During the course of the story the three slide deeper and deeper into a swamp of gangster and private problems out of which there are three possible ways out at the comparatively unspectacular end.Some of the missions we complete with all three some with only two protagonists often we are on our own. The latter especially at the beginning when the fates of the three have not yet intertwined so closely. Which of the three characters we control depends on the situation sometimes we decide for ourselves by simply switching to the protagonist of our choice. One of the core pieces of the game are the large scale raids which are always preceded by a planning phase (spying on a situation) and then a procurement phase (vehicles gadgets) before they finally get down to business according to previously defined plans A or B. The game is played on a large scale.An early example the robbery of a jeweler can be carried out with brute force of arms or with the support of narcotic gas through the ventilation shafts. The choice of procedures alone increases the replay value of GTA V enormously. But also smaller variables contribute to this like the fact that some missions can be initiated by one or the other character and thus each have a different beginning.GTA V is often accused that there are hardly any highlights and too many missions run according to the pattern "go there complete the task run away". Basically this is true but the missions always carry small and bigger unexpected surprises in themselves. The fervor with which Michael Franklin and Trevor fulfil their destinies and tasks as well as the trenchantly drawn side characters leave no chance for boredom. And those who are looking for a little distraction from the everyday life of a gangster will just throw themselves into one of the numerous secondary occupations such as tennis golf triathlon or going to the cinema.Trevor on the other hand should repel and upset most players from the very first moment. Rockstar already takes care of this in his introductory scene (after about four to five hours of playing time). At the latest however with the sufficiently controversial and extremely long torture scene it should become clear to everyone that the developers want to deliberately provoke with Trevor. I think this has been done more than successful!ContentMassive open world with tons of main missions side missions and stuff to do. Additionally you can mod and change the game to your heart's desire.Recommended?Unrestricted buy recommendation for everyone who loves crude humor and action. And the open game world and physics effects invite you more and more to a funny rampage.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Brilliant game in so many aspects. There are endless things that you can do in this open world and it's variety of environments leaves you in awe. My only one wish for this game is for mods to be available on the steam workshop (as I have limited knowledge installing mods) and for modded online servers that allow for even more unique scenarios and roleplay with friends. One other thing I would love since they went to so much effort to create such a variety of hobbies that you can participate in (tennis golf etc.) is that they including some hunting/fishing minigames for the next game they create. Apart from this I'd say it's the near perfect game one of the best games out there. The driving mechanics are really fun while maintaining some decent realism (when flat on the road) the variety of things you can do and replayability is beyond any other game I've seen and the gun mechanics/aiming is decent as well. 9/10

review: I am not into multiplayer so I don't know about bans character deletes by rockstar. My review is for single player. For single player story and attention to world creation is great by rockstar. Activities are nice too. But this is rpg and there is pretty much no scope to impact story based on your actions 95% of the game progresses regardless of your choices in a fixed way you can merely change partners in heist. There is pretty much 0 side questing. Despite being released in 2015 for PC the graphics animations look dated AC 4 had a lot better graphics and it was released an year before. After taking so much time to release for PC and charging full price 1.5 year after initial releae you'd expect rockstar to deliver value. Overall it's a decent game but you cannot ignore glaring shortcomings I mentioned above if you are into RPGs. It's hard to recommend at it's full retail price of 60$. 20$ 30$ might be good price for this.Edit Changing the game to recommended for it's current price ( 25$ on my store). For less than 30 bucks you get a very decent Action game experience. Still not sure whether to call this an RPG.

review: Gta v single player is pretty good but the main feature of it is the online mode so I'll talk about that in this review Pros 4 Player heists that are pretty fun and are repeatable where you get to use your own desired weapons and cars that you bought in the game Lots of cool stuff to buy in the game including apartments cars tanks helicopters jets etc. The map is pretty large and beautiful Lots of stuff to do in gameCons Those 4 player heists require you to have that minimum number of 4 players so you cannot start the heist if you do not have a team of four. in that situation you are forced to find 'pubs' and it's not that easy to find people keen on joining your lobby nowadays. Then you have to factor RNG of the pubs whether or not they do stupid things and cause the whole mission to restart repeatedly and get increasingly frustrating. All those cool stuff i mentioned cost alot of money which is incredibly difficult to earn in game without investing lots and lots of hours. *****Game takes FOREVER to load. You can start the game take a shower have dinner take a come back and the game could still be loading. Maybe even take a short nap too. And this is if your computer is decent. If it's not that good then don't even bother buying the game. While there's lots of stuff to do some of them do require you to do missions in a public lobby and you always have to factor in random players hunting you down just for the thrill of it. It's worse if they have weapons and vehicles to use against you that you have no access to but if you are able to fight back then it shouldn't be too depressing.TL DR GTA V Grand Theft Loading after five years they still haven't found a way to improve it all rockstar has done in their patches is add in new stuff or put up sales they should really consider doing something about that loading time.

review: If you're a fan of any of the other "Grand Theft Auto" games... this one should be a no brainer. Single player game is real good. That in itself is enough to recommend the game.The on line play is real good too! Sure it's on line so do you run into the occasional... umm... well... Not so nice person. Once you're on line it's kind of like a free for all PvP going on where some... uhhh... not so nice High Level players will target defenseless people and kill them. Or the occasional hacker who lights everyone on fire or blows everyone up over and over and over. Or drops millions of dollars on them. What?!? Yeah that's not good because Rockstar can ban you for it even though you didn't do anything wrong.There is a solution though. You can press "M" and in the options you can set yourself up to be in "Passive Mode". That means people can't kill you shoot you run you over blow you up knife you hijack you or otherwise inconvenience you. The downside is while in "Passive Mode" you can't use weapons can't punch or mug citizens get involved in random events or participate in server events. You can however steal cars go into stores start or join missions/races/death matches/etc... So there are plusses and minuses.Over all my single player and on line experiences have been great and I think the game was well worth the money I spent to get it. On sale of course.

review: Let s cut to the chase GTA V is one of the best games ever go get it immediately!Now if you want to know more let s expand it a bit then.The game is fun and really solid in every way the controls and playability are well implemented and responsive.On the technical side it has some really stunning and beautiful graphics and effects the city looks gorgeous and the countryside desert zones woods beaches mountains etc. are just amazing.The sea is what impressed me the most IMO it s over the top it feels very realistic and when you stand near the shore you feel video games will never be the same again if a virtual sea can be this overwhelming. It really feels this game is taking PC gaming to its limits so if you have a solid rig to run it then you will find here one of the best looking and most technically impressive games for PC ever. Having a system capable of running this beast on ultra settings will make you think that all your hardware is being put to the test and that your investment was totally worth it.I m very happy with this version yes the PC version is awesome and everything is almost flawless. As a good sandbox this open world has literally tons of things to do it feels huge!Coop is really fun and amazing with lots of unlockable missions races heists sports shopping activities and a lot more to do plus they keep adding more and more content.The story mode is well developed and it has funny characters (in their own GTA way). The humor is satirical and politically incorrect (as it should be in a rated M GTA). At first I thought the idea of having 3 characters simultaneously was strange and probably not good but when you play it you realize it works really well.Gameplay wise driving is well implemented intuitive and feels natural shooting swimming running and moving around are too. The game is cool as it is on 3d person already but it adds the bonus of a 1st person experience you can switch on the go and it s really nice too. And with so many types of vehicles ground air and sea and a lot of guns at your disposal it never feels repetitive or boring. I love clothing and shopping I have spent hours in the clothing stores shopping is fun!On the sound department the effects are stunning and I love the soundtrack! a lot of GTA V songs now are part of my personal playlists. In general a lot of attention was given to every little detail. This is basically a masterpiece and a perfect game simply one of the very best games there are for PC. Justice has been served for PC gamers and the wait was very much worth. I absolutely love it.So once again if you don t have it yet what are you waiting for? you should be playing it right now instead of being here reading this.See ya in Los Santos!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: CONS Load times Oh my god I hate the load times in this game. In Online they can range anywhere from 3 20 minutes and thats normal! Sometimes you can get upwards of 30 mins or more wait times! There are some bugs with loading times too were it will just keep perpetually loading without finding a lobby. This happens more often though when you are entering or exiting buildings with warps. I also hate the unskippable start screen on GTA V it's just makes the process of trying to get in the game that much painful.Grinding Many people when they start to play GTA Online play for maybe a couple months and then quit because you have to grind so much to get any of the cool vehicles weapons etc. Trying to get money in the game is hard enough but leveling up is even harder.Modders/Cheaters and GTA Online Anti Cheat In my opinion probably the worst part of GTA Online. I'll talk about the anti cheat first. Well it's crap. It makes Valves anti cheat look like God's gift. I'd say a good 1/6 or 1/7 people in this game are cheaters/modders. Sometimes I don't understand how they are able to explode everyone in a lobby and not get atleast suspended. The worst part is that as many people of you have heard people who don't cheat are being banned or suspended for no reason by Rockstars anti cheat. Now lets get on to the modders themselves. Most of the modders dont do much and are usually just driving around in expensive vehicles or whatever. There are a handful though that like to just grief the server killing anyone they see. And if they off about something they may explode the entire server for as long as they want watching everyone suffer. And sometimes they can do the unspeakable and mess up someones account for good. One of my friends was playing GTA Online when he was put in a bad sport lobby all of his properties and vehicles where taken away and he couldn't do anything to get it back. He contacted rockstar support but they didn't help either (more on that later). Then theres the once in a blue moon "nice" modder that basically gives everyone money drops.Rockstar Support It is horrible they have this copy and paste response for everything. They never actually have someone reply back to you. Like I said earlier when my friend's aaccount got hacked he submited a ticket to rockstar asking them to fix his account but they gave him a message saying his account was manually deleted even though he mever deleted it.After this he submitted another report ticket but this time with video proof. He got the exact same copy and paste message saying he manually deleted his account. He gave up from there becuase he obviously knows that most of the Rockstar Support team ar bots.Menu/Settings Changing your settings in this game is probably the worst out of any game I have played. When changing some settings to optimize the games performance you have to restart your game evertime and it's just a pain because you also have to go through the start screen which takes forever. Then if you want to run a benchmark after it finishes you also have to restart your game. So if you are trying to optimize the game you may have to restart your gay 4 8 times.Controls I don't have too much of a problem with on foot controls but aircraft and heli controls suck. You use WASD to either rotate the aircraft on helicopter ot use rudders on planes and to accelerate and deccelerate. You use numpad keys 4568 to steer the aircraft in a direction. This is already a problem for people without numpad keys like people with smaller keyboards or people with laptops with no numpad. It seems easy at first but the control feel clunky and unnatural especially with helis as it can be hard to land correctly with out crashing. It would of been 100x better if they used mouse to steer. I always keep a controller plugged into my pc so whenever I have to use any air vehicles I just use that becuase it is way easier to control on a controller.PROS I don't have much for this but that isn't bad because these couple pros are the main things I enjoy about this game.Gameplay Driving around in cars blowing things up. THE GAME IS FUN. There is so much to do in the game! You can have races you can play deathmatches do heists with friends. You can do whatever you want! I have gone hours on this game without getting bored becuase there is so much to do and explore.Graphics Nothing to really say the game looks great for a game from 5 years ago and has aged well.Replayability Since the game hs so much to do I usually wind up messing around with my friends in a lobby. The game always has someting new to do and thats the reason I keep coming back to it. Overall right now I rate this game a 7/10You may criticize me for this review becuase I only have a little above 100 hours on this game (At the time of this review) but I used to play this all the time on the XBOX One and later transferred to PC. I know some aspects of the game are different on console but most are the same. So I hope this doesn't degrade the credibility of this review.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: THE ONLY REVIEW YOU NEED TO READSHORT VERSIONGRAPHICS 7.5GAMEPLAY 8STORY 8.5OPTIMIZATION 9ONLINE 7.5 OVERALL RATING 8 **********************************Full ReviewGrand Theft Auto 5 was released in 2013 and has been supported since.The game has a map that covers an area of 64 sq km that is densly packed.The game world seems alive all the time and is beautifuly designed .The plot of gta 5 revolves around 3 main characters which is a first for the series it is a solid plot dealing with a variety of topics and it was deliverd with that iconicover the top rockstar humor the main story will take you around 30 40 hours to complete with side quests extending the life of the game to over a 100 easily.The lack of story dlc is a problem as the online aspect is what rockstar seems to be intrested in I expected dlc like the one we got for gta4 but instead we havenothing which is dissapointing.The online aspect which is quite contresversial was released a few months after the original launch has been supported ever since the online does get a lot of smackas it follows a mobile free to play game strategy to make money with shark cards.I do agree stuff is expensive in the online world and can require quite a lot of grinding to get the stuff that someone who paid for it can but you have to remeber the game is 5 years old and they are still adding stuff to the online world which is just a bonus.What I am implying is that you can still have fun online with friends regardlessThe game has Quite a lot of flaws but the things it does really well out weigh the flawshence I have to reccomend ( I do suggest You buy it on sale)this game to anyone found of the series or is just looking to have fun.***********************************************************************************************

review: I strongly advise to everyone DO NOT buy this game if you plan ONLY to be playing Gta online In the past i have given the game a good review but decided to delete it The main issue is the online part there's at least 1 to 3 modders in every session in gta online they use godmode airbreak spam huge planes and boats until your game start's to lag and possibly crash they spawn cages on you spawn huge strectures on your businesses Stick toilets and ufos on your character set you on fire spam explosions to instant kill you everytime you respawn frame you for killing others And destroy your cargo with their mods And this has been going for almost 3 years For a big multi triple billionare company such as Rockstar they arent planning on investing in a anti cheating program that will prevent any scripted modding file that would run with the game to stop modders at least in the online part because it will cost them money I have filed a complaint to rockstar on how so many legitimate people leave the game because of that and how unfair it is that the modders abuse legitimate players in the online sessions as i mentioned above I told them im reporting any modder i encounter they acknoledged that but they simply replied to me with a guide on how to report hackers which is what i already do and other legitimate players like me doing And this reply from rockstar is a huge disrespect to my intelligence and a huge slap to the face We as their clients and customers and gta fans need to start shake rockstar up because like everything in life nothing moves or changes if you dont speak up and make a noise about it or take an effort to make a change I really hope this review could spark a change within the gta v pc community more people need to constantly submit complains to rockstar to do something about it and if not rockstar will keep sleeping.

review: Postive ReviewThis is a great game for singleplayer and multiplayer for the PS4 and XboxOne great story for singleplayer I love it I love Franklin Michael and Trevor. Especially Trevor he makes me laugh and choose only him when I want to go a rampage and kill as many people as I can. GTA Online fun as hell as long as to get into the right lobbies. I got banned twice for modding which was my fault but Rockstar only banned for 2 weeks each time I finally learned my lesson and have not been banned since I go into closed friends servers mostly because there's a lot of modders and cheaters in the public servers. I do not recoommend GTA V for the PC to many hackers and modders. Pros Great story Rockstar did a great job making it. You get to switch between 3 different characters You get to own businesses and penthouses in GTA Online Fun game to go on a rampage with Trevor Get to do a lot of different heists Great game of the seriesNegative Cons Little kids trolls cheaters and bullies on GTA Online. "I've loved playing this game all the time I have 100+ hours into it just on PC until today the greatful day that I got "Banned" for GTA Online. Sadly enough this situation has made me not want to play the game any more and Rockstar has bothered replying to my ticket that I sent them. Another thing is that when this game came out for PC I sold my Consoles and invested $1500+ to be able to play the game maxed out. I really don't care about the stupid Single player because I've beat it with my brother on Console so when it came out on PC it gave me a way to play with my Friend online but now I can't I will be deletting the game and probably won't ever be on it again. Note to all who want to buy this game You can't trust anyone online or be willing to help them because they can report you can if RockStar finds anything in your record you can be banned for 14days forever! So keep that in mind when buying the game." Snow Eira Do I rerecommend this game for both single and multiplayer yes yes I do. After doing more research and thinking I do not put the blame on Rockstar I put the blame on their publisher Take 2 interactive. Please do not let any of the negative Not recommend reviews taint your view about this game. All of them must have done something to get targetted and banned. Get the game and see for yourself if you like you have the right to do so. And I will think about buying Red Dead Redemption 2 if I see that it's good.I rate this game 10/10 and that's the best in my book.

review: 2015 Amazing single player. Amazing Online. Amazing everything. Moddable. Truly the best Grand Theft Auto ever made. Hang out with your friends in your favorite game where you can literally do everything you want. Like a triple A garry's mod.2016 Just like promised free DLC! Well... free. You have to grind a lot. But nobody gives a because everyone spends hours and hours into this game and now that heists are coming everyone has a chance to get easy riches and at the same time have fun! I mean come on it's a heist! Everyone loves heists!OOPS cancerous kids appeared! They're ruining the game by friendly firing in heists ramming in races and exploiting the CEO update! Eh but nobody cares since we can make private lobbies with friends. We don't even have to worry about single player "Events"!OOPS! For some reason maxed out graphics look like now! Reflections are black and not even mods can fix this. Oh well let's wait for a patch.2017 OOPS! DLCs are now exclusive to GTA Online! Which means GTA V Singleplayer has been completely abandoned! Oh well that makes it more rewarding to get the cars in GTA Online also because we can create private lobbies!OOPS! Creating a private lobbie now causes one of these six things to happen!1) Get banned for cheating or cause your friends to be banned for cheating and be hated by them.2) Get disconnected.3) Crash and get your character corrupted AND saved to the cloud so there's no way to recover it.4) Your friend will be too focused in the grindfest to give two about you OR they will be bored of this game because kids ruined it.5) A kid hacks into your private server and starts shooting rockets at your car and making meteors fall from the sky then he gives you 900000000000XP to get you banned again.6) OOPS connection problems! Now you're only going to play in Strict NAT public servers with 'bad sports' enabled only full of modders and "9000000000 XP 69696969696969 $" deathmatches.Did i mention Rockstar and Take Two now got a policy to NOT disclose the reason you got banned? Oh and did i mention that modding this game in single player now also gets you banned? Yeah! Also cars cost 3 million now and are completely exclusive to GTA Online which means you are now forbidden from having fun in singleplayer! And you cannot even steal low tier sport cars in GTA Online. In a game called GRAND THEFT AUTO. Let that sink in.2018 GTA V Launcher has stopped working. On every pc i have. No matter how many times i format. Tried advice from 12 different forums. GTA V is dead. Only way left to play GTA V is getting a pirated copy and modding it. But even then any version beyond 1.41 will cause the GTA V Launcher to crash.Thanks Take Two. You took one of my favorite franchises and turned it into one of the worst games ever released on steam.

review: Short and honest A singleplayer that lacks real depth (unless you install mods of course) with an Online mode that basically forces you to either play hundreds of hours to buy a car or spend real money so you may flex on these online nibblets and actually have a chance in defending yourself.Game is so so it works and runs okay ish on medium budget PC's. Just don't get it for the Online Mode. You've got problems such as The aforementioned money grind the following microtransaction problem Hackers that drop all the money some people spent months grinding or worse even real moneyGlitches that wipe your online save and leave you with nothing A kind of boring gameplay routine Online Freeroaming mode would be fun if people who have a lot of money didn't have an advantage.In the end the main focus of this game is the Online mode which really isn't worth it.If you're in it for the Singleplayer experience maybe with a couple of mods it is still worth checking out though.Don't forget though make up your own mind.Read reviews to get an idea of something don't adapt to the reviewers opinion.

review: Update 16.06.2017 you Take 2 you Rockstar.You are not getting any more of my money after this Долгожданный (во многих смыслах) релиз от Рокстар на ПК наконец удался. После серии отвратительных релизов они всё таки смогли не подвести хотя бы один раз. До чего мы дошли приходится хвалить за казалось бы банальные и обязательные вещи _ Вкратце об игре это GTA. Если вы не знаете что это такое лучше поиграйте в GTA III Vice city и San andreas. Если знаете но с подозрением относитесь к серии после отвратительного GTA IV не сомневайтесь и играйте в V игра стала больше лучше веселее.Описывать геймплей как то не с руки поэтому просто пройдусь по плюсам минусам.Плюсы Три разных главных героя. Интересная система которая по началу слегка раздражала (тяжело сосредоточиться и вжиться в персонажей постоянно переключаясь между ними) но потом начала нравиться. Великолепный реднек Тревор это точно шедевр. Франклин практически классический "правильный парень с района". Майкл самый дурацкий персонаж но даже у него были свои моменты. Визуальное оформление. Ну или как там говорят... "графон"? Я честно говоря не особо упарываюсь по текстурам и количеству полигонов но общее графическое оформление горы вода виды из самолётов и с мостов закаты и просто спортивные машины всё очень гармонично и красиво. В продолжение предыдущего пункта вид от первого лица. Вот уж не ожидал что мне это так понравится. В результате примерно треть игры по времени я использовал вид от первого лица. Очень интересный опыт. Единственное что FOV из автомобиля от первого лица выглядит как будто бы персонаж дальнозоркий карлик и управлять машиной (особенно на холмистой или горной местности) просто невозможно. Но в целом очень круто. Эффект погружения мать его. Жду не дождусь когда я буду играть в GTA VII на Окулус рифте. Радио. Всегда было сильной частью всех серий GTA и тут с дизайном радио всё очень хорошо. Реклама очень в стиле этого мирка где рекламируют не электронные сигареты а электронные трубки с креком и героином а основная марка импортного пива PissWasser (Вассер это вода а что такое писс я думаю можете догадаться D). Talk radio это фактически отдельные несколько часов юмора которые можно слушать вне игры. Дополнительная мишура в игре есть но она не навязывает себя абсолютно. Можно проигнорировать 50% контента пройти игру до финала и остаться довольным. И не нужно возить своего брата недоумка в боулинг слава всем богам за это. (NIKO IT'S YOUR COUSIN...)нейтралочка Сюжет есть и слава богу. Физика вождения у меня не вызвала особых чувств. Наверное потому что я не разбираюсь и вообще не очень люблю гонки. Тюнинг туда же хотя он вроде как норм. Размер карты. Как ни странно карта мне показалась довольно маленькой. Или может... неразнообразной что ли. Хотя объективно она вроде как больше чем все предыдущие карты. Не знаю тут непонятно.Минусы Стрельба в игре сбалансированна под слепых инвалидов играющих одной рукой. (Ну или консольщиков примерно одно и то же). У двух из трёх героев "спец. способность" делает тривиальным любой замес в игре. Пушки (которых очень много. Штук 30) различаются весьма слабо апгрейды оружия однотипные редкие и стрёмные. Разницы между стартовым пистолетом и супер топовой пушкой примерно ноль. В голову всё убивает с первого выстрела. Баги всё же были. Один баг например я так и нашёл как исправить и из за этого не могу продвинуться по одной второстепенной сюжетной линии. Инноваций почти нет. Да три персонажа. Да вид от первого лица. Тут не поспорить супер. Ну собственно и всё. Всё остальное уже было и в принципе не то чтобы сильно хуже. Для игры с названием "ВЕЛИКИЙ УГОН АВТОМОБИЛЯ" маловато угона автомобиля. Не обычного бытового "дай сюда свою рандомную машину" а каких то миссий с этим связанных (их в игре я нашёл ровно 2 из сотни). Каких нибудь очень красивых уникальных автомобилей не хватает. Как то так. На мой вкус маловат упор на собственность/бизнесы/деньги. Нет я понимаю что игра не про великого регионального менеджера макдональдсов но всё же даже в vice city (или SA) с этим было гораздо интересней и лучше. А ещё можно торговать акциями.В целом не играя в GTA ONLINE я уже поиграл в GTA V 55 часов и я думаю что это хорошая длина для сингл плеер игры.Если бы не было GTA IV то эта итерация серии была бы 10/10 инновационным шедевром. А так добротная работа над ошибками от Рокстар и 8.5 9/10

review: So imagine GTA V on 360/PS3 was like the meal you ve waited for all your life that tasted a little raw but it was a good meal y know?Then you ve got the PS4/One version that is the same meal cooked ever so slightly better yet you re still hungry.This version is like the real deal. The main entrée. The dish you ve been truly hungry for your whole life. And it may have taken a little longer for it to be done but you craved it even more. In the end this is the most delicious meal of your life. You get everything and more especially for those who can crank up to 11 (4k resolution baby)Even if you ve bought this game before and thought you ve done it all don t overlook this well optimized glorious experience that will make your return to Los Santos ever so sweeter.

If you HAVE I recommend you to not buy it.I played this on PS3 and PS4 as well so I have some experience and knew how the game would be like. However running at recommended specs (760 &amp FX 6630) I didn't find it to look any better than the PS4 version other than the addition of 60 FPS. And actually SOME of the textures look worse than the PS4 version (this is at normal texture settings). Definetely need a good desktop to run this at high settings 1080p 60 FPS and to make sure it looks better than the consoles.Hopefully its just a bug on Rockstar's end and might send out a patch to fix the graphics but right now I'm not impressed.

review: Note I feel like I'm going to stir some crap up by saying this is a bad game. It's not. GTA V Story mode is a good game with a lot of fun gameplay mechanics. I wish the same could be said about GTA Online. Heck I wish there was a different section for reviews for GTA Online. So I can tell you truly how bad that is without on the Story. But for the sake of trying to make a clear explanation I guess I will have to divide that section up myself.GTA V Story Mode I really liked playing as all three main characters in this game with all of them having different unique skills special abilities side missions and things to do. I love the ability to switch characters at any point in the game and it shows them doing something while I'm not controlling them. Like they actually have some sort of "life". The gameplay mechanics isn't that different from previous games of the franchise which makes it easy to get into although I do wish they added more into the base game to allow for a more diverse experience and more actions or controls in game. The graphics well I guess they are pretty good. Not 2018 good as of today's standards(of when I am currently reviewing this game) but still good. I enjoy the variety of weapons and cars and the ability to mod them is pretty great allows you to change up the game a bit. You can add extended magazines or scopes or supressors to the gun of your choice which is a nice touch. The police do tend to get a bit annoying like I do one little thing (that even i don't think is illegal) and I get a 1 star which isn't great when you are trying to get somewhere while also have to hide from the police. I also enjoy the small activities like playing darts golfing going drinking or "taking a hit from the bong" in the game. Kinda gives you that feeling of freedom to do what you want. I do wish they had more activities which I imagine might be hard to program in but still possible. Like playing basketball surfing skateboarding or rollerskating. I mean they put GOLF and TENNIS in there so I think it could've been done. I kinda want the game to feel like you aren't restricted. And by that i don't mean MORE options for crime I mean more activities. The story overall was a great one and was executed well with some level of character progression and a lot of fun scenes. Franklin and Lamar are my favorite duo just because of the funy stuff they get up to. Trevor is just...insane but he allows you to just play it like a mass murdering psycho which at some points you would want to do because it's pretty fun. Michael was also great a different experience to the others with him having a crazy family while also trying to stay retired but can't because of all the events that happen in the game. Eventually it would reach the point where these three have met and pull of multiple heists growing more ambitious and larger. But...no spoilers. So GTA...great game.GTA Online GTA Online...is a mess a total disgrace from the story. Constantly bothered with twenty hundred calls from these npc's about having to buy something with money I don't have. Well money that I should've had if my character wasn't deleted simply because I haven't play GTA Online for a year. The growing amount of updates that add all these new things to the game sounds fun but actually isn't. It's a process of grinding for long periods of time to which at the end of it you won't be left feeling very satisfied. Even with all these new things it still has many problems starting with the players. I know i know GTA Online play with others in a crime game allowing you to do whatever the hell you want. And some of that freedom allows you to kill other players. And it gets annoying if you want to do some things without being bothered by others.That's the thing you can't do anything without other people interfering or helping. You can't do heists by yourself(because you need others) you can't do these stupid pickup missions by yourself(because you are playing in a open lobby) and some of the open world activities you can't do by yourself. Because not only do they require "more than 1 player" but some of it is also all open for the taking. You want to go steal that slow truck and bring it back to base for a mission that YOU started? You are bound to run into 10 others that will take it away from you because it alerts them of what you are doing. And they will constantly ruin your day. Not their problem they just want to have fun and kill some noobs. But I don't want to be killed...like a noob.Thank god they have a solo mode for the online. A solo mode that is stripped of most functionality that you would have if you played with others but still better than constantly earraped by children and killed by others and hackers. I mean a lot of these updates and activities require you to be some sort of VIP or CEO which would need you to have more than 1 million. Sure you can grind that out OR you can buy one of those SHARK Cards that Rockstar keeps shoving down your throat every 10 minutes. But even then SOLO MODE doesn't allow you to do those activities because it doesn't allow you to be a VIP or CEO in solo mode. So...whats the point? Should I just play in isolation? Well...I guess I could still go around and do stuff but just not allowed to do those new updates. Unless you enjoy being constantly killed while trying to deliver something with others in your way in normal online. But it's just...not fun. I guess this ends my review. Story mode is great. Online is trash. Opinions are opinions. Multiplayer is not the way to go. You want to kill others virtually to feel good about yourself? Go ahead. But nothing will beat a good story in a actually good game and the Online just ruined it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After a couple years after the release I finally bought and finished this game. As someone who haven't played GTA IV I really like new physics of the characters and cars. I also love that the cars can take some beating now so it would make sense now to upgrade your car.The story mode is great. I recommend buying this game just for the story. The attention to the details is amazing. The dialogs are hilarious and believable. Now the online. There are a lot of game modes you can explore from a classic deathmatch to Tron like hyper bike challenges. Only that can be a lot of fun. However personally for me these game modes are better played in other games. The free roaming mode though is quite boring unless you have friends to fool around with. In order to get the fun gear and vehicles you need a lot of in game currency. Sure you can do missions and other stuff but the payout is nothing in comparison to the price of access to the interesting content. And that's is the main problem the online portion was designed with micro transactions in mind. You can get yourself a CEO office MC club to get access to the best money making options. But this is very tedious. The cheapest CEO office is 1kk which in real world money is 20$ CAD. After that you need to buy a warehouse which costs 1.5kk. And after that you'll get access to special missions to make more money than standard jobs. The core gameplay mechanics boring and it gets stale after first couple times. It feels like work. Moreover that the game spams you with calls from NPC suggesting you to buy this cool night club quite often.Overall I recommend this game. The story mode is great and online can increase the perceived value of the game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
