review: (I'm still about the TakeTwo and OpenIV modding fiasco but it isn't really a problem anymore so I won't focus on that.)I love GTA V. I've been playing it since it ever came out on PS3 and got the PC version a year after it came out. The detail in the PC version over the PS3 version just astonished me. It's an amazing game. To add to that I modded the game with VisualV NVR countless car mods real LA architecture and LA Roads and realistic car physics. I can say that I have played over 700 hours of just singleplayer after finishing the story.I decided to try out Online because it looked interesting and I can say that it is a pay to win experience. Hackers were everywhere and I was okay with it as long as they didnt bother me but I had realized that if you weren't willing to either hack or pay for Shark cards then you probably weren't gonna get anywhere in Online without working your off. Then adding the fact that Singleplayer was left abandoned by Rockstar and their focus on online and milking bans out of legit online players for no reason I just stayed with singleplayer modding.TL DR Great game for singleplayer and singleplayer modding but Online is just a waste of time at this point.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player game is fine but if you're looking to play GTA Online don't even waste your time. You've probably seen multiple complaints of hackers and are thinking people complain of them in every game. No you really don't understand you will get lucky if you find a server without one. My favorite excuse is "well they ruined the game by making it P2W" except most of these modders could just give themselves unlimited money but they don't do that they kill you instead either out of anger because you killed them or just cause they can. "It's the toxic community! they keep killing me"...there's a passive mode that makes you invincible if you don't want to participate in PvP. These people literally kill you just because they can. It's so madening it's unreal if it wasn't for the modders GTAO would actually be fun.If you think it's okay to hack in order to kill other players whether you're mad at the developer or mad you don't have the skill to kill another player do real gamers a favor and don't play online games. I hope that for every hacker someone breaks into your home and breaks your hands so badly you live with the most agonizing crippling arthritis that no medication can seem to dull the pain rendering you unable to even use your hands nor sleep to escape the pain so nobody has the enjoyment of their game ruined by you again. The game has options for you to avoid PvP completely if you don't like it yet you still decide to be the biggest pos on the planet. You are not a gamer don't call yourself a gamer stick to single player games where you're comfortable and you can cheat all you like.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a great and i do mean realy great single player game. I would even go as far as to say that it is the best sandbox single player game yet.BUT....when it comes to the online part it sucks!! Not because the gameplay is bad no the gameplay is excelent. It sucks bigtime because of its stability issues.Getting disconnected and having the game crash while having the time of your (gamer) life is annoying. But having the game crash 6 8 times every time you play a full heist with your friends.... that just makes me ragequit the game and wish i could kill the damn thing.So you should buy this game for a super SINGLEPLAYER part but do not expect much from the online part stability wise.All in all I dont know if i should recommend this game or not.Oh and Rockstar sadly show themselves as true capitalists by offering shark cards ingame money for real money. But what else could you expect after all its only what everybody else does.

review: Just another open world RPG. Only 3 classes that are almost the same and also have predefined races that can't be changed. Skills level up by doing stuff like running. There is a main story line and a couple of side quests. But no boss fights only trash mobs the whole game. You can buy a lot of items but they don't have stats. Weapons are mostly ranged and you will get in trouble using melee only. There's only one kind of armor that isn't even visible on the character.Good thing so far there are a lot of different mounts to ride. Some of them can also fly but are destroyed quickly if you collide with the level geometry.Setting could be interesting if you're bored with fantasy.

review: its my first review for any game on steam so ill keep it simple. buy it for the offline mode. the online community is pure cancer... heres how1. all races are full of cheaters unless you make it a non contact race2. servers are crap and often disconnect randomly even on stable connections.3. heists bikerclub and ceo missions are quick money but some..no all the time there has to be someone to mess your life up. 4. unless you buy and upgrade your own cars in races your chances of victory are thinner than a layer of graphene. 5. all the cars are wayy to costly to even buy after hard grinds. (i barely managd to get an infernus and an armoured kuruma)6. deathmatch is ruled by snipers and miniguns.7. pk crapheads wont allow to even freeroam outside of passive mode.while thats there the offline mode is just too good....its got a great story great side missions tv and movies are a must watch in this one easy access to money and cars. no shitbags that follow you everywhere cops go much easier in offline mode and above all the gratest reason for getting this game is mods. the community is just so vast and good that you will thank yourself for not playing online and enjoying the pure bliss of a modded game.so whats my final verdict?online 2/10offline +12/10 play offline. stay away from the salt and cancer.

review: WARNING The following review contains !!OPINIONS!! Part I Introduction and Core Gameplay Review Let me start off by saying I played GTA V first on Xbox 360 with at least 200 hours played on that platform. When I first got into the storyline and the game world I was stunned by the size on the map and the beautiful graphics. It was a very good looking game for a 2013 game and the previous generation of consoles mind you. The gameplay was solid it was what I came to expect from a GTA game. Driving from one place to another to do a certain task with dialogue in between it was all too familiar to me having played GTA Vice City San Andreas GTA IV and Red Dead Redemption extensively in the past. It was the core gameplay I was accustomed to and loved! There were a few minor flaws or shortcomings with the game physics having regressed surprisingly from the state they were in GTA IV and Red Dead Redemption with the Euphoria game physics and what not. These were just minor flaws in the game physics and or gameplay but these minor details did not bother me too much as they were negligible. The game was still fun to mess around with as was any other GTA or RDR in the past. Killing everyone on sight or getting cheat codes and spawning a combat tank or helicopter was still a ton of fun for a while. In conclusion the core gameplay mechanics of GTA V were still fun like its predecessors so there isn't a lot to complain about on my part. With that being said let's move on to the storyline shall we? Part II Narrative and Characters Review Awful just awful end of review... ha! I wish I could just say that and be done with it but there is somuch more to say that I will not be giving you the reader enough justice if I kept all this disappointment to myself. This is the one and only biggest reason as to why you should absolutely not expend those sixty dollars. Let's begin with the protagonists. Rockstar did a very bold and corageous move which I applaud to try a different approach by introducing not one but three protagonists that you can actively play as at any time you choose. This gives a fresh perspective that we had never seen before in a Rockstar game but it does NOT come without consequences. Rockstar had to develop three different points of view intertwined into one single storyline. THIS is the major flaw here and where R* games failed miserably. The character development or lack thereof of these three protagonists and the characters around them is just unbelievable no other word to use or way to put it. Let's start with Michael the ex gangster or criminal turned protected witness. He is first introduced as a sadistic and depressed character with a family that clearly does not give two craps about him nor respects him in any way. That's about it for Michael De Santa's introduction. Next we get introduced with Franklin the totally not forced CJ clone (beloved protagonist from GTA SanAndreas) that is the stereotypical hood gangster that all of the sudden wants to leave that life behind by doing more crimes and getting rich. Oh Rockstar the story is going great so far! So the two resentful buddies Michael and Franklin immediately sympathize with each other and decide to leave their criminal lives behind by getting more money aquired by committing more cimes.... makes perfect sense to me. Also somehow Franklin sees Michael as some sort of father figure. That's right the resentful black hoolum sees a white dude living in Hollywood Hills as some form of father figure! Way to go in story telling Rockstar! The worst part is that nothing else develops that is about it for Michael and Franklin's character development. There are no more twists and turns we get three forced protagonists for the excuse to make heist missions. GTA V's storyline felt like Rockstar decided first that they just wanted to make the protagonists do heists as the main feature in the story and THEN they decided to to create eveything else (inclusing the protagonists and other characters) around this idea. That is an absolutely FLAWLESS story telling strategy by Rockstar Games! Am I right guys? Am I right? (SARCASM INTENSIFIES). Am I forgetting someone? Oh yes! Then there is Trevor.... not much to say there. Rockstar attempted the 'comedic relief' by creating Trevor's character. At times Trevor can be very funny yes but then they ruin it by making him attempt to be a serious character in certain segments of the story. The end result is Trevor being a very inconsistent character that the audient cannot sympathize with or relate to..... just like the other two protagonists! That is the single biggest flaw in the story in GTA V the fact that you as a player can never in any way relate to any of these protagonists or supporting characters. The fact that none of them progess into anything else makes it even worse. In addition as much as the protagonists are unlikeable and forgettable so are the villains. If you played the GTA V story more than two years ago I challenge you to name more than one of the antagonists. I am willing to bet most people won't even remember one of them and that is because of how weak and forgettable their characters are. In the other hand the satisfaction that I got after killing Vlad or Dimitri in GTA IV makes it a great story on its own. Seeing how Nikko Bellic struggled as an immigrant with the illusion of the american dream makes us all immigrants and even people that were born here in the U.S sympathize with his character. Conclusion and Verdict To summarize the gameplay mechanics and graphics were ok the storyline and awful characters made it one of the most disappointing games of this era of gaming. I cound go on and on about how the map is huge but mostly empty and how insanely boring the yoga mini game and most other mini games are but why bother. All in all I give GTA V a 6 out of 10 just because the core gameplay from past GTA games did not change much and that is what made it any good. The rest is all said and done at this point. I would recommend you to buy this game unless it is on sale for 20 dollars or less. When it comes to GTA Online I never played much of it but the reviews are not great to put it lightly. Thanks for reading my opinion and have a wonderful day.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I ve been a GTA player since I was 8 years old and I used to mod the hell out it. It s been a part of my life for a long time now ever since GTA San Andreas. Ever since T2 made a move against mod makers rockstar has left a bitter taste in my mind. All of the sudden everything started to come together. I ve never been a fan of the multiplayer in fact it s atrocious boring gameplay. But since Rockstar has grossed more than a hundred million dollars from shark cards each year they ve become extremely lazy. All new content is Online exclusive to add insult to injury Rockstar tries to stop you from spawning these DLC vehicles through a trainer in SP by disappearing them tempting you to buy them through the use of shark cards. A long awaited unannounced leaked SP expansion was cancelled a few months ago and a lot of the Online exclusive missions were going to be SP only. This general greediness and hostile attitude to the modding community has made me not recommend this game to anyone really. The story in GTA V is mediocre at best the gun play is ok for the most part. But it s not satisfying and it gets really boring unless you use mods. The car mechanics are the real kicker here they re bad. The handling is terrible the collisions are terrible it is terribly downgraded which leads me to believe that Rockstar cut out a lot of content in order for consoles to have a chance at running the game. The multiplayer... wow what a horrible piece of waste. It is the true definition of pay2win.Honestly this is a good game at its core but with the standards of companies like Rockstar it s average at most. GTA V will require you to use mods in order to find it engaging in my opinion because otherwise the vanilla game is underwhelming. It s safe to say that I won t be buying anything that comes from Take2 unless there s a major change in their greedy attitudes.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's GTA. Why are you reading my review? If you have not bought or played this game yet at this point you are either An advocate against violence in video games under the age of 0 over the age of 110 and/or Sean Murray*Not necessarily in that orderEDIT As a developer and modder myself I am reversing my recommendation due to Take Two Interactive's stance on modding and sending a cease and desist to OpenIV. A lot of great games came from mods and mods in general extend the life of the game beyond it's retail cycle. Hell I'm still playing Silent Hunter 3 a game that came out in 2005 thanks to mods!This is egregious behavior from a money hungry publisher who is more interested in pushing out microtransaction tat instead of making good games. All good then I will be part of the boycott against TTWO. Looking forward to shorting their stock!

review: I have bought this game 3 times (F me right?). I Pre ordered it on 360 bought it again first day for Xbox One. And bought it for PC after about a month of the release. I bought it for PC for the specific purpose of playing harmless single player mods. But since being released for PC Rockstar and Take Two have put up road blocks to the modding community. Including recently sending a Cease and Desist to Open IV. DO NOT buy this game on PC if you intend on enjoying mods in Single Player. DO NOT buy this game on PC if you intend on enjoying their own multiplayer either. They have attempted (and failed) to clean up the cheating mods on their own Online. You can and will get caught in their attempts to police the rampant money modding whether you're guilty of it yourself or just an innocent bystander. They can't stop the Grief Modders from ruining your online play but they can stop you from enjoying the work of the modding community in Single Player. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME ON PC. Full Stop.

review: Treating customers with gross disrespect has consequences.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Revision The latest DLC has drastically changed the experience and feels like an outright cash grab. Previously you could participate in the new online activities with a moderate amount of effort. CEO activities for example could be paid for by completing 2 3 heists and their setups. The barrier to entry on this update is easily 5x that or more. You need to drop at least $1.1mil on a bunker $1.25mil on a trailer (because your upgraded bunker coming in at an extra $2mil is otherwise useless) and another $1mil on a specific section to your trailer to be able to actually modify your guns. If you want to play the missions add another $600k to the trailer for the mission having module. That's right!.. The new weapons in this update come AFTER approximately $3.5mil of other crap purchases and missions come after $4mil. Once you have everything though you can look forward to $75 250k upgrades and $30 80k accessories for half a dozen weapons and a bunker that earns about $30k per hour. New vehicles come in at $1.5 2.5mil before their DLC specific mods ($200 500k+)And just to keep it interesting... AI and AI police are joined by players on nimble fast flying rocket bikes complete with homing missiles! Gone are the days of enjoying anything but the fastest vehicle avaiable and good luck outside of the city. Hydra griefers are sorely missed following what it possibly the stupidest addition to any game. Add in one hit kill explosive sniper rifle rounds fired from rifles with thermal scopes that somehow distinguish people from hot rocks and other in sunny California and we finally find ourselves with a truly pay to win environment in GTAO. I feel bad for folks just getting into the game!I'm currently trying to rush through the research here. Knocked out four camouflages for the paltry sum of $900 000! That just means they're discovered though... Only another $45k to apply them to each gun. Seriously this. It's "random" but I'm guessing Ill have to pay another million to get past the rest of the camos to the actually cool Then pay out the to actually use it.GTAO has become the game GTAV satirized. It's awful. It used to be one of the best examples of what AAA games should be and made Ubisoft's offerings look pathetic by comparison. This latest step in Rockstar trying to maximize their micro transactions has all but reversed that. We can only hope the next update will have a mode to revert to when GTAO wasn't a bunch of weaponized Saint's Row wannabe cars and planes and rocket bike planes where players need to shell out real cash or grind for *literally* weeks to stay competitive. I miss my favorite game.Original A mile wide and deep. It's amazing just how high Rockstar set the bar for the price compared to other titles out there. Of course they sold the game three different times but let's hope that's a one time thing (lol doubt it).The multiplayer community can be toxic at times and cheaters seem to be largely unopposed by either Rockstar or public lobby vote kicks. It's a sandbox though so you can take your ball and go somewhere else if someone is causing trouble. Beyond that it's a truly awesome game with a stimulating narrative and distractions presented with what remains some of the best artwork in the industry. After GTAV I cringe paying $60 for most other titles with respect to value... Remember the first Titanfall? *barf*Highly highly recommended.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Apparently Take Two don't want their game to have replayability. If you do not want singleplayer mods then you cut the lifetime of singleplayer WAY down. They just want us to play multiplayer and buy their cash cards.

review: I first played GTA V when I got it on release day for Xbox 360 it was fantastic then and it's fantastic now.GTA V is a great game sure it may not beat GTA IV's story but it's still fun. GTA IV focuses more on Story rather than Free Mode Playability GTA V is great for free mode playability plus there is mods which makes it so much better.GTA Online is great too except for the hackers who mess with players.GTA Online is fun though it is WAY better with friends believe me.You'll have an easier time doing Heists with friends/crew members than randoms.The Rockstar Editor is one of my most favorite things of the GTA V on PC (yeah I know it's on Current Gen now.) because it allows you to make videos way more easier than GTA IV did.NOTE DO NOT USE MODS ON GTA ONLINE YOU CAN BE BANNED.EDIT 6/15/17 Mods are outlawed OpenIV has been killed off because of 2K Interactive. YOU 2K. Do not get this game until the C&amp D from 2K is dropped. This is unacceptable. Without OpenIV many mods will be affected as well as the progression of modding for GTA V. It pains me to have to give a negative review but it is necessary.

review: Henlo Gamers i am very fortunate enough to have been banned on gta online. Why you ask? funny story.. You tell me. ive done nothing gamebreaking and im certainly not a cheater hacker or modder. I havent used a different VPN and i wouldnt even know how to go around doing this. I have been spawn trapped by cheaters and have filed reports against them but i dont feel like they have been banned yet i have. Although i dont have a lot of hours as most of the other people who have been wrongly banned i have played for more hours then stated. I have played since release date on xbox 360 Bought it on Xbox one and also pc. Buying shark cards on both consoles. Which seen as im getting reset in about a month will have been a waste of time Money and memories. The main thing that pisses me off is the fact that it hasnt said why i was banned the reason why Im banned for a month and am getting my character reset. It just said a really vague message that says something along the lines of you are banned till 8th of september your character will be reset end of story" And if you make an appeal or try to get your account back (sending a ticket) you will get a response in your email from an automated bot which gives you a list of reason why you may be banned. All which i cant remember breaking. when you respond to that email they basically tell you to go to players for support. which feels like a personal you we dont care. Which i know they dont really give a about their legit paying customers. i have quite easily spent at least 200 300 on the game alone including shark cards. For people wanting to get this game only do so on sale or or other thirs party sites. but i will never buy another copy or a rockstar game again as their support are bots...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Story Mode is fantastic. The chemistry between the 3 characters is so lacking that it is hilarious. Some of Micheal and Trevor's back and forth made me laugh. Great missions and the Big One is a masterpiece. I have yet to finish the game on PC (I beat it on PS3 back in 2013) but the beautiful graphics add to the narrative. Online is interesting. Running friends over in a Rolls Royce is undoubtedly a lot of fun. Me and a few friends have enjoyed hours doing death matches spontaneously shanking each over and stealing each other's cars. However the banter is ruined when a 12 year old tryhard griefer who thinks it's cool to blow people up in his jet when we're racing mopeds around a golf course shows up. They ruin the fun. Additionally modders are everywhere. I was in a plane and then he spawned a massive cage around it and put a bong on my head. Then the f*cking TARDIS landed on the cage. It sounds hilarious but he followed me around sessions until I eventually had to quit. Story 10/10 Online 6/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There seems to be an issue that a few people are facing regarding the game world not actually.. loading. In high density areas like the city more often than not the world will actually stop loading and the ground beneath your car will simply disappear. Not sure why I exceed the recommended specifications for the game. I can run it on high graphics with 60 FPS but that apparently doesn't stop the game world from being bugged to hell. Oh well we'll see if R* pushes a patch or something to fix this. Until then this game is in a near unplayable state for me. I'll alter my review accordingly when this game breaking bug is fixed.As it turns out the above was a compatibility issue with Windows 8 it seems. Setting the compatibility mode to Windows 7 solved my issue. The game runs amazingly on my mid tier computer. I'm honestly surprised i don't meet the recommended specs yet I run this game with high graphics at 60 FPS no problem. The game is very well optimized for a GTA game (I'm looking at you GTA IV).Now as for gameplay. This is probably one of the best open world games I have ever played. There is so much to do that I'm not even sure what to do next. You can go make a mess of the city go golfing play tennis race around with your friends the possibilities are almost limitless. The story mode is also really well done and after you beat it it pretty much feels like an amazing and polished retirement simulator.Even if you bought it twice already the game is worth it. No seriously you'll probably cringe a little at paying $60 for the same game again but especially on a mouse and keyboard the game feels like an entirely new experience.

review: First of all let me start off by saying they never should have released a game as broken as this. I can't run it for 20 minutes without Blue Screening but that doesn't change my opinion of this game. It is still one of the greatest games in the franchise and of all time in my opinion. (Vice City will always beat out the others for me). For the small time I could play it the controls were incredibly fine tuned and responsive and the controller support is phenomenal. The game is very well optimized especially if you have the newly released AMD/Nvidia drivers. The level of detail is wonderful to have and was nice to see coming from the PS3 version. Even though it's currently a broken piece of I will still reccomend it.

review: Loved modding this game its what has always attracted me to the GTA games on PC. The official online has always been a terrible money grab so after completeing the story I turned to mods to keep the game interesting. The only thing I enjoy in this game is adding new mods/combining them there are so many fun things to do. Why with the mod community when they are what adds longevity and interesting new mechanics to the game? Shutting down the people who are so enthusiastic about your game that they create new parts for YOUR game for ZERO pay is ing stupid. You should be supporting the mod creators with toolkits and maybe even a place to host the mods. It would fill the community with gratitude for helping them play the game they want to play it and extend the lifespan of the game for years to come.

review: Single player mode is great (I played it previously on xbox before making the mistake of buying this game.)The online game is the reigning king of sucking balls. Racing is decent but just buy a racing game. I have 7 hours in this game and every single one of them sucked. You sit and stare at a loading screen until you begin to wonder whether you should just play something else. Then the half baked game loads and some hacking/glitching guy wins by doing some BS you don't understand. So for 5 minutes of loading time the actual game lasts 15 seconds of confused chaos. Then back to the loading screen. I dare you to try and beat the Community Outreach mission. It's impossible. And each time you try you have to sit through even more minute of loading time. I was like "sweet I got some video game time!" Two hours later after NOT actually having played a full minute of a video game it occurred to me that this game just really really sucks. Online mode is must a smelly smelly thoroughly un entertaining turd. Graphic are awesome! I'd rather play an Atari game.

review: GTA has always been one of my favorite sandbox games. It has so many game modes all smoothly rolled into a single game. The online portion of the game really opened up the gta experience for me and is the reason I think this is the best GTA game yet. (also superior graphics and physics) No other game on the market has as much going on any given moment. I bought GTA on xbox 360 for myself and then a copy for my son. I then bought GTA V on pc and enjoyed playing online again. (my character from xbox transfered over) We bought another computer and a second copy of GTA V for pc to play with my son. I have purchased GTA V four times now. It is a violent gory swear fest but it's very fun!

review: Fantastic game. Runs perfect using a 980 and 3570K 1440p. Coming from the last GTA I wasn't expecting this to be such a well made game. They've done an awesome job easily the best looking game and yet it's also huge! First person mode is great and even then it's got much better graphics than most corridor shooters. There's only two or three setting I can't quite max but I'm running it at 2560x1440. Ultra grass (which looks no different to very high as far as I can tell) and HD shadows (which is seperate from the main shadow option has 15 20fps hit) but I'm running Nvidia soft shadows which means the "HD shadows" don't do much anyway.Online seems to be stable but I haven't played that much yet.Very very happy. Great game I'd highly recommend. Don't let the last GTA put you off (which is a mess still to this day) Rockstar have spent a lot of time making the PC version. I also have the Xboc One version and PC blows that away.

review: GTAV plays excellently on the PC. The optimization is great with mid range computers being able to flawlessly play this game with little hassle. It's a game that can be as beautiful as you want it to be with a plethora of options to tweak. The controls work well with keyboard AND controller. The awesome thing is that you can have the keyboard/mouse plugged in as well as a controller and the game will detect which you are using and adjust the tooltips. The polish on this game is very apparent. The character migration also works well. What I'm trying to get at is everything about this game is everything from the xbox one/ps4 but better in every way. Except helicopter control which I feel is a little loose and more difficult but still usable.

review: I can't believe Take Two would do something so terribly greedy. People who have spent the past decade making their games enjoyable long after all of the original content has been completed have seen all their hard work go down the drain. These people took pains to ensure that OpenIV cannot be used alongside GTA Online. The real problem with Online hackers are the coders and game file editors who corrupt files while playing Online NOT people installing single player mods. This will do literally nothing to curb Online cheaters they will continue to do what they do which has nothing to do with OpenIV. I wish this decision would hurt Take Two financially but I know that the main market for Shark Cards (10 year olds who buy them with mommy's money so they can go online and insult people's mothers) won't be affected.What a shame.

review: Product received for free. This is a game I've been playing since September 17th 2013 and have obtained three copies. I'm also a seasoned veteran of Grand Theft Auto V's Grand Theft Auto Online. And despite the general shenanigans of GTA Online I still love it. GTA V GTAO are still great games three years and three years later (X360 X1 PC). The story is good and well done to a point and thoroughly enjoyable. The 30+ hours I put into the story and many hours I ve put into GTA Online is and was very much worth it.Pros Well written story for the most part. Good characters for the most part (I'll explain below). Great graphics even on lower end GPUs. Runs well on decent CPUs. Action packed at times and keeps you going. Satisfying ending depending on what one you choose.Cons Despite the three characters out of Trevor and Michael Franklin isn't that well written and fleshed out as a character. I do understand he's the newbie in the group but he could've been fleshed out more. Lamar Davis. I understand he's a satire of the ignorant and stupid thug male but that's why I dislike him and him being in the game. The overly aggressive police AI in GTA Online. From shooting to kill the moment they exit their squad car to excessively ramming the ever loving out of a Rhino MBT or a vehicle MUCH bigger than their car. Seriously the police AI is screwed up. Not so much of a complaint but more of an observation. This game displays itself in a light of realism but you can flip your car back over with ease or turn your vehicle in any direction in mid air as you please.(This review may be updated.)9.5/10Would buy a 347 867 times again.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I think one of the major problems with GTA V is that time has shown how untrustworthy Take Two and Rockstar are when better games have released since 2013. The single player is brilliant. Everyone knows that by now. It's got amazing detail in the world but time seems to have turned Los Santos from this brilliant open world to a bland uninteresting wasteland. It just doesn't hold up very well anymore. Not to mention how long it took for the game to drop for $60 to $30. When the game launched on PC it already wasn't worth $60. The online is complete garbage from what I've heard even though the idea sounds promising. The port is solid enough. My older machine which has since been upgraded ran at 60 no matter how far I pushed the settings. I bought this for a third time over a year ago because I wanted to mod the game. And while that held my attention for around 10 hours. The mods for the game aren't very good most of the time. Everything outside trainers has too much clunk for me to enjoy when it's set in such a beautifully crafted game. But I have a bad itch when I don't like a developer or publisher. It just screams in the back of my mind that the game has micro transactions in it's online. Or that Take Two attempted to take down OpenIV. I can't recommend the game anymore. It just doesn't seem like a game I could tell my friend to go out and buy without telling him all of it's faults. Hell I'd rather just lend him one of the three copies I had to buy.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The games from rockstar have always been fun and they always seemed to love their fans but it definitely feels like this games more motivated by money and the business side of things. I certainly understand that they need to make money but their actions against their loyal fan base seem very disrespectful. While the microtransactions left a bad taste in many players mouths we ended up getting free DLC (the large content updates) so it was more understandable. However the actions that have been taken against the modding community by the corporate side of things has been disgusting claiming they were trying to help the online community but instead used brutal legal force against a bunch of gamers looking to help others have more fun. I agree that the online hackers suck and need to be stopped however rockstar or more accurately 'Take Two Interactive' has gone and attacked many single player only mods and modders. Some modders even reported having investigators come to their homes and threatening them in person with legal action. After these recent events I have lost most of the respect I had for rockstar I think the game devs are still amazing at what they do but if they loved their community they would stand up for it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

They make massive efforts to ban players that hack money but to nothing to the trolls to run about with infinite health and ammo. Take 2 Exectutive went on record a few days ago saying that "We feel that we UNDERmonetise our customers". We all know that the gaming industy is riding the microtransaction band wagon but this is a step too far might as well offer T2 our credit card info and they them take what they feel they're entitled to. Take 2 are greedy petty scum.I will NEVER spend a single penny on any Take 2 Interactive game EVER again until this move is reversed.

review: EDIT If you are considering buying this during the steam summer sale do it if you want to buy GTA V for the single player modding experience otherwise do not buy this the multiplayer has turned into garbage.If you are just getting the game for single player and modding that go for it tons of fun. But DO NOT PURCHASE any sharkcards or the "Starter Pack". Rockstar and Take Two have turned GTA Online into a disgusting cash grab that really makes me both sad and angry to see what it has become. GTA Online used to be a very fun experience and if you need proof just go look at the old gen console versions. The PS3 stopped getting updates before lowriders so they don't have to deal with the flying rocket bikes with homing missiles the assortment of jets that only people with sharkcards and modded accounts can afford (unless you want to spend a huge amount of time in game to afford that and make your money back from all the pay walls you have to buy into unless you want to just do races or other jobs which still would take hours to make a decent amount of money) and now with the release of this DLC the Orbital Cannon. A lock on one hit kill costs 750k to use while manual aim costs 500k. Its like they are giving hackers a tool on a golden platter to mess with anyone who would want to play the game as Rockstar "intended".I put a total of 60 real life days in game time played on PS3 PS4 and PC combined and near the end I really was regretting that. I have been a long time supporter of Rockstar (since GTA III) but their focus on "Recurrent consumer spending" rather than new single player or well polished content has forced me to withdraw my support until they fix their If they drop the focus on micro transactions (which is not likely to happen) I will recommend this game for Online (provided they fix that too) but until then I cannot recommend getting this game for its multiplayer.

review: This game is really good. I bought it back on PS3 when it first came out and immediatly couldn't let go. While it's true I have other games that maybe I like more inherently such as Half Life or NaissanceE Grand Theft Auto V probably is going to become my most played game very quickly simply because there's so much to do in it. Even once you've compleated the story campaign and every single player mission (an unrealistically gargantuan task by the way) there is still GTA online. If you somehow manage to finish that (Which because of the user created content I don't think that can even be done) the huge open world still gives plenty of opportunities to screw around and have fun. I have seen better stories in games but I was still thoroughly entertained by that of GTA. The main story is extremely enjoyable and almost all the side missions bode well into the open world and don't feel tacked on.As for optimization the game runs fabulously on my old laptop on the medium settings something that left me totally dumbfounded. I have heard people are having issues with getting the game to run I never had anything like this but judging by the other reviews I would say you should look into these issues before you purchase.All in all this game is absolutly amazing and totally worth buying even if you've already bought and beat the last gen versions. If you already have the current gen maybe hold of till a sale though.

review: The GTA series is a really good game series and Grand Theft Auto V is no exception.Pros 1. First Person View gives the world of GTA V a new look.2. A really good looking game!3. An action packed story with 3 characters now.4. Gameplay gets boring after story mode.Cons 1. GTA Online is very lackluster with hackers swarming servers. Recommend friends only server.Sad thing is the PS4 edition's GTA Online is better by a bit.(New con)2. Rockstar is trying very hard to stop people from modding the game so they update the game twice and require you to have the current version of Social Club to run the game or else the game won't run.3. Did I say the Social Club is still annoying?4. Take Two wants to rid the game of modding once more and is trying to delete any way of installing them. Also they consider it illegal. Total Game Score 4/10Do not get this game the company/manufacturer does not want the consumer to have fun in any way.

review: so full disclosure i got banned for using a mod menu online.I bought the mod menu because it took forever to make money in this game. You could do rooftop rumble and make 20k before they lowered that amount to like 10k for 20 minutes of work. They introduced CEO work but all it takes is one 10 year old in a jet singing the trolololo song in his head to make sure that you dont make any money from that. Same situation with the later added MC. You can do heists but half the time it doesnt load and 3/4ths of the times it loads you cant start because someone fell asleep while waiting for it to load then half of those successful times one of the people blows themselves up with a rocket because it why not.So ultimately youre left with a choice pay $10 for lifetime access to a mod menu which is essentially unlimited money or $100 for 8 million gta dollars. You can get 2 of the new cars and halfway upgrade both of them for $8million. What I did with the menu was so much more than money. I didnt even end up giving myself money after my inital 30 day ban. I spawned cars for people asking what they were like to drive I spawned blimps for me and my friends to fly around and have fun with I flew people around in a school bus. I was finally permanantly banned after logging in driving my car on the water to my yacht and then repairing the damage done to said car in the process. Looking at the reviews the modding problem hasnt gotten much better and i got banned easily 6 months ago.On top of all of this they still charge $60 for a game that was released first in 2013 again in 2014 and again in 2015. This game is almost 4 years old and they are still charging full price. ON TOP OF the insultingly high shark card prices. This whole thing with single player modding doesnt even make any sense because its not like single player has received any new cars since 2014 anyway. Which honestly sucks because I really enjoyed the story that was told.Forgot to mention that online is a joke now anyway flying motorcycles tron bikes tanks military grade helicopters and jets a car that can jump 50 feet in the air and then deploy an unlimited amount of parachutes an electric car with a jet turbine on the back and so on. I can no longer support either of these companies and I was strongly considering RDR2 but I can't morally justify giving these people any more of my money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a great game ruined by money grubbing t. I'm not sure if it's Rockstar or Take Two I don't care. I'm never buying another one of their games no matter how much I want to experience them. Their business practices have alienated me and a lot of gamers like me.Single player DLC that was promised has been delayed indefinitely because they're raking in too much cash with GTA O and don't want people to stop spending money on it. That me off.I was banned for using single player mods. Lost all of my progress which took a lot of grinding since I don't waste money on shark cards no matter how badly they try to make it impossible to progress without them. Whatever I won't play GTA O. Honestly it's a cobbled together piece of that serves only as a cash machine and they don't do much to hide that.Now they've banned single player mods altogether. That was the last straw. Rockstar and Take Two can eat a

review: Sued a mod developer because others used his base mod for their own BS needs.RIP OpenIV______________________________________________________________Actual review Started strong with a good and fair in game market. After a few updates cars guns and everything else started to cost more and more. This raised the issue that never bothered other GTA games. Is GTA actually fun when you can't afford to buy the fun stuff? The answer is no not really. If you want to afford the fun cars cool guns and other amazing stuff you will need to grind endless hours of the same missions to do so. If you make a bad purchase and get a car or item that isn't super fun you have to start that grind again.Also they are super strict on anything considered cheating. Modder join your PUBLIC lobby and start spawning cash on you? Banned and fully reset account once you come back. Have fun grinding.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I liked it to begin with. I loved the multiplayer. It was fun to arrange freemode battles. Hunting tryhards facing off hostile jets from the ground. taking on groups of people at once or just goof around. I loved it.Then R* stopped dealing with the modders.Now you have less tryhards and more cryhards people who sit literally for HOURS ingame in their apartments passive trashtalking nonstop. then start following you around in passive vehicles. trying to kill you with eject kills while still in passive. If they fail at killing you like that they will either Go to the new bunker prepare the orbital cancer and then try to kill you with that. if they fail. or you go passive they will start trashtalking you for going passive despite they have been passive all the time themselves. and sit for an hour talking in the bunker while charging another shot. If they fail again they call in modders that will freeze you in an open area so they get free kill which they will brag about for weeks. they will follow you despite you block them.Or they will use mods to crash your game. sometimes even follow you when you join another server just to crash you again. GTA V and online WAS good.Now it is trash. do NOT buy it.

review: Invasive 3rd party DRM makes this game inoperable for many who purchased. The game itself at least in single player while funtioning was superb and felt alive with personality and many great satirical commentaries. However that was short lived in my experience as the game suddenly refused to log into the Rockstar servers. My game was new and unmodded no firewall blocks that could hinder connection so I went to the Rockstar forums and discovered how many others are facing the same issue. Cannot play the single player or multiplayer portion of the game because it requires DRM to verify through it's servers even AFTER initial authentication. Absolute garbageware waste of everyone's time.Refunded after an hour or so of being able to play the game have never had an investment become so useless so quickly. I don't recommend buying this or any future Take Two Interactive/Rockstar games until they and all other publishers realize that DRM is the wind in the pirate ship's sails.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I WILL NOT BE SUPPORTING THIS COMPANY FURTHER. I refuse to be nickel and dimedSo I dont normally write reviews... but this is a special case I feel.I got this game when it first came out for ps3 then again for pc for mods like LSPDFR andadding cars etc. had a good bit of fun with friends on both versions. Then why do i not reccommend it? well... the first Issues I had were when they added microtransactions to the online. well doesnt sound too bad at first.... but look at the prices of them! at time of writing $8 000 000 in game is currently $99. so basically if you just want to buy that floating fortress yacht in game that automatically shoots people approaching it basically closing off portions of the map to any players you dont like that particular day. gameplay issues aside its not cheap (keep in mind... you can upgrade this yacht by painting it other colors and choose between 3 hull styles naming it putting a flag on it... all of which costs more money. the 8 mil is just the base cost). ok lets look at some other examples. they added heists (which took forever for them to impliment) in where you would pay a setup fee and then with 2 4 players (cant solo these) attempt to complete a set of setup missions and then attempt to pull off the heist itself. thehost of these missions does NOT get paid durring the setup missions. ONLY after completing the actual heist. meaning theres already less incentive to do heists. why spend the3 or so hours trying to do 1 heist and make a few hundred k for themain event as host when you can join some random guys setup and get 200k for every setup mission. which there are usually 2 or 4 of. so in short it isnt cost/time effective. the next issue. is the ONLY expansions to the game have been to the online. by itself again doesnt sound like a big deal.... but not everyone likes playing with people who are just going to be jerks and try to kill you constantly for no reason. "well what about passive mode?" behold my next issue... while a good concept it stops players from attacking you yes. however... italso stops you from drawing a weapon at all. which first thought is why do you want to draw a weapong if you cant attack players? AI. the police in this game are brutal. they will hunt you down across the map for just standing near a cop too long. you cant defend yourself from ANY attacks. its stupidly easy to gain wanted level. and if you start to get away more just magically spawn in front of you often so close you cant even turn away before they spot you again. the only ways to escape are 1 use the alley ways to hide from them. after breaking line of sight duck into an alley to hide. its pretty obvious the devs made this intentionally the focused way to escape. 2 the other way is to high tail it to the airport and take a plane and start flying high out over the water. helicopters will spawn but can usually get away from those."well the other additions to the game have good ways to make money too!" and you arn't wrong. however. those other ways require a substantial startup cost. multiple millions often times to get going. andtheres a chance you dont succeed so a lot of the invested cash is just gone. short version.... they make doing anything in game less profitable than just throwing obsurd ammounts of money at them. if I recall NerdCubed and a friend of his had a contest... see who could make more money in a set ammount of time. that video more or less expresses my issues with this.another thing I am not a fan of is the vehicle upgrades. I like the idea of upgrades however the only way to unlock those upgrades is by winning races in that type of vehicle. not everyone likes racing so this is just really annoying to the rest of us. I think the worst of it was you have to WIN 107 races to unlock some part.so this game has more than plenty of flaws and issues.and overall it was a decent game especially since you could escape to single player and mod it to be silly and run around with a tornado chasing you or become a police officer and respond to calls doing some roleplay in the game world like being a truck driver firefighter garbage collector.... it was a good change from the usual run around and shoot this shoot that race here... it gave the game variety and gave it more replay value. now Take Two has in its infinite wisdom "made mods illegal" before. it was against TOS to use mods in multiplayer. ok thats fine no problem. a few months later they released in an interview they feel they are UNDER monetising their users.... they feel there are NOT ENOUGH microtransactions in a 60$ game... GTA is in the top 5 best selling games of ALL TIME and they feel they arnt making enough from the users...microtransactions aside.... as I said mods give a fun change of pace. for things as small as graphical tweaks to as big as basicall anything you can imagine. but now thats gone. so if you like grinding for weeks at a time to get enough money to buy 2 OK cars and a motorbike (not even the big fancy yacht) go ahead and buy this. if you want to pay over $130 of your real money for a virtual yacht that takes away freedom of other players to explore the map go have fun.but if you are a player that believes in earning things IN GAME with in game methods I reccomend finding something else. this is a real shame. the game has a good bit of potential to be fun. but when everything is aimed at making you feel so insignificant you have to give them MORE money to afford anything. its no longer a fun experience. and its getting shelved until some practices get changed. modding is the whole reason some games are as successful as they are. gta SA IV III all included. while yes by themselves the games are good. once you play the story once thats usually it. no new surprises or benefit from playing again. mods give reason to keep buying and playing older games. and squeezing every penny from your customers does not make us want to come and play more of your games. recently Take Two put a Cease and Decist for OpenIV. Basically a program that allows you to change game models or install the majority of mods. it has been around since GTA 4 and opened doors to hundereds of hours of fun. now declared illegal. basically the Open IV devs have said it isnt worth the time to fight back even though they could easily win this in court under fair use as similar cases have appeared in the recent past. Take Two have made their position known.... "you can have fun as long as you give us more money. and no other way" is the gist of it. if you dont give in to the scheme you are in for a loooooong grind fest to get anywhere decent. If you are a believer in fair use mods or having fun without microtransactions then stay away from this game and Take Two Interactive. I do not entirely blame R* for this but dont call them innocent either
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Spoiler alert.I've played many of the GTA games (the only GTA game I haven't played yet is LCS). This game is the best one to date.The storyline is very good although Franklin to my seems like the weakest of the three characters in terms of the quality of his backstory and motivations (mainly because his story doesn't seem all that compelling to me). The ability to end the game 3 different ways makes for a difficult decision for some. I was not really a Johnny fan from GTA 4 (spoiler) so seeing his ending seemed like a rather pathelic way to finish him off. Trevor is a Psychopath who claims to be "loyal" and in some ways is but he is also a dangerous Psychopath that has no remorse in hurting evn his closest friends and allies so being given the chance to end his life is tempting. Michael on the other hand "loves" his family but doesn't know how to be a dad nor did he show a lot of guilty over turning against Trevor or taking actions that would hurt his own friends and family members. At the end of the storyline although option A was tempting I picked C because the enermies were a far greater ongoing threat then Trevor was.I have to admit the game is a very fun game to play. One of the key differences between this game and GTA 4 is more options in terms of stuff to do. They have also changed how characters get paid which makes certain key missions in game (heists) the type of missions you really want to do your research on before starting them. In some ways the game encourages you to do out there and explore the map to try and acquire new allies for the heists as well as experience some rather unique and in some cases weird side missions with random characters. One of the little changes that GTA 5 did which I love was bring back properties. Getting killed in other GTA games was discouraged as often times you would either lose a lot of money dying or your weapons and to get them or the money back required some level of grinding and or purchasing of guns in game to replace what was lost. In GTA 5 with the properties the players can buy death really isn't a big deal anymore because you can eventually purchase properties that pay a good stream of income every week without having to do any real work to maintain those properties (although for some properties you may have optional property missions to maintain that weeks dividend). It's nice knowing you can focus on for example trying to do the special jumps or on doing the flying achievements and not be all that concerned if you have an accident knowing that your character will be getting a relatively consistant cheque every week that would more then cover the hospital and gun store bills.Flying in GTA 5 is very simular to the flying system in GTA 4 but they added in trubulance which can make certain manuevers more likely to end in instant death. This adds to the challenge but I find that once I adjusted to it it made the gameplay even more enjoyable. Being able to hunt in game adds another entertainment area although I never really was a fan of it. If you are playing this game on a laptop a mouse is 100% necessary given how important it is for the purposes of shooting and driving.The one area of the game where it could have been better was in friend activities. I just felt like in GTA 4 you have a couple more options in terms of friend activities then in GTA 5 as in 5 the options seem to only really be strip club movies tennis golf drinking and darts which isn't great.Overall I would give this game a 9/10.

On with the review!I won't be going over the main game because you already know how good it is.Grand Theft Auto V the fast paced crime simulator made by the incredible Rockstar Games finally comes to PC in what is considered the definitive edition of the game and for good reason. 60FPS and 4k support changes the game so much along with mouse &amp keyboard support. Directly related is Director Mode which allows you to set conditions and change the environment of the world and make amazing videos filled with action and set music of your choice.Mods make the PC version the best part of the game without question Bored? Spawn a Hydra and go flying around the map as a monkey and make it rain whales and enable carmageddon and have cars explode and fly around like an eagle on bath salts. Even FOV will get you banned. Although this is hated by many it is to prevent cheaters.EDIT #2 Apparently people are throwing a fit because they wanted GTA V to go on sale and it didn't. What happened INSTEAD was Rockstar was nice and offered to give you a shark card san andreas/max payne 3 AND gta v all for 60 dollars.PRETTY GOOD ING DEAL.The sad part is most people aren't complaining about GTA V itself not being on sale no THEY'RE ING ABOUT BEING "FORCED" TO BUY AN EXTRA GAME GTA V AND IN GAME MONEY FOR THE SAME PRICE.People get your together.

review: When asked a lot of people don't like idol anime or anything similar or in other words anime based on music and stuff. I'm one of these people. I don't usually watch idol anime but I wanted to try this out because of the outstanding art that this anime offers.At first I was really hesitant even to the point where I removed it off my PTW list because I would feel embarrassed having watched something like this. Sure this anime might be targeted towards children rather than teens/adults but it doesn't mean that teens/adults wouldn't enjoy this. This anime taught to me that hard work actually does pay off that if you try your hardest you will eventually arrive to your destination point. There are a lot of things I liked about this anime but the thing I liked most was probably the art. Yes I'm a very picky person when it comes to art and this anime reached my expectations when it came to the art. All the characters were nicely designed and all of the 9 girls are cute. In other words the art was what some people call it flawless.The only thing I disliked about this anime was the fact that they were taking too long to prepare for the live shows and stuff like that. The producers should have shown the girls in action more (I don't literally mean in action I meant that they should probably have shown more of their songs).In terms of characters all of them are easily likable none of them are really that bland. There are 3 main characters in this anime Honoka who is seriously hyper and energetic Umi who is very shy and was reluctant to become a school idol at first and Kotori who is a very calm and a little shy. We have these 3 main characters make an school idol group in order to save the school from closing (because they aren't reaching the applicant quota). They name this school idol group 'Muse' (sorry I don't want to look all over the internet just for a greek character). Eventually they reach 9 members by around episode 6 9 forgot. That's basically it for the story since I don't want to spoil a lot.The sound is the second thing I enjoyed a lot in this anime. The opening was just straight up amazing I almost watched it every episode. I don't usually watch endings because they're usually dull and boring but I really loved the ending song this time I ended up watching it every episode. The insert songs were amazing too I ended up downloading that 'Dash' song too (it was that good &gt ).I could probably say that I felt embarrassed inside while watching the first few episodes due to this being my first idol anime but eventually I got used to the feeling and I opened myself up to this anime. All in all I could say that I enjoyed this anime a lot for my first idol anime and I would suggest this to anyone who is looking for an idol anime.

review: at first i was skeptical about buying the game for pc. I mean with the numerous amount of hackers i heard about on gta online (which is the only mode i play) i thought that spending the 60$ was not gonna be worth it. Then came the fateful day when the game FINALLY came out on sale in the winter for 36$. Figuring it wasn't gonna go lower than that for a while I decided to finally see if gta pc had improved at all and got rid of the hackers. i am happy to say that there are no hackers AT ALL on the online mode or at least in my case. there are some people that aren't exactly the nicest of people (people that spam kill you repeatedly and don't stop) but there were others that were welcoming. some even invited me to rob a store with them and some then specifically invited me to heists which are SO MUCH FUN. i transferred my account from my xbox 360 to my pc with very high hopes and i am glad to say that gta 5 for pc exceeded my expectations. buy it now if you love violence or at least get it when it goes on sale (if ever again)

review: It is unfortunate that a game such as this with a large and unique multiplayer has such issues. Rockstar really needed someone with experience to manage it but instead they tried to take on the beast known as GTAO alone. It has pushed many away especially with unfair punishments to those that have done nothing after devoting many weeks in the game both on console and PC. Some of those on PC bought the game to mod the single player and have more fun others went to single player after getting tired of the toxic online. Now the single player is pointless after you have beaten it and you can't have fun on your own with mods. Unless you want to deal with a solid single player experience and then deal with a toxic grindy microtransaction riddled hellspawn of an MMO I would not recommend getting this game. Legit players get punished for people giving them money or because they are flagged by an automated system. Rockstar rarely helps out in these situations going so far as to close support tickets without a response.

review: Let me first start of with that this game run's shockingly terrible after trying to find a solution to about an hour all the supposed "Solution's" do not help what so ever. I also then have found out the multiple other issues that this game has such as frequent crashes servers keep lagging out the amount of hackers that completely ruin the experience by spawning in money right in front of you or simply flying around with god mode and killing everyone is really beyond me how this game has not yet been fixed after months of the game coming out. Another issue i have with this game (Which links to the performance issue i suppose) is the constant stutter.. Within singleplayer the stutter is minimal and doesn't affect that much my fps usually goes from 60 to 40 HOWEVER the second i join multiplayer i am unable to drive shoot or anything as the game will stutter every couple of seconds that causes my fps to go from 60 to about 5 10. Apparently also a lot of people have had this issue since the new patch came out with the new content that came out about a week ago. This was a complete waste of money as i am unable to play without having my experience ruined by either hackers "amazing" performance or the frequent crashes that prevent me from progressing in the game.

review: Story mode 10/10Online 5/10 unless you're willing to pay for modded money and unlocks then it's 9/10.Story mode is perfectly crafted and plays like a movie rather than a traditional linear story you'd expect from most games. The characters are good and the setting (as someone who grew up in LA) is surreal. One of the most enjoyable and memorable playthroughs and worth 100% completion.Online is... well it has a lot of potentional but it falls short due to Rockstar's lack of attention when it comes to hackers. You basically have to hack your account to get money but Rockstar won't ban you for that. Just don't do mod menus or around with other players too much and you'll go undetected. Literally you can have someone add one billion dollars to your account and Rockstar won't do anything about it. It's sad but hey... They asked for it by doing the stupid shark cards and making a whack economy to begin with.

review: The single player is great and everything I expected after the previous gta's and even more. It is worth buying just because of that. Prepare for nice views funny ads great characters and good story. Online however is broken in so many ways I cannot describe it. Trying to play with friends is frustrating for the whole group. It really seems like a half finished job that has just been put there. Prepare for random disconnects LOADING SCREENS waiting more waiting many confusion jobs that don't pay not being able to join random jobs with your buddies as a group not being able to join jobs with your buddies because you're two or three instead of four hackers finishing jobs and ending up in different sessions than the ones you were in with your friends which leads to LOADING SCREENS racing with a friend in private session and suddenly the game makes lots random people join unskippable dialogues people leaving missions which boots everybody back to random places in the city forcing you to drive back to the mission and start inviting players from scratch as if you didn't already see enough loading screens npcs that pester you with phone calls until you answer only to give you a mission which you cannot refuse. It's just a mess. We've had more fun and less trouble playing early access titles in multi player. Get it for single player.Example in one entire afternoon I was unable to complete the very fist online mission of Lamar because somebody would always quit for various reasons forcing me to spawn at the airport (after a loading screen) drive back to Lamar's place loading screen re invite players wait for players loading screen. Mission. Something goes wrong somebody quits. Rinse repeat. I've spent more time inviting and in loading screens than playing.

review: I would recommend this game to others who would enjoy this style of gaming. While I know others have complained about being blown up or being bothered by other players this comes with the environment you are in. Of course someone is going to want to rob you or do you harm. I'd say really learn the map and fix up your car to maneuver through alleys and other small areas. I've come to the conclusion that if you are good with being a GTA driver then you will have fun escaping other players when they try chasing you. Be on the lookout and always know that someone is watching you. All I can say is I am always two steps ahead of the curve when traveling in the city. Just be smart online and you will do well in this game. Most importantly have fun even if you are getting your handed to you. Know that you will come out ahead as you level up and gain more guns and cars. I love this game! Stay frosty peeps!

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Been a fan of the Grand Theft Auto series for a long time so buying this was something I was to do no matter what the game was like.Between PS3 PS4 and PC I have played this game for way over 1000 hours.This game has everything you would expect from a Grand Theft Auto game and everything you could want from a free roam city sandbox. This game allows you to drive a ridiculous amount of vehicles (air land and sea) and of course blow stuff up with a multitude of weapons of which the list is ever increasing with regular updates adding new weapons clothing and vehicles (which is incredible seeing as the game has been out for over 3 years).I have spent an embarrassing amount of time just aimlessly driving around the map just because I can and after all this time I still always manage to find something new which goes to show just how in depth this game is.There have been some iffy things around this game in terms of features of the game itself as well as decisions that the devs/publishers have made such as Having NO FOV slider the only way to change it properly is downloading an FOV modNot having singleplayer DLC (which was promised in 2014 seems like the publishers/devs realised that online updates were more profitable and being easier to make which is a shame as GTA IV's DLC packs were great).Lots of modders/cheaters online although this is much less of an issue in recent months there have been periods in which you couldn't go online without an annoying cheater trying to ruin everyone's fun.Lack of singleplayer love from online updates In many of the updates that added new vehicles/clothes/weapons to GTA Online Rockstar have chosen to not only prevent them from being purchased or found in singleplayer but in some cases actively preventing the vehicles/weapons etc from being spawned in singleplayer (assumed to be to boost shark card sales in GTA Online).It is sad to say the devs/publishers have been a lot more focused on GTA Online and not much on single player at all but game is still incredibly fun to play both solo and with friends. Updates are still being created/added which is quite rare for a game like this especially being almost 5 years after its initial release now.Take Two and/or Rockstar have made attempts to kill the modding scene of GTA V which is a shame they went back on their word to push shark cards on users which has turned GTA Online into a pay to win grind fest rather than creating promised Single Player DLC. I'm really not expecting anything different for future Rockstar games such as Red Dead Redemption 2 and the Inevitable Grand Theft Auto VI which is disappointing to admit after being so hyped for this game originally even though I enjoyed the game watching one of my favourite game studios turn quite sour towards their playerbase wasn't fun.Although this game had quite a few issues it was a massive improvement for GTA on PC from GTA IV which was a wreck in terms of optimisation. I am unsure as to whether I will purchase GTA VI/6 on its release even though this game has given me hundreds of hours of fun between its release on PS3 PS4 and then PC due to Rockstar's drastic change in direction for the series.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a great game!The story is amazing and even though many missions use the same mechanics they are all unique and fun.There is a skip button to skip part of a mission if you get stuck on it.It looks amazing for how old it is and most modern hardware can run it.$60 seems to much to pay but on sale it goes for $20 $30I highly suggest buying it as it is still heavily supported by the developers and there will not be a sequel in the near future!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Yes we really bought this. We built a cloud chamber for a 6th or 7th grade school science fair and were looking for things to test. I wanted to find some uranium glass but that was harder to find expensive and the delivery times were all too late. We also opened up a smoke detector to find the americium (we didn't break it out of its casing). Sure enough we were able to see the tracks in the cloud chamber which was pretty cool. We did NOT bring the ore to school!!! but we did bring the little tin. If you're looking for an impressive and cool but really easy science fair project go with a cloud chamber. They are easy to build and they work. If this freaks you out find some uranium glass (also called vaseline glass). If you do the project right and make the kid do some serious research it is also a great learning experience. As for safety concerns the ore comes in the tin and in a tiny zipper bag inside that. We never opened the zipper bag since it is the dust you might breathe in that is probably the biggest issue.

review: When the game was released on PS3 I loved it. Not wanting to by another console I opted to build a PC. First Steam purcahse was GTAV. Best decision I ever made. That is until the last few months. The game is now overrun by "hackers." I usually wouldn't care about this but it has turned the gaming experience into one of two options. 1. You play in the open world games for 3 minutes before having something go up because of some garbage "hacker" or you try and play one of the numerous gametypes only to find out that no one is online and you just wait in a lobby for 5 minutes before quitting out and playing something else because the people that actually enjoy playing GTA without cheating are no more. I love this game. But without some type of policing of hackers by Rockstar I feel that this game is on its way out. And no amount of double XP/RP Weekends or new Adversary game modes are going to save it.On a brighter note the campaign mode is one of the most entertaining campaigns ever created. The story is captivating and immersive. The gameplay and controls are smooth and intuitive. Also the game still feels like a GTA game while still evolving the genre of openworld gaming. In summation if you have never played GTAV and want a great game to play wait for a sale and snatch this up. The campaign alone is worth the puchase. If Rockstar gets the modder/hacker t under control then the online aspect might return to its original glory. However if you are looking for an game with great online gameplay you have missed your window with this game. Which is actually pretty sad to me.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: it is a good game but a little over rated. I see it always at the top of the stat page and the multiplayer isn't all that great in my eyes. I thought the story was the best part. I still agree it is a good game but I wouldn't say it is the best game. I found it to become boring after a time. I give it a 8 out of 10. It would of been better if it had more character development. More mods for cars and weapons and a broader selection of mission types. I wouldn't have paid 60$ for it if I had known I was gonna put however many hours I have in it and never look back. Last note is I would agree it is the best gta out to date but I guess i am not a gta hardcore fan anyways. If you love gta I would totally recommend this game. If you feel meh about gta get it on sale. Don't take this review like I am knocking the game. I just feel they could of put more time into gameplay and replay value.

review: The cable car ride was stunning. I stand on the summit and look at the amazing scenery unfolded below me. I see my hometown far in the distance. The sun is setting and the lights of the city stand out against the darkening sky.I get on my dirtbike and find a trail and can almost feel the wind in my hair as I traverse the narrow mountain trail. A coyote darts out in the path ahead of me in the twilight and I almost hit him which would send my bike end over end into a ravine. My heart jumps and I feel the adreniline rush as I navigate the narrow trail in the fading light. I am almost at the bottom and my bike hits a stone and I flip over and land head over heels and end up in a ditch. Ouch That's gonna leave a mark..... I get up brush myself off and call a taxi to come pick me up as my bike is a twisted pile of steel and rubber.What a rush. What a beautiful place.....So why am I such an A hole.I have never felt so divided by a game in my entire life. Let me make one thing clear. I am not some self righteous prude that things video games are evil and need to be banned. I remember the first time I clobbered a waste barrel in doom and took great delight in watching the imp disintigrate into a pile of gore at my feet.But GTA V is sometimes so hard to love. This is because your main "characters" are people with little if no redeeming features whatsoever. Now I get it GTA has never been about being a "good guy". But usually even "bad guy's" have some redeeming features. The closest thing to a "hero" in this game is retired gangster Michael that is in a dead end marriage with D bag kids (ones a stoner millenial and the other is....well not a virgin by a longshot) and a nice comfy house in Rockford Hills that he seemed to only get because he screwed over his buddys a decade ago.The satire of the game is laugh out loud sometimes and I get where Rockstar is going. Missions like where you end up fighting aliens in a self imposed "bad acid trip" or high tailing it around town after you've caught "America's Sweetheart" in a rather compromising situation with a fellow teen star are riotous and hilarious. But then you get a mission like "By The Book" and .... If I ever have to do that mission again in my lifetime it will be too soon. I warned my friend about that mission and he said... What did you do knock off a pet store? "I wish I had....I wish I had...."I love the game I love the environment and I love the beauty of the world around me. I'm just not a fan of who I am in it....And perhaps that's the point they're trying to make.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
