review: Since most people know what GTA 5 is all about (unless you were living in a cave) ill skip to the basics of a review and keep it simple...Good Things... Best Map yet with 2 diverse sides and detailed underwater landscape Great combat with pinpoint shooting and a cover system Fun sandbox gameplay for both single and multiplayer Tons of customization from cars guns clothes hairstyles and even your own multiplayer character Decent story in singleplayer A few story choices to allow for another playthrough Buyable properties and player housing Tons of side activities like tennis racing or other shinanigans Tons of vehicles guns and clothes Intresting characters with a very human feel with tons of personality Great social/political commentary Gives the finger to political corectness Very well optimized all around Free updates and DLC Fluid animations and beautiful scenery Singleplayer and multiplayer character progression both with statistics and moneyBad Things... TONS of hackers cheaters modders exploiters and garbage community members who will have fun at your expense MMO level DRM with required internet connection for both single and multiplayer Loading screens take forever when loging on (likely due to DRM) Shark Cards microtransaction items that allow you to buy ingame money with real money Shark Card promoting multiplayer economy with jacked up prices on items Limit of 2 characters for multiplayer per account Limit of 4 properties per multiplayer character Private multiplayer sessions have to be accessed through singleplayer No wildlife to hunt in multiplayer (cant feed friend to sharks) Server reliant multiplayer character saves No LAN playOverall...Despite the negative things I have pointed out the game can be quite enjoyable and even "perfect" if it could just get rid of those flaws. Many of those flaws hopefully wont be an issue for most people as many of them are just small issues rather then anything serious. The game as is is a game I would recomend to just about anyone from my grandmother to the most hardcore video game addict. If its your first time playing a GTA it will be a perfect place to start in the series. If your a veteran player expect the best GTA made yet. If you never played and are not really intrested you should play it anyway... Its just that good. It will suprise just about anyone in one way or another...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I must stress that the downrating is purely about the state of GTA Online. GTA V is a fantastic game but this critique is purely about GTA Online.Rockstar has a history of making exceptional games. But GTA Online is the first exceptionally bad game that they have released. The online mode is completely broken. There is a huge disparity amongst the player base between the payers and players. You can grind for days on end to try and achieve something like a new car or plane. But grinding is the opposite of fun. Or you can buy shark cards which are micro transactions although it's hard to see them as "micro" when some of them cost more than the game itself. Grinding to get money in GTA Online may as well be a second full time job it's boring and monotonous like a real job. Rockstar has gotten away with destroying one of my favourite franchises by diluting the experience and charging obscene amounts of real world money for in game items.GTA used to be fun escapism where you could indulge in your baser instincts. But now you still can do that but only after wasting hundreds of hours of your life or paying disgusting amounts of real world money. I'm honestly depressed by what GTA has become it's very similar to what EA has done to Star Wars. GTA IV got expansions in the form of "The Lost &amp Damned" and "The Ballad Of Gay Tony" Two of the best examples of expansion packs I can think of. GTA V got Shark Cards.This current plague of Micro transactions is killing my interest in my favourite hobby that is video gaming .
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Dear Rockstar I'm afraid after being a long time GTA customer (Since GTA 1!) purchasing GTA V THREE times and spending a large amount of money on in game money I'm forced into position where I have to complain.As noted above I have spend a lot of money on not only the GTA franchise but also Rockstar games in general and feel now cheated out of my cash and loyalty. I decided to purchase GTA V a third time to reap the benefits of my powerful PC as I no longer have my Xbox One and to continue my profile that I transferred originally from my Xbox 360. I feel I am disappointingly being penalized for investing a lot of money and time money into your franchise by you putting a "limit" on when people can transfer their profiles to PC.I'm afraid that I cannot see any sense or logic at all in such a well established company with an extraordinary loyal client base applying a "cut off point" for profile transfers. Given the many poor reviews of your game it is easy to see that loyal customers are feeling poorly treated me for one.I have every confidence that such a good successful company as yourselves would realise what you need to do to make your loyal customers happy and turn around all these negative reviews. Notably myself if/when you make the decision to make this ethically right you would restore my faith in you as developers and this franchise.I look forward to your response and being able to turn my review from negative to positive.Regards Antoine

review: The recent move by Take Two with their cease and desist against the creators of OpenIV is unwarranted. The program is never used as a way to cheat in GTA Online it was always intended to be a tool for single player mod developers to add interesting new ways to play the game and is very likely the reason why Rockstar and Take Two still get so many sales of the PC version even after 2 years. They have killed a lot of the replayability with the cease and desist and likely have killed a majority of future PC version sales.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Whenever I have no idea what I want to play I just start up GTA Online and I'm happy. You can do so much in this game and if you get lucky and load up into a full session with 20 other people it feels so much more social than any MMO I've played lately. I highly recommend this for everyone even if violence isn't your thing. So many mini games great soundtrack fun physics hilarious banter to be overhead while driving and walking past pedestrians. My sister doesn't like video games really but she loves to just drive around the map and sometimes when I get off work I love to do the same. This game is probably the closest thing to a life sim that is out right now. Especially when you switch to 1st person. I don't want to write a whole essay here but maybe the biggest selling point of this game for me is that Rockstar is STILL releasing DLC for this game and it's always 100% free. It's a little ridiculous how much they want us to like them but it has worked and I will certainly be in line for the next pc GTA title.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Whether or not I recommend this game not cut and dry. I've spent about 50 hours on the main story and I can confirm that it is an absolute masterpeice with a sprawling living map believable characters and an awesome plot. However with 180 hours of online playtime I must admit the online mode has grown stale is incredibly pay to win and reeks of griefing and requires massive amounts of grinding. Single player wise I would 100% recommend this game but the multiplayer experience overshadows the whole game so much that I have to give it negative feedback.

review: 1/10 for GTA Online (if you re playing solo only)3/10 for GTA Online (if you have real life friends who re also playing).#1 THE GAME Back in 2013 it was 9/10 to me. You actually had fun. Now? All you ll ever have is working your off for money. People don t have fun no more like they did in the old day. The game is extremely enjoyable but only if you have time to enjoy it like you do in offline mode.#2 THE COMMUNITYTrust me 60% of the people are actually good here. HOWEVER YOU WILL ONLY MEET THE REST 40% OF TOXIC. (Well they may say it s just a game they re having fun but you will be anoying as hell) You will shortly turn into the kind of person you despite. You will be a racist. You will be a sexist. You will develop an anti social personality. THEN you figure it out 50% of good people in the 60% group have load of money yet have nothing to do no more thing to spend on. That leads to the sight of your future.#3 THE FUTUREYou yourself and your friends (if you got any) will turn into selfish jerks who only care about themselves. Like I previously said GRINDING. The fun is the past.#4 THE DEV More and more they put in ridiculous stuffs just to make more ******* of humanity appear and make you regret buying (then buying more) sharkcards. All they care about is your money. This game is older than my ex boyfriend yet it s still plagued with its first day bug. Solving methods ain t working in many cases and they will keep suggesting you do what they tell you to do again and again.Support? Supporters are mostly machines who can t even read English! What s next? SLOWER THAN SNAIL REPLY! I once waited 3 hours for a maximum 2 hour waiting livechat as it's the only way to meet an actual human being. What if I don t need live chat? you may ask You do you surely do when you realize the ONLY thing they help you quickly is SHUTTING DOWN YOUR REFUND REQUEST OF ANY KIND IN 5 MINUTES IN COLD BLOOD WITHOUT EXPLAINING ANYTHING..Actually I should have writen more to help you understand how non sense and ridiculous. GTA Online Veterans say all of them in their videos on Youtube go find out. We should try talking to the dev to change thing? Well like I previously said this game is old and if people re still saying there re still negative things here in the game then your opinions don t mean anything to them. And don t even tell me your money matter It's like how people make lemonade they throw away the lemon after they re done! It doesn t matter if you can stand all that bullcrap Later you will realize you should be better off pirating it. Don t feel bad about this as they made at least 3 times more money from sharkcards bought by people already!.9/10 for GTA VThis game in its offline mode is GOLD! You can do anything you want and experiencing new thing every time! The only 1 point I took away is that you can t have fun with your friends in offline mode.

review: After playing for over 400 hours I was banned without any reason. I've never cheated in this game or accepted/asked for modded money. I have spent many hours doing resupplies heists hangar cargo missions and vehicle warehouse missions. After I was banned an agent told me "The total earned on your old character was GTA $31 873 938 and total spent was GTA $29 602 227." This was from a conversation on the 18th of Match 2018. It was one of many conversations I had with customer service from Rockstar that ended in being told a ban is unappealable. Here is my experience.When the ban first arrived it came with a message that it was unappealable and that I would lose all character progress. I instantly tried to remedy the situation as I know I have not modded or broken any of Rockstars terms and conditions. This was a false ban. Rockstar informed me as I thought they would that there was nothing they can do. However over the course of the next few days Rockstar filled me with false hope that the ban could be lifted and that that the matter was being looked into by their supervisor. This is one exchange that I had with a customer service representative named Mandi Agent I understand that this is taking a longer time. The reason why it is taking a longer time is because usually bans on the account cannot be appealed and we need to be double sure if everything is accurate from the account and for this it might take sometime. I appreciate your understanding in this issue. Even though this is the case you can be rest assured that your case is being looked into and we will get back to you once we have more information on this.User 3/18/18 6 38 41 AM That is good to hear. Does that mean there is the potential for this issue to be fixedAgent 3/18/18 6 41 00 AM Usually the bans on the account are not lifted however this has been looked into by our supervisor. I will not be able to give comments about the result of this investigation rest assured we will get back to you at the earliest.Another agent told me that my claim was being expidited and that Rockstar would get back to me soon. None of this occurred. Instead I was let down never told what my infraction was and ultimately informed that I would not be allowed to play until the ban was lifted and that my character was gone. There was nothing I can do. Rockstar took roughly 32 million dollars away from me with this false ban. That's how much I had earned during this process. To put that into a dollar figure that's over 400 Canadian dollars in Shark Cards ($305.87 US). That is a large amount for a company to repeal from an account without reason or appeal. For those who want to play this game for the story I saw do it. For those who venture into the online mode Beware. You too could be banned without reason. You play without mods and without cheating (to your knowledge) and still be banned. You can be friendly to other players and not use exploitsd and still be banned. Rockstar will not help you. They will give you automated "no appeals" messages. Don't buy this game for the online as you are rolling the twice each time you play on whether you get banned or not.It was a fun game to play to play (look at my hours) but the damage suffered from the false ban made the time I spent playing a painful memory and a wasted experience.Please pass the word on as everyone should know this before buying a rockstar game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Story is average and can't reach even half of qualities of GTA SA.I uninstalled few days ago and i've heard they already nerfed i/e bunker and all these goods ? It was my main way to make money.. I'm so glad i removed this crap. I've had no friends playing this game so i had to play in cheater fest public lobby which is terrible. I saw russian garbage (crew RUSS) level 5000 8000 players every single lobby i joined in they were spawning fire water and cages under feet of every player in session and yet no one even kicks them off. I made a lot of money legal way and i bought almost everything this game has to offer there's really lot of content and i liked but so needlessly expansive... there's really a lot of grinding required to make money for everything.. but why bother making money true way when cheaters just smash one button and they have thousand times more money than i've ever made for 300 hours of gameplay.. and even when you report them on rockstar support they always send you automatically generated robot message that there is no further action needed from me (i even tried testing by asking support for something else and got same robot answer lol)..and then i come into game and the player i've just reported and got answer from support is still happily cheating around. So no money legit players and yet still let cheaters cheat around ? Good step rockstar..you just ensured that more legit players are going to cheat as no one is going to pay real money for something you can just cheat for no punishment whatsoever.

Lastly the CHEATING and exploitation in the game world is TERRIBLE.

review: Singleplayer better map and story than GTA IV although with much inferior physics destruction and vehicle handling. Still a fun experience but the gameplay is just not as satisfying as it could've been had they just copied it from the previous game. Keep in mind before you purchase this game that the singleplayer mode has been abandoned (content wise) all the new stuff is exclusive to Online.Online aka loading screen simulator relies on peer to peer connections that make the whole experience worse for everyone with the only advantage of costing less to Rock$tar. There's an absolutely massive grind to it if you want to purchase and have fun with any of the cool stuff which is similar to working in the lowest paying and most boring jobs in real life (players waste several hours/days to make a million and everything costs several millions). So this obviously favors micro transactons (aswell as money hack/glitches) it's a triple A game with a triple A price tag but Rockstar's greedy asses still managed to turn it into pay to win.There's also a huge lack of rather obvious and simple quality of life improvements to the game which would require me a few more thousand characters to address although the most urgent one is that we need to be able to kick players who are joining a lobby. The amount of times people glitch and stay in joining status for eternity effectively killing the lobby (since you can't start until they join) is too damn high.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I got gifted this well over a year ago now and I think it's more interesting to write my review well after the fact given the amount of unusual time I've played (and have yet to play) BACKGROUND 1) I started the campaign post forced Prologue and managed about 3 or 4 missions in about 12 months ago but gave up When I wiped my computer I lost whatever little progress I'd made. It didn't wow me then but characters and writing were on point with previous GTA shenanigans. However 2) The hours I've spent in this game reflect an online experience like no other I've yet to those are vanilla hours too spread across late nights and early morning binges with mates and way too many cups of coffee. It's not a standard MMO by any means but a mishmash of peer to peer "servers" where sandboxed chaos ensues. It's the only reason I play this game really the interconnectivity with other crazy people the amount we are forced to work together (and how bad heists begin with bad crews) when all we want are each other's wallets. Understandably a solo online experience is has been would be much much less interesting. So what I'll be reviewing is mostly to do with GTA online OVERALL ONLINE EXPERIENCE + Rockstar's been a little lazy and made the whole community peer to peer one computer connected to another connected to another in a shared environment It's like LAN in your native country if people still LAN so connectivity's great depending on how close you and your friends are. Reaction time between shooting and killing an enemy is crisp and while this might sound like a con as a pro heisting with your friends is what online's really all about so if a game can't do it in my backyard well problems are gonna ensue. If you're connecting overseas yes peer to peer also a massive amount of nausea/rage enducing lag is sure to follow unless your internet's fiber optic. I can confortably complain that peer to peer's an issue because in my country we use copper phone lines for landline calls for our internet. If you're fiber optic net dedicated you're fine. If you're a fiber optic user trying to connect to me it's like funnelling an elephant's worth of data into a peanut just isn't going to fit. If a BIG if Rockstar managed to make national servers this would alleviate the peer to peer problems altogether.+/ Give or take the last six to eight months the online community's been replete with a variety of benevolent and Dickensian hackers droppin' money immortality bombs giant propellers airliners UFOs you name it. Some steal your money allegedly others give (and what is given is prone to being taken away by Rockstar). Bans are likely so affiliating with hackers not usually by choice (just being in a "server" with one feels like a liability) is a bit of a mixed bag. Pro/Con sometimes the shenanigans are more hilarious when you're trippin' on a bong and a teleport mod ejects you midair from your apartment couch.USER SPECIFIC EXPERIENCE + Showcasing material with a character YOU'VE MADE by picking the parents of your avatar individualises the whole experience on a whole 'nother level. Where the campaign has you follow a preset character in an open world following a preset story online has you make your own character (who cannot unfortunately speak) make their own story buy their own house their own car jet yacht their own clothes their own expression of themselves (limited as in game presets selected by the user).+ Because things are peer to peer you can import a playlist of your own music (simply find some MP3s and bung 'em in the Rockstar &gt GTAV &gt User Music) to listen to on 'Self Radio'. It's great every now and again to hear the Yavin IV Trench run theme come on when I'm heisting in the middle of traffic bullets are flying teammates are screamin' down my dongle "LOOSEN UP!". The other radio stations aren't too shabby either. Everyone's avatar's about the same age about the same height about the same build very white if male very masculine if female limited variety of clothes but updates tend to filter in new types of things. Nobody in their right minds however would wear blocky glasses like GTAV's in real life however. /+ At times game can feel a little grindy. The bigger stuff like the yacht the gold plated jet (well sheet) these cost millions. That means heisting multiple times at best maybe doing a complete heist (BIG CACHINGAS) and its five or six setup jobs (POCKET MONEY) over and over again. And if you want that yacht chrome plated there goes another million you forgot to factor into the original save up budget. That doesn't include bullets armor bugger up retries hookahs and blow. As my crew has heard me say repeatedly GTAV is the only game where I feel poor with a million bucks in my pocket VERDICT Like all games I tend to buy them a little while after their release they're cheaper they're patched they've usually got a bit more content. So far Rockstar hasn't introduced any pay to play featurettes added content has been on top of purchased content of course if you can't be bothered grinding for that chrome yacht you can buy in game currency for real life Matrix dollars (and why you want to steer clear of hacked cache Rockstar's makin' bank off of these and you hacking your way to being a billionaire hampers those efforts).The campaign which I hear is pretty lengthy I feel is on top of the Online (four main heist missions 4x6 setup missions voice acted and cheekily written). It's like games used to be feeling either like you've got more or what you've paid for.10/10 Would make it rain for Candy again.

review: Note I only have played the single player. I intend to try GTA Online in the future but there are just so many games to play!Absolutely fantastic game. Ran incredibly well on my PC and looked stunning all the time (check my screenshots on my profile!). Scenery was super vibrant and breathtaking especially on top of mountains or in the city (welcome to Los Santos!). The game has urban rural and even forest settings the game world is ridiculously large (you can drive around for hours). I loved all the characters and the settings they were in (though Franklin was my fave). The story is too cool with tons of crazy situations beautiful locations and insane characters. The humour and writing is top notch I was laughing many times while playing GTA5. As always Rockstar parodies California culture perfectly. Even the side missions are fun I spent the time to complete them all just to hear the awesome dialogue.There are so many different vehicles clothing options and guns in this game. I had fun just driving around and interacting with the world. I also spent a good bit of time customizing my cars there is just so much to do. Minigames jobs sports heists... I played the single player alone for over 50 hours. I got it at launch and still feel it was totally worth it. Fantastic work Rockstar. I wish they made single player DLC I would buy it in a heartbeat.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This Game is a weird one This game can be fun but boring/annoying at times The story mode to this is really good I really recommend playing the story if you haven't.But the online is the weird part there are times it can be fun like driving crazy rocket powered vehicles that aren't accesible in story mode but there are other times where you get caged by a modder lose your money by a modder and your cars get destroyed by modders thats when this game gets really annoying. But The most frustrating thing about online is you can get banned for doing nothing and lose all your money vehicles and properties rank for something you didn't do.In my opinion this game is really on and off times you can have fun other times you can't really have fun.9/10 Story Mode4/10 Online

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: ing excellent story with great writing and charismatic characters who are extremely well acted and all work together in different and interesting ways. The singleplayer is probably the best GTA storyline ever (IMO). Others will say games like San Andreas or Vice City were better and i see where they are coming from (they are also some of my favorites) but the mocap voice acting facial animations and graphics make it so much more immersive and also the fact you can change between three characters means if there is a character you don't like (I don't know how you could though) you aren't forced to play a character you don't like the whole game.This is already a glowing review and i haven't even spoken about the gameplay which is of the same quality as the rest of the game the shooting is fast paced and exciting with a multitude of weapons at your disposal from a homing missile launcher all the way down to a broken bottle and everything in between. There are hundreds of different types of cars with even more ways to customise them. These can also can also be enhanced by the characters special ablity which continue to make them all very different and special.Yes I am still going on about this game because i haven't talked bout modding and I know not everyone uses mods but in this game it came make an already fun action movie sandbox even more fun and ridiculous (In a good way D). From simple trainers which give you the ability change the world to your liking from the weather to the time to you character model to vehicles name it and with a trainer you can probably do it. Or if you want something a little different you can get a mod that lets you be a police officer or a mod that spawns zombies or aliens or both if that's your kind of thing.I already know how long this review is and I'm gonna stop soon but I have to mention the multiplayer which isn't everyone's cup of tea i personally like it and the rush of getting a big score but if that's not your thing then the game is still worth the price tag. It's a wonderfully written and engaging story that is set in a large and fun map to play around in with a vast sea of mods to play with.TLDR Fantastic singleplayer multiplayer is pretty good IMO.

review: I deleted my review that I left when they banned modding in any way when they were too lazy to figure out the cheating/modding situation. Everyone downvoted then and so did I. But that there was just a fight we all had to fight to prove a point. What point though? The imbeciles fooled us all. None of the negative reviews really made any kind of impact. The sales are still hapenning up to this day even though the most ideal situation for this game would be to be dead. What really happenned is Rockstar stole intellectual property by making a fuss as if THEY were attacked in some way. They banned modding literally hours after the guy who ported GTAIV to the GTAV engine released a teaser trailer. And when we 'fought back' we couldn't save the most important target of this whole ban. That exact guy who did the job of porting the best GTA to the worst. And now Rockstar will wait until Red Dead 2 dies in order to boost their sales with a VERY shoddily ported GTAIV as we can see in all content Rockstar has added to GTA V post lowrider update. They can't tell muscle cars apart they add vehicles to the game months before they actually release them to the public and even then it takes them a week to figure out those vehicles were never able to turn left they add the 'fastest' vehicle out there and rule it out as a glitch and 'fix' it only after EVERYONE already bought it and anything post Lowrider update except the clothing will at NO POINT cost less than a million. It does? Means it has absolutely no use. Release a car that costs 100k? Release a less aesthetically pleasing worse handling car on the same update that costs 900k and stretch the time to the next update for TWO MONTHS pretending that the Supra knockoff is definitely the nightlife update content sure. Not trying to cash in on lack of content at all. Everything after the Biker Update was the Biker Update anyways 'get' more cash and do ten times the work still making the Pac Standard heist theonly viable way to make money ( not spend a full day of grinding for a single car ). If you have not bought GTA V DO NOT FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. Serious. I have flunked uni just to play more of the game that never quit coming up with ways to take ALL of my time. If you have the game and are having fun sorry but you soon won't. Because there will ALWAYS be more updates with 'cars or things you want' that serve no other but cosmetic purpose. It will never end and most likely GTA 6 will never be. There was supposed to be a proper DLC for GTA 5 yet it all got scrapped with the new CEO. And then we got all this useless content that doesn't put the game in any better place just significantly laggier another issue that for me was never prevalent but then ruined the game forever for me. I used to get seamless 40 60 fps in the city and now it just spikes whenever it wants to. Or actually it kinda decides on when to play right it just lags all the time it's just sometimes it's not as severe. So yeah. This is a very bad game. The only upside is that it has more content than any other game. But that's it. It's Assassin's Creed just not involving. Get from A to B start mission get from B to A and kill a dude with various difficulty. Spend money. Earn 10k a mission car costs a milli. Go figure.

review: I bought GTA 5 mostly for the sole purpose of playing online with a few of my friends. After GTA4 I wasn't expecting much fun in the storyline. To be honest I played single player a little bit and it has more of the feel of how San Andreas used to play I would expect this to be fairly fun to play.Regarding online play the modders/cheaters are OUT OF CONTROL. They are always there the same ones and it seems that rockstar just turns a blind eye to them and lets them continue. Last night within my first two minutes ingame a modder teleported to me and just kept melee'ing me following me into my personal garage and continuing to beat me/followme/harrass me. I went back outside was put in a steel cage and randomly shot at as he heckled me for getting "mad". I bought this game to have some good pvp fun and do some fun missions. Unfortunately some modder ALWAYS shows up to mess with your gameplay.If you think being put in a cage so you can't shoot/participate in anything being blown up remotely being sniped repeatedly with impossible shots being teleported to and harrassed and having your client crashed on you by these guys all while hearing a litany of foul/assholish chat come at you then this is the game for you. ROCKSTAR. Get your together and fix the online mode ffs.

Then the waiting game started features got pushed back more shark cards and the like I quit far before hiests become an option.Fast forward to now and it seems like things are far worse then better after friends begged me to get the game one finally gave me the money to just buy it I wasn't gonna buy is a second time about the only thing I find even remotely fun is mesing with the new cars and most of those are so costly that I got bored of the grind to get them the hiests are okay I guess worth running once atleast maybe twice. but this game wasn't worth the 120 bucks that was paid for it to get it two times. review: After playing this game I have a few things to say about it. One the singleplayer mode is very good and has a great story. Here are some pros and cons about Singleplayer and the game itself +Driving Physics and Steering are great and comfortable+Wide variety of guns and combat options+Great voice actor ensemble and radio choices+Many jokes and puns put in the game+Can be played with a controller+Lots of customization+Long Storyline (Minimum about 40 hours)+Very open world+Replayability due to many options in missions Can be a bit glitchy Gets boring offline after the ending Surprisingly low amount of accessable buildings Story can be very predictable Some side missions seem uselessNow for the multiplayer review Rockstar Games is pure garbage. They hate modding they have the worst customer support they funnel in money through BS microtransactions their hacking detection punishes innocent people solely based on the fact that these people make a lot of money and play the game a lot. The hacking detection cannot detect actual hackers making it so that there is a good 50% chance that any given server will have a hacker on it. Honestly Rockstar Games is the least consumer friendly game publisher in the gaming industry.Most people do not buy this game for its singleplayer but if you do it better be on atleast 50% off sale or you are wasting your money.8/10 singleplayer1/10 multiplayer
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "This review will be released on April 14 2020 because I want PC gamers to have the best possible review reading experience. This review needs more polishing and my review DLC is coming for xbox one and ps4 on March 11 2016. Rest assured "the review DLC" will be included for PC during final launch and I promise support for 4K textures in my review fonts while reading at a smooth 60 frames per second. I thank you for your patience."Here are the pros and cons of the game.Pros Single Player Jesus the graphics of this game is fantastic. Great optimisation with PC hardware. I have liked every GTA story so far this is no exception. The map is huge. There are a variety of things you can do here just like anyother GTA.GTA Online Heists are great. I wish they could add more. 5 is not enough. Regular missions are decent. Apart from doing missions you can race deathmatch all those things which are fun. New content continously being added.Cons If you are unlucky you end up in a server with a hacker and all kinds of bad will happen to you. The anti cheat system isnt that strong if it exists in the first place. Every morning I get up run this game click "multiplayer" go to work and by the time I am back from work in the evening multiplayer still wouldnt be loaded. The loading screen is too long almost as long as my p*n*s.Edit Good job rockstar my friend who has absolutely done nothing got banned for no reason along with thousand others.

review: I was recently (along with 100s and possibly 1000s of other GTA users temporarily banned and (the far worse part) had my character reset to zero and ingame hard earned earned money all vanished). Researching online and reading all the other posts about this happening to people the most likely reason seems to be that a recent update by R* made their antimodding system hypersensitive to other Software. So I use discord for the first time ever to play friendly co op GTA with a bunch of great people one evening. The next time I try to log in a few days later I receive a message saying I am banned and my account reset to zero. The fun doesn't stop there though. I write unhappy but civil messages to Rockstar support asking for assistance and every single one is returned with a cut and paste list of things people do that get them banned (NONE of which i've ever done) and am implied message don't do any of these things (which I've never done) again or risk being banned again. 0 out of 10 Rockstar for valuing and respecting your customer base. &lt sarcasm&gt Thanks for the great reward for being a decent player that you just gave me I feel so appreciated. &lt /sarcasm&gt (See my original positive review below.) I really really like GTAV. Yet I'm sure it's also a psychologists nightmare. )WHAT I LOVE # The fun of crazy driving where no real people are actually physically hurt no matter what you do # The action of shoot ups with ever escalating official response options (its like being in an action movie!!) # Escaping miraculously from those massive responses # Doing missions with people where there is at least a basic degree of patience and co operation even when we fail and start again that there's some learning and strategy going on # Making a random new friend on a mission and then going on a rampage gang fight or bunch of missions with them # Motorbike races across country!! )# Train rampages! Hopping on the fladbed car of a train either cos it just rocks up when I'm fighting the cops or just getting on and blowing up some cars and then waiting for the cops to arrive and give chase. Such chaos!! Yeh!WHAT I DON'T LIKE # The waiting screens # The greedy angry impatient scramble for cash some people have (Please! It's a game. It's not real!!!) # Horribly rude impatience with people who make mistakes or get shot on a mission I mean come on if there was no risk of failure what would be the point and because there's a risk of failure people will sometimes fail!!! Whining on about it or being derogatory about their mothers or saying you wish they were dead is just you being an a**hole! Sure on a mission try and keep your together but stop with the a**hole perfectionism!! Maybe Rockstar could make categories of missions (1) Dead Serious (2) Serious But Co operative (3) Newbies and easy going. (Just a thought.)# The fact that you can't block players that are real a**holes so they can't interact with you in freemode. Not a major problem but would be damn useful sometimes. Even to be able to block them for 1hr and then have to renew it would be an awesome addition to the game.WHAT I FIND REALLY BORING # Being repeatedly killed for no reason by someone who is massively more armored and tooled up that I am. Again come on. I'm walking around and someone in an armored car starts repeatedly assassinating me!! It doesn't make me angry or competitive. It's just boring. If it's more evenly matched then at least there's the fun in trying to fight back or get away. I had a great time once where two guys in armored cars were going round assassinating people and I eventually escaped on foot when I got lucky and came across a fast car and they chased me halfway across the map trying to get me and eventually have up. Hah. Hah! Taht was awesome. Usually though I just switch to a new server# Modders who blow everyone up. Again it doesn't make me angry or upset. It's just BORING!!!! Yawn!!WHAT I RECOMMEND# Be in it for the fun# Be patient and co operative.# Give other players a chance if they make mistakes on missions. Sure if someone keeps doing the same dumb thing and getting killed pointlessly that can be a pain but just move on to another mission somewhere else. Sometimes it's just bad luck. The amount of times I've been doing really well and then some bad guy with a shot gun somehow blows my head off... Hell!# If someone pisses you off just move on. Don't waste any time with them.# Anyone is a good player (as in co operative and fun or interesting to be on a mission with) write down their online name then friend them up as soon as moving your attention away from the game isn't going to get you or anyone else killed. Build up a bank of friendsOne last thing about patience. A couple of times the message function has just vanished due to server error and people got really off with me cos I wasn't talking to them. I couldn't it was impossible. Other times lag caused problems. Again it's a GAME. Give people a break. Maybe the server is crapping out!!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What in the F**K happend to this game...So i'm a veteran player from day 1 on ps3 switched to ps4 and recently bought the game the crimminal enterprise starter pack and a few sharkcards on pc (i've given alot of money to Rockstar...) and been grinding my a** off to be able to afford the stupidly overpriced stuff in the game. Had a ton of fun over the years but that went downhill lately. Recently i were notified that i've been banned for 30 days and when the time expires ALL of my progress property ect. will be reset. several months of constant grind straight down the drain. Since i've never wanted to get into trouble for using mods and hacks i've stayed away from them but somehow i still got banned. As this made no sense i tried contacting rockstar to hear what the reasoning for the ban was but was only met with the same automated response that all bans are final and there's nothing to do. I've had a 2 month bad sport period revoked before as rockstar themselves admitted to me that it was a mistake and i did not do anything wrong so obviously this system that they have are NOT flawless and sometimes legit players are caught in this bug or whatever it is and rockstar won't take the time to explain themselves to you. Because you know.. they got their money right? so why would they give a f**k about you. **UPDATE** So i finally got in contact with an actual human being trough the live support chat and he actually said that the anti cheat system in GTA controlls all of the bans and that rockstar themselves actually have no control over this system. So basically they created a machine that just ban people for whatever reason and rockstar can't do aything to stop or revoke it way to go guys. Hackers are roaming every single lobby ruining the experience for everyone trying to make money legit while the legit players are getting punished. The only positive thing about this is that i can finally get over my addiction to this horrible joke of a game. I've never wanted a refund as bad as i want from this game but obviously that's not gonna happen.. All i wanna know is WHY i got banned. Naturally if i got a ticket from a police officer i would like to know why.. You would think that such a big company would at least take the time to take responsibility for their actions and let their fans know what's up but nope. I could go on and on with what's wrong with this game like the items getting more and more expensive and the missions paying less and less. Rockstar has become the shadiest and greediest scumbag company out there and i would reccomend everyone considering buying the game to leave it in the dirt where it belongs.

review: There is almost no point in reviewing this game because it's awesome!Gameplay Mostly improved comparing to GTAIV. Cars bikes and other vehicles for land and water handle really well. Flying helicopters feels playing with a balloon on a windy day. At least using a mouse and keyboard. On foot gameplay also feels a little better than the previous games. Also switching between 3 character more if online and leveling them up is very cool. Makes you connect to them even more. I would be cool to see more of the mini games from GTAIV in here but tennis and golf like the previous mini games work well. They are fun to do and a good reason to add more game hours to your playthrough. Visuals Graphics are insane! Some hair models could be improved upon. The look a bit fuzzy and chunky upclose. The world feels alive and huge! So much to explore.Story Overall good story. Crazy moments with Trevor family drama with Michael and how to get a live outside the hood with Franklin. The three characters interact really well. Every scene with the three of them together puts a smile on your face.

review: Despite a few port problems that myself and some friends were having this version of GTA very much so lives up to the hype. That being said I do have a few gripes with the single player campaign The biggest one is that the money is completely and annoyingly spread out. 1M is quite a bit in GTA but not nearly enough to start snatching up buildings and buying nice cars and past the first heist you'll stick around 1M until the end. This can make the game seem a bit annoying as more often than not you have no incentives (other than story) to continue playing the main storyline. There's very little money to be made until the end and the side quests don't give you much to build on either.Other than that it is a great game and well worth the money especially if you liked previous GTAs but I don't think I'll be replaying it anytime soon.

review: After having played this game between 360 ps4 and now pc for about 2 years I thought it was time to write out a nice littel F*** you to rockstar.I've never had a probelm on the 360 or ps4 when playing this game probably cause its a little harder to hack the consoles than it is a PC. But what I can't wrap my head around is how one guy can force blowup the entire server population(using MODS of course) snipe everyone within the expanded minimap view take no damage with 10 people shooting at him and because he missed a couple shots can report someone for modding and get them banned for a month just cause i ran around the corner at the right time.That's right I got banned from this game because SOMEONE ELSE was modding and got off that I escaped just in time. Steady blowing up people several people all across the map simultaneously. Rockstar/take two says they are cracking down on hackers/modders when really they are punishing the hacked/modded.I'm not even sure I'll play this game anymore when my ban is lifted. If this is how they intend to carry themselves as "one of the most popular gaming companies" of the time I don't want to support these F*** faces anymore. The main problem I have with getting banned when i wasn't modding is that I'm not allowed to tell my side of the story. Our legal system revolves (in theory of course) around innocent until proven guilty. However Rockstar/take two has turned this s*** into a witch hunt where there is no trial no questions. You are burned at the stake for what the actual "witches" (hackers/modders in this case) say. So F*** you rockstar and take two. You'll never recieve another penny from me. And my few dollars may not be enough to significantly hurt your multi however many zero's behind the number wallet it at leasts makes me feel a little better knowing that I stand my ground on this decision.Edited ***4/21/2018***I will admit when I wrote this review I was extremely salty over a t ban caused by being reported by an actual modder. the Truth is this really is a great game. They are constantly pushing out free DLC even after being on the market across several platforms for five years. I still get kicks out of the new stuff. I just wish they would get better at their cheat detection instead of just taking the word of a douchey 12 year old who is actually running mods that got mad me and my partner got a few headshots in on him (he was using the health multiplier modifier)

review: Concerning the online cheaters are becoming more and more rampant in this game. The "good" ones deposit money into your account (which makes me come to the conclusion that Rockstar's shark cards are one of the worst ideas ever conceived if it's so easy to get money from hackers) and the bad ones can kill you randomly stay invincible be character models they shouldn't be take over your controls etc. The online only becomes completely safe if you either play solo or do a private match with friends but even then the backwards way they coded it means that when you go into a game it forces you into a public session before you can even join friends or whatnot. Is the game part fun? Yes. However getting free money when I want to work for it and thereby taking some of the fun out of it when just handed to me and the risk of coming across meaner hackers who will torment your experience is starting to get me turned off from this game.That and the fact that if you try to get a heist setup going people only wait about 10 seconds before they leave which means it can be hard to get one going unless it's a group of four friends.

review: I'll be honest.Their servers are crapThere are hackers everywhereand the only way to avoid a RDM is to go passive even if you don't want to.First person still has a few bugs with it. (Like not seeing your gun in certain vehicles that you would see your gun. The aiming and a few other small things I've noticed.)Players kill each other in the streets for the hell of it. Hackers mess with people for no reason other than "I'm bored."I thought DayZ made it hard to trust other players but damn this game will prove to you that NO ONE not even your friends can be trusted.Higher levels will use their better weapons and vehicles just to pick on lower levelsThe server chat is total crap.etc etc etcBut the game is NOT $80 There are two options you can get the "sale" which is just a shark cash card included or you can just buy the game. The game just recently came out. I'm not surprised they didn't actually put it on sale. Maybe all these kids complaining about it not actually being on sale will be happy to know that it'll most likely go on sale around christmas time.But seriously if you want to enjoy the story go for it.If you feel a little crazy hop on Online and enjoy.But seriously stop complaining about them "ramping up" the price. IT's still $60 but now you get online cash.Online cash I was SUPPOSED to get forever ago when I preordered the game but I didn't.Oh well hasn't stopped me from enjoying it.

review: It's a dominant feeling when owning Grand Theft Auto V simultaneously on two "next gen" platforms. The overload of complaints regarding the online system is fairly comprehendable but that is separated between Rockstar's aesthetic craftsmanship of this game's singleplayer story mode. If you're the kind of person to grant yourself ownership of this game just for multiplayer without cost reconsider. If you wish to advance your heist character and treat it with the best criminality as possible you'd be disappointed by the underwhelmingly wacky environment (given that Rockster doesn't give two $hits about players being banished for no apparent reason). However if you are new to the Grand Theft Auto series and want to join in the campaign portal be my or Rockster's guest. Online hackers and shark card 'problems' aside this is the game that hilariously achieves pride in its M Rating. Metacrits have already praised the game upon its 2013 release with an agreeably satisfying score of over 90. And I'm pretty sure they were talking about story mode. The next gen graphics and visual update for PC finalized pretty satisfactory but its still awesome to roam around streets you know by heart and committing unrealistic* crimes along the way. Dialogues between the characters are written extraordinarly well as well as the game's ability to provide an answer to the question "What if I fire rockets at Micheal's house as Trevor?" I'll give you an advice This game is hella fun therefore play story mode instead.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: One of the best AAA games aroundGTA V is without a doubt one of the best (if not the best) AAA games I've ever played. And here's why.SingleplayerThe game's story is great and the characters are unique and interesting in their own ways. Having played parts of the singleplayer campaign beforehand on PS3 I still got some good laughs from playing it because I sure do love its humor. Although at times I actually doubt that you're suppossed to laugh since the game can go from unserious to serious in the blink of an eye.There are plenty of missions to play as the three different main characters (Trevor Franklin and Michael) and they are surprisingly varied with tasks ranging from towing cars to robbing jewlery stores. When it comes to playtime I've heard that it takes about 10 15 hours to finish the campaign.To keep it short If you've always liked them gangsters you're going to have a good time.MultiplayerI haven't played that much multiplayer yet but I have played the first heist bought myself an apartment and played around in freemode with my friends. From my experience the "hacker problem" seems kind of blown out of proportion since I've been on a bunch of different servers and the few times I actually stumbled upon a hacker they didn't really cause me any harm. However something that did bother me was the loading times which are pretty long especially if you're on an HDD. The good in the bad is that the game doesn't load very often.All in all I've had a great time in GTA Online and I think that the jobs and activites (tennis golf deathmatch races etc.) are great and I must say that the lobby system and invite system both work really well. So if you have any friends to play this game with you'll probably enjoy yourselves a lot.PerformanceThe game runs at a constant 60+ fps on Medium to High settings on my PC which has a GTX 660 and a quad core i5 clocked at 3 GHz. If you ask me that's pretty impressive considering how great the game looks and the fact that it's open world.Closing thoughtsGTA V for PC is a really good AAA game and is well worth the 36 I paid for it. Also I think I'm right to assume that I will spend many more hours on this gem and I simply can't do anything but give it a thumbs up if not only for the truly top class Singleplayer mode.

review: Have you ever wanted to cause mayhem? Well have ya? Well in GTA V you can blow up cars (wow look at that explosion) hijack aeroplanes and helichopters and mow people down (fake computer generated people not real people) the story is really good you play as three character no that ain't no mistype three characters (I'm sure you already know this since the game came out 2 years ago on last gen consoles) you play as Michael a retired ex con robber type guy who may or may not be in witness protection. Franklin who lives in the hood and is hustling anyway he can to get out of said hood. And Trevor whose a drug addict lunatic enough said. The online is pretty cool you can buy cars and apartments and clothes and shoes and tattoos and mods for said cars you can even buy chest hair for your character which is really cool if you wanna do your best Sasquatch impression you can also buy boats and planes. Speaking of boats that's how much money you're going to need to buy all that stuff which can be acquired by doing jobs (or by spending your real hard earned dollars on shark cards) All that being said if you like fun explosions action and adventure prostitutes galore then this is the game for you think of it as a new life since your real one is probably boring and filled with a bunch of pesky rules and bills and work and kids and a wife and or husband that keeps nagging at you all day to do things around the house. Get GTA V and get lost... In los santos.

Whenever I launch the game I am asked to sign into Social Club a side feature of the game that plays little part in story mode but is what allows online play. In essence because I can't sign in due to a problem on Rockstar Games' part I cannot play the game anymore.

review: The story is fantastic. Truly it is a well told story. The graphics are amazing especially if you have a computer that can run it at high details. It is fairly well optimized too. I could run it on an intel integrated chip. Plus the modding scene for single player is crazy and awesome.But the one thing that kills this game is the online. The feces was incinerated by the fan. Hackers run rampant and rule the online world while innocent players who legitimately worked for their progress get banned for no reason with no way of getting the ban appealed. Heck I modded in online for over a year and only recieved 2 temp bans. I never messed with other players I always played nice I just hated the grind. But the amount of people who get banned for absolutely no reason is unacceptable.This is not how an anticheat system should work.However I still reccomend this game. They finally lowered the price to $30 and the story is well worth the full $60. I say you should at least try online and play honestly. But at this point that may not matter. I have not recieved any bans or any money adjustments in over a year but the online community has gone to crap. Find some friends to play with and stick to them.

review: So far so good spent 92 minutes 'playing' GTA 5 by playing if that includes staring at a loading screen then I'm currently having a grand old time. *** UPADTE 25.04.2015 **Following the recent patches I can now finally play the game and can say that a really nice job has been done by Rockstar I also own this on both 360 and PS4 and without a doubt I love playing this with mouse &amp k/b and at 2560x1440 I had quite a rocky start to getting this game working and it would also seem that not as many people had the same issue as me with getting the game up and running as I couldn't initially even get to the calibration screen yet alone the game.Now that it works I'm really enjoying the game the graphics are nice with a high res monitor they look amazing with everything maxed I've not hit any framerate issues yet and that's on a 4gb GTX 680.On a first impressions basis I'd say that this is where GTA belongs if you don't have a console version then it's worth getting on the PC if you do have a console version there's some improvements over those ports but you'd have to ask yourself is having 60fps higher res and the Movie Editor enough to make you shell out for another copy.Control wise personally for me you can't beat the good old k/b and mouse I've had a few adjustments to make with the driving sections as I do miss the refined movements you get with the analogue sticks on a joypad but that's a small price to pay in order to enjoy the game on the pc. You can play using both JP and K/B &amp Mouse which can in some respects make the driving sections easier.Overall it's a good game worth getting if you don't have it and like the GTA series I don't think you're going to find massive innovations based on the previous game but it's a GTA game and it delivers on the parts that you want it to.

review: Game is as awesome as it was on PS3 demanding now but still awesome. I'm running i5 4960K 3.9ghz 16 GB 1600mhz RAM and and VouprX R9 290 OC'd to 1100Mhz and I get an average of 52FPS at 1080P on DX10 settings with most stuff either on High (not very high or ultra) or Normal. I am quite surprised actually considering the game on Max settings isn't that impressive to look at not for the specs it demands to be playable at those settings anyhow.One major drawback I find is that the keyboard controls suck not just a little but horendously. I have been switching between KB/M and Xbox One Gamepad gamepad for anything other than intense shooting sections but have now taken to using KB/M as a last resort if getting cained in deathmatch by other players or something.First person mode is the pc 's possible saving grace over console. Usually graphics and controls would be but seen as you need a rig about 3000 to run it at superior settings and the controls are abominable this not the case. First person sucks in a car and flying but on foot it is great reminds me of a shooter mirrors edge style. Where it comes into it's own is on motorbikes riding one in first person mode makes it actually thrilling! But I kinda feel like that is this PC ports only success over console versions.In conclusion good effort R* a definite improvement on previous PC ports but still not quite hitting it on the money yet.

review: This game is mediocre at best. Yes with friends it can be fun running around killing other players but overall I'm already kinda bored. The cars are cool but not very customizable they are more customizable than previous games but really all you can do is upgrade it and change colors not a whole lot of changing the body hood or spoiler.You have stock or one other that isnt stock. The racing is fun but the driving mechanics can really suck at times. The AI are all sharpshooters with pistols... I hold my own against other players but the stupid police snipe me with pistols from so far away. The graphics are beautiful I have everything set to very high and it runs real smooth even after a couple hours of gameplay my computer is still pushing cool air out the top. So that is nice. The bottom line is this is just another grand theft auto game the major difference is the graphics and I guess video editor if your into that sort of thing. honestly I have found all the missions and heists I have done to be horrifically boring and the loading screens between them drive me F****** insane... Only get this game if you have never played one of the others til you got bored or if your into video editing. PS I have not had any problems with crashing i just dont think its a very good game

review: im a huge fan of the series with teh exception of gta london they are all great games imo but this one is just gettin annoying. first time trying to run the storyline i get a while into it then the game crash and i end up with corrupt save files. so i remove them start from scratch when i get to the heist i nearly finish the darn job then it crashes again reseting me back to the inital point of the heist fair enough... i jump in the car and drive back to the store to rob it... crash again.. gettin seriously annoyed at this point but 3rd time is the charm or so they say so i try again... same story.. jump in the car gettin close to the store... crash... in dire need of anger management now.imo they released the game too sudden lots of crashing occurance they should have worked out of the system.im givin it the thumbs up but it was a hard decision weather or not to give it thumbs up. so overall 6/10 id give it 10 if it wasnt for the bugs that makes u wanna see a anger management counsler every so often
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First off im not recommending this game for people wishing to play online with their friends. If you simply want to play singel player the game works great buy it! A list of GTA V Online bugs happening to me and my friends all the time You cant simply join your friends. The game freeze return to single player return to empty servers/or servers with other plays and sometiems you simply get "a unknown error occured". We spend atleast 50% of the time trying to meet up for a heist or a mission and sometimes just sometimes we can finish it... The times we manage to finish a mission we usually end up on different servers afterwards even though we were on the same one before the mission. This gets really annyoing when you have to spend up to an hour finding or joining each other again. Mission invites dont always show and if they do you usually cant join either way. Its like winning the lottery when it actually happens. The menus are completly unlogical and many functions are missing for exampel that you cant kick players joining a mission or heist. Some people just want to ruin it for everyone and there's nothing you can do. The lagg! The lagg on the servers a real and it seems to be connected to cars you or your friends are driving. What the person driving see is never the same as the person sitting in the passenger seat see. Also other non player cars spawn/act strange and keeps jumping all over the place. Well this is some of the most impactful bugs i've encounterd and theres so many more. So dont buy this game just yet if your goal is to play online. The single player part on the other hand is great!

Here's all my cons. Too many paywalls. Too grindy. You crash servers drop a lot. Too many entitled people do it their way or kicked. Or they you over in heist or open world. Griefing if you played GTA IV MP it's like that but on steroids.In a form it's literally pay to win almost. Want to get the most overpowered gear? Drop 4m on a piece of equipment? Oh you can't? Well have fun getting in the open world until you grind for hundreds of hours or drop $100 bucks on a shark card.

When Rockstar chose to let people buy shark cards and added tons of more stuff then that is where things went way off. For one Rockstar may the prices for stuff way too high and that is *one* reason people user modders this to get money God that's why in the start of GTA people do the money glitch so they can get better stuff. Then GTA V has short of becoming a "Pay to win" game and I say it like that because you can get better stuff. After all GTA V became crap and the only good use for it is to actual roleplay on FiveM server where you actually don't have to deal modders trollers spawn killers etc. The modder issue also has become way worst which is making GTA V it self look bad. Even rockstar banning innocent people because Rockstar is accusing people of modding after they did a heist (My friend for banned permanent for doing a heist with me and got banned for modding). In the end when GTA VI comes out I can tell you it will not be worth it unless you plan on playing on a private server. Also GTA V story mod was the only thing I liked about GTA V which is this sad for Rockstar. Redjoe678

review: I enjoy the game but I do not agree with how Rockstar handles their bans. I understand their want to prevent modding and user generated content it's their right to do so but there are innocent players being punished for other players hacking and modding in lobbies. I personally have not been affected by a ban but my brother has and I deal with hackers daily so it only shows me one thing. The Rockstar ban system isn't as good as Rockstar makes it out to be. Maybe instead of having a computer ban players they could maybe have player mods or hosted lobbys so that players can administrate their own little Los Santos. Keep the system to detect "illegal money" but please add a way to remove money that was involuntarily added to your person. Let the players have a say in their actions. I love the Grand Theft Auto franchise and I do not want to see it fall like this. Please I'm begging you Rockstar fix this issue.

review: 3/5. This game frustrated me because it started off so very well. Unlike the crud that is IV we are introduced to two characters Franklin Clinton and Michael "Dad Nips" De Santa who are written with authentic dialogue and have subtlety and nuance within their interactions. Franklin is strying to stay straight while being emeshed in gang territory and having gang ties. Michael is having a mid life crises while trying to deal with his selfish self absorbed young adult children and a straying wife. Their paths cross and Michael attempts to be a decent father to Franklin because he's so bad at being a father to his own kids. Things don't go rainbows and puppies but the basis is there for a good interesting relationship and story about these two.And then Trevor appears.Trevor is an obnoxious loud mouthed violent stereotype a psychotic charactature whose only positive aspect is that he is a shrug off who cares bisexual (which is exactly how it's supposed to be so props where props are due). Trevor's main purpose is in life is to kill people sell drugs and kill more people. Trevor shouts all his dialogue and reminds me of Vincent D'Onofrio playing bug alien Edgar in Men in Black. All nuance and subtlety has been thrown out. It's as if a different writer was forcibly introduced into the game e.g. "This is the CEO's nephew Biff who's always wanted to be a video game writer." I went from being entertained to looking up how many main missions I have left before the end. Not good.I'm up in the air about recommending this game. Trevor ruined it for me but other gamers might not care about character and story as much as I do. The game play itself is good. In fact this is the best driving I've found in a game the cars don't feel like they're completely out of control constantly. Helicopters on the other hand are the worst controls I've played. I don't feel like it's too difficult despite having no difficultly adjuster. Los Santos is one heck of a city down to the stars on the walk of fame having individual names. Bonus is that you can fail three times and then you're offered a skip section in a mission something I plan to utilize extensively to force myself through Trevor's parts in the game.ETA Finished the game. Michael is the story and the game would've been fantastic if he was the only lead. Trevor remained a dbag that brought the game way down to me. Franklin kept it real. So recommended for Michael not recommended for Trevor.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game.... Its been out for five ing years. AND IT STILL LOOKS GORGEOUS!!!! AAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!! This game is amazing to look at and the updates with all the new stuff that R* adds is always alot of fun!!!! There is a few problems with it however.... First of all is online mode. You will find modders EVERYWHERE. Now that can be both bad AND good. Bad because there are those modders that just LOVE to command kill the whole server. Then there is the modders who are cool and will spawn money/exp or just spawn cars and let you drive them or whatever. The driving is alot of fun kiinda hard to drift around corners with how the cars work but whatever. Cars look amazing but the detail/textures on the engine when you pop the hood is not very good mostly blurred generic So for all you car enthusiasts out there... this games car engine textures are mostly .. BUT there is a few good cars with very well done textures and very detailed.PLUS and car that you can take to Benny's Original Motorworks can let you customize things like the carb airfilter etc thich is REALLY fun. Now thats online. In story mode I gotta say that I LOVED the story. Very well done!!!! No complaints. Any problems I had was jsut my own dumbass fault... For example in one mission I had to Find and deliver a uhhh whats it called? lemme look this up real quick....................................................................................................................................AHHH FOUND IT!!!! I had to deliver a Z type. Now I had done everything!!!! All the hard parts I had done. All I had to do was drive it to the airport. IT TOOK ME TWO I.N.G HOURS TO DELIVER IT BECAUSE I SOMEHOW KEPT BLOWING IT UP!!!!!!!!!! WTF!??!?!?! Anyways as I said before that was all on moi because I just couldnt drive the car for whatever reason. Any ways this game is AMAZING Love it to bits!!!! (GTA Online is where its at for fun after storymode though) Blackjack

review: It's GTA V on PC. Enough said......but if I must go on then I'd say it's very good. Now this is coming from Xbox 360 tho so of course it looks and plays amazingly. There are subtle changes that I think if you're a true fan you'll definitely notice how different it is. Despite the obvious launch crashes and chaos it runs really well. I mean it's beautiful. At 90+ FPS it's just awesome really. Invest in Gsync or freesync when it's out or whatever because you haven't seen anything until you've seen this at those Fps stutter/tear free. It really was meant for pc honetly and I'm not all pc master race bs either. I own consoles. This is really better. But the issues are pretty heavy right now tho. Wait til it's patched b4 you buy if you're considering it. I wouldn't want more whiners in the forums

review: Best open world game so far. The world feels alive and legit. Story is great and the characters are awesome. To complete the packege comes the online which is a whole other game in itself. Can't stop playing havent bought another game since 2013.Bought the PS3 version on september 2013 pre sale. Bought the PS4 version ins 2014 and transfered my online character. Now I bought the PC version in 2015 and imported also my progress from PS4. Will still be playing the PS4 though.Got some friends that have only the console version and many others who only have the PC...Is it THAT good to make me buy the same game 3 times??? YES IT IS.It is constantly evolving and changing for the better. Getting together with some friends and pulling up heists is so much rewarding that you forget what time it is....oops another all nighter just flew by...

review: I hate Steam's rating system... needs to be points based. If I had to choose 0 10 10 being outstanding I'd choose a 8. So far i've only played about an 10 hours and come in with very high expectations. It worked on first launch no crashes or glitches. I set my graphics to my monitors resolution of 1920x1080 and set several a few items to high but left most at normal (including textures). I only have an nVidia 570 card so I can't go extreme. I chose to ignore overlimit warnings and went over the memory allocation slightly. The game still runs perfectly smooth for me so far so I may try increasing a few more settings. With my Intel i7 4770K and 16GB RAM running on Windows 10 preview x64.I've only played the story mode so far but so far seems fun in typical GTA fashion. I'll make a few more reviews as I progress in the game.

review: Having played a combined 75+ hours between the X360 and the PC I feel confident enough in my review. This game takes place in a obvious parody of Los Angeles where there are plenty of things to do and pop culture refrences to find (no spoilers for those). The main story has a total of 40 hours and then another 5 in side missions. The main story is very different from those of the other GTA games but it is still quite interesting. The online mode is par with some other online games but it could be more fleshed out in my opinion.

review: This is a very clean port... excuse me not port... modification? Anyways it was long over due but they finally got it out. No bugs. VERY PRETTY. However to get the DX11 1080p 60fps youll need GTX780ti or better. I have that and i still havent maxed out everything. If you have a half decent SLI or Crossfire setup you should be good to go. The singleplayer is fantastic and the online feature is also very luring. The online heists are pretty dang fun too BTW. I give it a 10/10. The story is complex and the voice work is amazing as usual. I was mad all the way back in february when they delayed it then delayed it.... then delayed it... but it was worth it. Even if you played it on the consoles get it on PC. Much prettier and first person mode is really cool. Worth 60 dollars for sure.

Now Take Two sees it fit to ruin the fun and replayability of the single player mode that can come from modding. Most people who play this game already have a copy so the entire purpose of having a PC copy is to use the mods. When Take Two tried to shut down OPENIV they made a big mistake. Unless you want to play the vanilla single player experience for the first time this game is probably not for you. TL DR Online is a cash grab full of hackers and mods are now almost unusable in the singleplayer.

review: UPDATENow that they have addressed this issue and handled it appropriately I think anyone with a functioning brain can agree this is a great if not the greatest as of yet game.________________________________________________________________I literally cannot believe they are banning now even for single player mods that do not affect online play whatsoever. I have considered the Grand Theft Auto line of games my favorite since GTA 2 and once they went 3D the allure was almost exclusive for car modding for me. I loved being able to have a personalized version for me with genuine cars custom skins even my own face on my character etc. to be able to show off to my friends and enjoy myself. I always thought Rockstar was aware that their games were such an amazing canvas for such creativity but now they're permabanning people from SP just because they want to alter their save files in single player? Or mod cars? Or improve their field of view? This is insane and one of the worst mistakes in video game history since the creation of ET by Atari.It is common sense that modding for *Online* purposes should get you a permaban seeing as online modding is also known as HACKING. But for single player? There is no shame in using a single player trainer after you've bored yourself with all there is to do or having a Corvette instead of a Coquette or maxing out your FOV because you have two 4GB GPU's. This is madness and by the recent reviews of your game Rockstar I think it is quite clear that you have f#%&amp ed up big time. I hope you correct this immediately.Give us what we want you already have our money. Ban the pirates and online hackers but leave us single player engineers alone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

It's important to remember that they will not ban for single player mods as they have outright stated on their news site and almost all of the crashing issues have been fixed in a recent update. I have friends who used to only be able to play online for about an hour but after the update we were able to play for 4+ hours consistently. I absolutely recommend this game and that's coming from somebody who isn't very happy to pay $60 for a game (especially since I already payed to play it on a potato).

review: Buy it during sale. High risk of being banned.The support team is horrible The contents can be REALLY entertaining Story is acceptable and the graphics are amazing. Game is alive and constantly updating bringing great new contents. File size is huge but worth it. But the reason I'd give it a thumbs down and say buy it during sale is mainly because as others and also me have stated It is a banning simulator. Also as said before The Rockstar support is very bad/ignorant up to a point that I am not sure if I am actually talking to a human at all.How I got banned? Whilst driving a Zentorno that took me months to get (I had to do VIP work bcs I did not know about the games that reward alot more) Everywhere I go mods just kept dropping the cashes everywhere. Some added me and offered to teach me the hacks. I always was the one who refused and told them no I would never cheat it ruins the fun of the game and it would not be worth my money at all if i had everything. Few days later RS banned me for a month After that I came back and the transformation race was introduced I used akuta while everyone else used tron bikes and since I have played 80% of my time with my bikes I am godlike with driving it. I won my first transformation race starting with an akuta. I believed the game thought I was cheating so they banned me permanently. It's been more than a year and I still can't do anything about it. It is one of my favourite games ever till this very day and I just wish Rockstar believed me. It hurts to love something so much just to be thrown away by it. That's all enjoy your game
