review: GTA V a no brainer for most gamers. The optimization is surprinslgy good honestly besides a few things like while running a r9 290 with very high everything and 2x msaa it will have almost a constant 60 besides some mostly random drops to as low as 39 fps. The story is alright but that's not why you really play this game. The gameplay is very fun with many options for guns and such. Online adds tons and tons of replability with it's own set of heists and all around fun chaos with other players. The community for the game I found was quite good. In one lobby we all basically sat about and just chatted without any interuptions and honestly I haven't seen one hacker while playing. There are some other things I could go on about but my scale says it all This is a must play. Get it if you can.That said...For a game that it's predecessor had one of the biggest modding scenes of any game they've treated modders like Revising this to say give it a pass.

review: The storymode is pretty good if you like story which I do. Though what has destroyed the game for me is the on line play. Other then the constant hackers who will blow you up in 5 seconds after joining teleport you half way into the ground and set you on fire (not to mention the blowing up of my vehicle then having to pay for it's return). There are also a LOT of bugs like the one that pops up from time to time about my friend still being in the tutorial (which he is not) but now I'm finding out that he is getting missions that should have unlocked for me that I've never seen. Like for Simeone Lester Ron Merryweather drops etc. Being level 28 I should be getting them from time to time but through hours of play haven't seen a single one.Admittedly it was funny when I popped out of tutorial with high hopes going "Oh I can't wait to play with friends and meet people!" then before I could get in a car I got snipered and watched my vehicle explode. I see why the 500k comes with the game now. . I do not recommend this game till it is fixed or they make it easier to contact Rockstar gaming as I have yet to find it in ANY of the options in game. (Except if you want to report someone that was a pain to find too)

review: It's been a very long time since I've played a game this much. Seriously blows away my expectations the only problems I've had are a few texture issues and one time where it hanged after the end of an online mission (out of 60 hours) howeer YOUR EXPERIENCE MAY VARY there are still players having issues.I feel the single player is very well done no real complaints at all. The multiplayer on the other hand I would really like to see more development (as I'm sure is coming) I would LOVE to be able to experience the full Los Santos with my friends meaning I'd love to see the wildlife put into the game the ocean especially is so boring without it.. The leveling up system is a bit of a drag at first limited missions and weapons but a little grinding and I'm starting to see the online game open up for me. If you're purely interested in just doing missions with friends it's great but this game is so beautiful to look at and just drive around in I'd love to see the freemode opened up a bit more and I know I see other people online asking for the wildlife to be added in.And on a final note about online Rockstar please make it easier to create an invite only session. I'm so fed up with getting kicked into a public session after playing with my friends especially after starting in a invite session. Yes I understand I can turn on passive mode and I do see some promise with the commending system but a lot of people just find it fun to have the map to their friends so why make it a lengthy process to get there?
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: One word Fantastic!Thank you *R for this brilliant masterpiece!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First ImpressionsHaving played neither the console version nor any other game in the series I was pleasantly surprise by how much effort has been put into the game by Rockstar which is good considering that they must have delayed the game at least three or four times. It also runs fairly nicely on my dual core CPU providing it is set to high priority in the task manager wih the lowest the framerate ever drops being around 45FPS and maintaining a solid 60FPS indoors and in enclosed locations. I can safely say that the CPU is the bottleneck here and I can crank the game up to maximum setting without a performance change (graphics card being a GTX 970). The game is very well optimised.OverviewYou are placed in the role of the three protagonists who can be switched between at most points in the game all with very well portrayed and unique personalities unlike some (I'm looking at you Aiden Pearce). While the story can be slow moving at some points the heists and parts which involve actual gunfights and car chases really make your heart pump (and you feel cool after a getaway on the side) and the sidequests are fairly in the sense that some can be extremely fun and others can be you towing a car from one place to another for five miles).WeaponsThere are many weapons which can all be customised with attachements and skins all with slight or major variations (i.e. a heavy handgun is a lot more different to a grenade launcher than it is to a pistol). None of them are overpowered or underpowered.VehiclesThe wide range of vehicles is great especially with some being fairly unique (like a supercar with a reflective silver paintjob). The main types of vehicles are cars bikes planes boats and helicopters with a few sub categories like quad bikes and jetskis.OnlineThe online play is by far my most favourite aspect of the game from thrilling heists to car chases to buggering about shooting stuff up it's all there. It's like the singleplayer but with more features it is also so much better with friends.ConclusionThe game is amazingly well optimised with solid gameplay and an infinite amount of detail way to much to list and many aspects likely still to be discovered.Overall I award this game a score of 8.5 out of 10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Oh my god first of all let me get this situation out of the way. I was playing the game happy as can be when I decided to plug in a controller. I could practically hear my computer wheezing to try the run the now 2 fps game. It's been lagging ever since. Pros Great for mods Higher texture than the ps4 ( WHEN GTA RUNS ) Also full controller support maybe possibly my game died before I could really test it.Cons Hard to start up. Not kidding it takes my 2 minutes to get the game to even show me the launcher let alone wait for it to load. Never remembers setting. I have played this game like 15 times over the 14 hours and EACH TIME I had to go into the setting and turn on fullscreen mode. Seriously? Moody in terms of performance. Over the course of the 15 times I've played at least a third of the time the game would barely go above 10 fps when it ran. Other times I was reaching well into the 60s maybe even 70s. NO STEAM OVERLAY ( If that's what it's called ). Whenever you try to Google something prepare for a battle because GTA 5 is getting ready for a war with Steam. It never lets you see what you're doing as it wants to take control and forces you out. I've even had it flash between overlay and the game repeatedly for minutes before I restarted the game. EDIT Also wanted to add that GTA online is a grind fest. Not even one mission is remotley original. Over all GTA 5 on Steam seems like a missed opportunity. It's almost as if Rockstar doesn't even care about the pc gamers and just stuffs their pocket full of the consoles' money without glancing at pc. Even when we got a port it was a performance nightmare. Just save yourself the trouble and buy a ps4 for and GTA 5.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've always been a fan of the GTA games. (Not so much the short side stories)Played every one including the very first one which was sky view and not the greatest of graphics. Miss running over the joggers! Played all the rest on console till I was able to get my own PCThis year it was given to me as a gift. Finished the story mode in 5 days have yet to try the online but hoping to.Its action/adventure and you basically get thrown in a sequence of missions commiting crimes covering them up for you or others and switching between several people who all come together in the story. You can play the story mode at your own pace. Stop and save whenever and being able to roam around find easter eggs and goof off is always a treat.I can't really say much about playing online with it but I've watched videos of play throughs the mods you can put on it and a lot of what can be done is pretty hilarious and interesting.Well worth getting and was so happy when it came out. Always leaving me wanting more.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Edit Screw it. Rockstar is not doing anything to properly tackle modders etc in online. I have been in gta online twice in the past week. Both times i cycled through several lobbies and in all but one of the lobbies there were modders. Some of those modders decided to drop money on everyone hence i have recieved a 30 day ban for just playing the game properly. So screw it. im not playing the game again. And as for future GTA games? they can shove them up their Unless they are willing to actually fix the online functions to make it fairer online im not buying another one of their games.So Rockstar and Take two are bow allowing development of OpenIV to continue. This is brilliant! And it would almost convince me to change my recommendation and recommend the game. But they are screwing over the online with micro transactions that don't even provide enough in game money to buy most things from the new DLC. It's a heap of crap.Therefore I still think I have to continue not to recommend the game. The singleness player is very good and now that we can continue to mod it it is even better but the way they are taking the online is horrendous.

review: Moving to ban modding(open iv) and in turn driving offline players online for new content to bolster their own macro transactions I absolutely will not stand for this. Unreasonable prices online for cash ($144.48 CDN for 8 mill the time of this review) absolutely insane given the hackers that are online giving millions away for free in a few seconds. I think Take Two should treat the modding community with a little respect given quite a few features in GTAV were features that were blatent ripoffs of GTAIV mods.Now you too can play in the buggy hacker laden community that is GTAV. I can't count how many times in a play session everyone blows up due to some hacker or people are given 50+ mill by anonymous players but I guess they can't really be hackers since they are all banned right?____Update September 25th 2017 OPENiv negotiations took place which is what should have happend to begin with. Tried the online experience again 2 days ago after a long hiatus. The first instance had a hacker that threw everyone around and killed them as well as removed all of your guns causing loss of profits from missions. I changed instances and the second instance had a more vulgar hacker threw cars and people around endlessly until my game crashed (couldn't even report player).Long story short if you like the single player it might be worth a look.Online experience isn't. Just DON'T BOTHER. New content is published regularly to earn R* money but has never fixed the giant hacking vulnarability ruining the experience for everyone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Which literally powers every single mod in gtav and gtaiv and probably the other gta's. Now it's time to face the wrath of yet another negative review rockstar. Take two interactive and Rockstar are only going to make this worse for themselves. You guys better rip that cease and desist letter and burn it. Because it's all one big giant jokeEDIT I do now rate this game positive. BUT. there's still ONE thing rockstar ONE thing. why the hell do you feel the need to take our money? why the hell do you feel the need to listen to kids 10 12 that love to take their parent's credit cards and buy a dozen shark cards? huh? how about doing the opposite of that and actually investing your time into something better with the game like adding a BIG dlc for singleplayer. this game has potential it really does. but don't ruin it.

review: frame rate drop tip! if you have a high end pc and can't figure out why it drops to 10 20 fps sometimes its your cpu being bottlenecked by the power saver option. go into system settings and turn the power profile to performance and no more framerate drops and you can crank your graphics again. took me a week to figure out.... I7 4770k/strix gtx970/16gigs ram. as for the game its great everything i remember from the gta series!

review: Alright.. So I don't pay full price for games very often anymore. Something told me this game would be different and I paid for it about 2 days before release.I have to say I am so happy I did. The story was fun the characters were realistic and loveable the gameplay was classic GTA with some nice new twists but best of all was the ONLINE GAMEPLAY.Online was so much fun. The matchmaking was a little screwy especially using a gamepad on the PC version but other than minor bugs it was incredible to be having a GTA experience doing jobs earning cash going on sprees that all involved the chance of another human being coming crashing through your screen in an armored hatchback or picking up your car with a giant magnetic helicopter. I put hours and hours into getting a nice house a nice suit a nice car and then I had so much fun ruining them all with blood and gasoline in the company of friends.If the community is still alive when you read this pick up the game.If it's on sale for a decent price grab it even just for the single player story.Trevor is worth at least $60 alone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pretty much a perfect game except for poor optimization for Dual Core CPU's and the fact that it's based on grinding In game currency and/or buying Shark Cards with Real Currency Money. Grand Theft Auto V runs pretty smooth on my laptop with a GTX 850M (4GB VRAM) an Intel Core i5 4210U 2.7 GHz and 8 GB DDR3 RAM. I play on somewhere between the highest and ultra graphics at around 45 fps constant except for CPU demanding settings like 'Draw Distance' and 'HD Rendering when flying'. In total I have 560 hours on Online with my transferred account from Playstation 3 my rank is at 107 for my main and 125 for my troll account. The only things that could be much better is connectivity to the Rockstar game servers and the Anti Cheat (Online) system. If these things get improved I'd gladly give this game a 9.5/10 for nowI give this game a 8.75/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So this is my 3rd time purchasing and completing this game once on ps3 once on ps4 and now on the allmighty PC edition and I can definatly confirm this is the best edition.The story is great but the cops are a little annoying such as if you choose the steal the huge cutter thing on "The Big One" they are relentless and keep spawning infront of you which is a huge pain in the they're too quick and violent and constinatly spawn right infront of you.The graphics are great and are the sole purpose in which I bought this game for the 3rd time. It's amazing a masterpiece if you will and the game feels fresh with now 60fps and amazing graphics it really feels like a new game. I can run it on all very high at 60fps on an i5 4690k at 3.5 GHz 8gb RAM and a gtx 970 at 4gb of VRAM.The story is great and I already talked about it a touch but it is great pulled me in once again getting real emotions and attachments to each character. The heists give it a fresh feel with them being a new edition to the GTA franchise and make it feel like you are really one of the characters by letting you choose which way you want to carry out a heist or a robbary or an asssanination. The missions are linear Franklin doing more "gangster" missions with Michael doing "upper class" missions such as yoga and Trevor doing well hilarious and explosive missions. The three characters each have their own personality and emotions. Franklin being very 3 bit Michael being relaxed and upper class and Trevor being a mainiac.Overall the game is great and the new graphics and 60fps give the game a very fresh feel to them and the story is very interesting and cutting edge. for 24 on Winter Sale it really is a steal.UPDATE I've noticed a bug where the game drops to 30fps and locks for 2 seconds and then goes back to 60fps this happens whenever I boot up my latest save and I have to wait a while for the game to fix itself.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game it's just awsome )I enjoy playn' it so much and just want to positive review it !

review: Absolutely incredible game for plenty of aspects. The story is well done. The graphics are breathtaking. You can do plenty of different activities.Online in my opinion isn't bad at all. You may see 90% of the Negative Reviews are either modders or Rockstar shutting down GTA MP. Shouldn't give a thumbs down for a whole game just because of the online mode.The game is also optimized very nicely. Can hit 60 fps on higher resolutions than you might think is possible for your computer.Definitely a must buy could be arguably one of the greatest games of all time.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: &gt Installing GTA V and start enjoying story mode.&gt start creating new character on online and so hyped to join the game.&gt first session someone comes with Armoured Kuruma and killed me with SMG.&gt second session and oppressor(a flying bike with guided rockets) starts to stalk and killing me.&gt third session you guessed it. a deluxo (Flying Delorean with rockets) starts to none stop killing me.&gt forth session a hacker enjoying humilating me.&gt fifth session there is no fifth session because Rockstar banned me from playing me this game for no reason.To be honest here If you wanted to buy Grand Theft Auto V for story then you came to the right place as for online No sir.... this is where you start to regret doing it you will have tough time to get used for Online.GTA Online is known for very toxic multiplayer game and you find too many griefers and hackers are out of control for Rockstar service to handle instead they start to ban people who have no absolute clue what have they done Rockstar Support service is a joke all they do is copy/paste FAQ without even reading what is your issue if you want to play a good multiplayer game? there is alot in steam stores and for god sake think ten times before buying this.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I bought this game some time ago and went online played for about 50 hours and then after i got everything i wanted i put it down again thinking is this all? a few months later i picked it up again and booted up the story mode and oh my this game is good.Things and points i like most about this game "Single player" 1. The story is good it makes u feel like a badass!2. A big world with alot of stuff to do and try3. Many different kind of vehicles to drive and fly with4. Many crazy weapons and to blow up withThings and points i do not like very much about this game "Single player" 1. Its to short! in 33 hours u finish the main story while this is not short when compared to other games. its short becuase the story for me was so damn good!2. To little events in the world after a few hours when u see something happening it feels like a copy of something u saw an hour ago.3. For me the side quests are not needed and a useless addition to the game especialy the fly thru these hoops with a parachute and be the fastest kind of things. BORINGThings and points i like most about this game "Online" 1. Heists! awesome but only if u have friends to play with!2. A big world with alot of stuff to do and try3. Many different kind of vehicles to drive and fly with4. Many crazy weapons and to blow up with5. Random events and alot of maps to play all kinds of scenarios on with friends or random strangers.Things and points i do not like very much about this game "Online" 1. Your house cars and weapons are in my opinion not customizable enough id like to see way more customization.2. Random strangers always mess up ur heists there should be severe penaltys for this kind of behaviour so people start to take it abit more seriously.3. Passive mode makes u see through and u wont take damage unless u do damage. This is boring for me i like a free for all world where u can do anything to anyone.4. alot of hackers in online mode can ruin the fun for many! they should really do something about thisThis game was a hit for me and my girlfriend. we played it many hours and after finishing the story i am convinced this is the best GTA game i have played and i played all of them. im hoping there will be some kind of DLC to the story so we can enjoy some more )If you like a good single player story next to having alot of fun with your buddys in the online mode in an open world sandbox type game where u make ur own fun then this game is definatly for you!My score Graphics 9Music 8Cinematics 0Story 9Content 7Controls 10Gameplay 8pay to win factor 0Hackers multiplayer 7

review: 9/10 This is GTA ....Hour and hours AND hours of fun wether you are solo or with friends. 800+ hours on PC.I only have two negative things to say!!!!.CHEATS! Cheats are the biggest problem you cannot enter a game without cheats ruining the game.I recommend that you play with friends only in an "invite only session" if you want to avoid the annoying cheats.GTA DOLLARS OK! they made a really good game but... Rockstar have made it so that if you want to have real fun you have to spend alot of money making your vehicles the best they can be. I have been playing since the day it was released on the PS3 and i spend alot of time doing missions and heists to make money which hardly cover your ammo costs.The result is you "have" to buy gta dollars as cars cant be stolen as often as you want and do not pay out that much when you do.I have bought gta dollars a few times which i didnt mind doing ! but FFS when i spend hard earned money for virtual money and then i join i random lobby what do i see!!!.*People asking cheats to give them money*....WTF so lets say ive just gone and bought what is it $8.500.000 gtad's? which is hmmmm 54.99 lol i could have just gone in any lobby and found a cheat and got all those dollars by begging in practically any server.Thats if you wasnt spawned to some remote area frozen in place and money bags spawned on you by some cheat you dont even know which does happen!.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What more can be said about GTA 5 that you haven't heard already? Rockstar usually make amazing games and this one is no exception to that. The open world element of the game has been perfected as you can easily navigate the entire world without even using the minimap! That demonstrates the games ability to create landmarks that are easily recognisable. The world is very diverse with many different areas and different things for most types of gamers. The gameplay is very responsive with very good feedback as the guns feel responsive whenever you pull the trigger. Shooting an npc gives you the correct feeling unlike GTA 4 which made them feel abit bullet spongy. If you use a controller vibrations are as you would expect and the controls make the game easy to playthrough and not difficult to just pick up and play. The story is fantastic with three playable characters a never before for the GTA series or maybe for Rockstar as a whole. There are many different great set pieces in the game which look fantastic and are pulled off very well. The game also has an online counterpart dubbed GTA Online. This part is different but similar to the single player. It is rather buggy but the bugs are slowly being ironed out. The servers can sometimes die which can be a huge pain but whenever the are working the connection is quick and smooth with lag being rare (but it can and does occur). The public lobby's are as expected walk around minding your own business will get you killed pretty quickly. However if you play the online with friends in a private lobby then the online section will be great fun as you's can do anything you want. Wanna rob a store? Go ahead. Wanna skydive? Jump off the nearest mountain! The possibility's are endless and the amount of fun you can get out of it is the same amount.

review: The game is astounding in all respects however the online is a mess. There is no division among servers so someone in America with a ping of 200 may be lagging around your server and that is only 'IF' you are successful in getting online. In truth the system being used is so ancient and prehistoric that you will have spent more time loading than playing the game. You want to set up a dedicated server? Load single player then load multiplayer then load a mission load the players into your mission load the mission itself and then when done load the end of the mission and load the server back up again. Usually invited players are kicked back to main menu and have to be invited again to the server. When you play online and don't enter any events or missions you die by severe lag or get disconnected.Worst of all is the t where Rockstar service is unavailable and you have no reason at all as to why you cannot connect but your friends might get online even though it says the services are unavailable. Its due to terrible online design and no literally no money spent on buying servers.If you buy this game to get online just be aware you may never actually get online and all the t methods people tell you to do in order to get on will get you no where because this is all based on the terrible service from rockstar. Again another example of a game company that milk your money and tell you to go yourself when their online service breaks down. In truth Steam should be removing this off their store as it only tarnishes their good reputation. Would love to continue playing the game but have been unable to for 2 days. Was playing perfectly fine for 3 days then this Its a disgrace. And a waste of my time and money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game does justice to PC Gamer's everywhere for all the awful console ports we've been forced to endure over the years or even worse all the games that never made it to PC but should have. This is the quality of game that PC Gamer's expect and richly deserve. Studio's need to take notice because the bar has been raised. If substandard ports like Alien Isolation Splinter Cell and Mortal Kombat X are the reason PC Gamer are often grumpy then games like this surely must be the reason why we carry on buying expensive GPU's and overpriced accessories. To say this game is visually stunning is a gross understatement. The gameplay refinements made in the last two years help deliver on some of the best narrative you will find in modern gaming. When GTA III first came out it completely changed gaming this iteration of GTA does the exact same thing. This is the best game ever made and nothing really comes close.

review: Great game but there is one problem which is that the game has a memory issue which causes it to get lower and lower framerate the longer you play. After playing for awhile you will start to experience frame drops which get progressively worse the more areas of the map you load. This is extremely frustrating because there doesn't appear to be a fix other than to "just upgrade your computer." I have an Intel core i5 processor 8GB RAM and an NVIDIA GTX 1080 TI graphics card so while I am not exactly running a NASA computer it's still pretty decent. Rockstar doesn't appear to care about this issue as they seem offended that anyone would dare to play their game without what I feel like most people would consider an exessive amount of RAM. Game itself is pretty fun apart from the technical issues (and the fact that most of the people in the online mode are whiny little 12 year olds). Story is alright walking is a little clunky and cars control pretty decently (plus when the game is running well it looks quite pretty). Honestly the online mode is not horribly interesting unless you are running the FiveM client and getting on RP servers or you have a few friends that own the game. The money system in online is horribly grindy. The only real way to make money is by doing missions that you probably don't have the money to buy gear for which leaves you with the option of either robbing stores (which doesn't pay very well) joining a mission and hoping you get matched with someone who has cool stuff and can carry everyone through paying for the Shark cards (which I do NOT recommend since you will have way too much money and way too little skill plus the fact that you probably already paid somewhere around $60 or so for the game) or doing what I did which is just spend around 10 15 hours running races to get enough money to buy the gear you need to do the missions that pay well enough to be worth doing. Overall though I would say it's probably one of those games most people should at least have in their library somewhere since I can pretty much guarantee at least 100 or so hours on the singleplayer story alone. Plus with a couple of friends you might even have some fun just screwing around in the godforsaken hole that is online mode.TL DR Buy the game for the singleplayer mode and the huge open world. Online is grindy and toxic (although some fun can be had if you have friends).

review: Yes Indeed this is a good game to play and yes it can look beautiful with the right PC specs but EVERY game has its downside. This game? Well dont get me started. There ARE hackers everywhere using godmode cheats and stupid files like that but as long as you stay away from them or go into passive mode you will be fine. Another thing this game takes bloody FOREVER to get going properly. Constant crashes on launch poor optimization I have an R9 280X from ASUS and I had to turn VSYNC on and go to DX10 And Im still having issues with rendering distance and shaders. My final review would be mixed between Yes and NO because of how badly these downsides affect gameplay.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After playing GTA V for a good 50 hours I can confidently say that this is one hell of a game possibly even a top 10 for me. I don't know what it is but cursing down Interstate 2 (5) in a convertible on a hot summer day with a mini SMG shooting anyone who dares cut you off is a special kind of fun. The missions are diverse fun and challenging. I haven t really played any GTA Online yet but I m sure I ll get around to it. Here are the pros/cons of the game I have found so far Pros Huge diverse open world that GTA is famous for. You can drive off road downtown or even go boating in your yacht. Cars cars cars. I love driving in GTA and with the improved driving physics and increased number of vehicles GTA V is a driver's paradise. It may not be a driving simulator but damn it's fun. I LOVE the characters and their unique abilities. The three way switching system is great and I like how each character has their own unique background.Cons The helicopter and plane controls are absolutely atrocious. I failed a mission 4 times in a row looking for the right key to make the plane ascend. I eventually just reconfigured them but by default they are mapped to the numpad which is OK I guess but on a laptop without one you will need to make some changes. The DRM seems pretty insane and I hope that it never becomes an issue. So far it hasn t been but I m suspicious that it may cause problems in the future.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Hello again! If you read my review for GTA IV then you might be discouraged from getting this game. DONT BE DISCOURAGED!!! I was extremely sceptical especially when GTA IV had so many damned issues with just the vanilla game but it seems like this next installment was ported over to the pc a lot better. I am happy to report no crashes whatsoever even with mods installed all of the missions so far have worked perfectly and the cell phone always pops up! The vanilla game itself is one of my favorite GTA games to date and it is even more fun once the modding begins. I have played this game on both the console and on the computer and let me say that I am extremely happy that I gave GTA on the pc another chance. Highly recomended 9 out of 10 rating!!! )

I didn't stay on gta on the ps4 because people didnt really talk and the ones who did usually had their mics always on so i could hear their mother in the background telling them to come eat dinner. Overall I am satisfied with this game and super happy I could transfer my characters.

review: First of all I love this game ... been a fan of the entire series since the very first game IV although one of the greats just didn't really click (insert hate comment here!) between Niko and the whole dating mechanics they somewhat lost me.This one however the game style seems more similar to what we used to get early on ... I have to agree with some reviewers that the game leaves you wanting more after the story wraps up in single player mode and that it becomes a true fan thing afterwards to push for gold on mission try to cause chaos or finish every single task in the game and push for achievements and that works for me so I m happy.I have just started playing Online initial thoughts looks good the newly added protection mechanism (disable something something where no one can shoot you I think it s called passive mode) seems to work or maybe it's just because I play in hours no one is online not sure but no complaints from me yet anyways!The 3 character theme heist the voice acting the style of missions the amount of details cramped into the beautiful city and now playing online I have enjoyed almost everything in this game and for me personally I couldn t get any game to get me hocked this much in a very long time (with a busy schedule) this one gets my vote for a full score and a recommendation to anyone to play this one

review: Update 2 january 2016 (ye almost 3 months ) finelly i got in game. support didnt help. found sollution in internet. thats why i still not recommend this game cause if you get any bug or problem with social club than rockstar's support won't help you at all. they wasnt able to help me in 2 months.But the game is great and if you not afraid of problems with social club than totaly buy it.Update 4 november 2015 still no help from rockstars. no fix. i cant get in game for a week.Update 25 october 2015 after last patch "lowriders" game stop working. as u can see i played for 130 hours. and had no problems. but now its not working. launcher start and than i get error "unable connect to rockstar servers". i wrote to rockstar but they only saying "update this update that" and nothing working. i start to read in internet and found thats lots of people have same problem (or dissconect after loggin) after last patch. and not only on PC. on xbox and ps4 too. but rockstart do nothing.i complited it on xbox 360 in 2013 (just a few days after release)... after that i sold my xbox. and was sure i wont get back to it only because of gta online. and it was so until i saw my friends played heists on PC. and ofcourse bought it next day. thats the last thing i remember from real life )PS i still didnt play even one mission in single (after intro) cause complited on xbox 2 ears ago. but online is so fun and addictive. the only 2 cones are 1 match making. if u dont have like 1000 friends in social club. or just 3 that will alweas alweas play with u same time its hard to fined good team for heists. cause game will try to fined u team only from your "room" (and friends and crew and skillsame wich is usless). and in room usually only 5 20 ppl. and most of them low lvls or cheaters. so random matchmaking is hell.2 and here the seconed cone cheaters. they everywhere. u will see ppl with 999 lvl. with 5000 lvl. teleporting. killing you with flame from above. getting random stuff in your garage. or just blow up hole map in one sec.Yes they banning lots of them. but not much. so be sure that u will get in rooms with cheaters like 9 times from 10.maybe someone will be afraid to play after read about those cones but i will tell u that i really get like 90% rooms with cheaters and i really love heists (its even better than in payday 2. which is strange cause payday is all about heists and gta online not. i only want rockstars to add more) but cant do them 90% of time cause not all my friends play same time as i do and random pick is horrible... but did it stop me from playing?! not even on sec ) in this game u have so much to do. and so much to see. and even when u bored after 24 hours of nonstop gaming from missions heasts races deathmatches golf armrestling (and so on) u cant exit game cause rain starts... with thunder... and u getting in car turn on your favourite radio station and just ride in the city ))

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Being one of the best selling video games of all time I felt that it is worthy of a review. Being honest (this actually probably goes to many people) GTA V is actually the only GTA game I ve ever purchased. Although it is worthy of this having the best visuals biggest map largest player base and most detail. The story mode can be completed between 25 30 hours and having 7 hours just of cutscenes! The story mode truly is like a complex movie clearly grabbing inspiration from a handful of crime movies such as ones directed by Scorsese. The story includes numerous complex characters who we connect to seeing both their lives at home and their lives as kickass criminals. Throughout the story you get a good amount of time playing whoever you want although most of your time you actually will probably spend exploring around the map. The map as a whole is around 100 square miles being one of the largest detailed game maps ever made. In single player mode another thing many people find themselves doing on PC at one time or another is modding. Modding is not recommended by Rockstar by any means and there is always the risk of being banned but as long as you only mod in single player mode you aren t risking much (they only take online modding seriously and I highly discourage it). Modding single player is pretty awesome though allowing for so many new possibilities. You can use flying cars you can become a superhero change the course of time etc. Although Online mode is where it s at. In online mode you can do hundreds of missions and games with friends and Rockstar is adding new content on a regular basis (making people question if there is a GTA VI in the making). In online mode one of the main status indicators are people s vehicles. Most of the major updates involve cool vehicles like winged motorcycles Deloreans underwater cars etc. You can even own a yacht that is equipped with a helicopter luxury motor boats and jetskis. Multiplayer frequently is dominated by modders though which can be interpreted as a good thing or a bad thing. Sometimes modders are only there to feel powerful and repeatedly mass kill everyone on the server but sometimes they make it rain big bills and get you enough to buy that turreted car you were saving up for. GTA V Online never really gets old even if you ve done a lot. Even if you aren t working on missions you can have fun in the world of Los Santos doing pretty much whatever you want.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is fun enough if a tad samey the multiplayer however... It's just bad. You basically have to buy shark cards to get anywhere anymore because prices are so inflated. You can get one shot by some 12 year old that stole mommy's credit card and bought an effectively invincible vehicle and there are so many hackers that there truly is no point even trying to play for real anymore.Don't go anywhere near the multiplayer no matter how many friends you have. It's just not worth it.

review: Labor of Love The best way to describe this game. As one who enjoys open world multiplayer games with a variety of content with the addition of a great singleplayer campaign with a great story I do enjoy this game greatly. Never have I been able to run out of things to do in either the campaign or online nor have I exhausted new and creative ways to experience the wide variety of gameplay presented. Unfortunately Grand Theft Auto really makes you fight for it's affection. There are no small shortage of reasons to dislike this game a few major ones I wish to go in detail for later but it is safe to say that no game is without flaw and GTA has quite a lot. As often as you can enjoy this game you can just as quickly despise it. When I bought the game half off years ago I had been anticipating playing it. I had seen several people I follow publish videos of their antics online and was noticeably intrigued. Playing it with my friends who already owned it only further made me anxious to obtain it. When I first started my initial opinion was neither good nor bad. There had not been any particular thing that swayed me one way or the other and I sought to play it more to formulate my own general consensus on it. As I continued playing it I began to look beyond minor flaws in favor of the increasingly positive gameplay. As of wiriting this review I own dozens of cars buildings and businesses and tens of millions of dollars. I find this game extremely fun to play fully aware that there are flaws which are in the grand scheme of things undermined by the overall pleasant experience and satisfaction I get from it. One of the key selling features for me was GTA Online a chance to not only do everything the main characters from the story undertook but now with friends. I could partake in all manner of new events online and for someone quite introversive made several friends who have only made the game more enjoyable. This game has really left a positive impact on me. I can remember with ease all of the fun I have had over the years. I can easily consider this one of my favorite games of all time. For those yet to purchase it the game can feel quite overwhelming at first even throwing too much at you. Once you get accustomed to the controls gameplay mechanics and ultimate objectives for your character the fun begins. For such a large place to explore there are hundreds of small and large things to busy yourself with. Grow a criminal empire untertake ando create the most extravegant of races hold car shows and goof off in rather eccentric vehicles the choice is yours. Whatever you want to do if it is in this game there will easily be hundreds of hours avaible for that activity. Now I understand that I am one person and one who probably has quite a few deviating opinions from that of several others. To give them a fair chance you should know what may be of great importance to you. Overwhelmingly most reasons not to buy this game given by others can be boiled down into the fact that Rockstar does a poor job of regulating its game from modding and that heaven knows how many accounts have been unjustly suspended and several hundred and even several thousand hours of progress have been lost. This is more than enough to justify one turning away from a game and my opinion should be taken in this regard with a grain of salt as I have not had my account suspended. With that said in a very careful attempt to analyze these complaints I am going to attempt to ask a question I kindly request not to take as insincere. I am curious and would like to ask these reviewers if their accounts had not been suspended would they recommend this game? From the hundred of reviews I have seen over the years I can only infer that they would recommend it as there are few other problems major enough to warrant a negative review. As someone who still holds a lot of emotional attachment to a great many games I can be easily angered when I lose gameplay for a title I have invested a lot of time in. However is it not the job of a review to analyze the game as a whole and not based upon one bad experience? From what I know about games losing all gameplay is the worst possible thing that could happen and that it does not occur quite often in terms of one person. I don't think you should not inform those interested in purchasing GTA that this thing can happen but I do not think that the most extreme problem a person can experience with a game should be the foundation on why you discourage others from buying it. I myself am not without a handful of complaints and do not blindly defend any game or developer. Rockstar does need to better manage their game with modding modders can be a right pain the butt at times several features in the game are quite irritating and seems to only serve the conquest of griefing GTA is not immune from microtansactions a problem worthy of its own category the K/D ratio has spawned a depraved group of tryhards that only make the online experience worse the list goes on. But at the end of the day I still find that while all of these things can let the game down they are only small and brief instances of negativity while the game itself with nothing else attached can still deliver a positive outcome. Ultimately I can determine that the majority of my complaints can be levelled at people abusing mechanics or actively trying to irritate me online. If I were to play the game alone or only with friends my list of complaints would vastly diminish which I believe speaks for the actual quality of GTA and not of the players. I can not speak for everyone but if I can hate the tryhards and griefers but love the game I would consider the game still worth purchasing. No doubt there will be rainy days but if you still think the game as a game is good then stick to it and do your best to enjoy it. In conclusion I would recommend checking the game out via let's plays analysis and reviews and the opinions of friends and/or colleagues you trust. For the price this is a game you should research carefully before buying or just wait until a rather generous sale to pick it up. If at all possible find a friend who owns it and ask to try it out. If you think that you will be able to look beyond the actions of a rather irritating minority of players for a generally impressive game I recommend it. If not I would probably say not to buy it.

review: This game is an oddball for me. The story mode is phenominal I've 100% it twice once on the Xbox 360 and another on the PS4. I have not gotten around to beating it on the PC due to laziness but nonetheless I've had my fair share of the story to say the least. In terms of gameplay it is definitely dependant on how you play with the control setup. But once you have that sorted away you should have no issues at all. The game is so smooth and very easy get get used to. There is no skill based things that you can improve upon at least to my knowledge. The controls on the keyboard and mouse are very complex and sometimes don't make sense so using a controller is highly reccomended. If you're using the keyboard and mouse for combat while using a controller for vehicles it will be a 10/10 experience. The online is another case though as once you 'beat' it as in basically doing everything there is to do there is no replay ability unless you're willing to wait for a lackluster update. I'm currently around level 177 and I still find myself unable to have fun. The missions are repetative and usually fetch quests which get boring after you play for about an hour. The community really takes the cake when it comes to negativity as this is probably one of the top 10 most toxic gaming communities from my personal experience. In every public lobby I always find myself being shot at as soon as I'm in the vicinity of another player even though I mean no harm. I go into passive mode after my car is blown up for the hundredth time and I'm then called a . It's not entirely the experience in trying to go for so ya. TL DROverall I rate the game an 8/10. The story is great the characters are very interesting the gameplay is fun the controls are iffy on the keyboard and mouse and the online is cancer.

Seriously it's several minutes each and every time. I have over 270 hours in this game and probably 100 of them was spent at a loading screen. And unfortunately you have to deal with it A LOT. What makes it even more annoying is that random players online tend to leave in the middle of a mission FORCING you to go back to freemode (load) and restart the mission (another load). If it wasn't for the unholy load times this game would be damn near perfect.But even with the load times I still would have to recommend this game just for the sheer fun of it. Hopefully one day Rockstar will address them but it isn't looking promising.

review: Grand Theft Auto V Reviewwell it's finally here almost 2 long years after it's initial launch GTA 5 is finally on PC. I've played this game on both my Xbox360 and my XboxOne and now i can finally play it on my glorious gaming rig. I will admit that I'm still a little bit salty with rockstar for delaying the PC version of this game for so long but I got to say they did one hell of a job optimizing this game for PC. this game runs great and has more graphic settings then even a lot of PC exclusive games have. the keyboard and mouse controls feel very fine tuned and even driving with them feels decent which is a huge rarity in games. I think it's fair to say that this has to be rockstars best PC launch yet but on the other hand that's to be expected with how many delays this game has had...anyway with that being said let's move on to the game play aspect. GTA V with no question has one of the most diverse open worlds I've ever seen in a videogame this world is HUGE and it feels like a real living city. I've been playing this game for almost two years now and to this day sometimes I still find new places I haven't seen before in the game it's that divers. the gameplay has been refined from GTA 4 and feels a lot more natural and fluent it even has a very well done tacked on FPS mode so you can experience the game in a whole different perspective in a way it makes it feel like an entirely different game. the story is very fun and very compelling and can even be touchy at times and is a reflection of how messed up modern day society can be. there is a ton of side ejectives to do in the single player and playing GTA online with your friends is an absolute blast. this has been said to death but I'll say it again even with all the delays this game has had it is still a masterpiece. I can highly recommend this game to almost anyone. it just goes to show what can happen when developers put actual time and effort into their games and build them to last. all i gotta say Rockstar is way to not f*** it up xDFinal Score (9/10) Incredible 3

review: An amazing and beautiful singleplayer story with stunning graphics great writing and fun gameplay that is plagued by its ugly sister known as GTA Online. A virtual world in which you engage in hours of grinding to be able to afford the luxury weapons vehicles and properties that are relentlessly advertised to you through a ridiculous amount of phone calls text messages emails and ads on the loading screen that you'll likely spend hours of your life staring at due to long loading times. Those hours of grinding will be required due to the insane amount of inflation in the GTA economy that has occured since the game has launched. Your online experience will also be plagued with high amounts of toxic players some who engage in cheating behaviors that threaten the reputation of all other players in the lobby. After nearly 100 hours of grinding in the competitive and repetitive online mode I was banned for 30 days and had my account reset despite having never cheated modded nor received money or other incentives from players who were cheating. If you are like me and find yourself in this situation then good luck. As R* does not allow your ban to be appealed and has a terrible customer support network that will provide you with no information as to why exactly your account was banned in the first place. This horrific online experience has convinced me to never touch GTA Online again and I will likely never purchase Red Dead Redemption 2. And you know I'm definitely going to mod the singleplayer now. Overall an amazing singleplayer experience that is ruined by a disgusting and unfair online system that is plagued with cheaters and microtransactions.4/10 Would Not Recommend
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is both my most favorite and most hated. The game itself is really fun and frustrating to play and the game mechanics such as driving are great.The best ways to make money are heists vehicle warehouse or doomsday. The buy ins (in order) are 200k (plus the varying buy ins for the heists themselves) 1.5 million (at least) or 1.25 million (at least). The heists buy in is 200k since you need a high end appartment to start them and the cheapest being that expensive. The only other way to make actual progress and money you pretty much need to find a hacker or become one. Which there is a plethora of them if you go that route. The anti cheat pretty much doesn't exist unless you have a completely stupid amount of money. But this is a double edged sword. If you find a "nice hacker " you will probably drive nice cars that haven't come out yet and get some money. If you are unlucky the hacker will spawn things on you and make the game unplayable. The "nice hacker" will more than likely be the one who gets banned. The Shark Cards are options as well... but they are really expensive and will probably be a bad option. It also supports the bad business practice that they have enabled. Although if you can afford them Rockstar has made enough money that even if you speak with your wallets it won't do very much to change. This game has honestly the worst AI I think I have ever encountered in my entire history actually. The NPCs will spawn in the middle of the street within your POV sometimes even on top of you. You will notice a fun game of bumper cars with or without your consent. They will swerve into your lane or into oncoming traffic just to crash into you. There is no reasoning that I've heard of to justify it. The gunplay is the farthest thing from satisfying since enemies will either die in one hit or one million. There is no in between. The controls in order to change your gun or zoom in (not ADS) are the same and if you go even slightly too fast it will just change your weapon instead of zoom.There is a lot of connectivity issues that I have run into. They mostly consist of booting you from servers and putting you by yourself or kicking you from missions. One thing that happened to me and my friends during the Doomsday Scenerio (final Doomsday heist) we would all experience lag spikes in certain areas in the building but not outside even though all of our PCs are above recommended specs. At the very end of the heist my friend messed up and died resetting us to the last checkpoint. Which isn't that big of a deal as the checkpoint was right before the end. But instead of putting us together at the checkpoint my friend got kicked and we were booted from the lobby losing 2 hours of progress and had to restart the entire heist. That's really just one example of the connection issues.The ONLY redeemable factor for me is the vehicles and their customization. This is why I actually play the game. I love driving the cars and customizing them. The planes and helicopters are cool too. The people at Rockstar are pretty creative when it comes to vehicles. The Oppressor Mk1 and Mk2 come to mind. The games most fun part has to be customizing vehicles with your friends and compete to see who has the coolest and fastest car. The missions for the vehicle warehouse are really fun and selling lets you customize cars for free and drive them afterwards. In conclusion I don't know why I still play this. The more I play the more I realize all of the flaws this "definitive" edition has and it makes me lose more and more respect for Rockstar and Take Two. I honestly don't think I will support them anymore. I feel like the $262 000 000 dollar budget was put entirely into "how to make the player pay more money and how can we make sure he/she hates themself for starting this." END OF RANT

review: From sunny beaches to a forsaken desert. From a bustling city to cultist dwelling mountains. This game has a little bit of everything for everybody in it. Grand Theft Auto 5 is a masterpiece and Rockstar's best game to date. If you've played the past entries in the series then it is the same usual mechanics finely tuned and improved. Los Santos is a large sprawling open world with countless things to see and experience. Even under those crashing waves are sights to behold. One new mechanic has been thrown into the mix three playable characters that you can (most of the time) switch between on the fly at any point you want. The story spans all three of these characters and is some of the best writing in the series to date. Simply put play this game you will not be disappointed.

review: Sigh... Oh man. So I've played GTA V for a pretty okay amount of time and don't get me wrong I love the game. I love playing the game. Specifically I love GTA Online but I certainly don't mind the plot. There's just a few things wrong with the actual gameplay like the really long loadtimes and broken dialogue every once in awhile. But that's not enough to not play it. It's still worth it's pricex in that regard.But... to put it simply everyone who plays GTA V is in an abusive relationship with Take Two. The reason I don't say Rockstar is because Rockstar's developers had nothing to do with the horrid updates of the game. But Take Two is just... awful. Every update has so many features that NONE OF US WANTED and maybe two or three bugfixes out of the hundreds that need to be done. Every new "event" is chalk full of totally overpowered items just to get people to use their in game money so they have to buy more with real money. Imagine GTA V as a dead corpsified horse and it's players as vultures. The developers keep smashing in the corpse (beating a dead horse you could say) trying to expose more gross bloody meat for the ever hungry players. The only problem is that the horse has no meat left. BUT THAT DOESN'T STOP TAKE TWO! You can almost hear the lead developer yelling "GRIND THE BONES INTO PROTEIN POWDER POP THE EYES LIKE GRAPES MAKE THE SKIN INTO FRUIT LEATHER BUT FOR GOD'S SAKE MEN DO SOMETHING WE'RE OUT OF IDEAS." Meanwhile of course they're caring 0% about the players at all just greedy for their money. Remember when there was a bug that banned anyone who joined an Online game? Remember how the developers denied it's existence and gave the task to redditors to warn each other of it's deadly effects?The point being GTA V is a good game. It really is. And I do reccomend playing the plot. Just be prepared for the how and be ready to be as annoyed as everyone else.

review: I still haven't touched the single player version of this but jumped straight into GTA Online instead. And after that I don't care about the single player ither because the online version is so bloody brilliant. It's the best balanced combination of driving shooting action and great team play in any game I have ever encountered. You can play it as a typical team shooter with just your friends by doing instanced missions either co op or PvP or you can free roam around the huge map in a variety of vehicles (almost 500 to choose from) and run a full criminal business or jack cargo from other people's businesses for fun and profit )Despite being several years old it's still getting frequent updates and the servers are pretty lively. You do get the occassional childish griefer taking out "noobs" for no good reason but by and large the community seems reasonable and you can always server hop easily if someone is being a pain in the I honestly don't think I've ever had this much fun in any other game. 11/10 would shoot cops in a weaponised dune buggy again.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is easily the best Grand Theft Auto game yet. It improves over its predecessors in virtually every category but perhaps the greatest new feature of GTAV is its online multiplayer mode You can share the city with a large number of players and either engage in a variety of cooperative or versus missions or you can roam the city causing mayhem to your heart's content. The online mode does suffer from the occasional but obvious hackers with invulnerability no clipping through the sky or even destroying all vehicles (including the one you're driving) within an area at the push of a button. Arguably the best feature in online mode is the cooperative heists which typically consist of 4 5 smaller missions leading up to a big finale and an equally large payout for successful completion. Finally the large variety of missions available keep the online gameplay new and exciting for quite some time which easily makes this game one with a abundance of replayability.The single player mode also improves across virtually all aspects of the game. The storyline is exciting hilarious and often unpredictable while effortlessly allowing the player to cycle through up to three separate main characters each with unique perspectives and storylines all in the same city. The graphics are breathtaking and the game's optimization is enough to ensure even an $800 bargain computer can handle it on maximum or near maximum settings. The music is reminiscent of earlier GTA games but with more options and some hilarious talk show stations to keep you entertained. Vehicle customizations are vast and many online vehicle enhancements are unlocked with successful completion of multiplayer missions. The variety of vehicles you can control are enormous from luxurious super cars to giant dump trucks to military tank and jet fighters you'll have plenty to save your hard earned cash to purchase.As you've no doubt predicted by now I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed any of the previous GTA games or to anyone seeking an open world mayhem video game with a criminal theme. I'd be remiss if I gave it anything less than a 9.5/10. It loses 0.5 merely due to having so many hackers in online mode.

review: IF in regards to the GTA ONLINE Feature DONT BUY THIS GAME!!! It is a pay to advance mode and the final heist that offers a 1 million dollar reward is total crap. If anyone dies or anyone carrying the money gets shot you lose money and when you respawn you respawn with even less money than what you had. If you want to play the next GTA then go ahead and play GTA V but if you think GTA Online looks good it ISNT. The fact that paying more REAL MONEY into the game in order to advance and get cool stuff is comparable to when you have to pay money into Clash of Clans or Candycrush in order to advance. Yes it is possible to save up enough money to buy something really cool in game like the VTOL jet but you have to play the heists over and over and over again. And there are problems with these heists in terms of waiting in lobbies for other players to join and then having them leave the heist when you're literally ten seconds away from it being completed. This has happened to me in not only the heist finales but also the heist setup missions many times. A lot of things in the online mode feel like they need some more work in order to be almost enjoyable at least make it more of an enjoyable experience by fixing the leaving players in the middle or at the end of a heist. Or just do away with the whole buy fake money with real money concept. I don't like seeing GTA this way.Also while this video is very funny it also lives up to its title in my experience.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v gyE75Y Z0gE

review: Excellent graphics and cutscenes. Not everyone wants to be an ignorant gangster or drug dealer or some trash like that it would be nice to play a police officer in the game too. Can play a very nice and advanced Golf game. Can play tennis. This game is best played with friends with a similar taste in games. Very big open world to explore. Killing people is absolutely unnecessary but the game characters taunt you like mad and eventually you get desensitized to the violence. There's too many menus and menus within those menus. Best played with a controller in many situations. You can't play online until you beat their intro which can be difficult. I didn't enjoy this game at first but once I got use to the controls and I had friends explain how to navigate through things I changed my outlook on this game and I really enjoy it. I turned off my microphone so I can't hear strange human players taunt me (they can be ignorant). I use a 3rd party program like mumble or skype to chat with my friends within the game so we can communicate and effectively beat difficult missions. Overall I give this game a 7/10 5 being average. Still there's a lot of possibilities in this game waiting to be explored.

review: My opinion of GTA V is a bit mixed. The game is worth it alone for the single player campaign but GTA Online can be a bit iffy. GTAO has some issues large amounts of hackers long loading times and clunky loading screens and GTAO freeroam is P2W in it's entierty. Oh you didn't spend $100.00 to be able to afford a flying motorcycle that shoots missles too bad enjoy getting blown up at every encounter with another player. What GTAO does good however is providing a platform for fun minigames in the form of FPS games racing and community made games. That along with the online heist missions makes GTAO barrable. The devs of GTA V said there was going to be more single player DLC but that was dropped because Online was a massive cash cow for Rockstar. The single player is great. Switch between 3 characters mid mission to perform different tasks great wacky cops as per usualIn the end and wonderful driving and shooting. This game leaves me feeling bittersweet but I would say the game is worth it for the single player experience alone.

review: It's been out for over a year so a review this late is mostly semantic but An incredible adventure that manages to bring a bit of life and joy back to the GTA series that GTA4 took out without necessarily being as good as it's forebearer San Andreas GTA5 is worth your time and your money though a somewhat anemic third act will leave people confused and unsatisifed at the absolute end.If you've played a GTA game before you know what to expect. The only real additions are the Heist and Three Character swap system. The Heists are a bigger deal in Multiplayer and it gives the sense that content was cut as there is an entire RPG leveling system for your crew members and not nearly enough heists to actually do anything with them. The Three Characters while expanding the narrative possibility in the game also strech the story so thin it loses flavor near the end. Franklin is missing an entire act of character development while Trevor and Michael have their climax during the top of Act 2 and then stop developing until endgame. A last minute decision to kill either Trevor Michael or get the actually good ending of the game reeks that a design decision was thrown out at the last minute. Perhaps Franklin was supposed to learn more about his mentors and come to a decision himself rather than be forced into it by the Assholiest s who ever Arsed a Hole even by GTA standards. But aside from some final act woes GTA V has found a measure of spirit that GTA IV threw out in a desperate misguided bid to become the Sopranos. GTA V isn't afraid to laugh at it's audience it's tropes or itself. There's a running almost desperately forced theme about Cliches avoiding or embracing them. From the moment Gang Banger Lamar briefly gives an overview of how every first five missions in a GTA game go to Michael bemoaning that he'd become a sitcom father even to the ingame anime spoof being predominantly about the dangers and virtues of playing it safe it's hard not to see a shot at meaning that GTA IV couldn't manage with all it's grey rainy cousin murdering muddiness. It doesn't quite get there (the thin and bland last missions have nothing to say on the theme regaurdless of who you decide to gun down) but the attempt is heartfelt.A stronger final act would have gone a long way to making this a nearly artistic work "Heartfelt" is the best way to summarize GTA V this is a game that someone wanted to make and be a part of and every performance and line and mission has an undeniable energy and excitement to it. I'm just glad that it's found a way to crack a joke again.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Glad to see that the game is down in price after such a long time. Not that it really matters though at least for multiplayer. If you want to play this game just to make private lobbies with your buddies and single player of course go right ahead. But for public lobbies I cannot say the same. GTA Online as devolved into a goddamn warzone of cheaters. I've owned this game and have been playing ever since release on PC so I can say with confidence that cheating was never this bad. Was it a problem? Of course it was. But never was it so common that I just down right do not have any interest in playing anymore.For example I played for about 2 hours today and had to join 3 different lobbies becuase there were cheaters ruining the game. Kicking me out of my vehicle appearing and disappearing on the minimap and then finally making my game ing crash just becuase I talked to him in the chat. It is this amount of power and control in this game that nothing feels worth it I have such little power compared to the losers who cheat. At this point I'm not sure I ever want to pick up the game again. The community is such a cancer in this game they're actually doing exaclty what the disease does best.So absolutely amazed that Rockstar has done nothing about the issue. Shame on you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This installation of the Grand Theft Auto series hit a new high with this release of GTAV. Originally released in PS3 and Xbox 360 the PC port is a similar release to what came out for the PS4 and Xbox One. Differences with the PC version of GTAV is that it has a first person view a modding community (no Steam workshop) and a vast amount of players in its multiplayer (top 3 via steamcharts.com). What might put people off are mods can be used for single player however cannot be brought to multiplayer. I do not think it is a big deal as multiplayer is still fun nonetheless. I wish community driven modes can be brought to multiplayer for new experiences rather than what's given with the game. Other than that the single player mode is still the same as before. Nothing new has changed since the PS3 and 360 versions. Graphics in this version are beautiful on a i5 4690k and a GTX 970. I can nearly max out settings with 60 FPS and I feel much more immersive in this game as a result. If you are on the fence about picking this game up because of price point and previous played it I would still recommend picking this up. Multiplayer is just a new experience with this game and much better with friends. Even without friends the game is still fun because of so much you can do in the map. Also heists are tons of fun and so much replayability.

review: At its core Grand Theft Auto V on PC is the same game that it is on other platforms and while it s never looked as good as it does on a strong PC anyone who s played GTA V elsewhere may not benefit from buying it for a second or third time unless they re desperate for better graphics. If you fall into that camp you can easily transfer your progress over to the PC version via the Rockstar Social Club to continue where you left off diving headlong into the revamped Los Santos with minimal fuss.It looked great on PS4 and Xbox One but GTA V shines on PC thanks to 4K grade textures the availability of additional post processing effects and an unlocked frame rate. Previous versions of the game played just fine at 30 frames per second but you quickly appreciate the added fluidity of playing at 60 FPS (if not more) on PC. If you can give it enough juice (read afford top end gaming hardware) then you can marvel at the added flourishes in 4K even but even three Nvidia GTX 980's in SLI couldn't push the highest settings at 4K without dipping to around 30 frames per second. Whether in 4K or at 1080p the new high res textures pop with detail and new lighting effects lead to plenty of awe inspiring moments. GTA V can paint stunning pictures with the right mix of scenery subject and daylight that highlight the natural beauty of its geography and the grime that pulses through its concrete veins. GTA V has always looked good but a great gaming PC is the only way to witness the full extent of Rockstar s admirable handiwork.Keep in mind that GTA V retains evidence of its last gen roots even on PC with simple geometry abound. You notice low poly models on occasion as they contrast with the great texture work and lighting on hand as simplicity and complexity mix before your eyes. GTA V is impressive at times but you never forget that you re playing a game that s foundation was built with outdated constraints in mind.

The loading screens take so long I could read a book quicker and the game is a hackers haven at this point and Rockstar really need to get off their arses and sort it out. Overall though GTA V is a brilliant game that's well worth your time and money.

review: This game is probably the best open world. with a large map and an amazing single player this game is awesome.Tho on the online side of things it's gettin repetitive they are constantly adding new propertys missions vehicles and more each with their own unique theme but the problem comes when evrything becomes to repetitive.There are many fun stuff to do in online and there is allways something to do and even if it is boring it can entretain you in a way online has some awesome content like doomsday heists or normal heists but it comes back again to the problem of being repetitive again because of the reason that you must do boring prep missions and just like all the other buissnises it's the same formula of go to this place shoot some people steal the car and get back to the bunker or office or whateverAnd that is a big problem in my opinion as there are really good setup missions but most of them are boring trash.Gta online has some cool vehicles apartments and other cool stuff you can own but the problem comes when you look at the prizes... and you must start grinding again i personally think that it's actually pretty fun to grind bunker as there are allways cool stuff happening like merryweather helicopters following you and other stuff but if you don't have the time to grind and get bored easily then i wouldn't even bother playing gta online still whatever gta online adds even if it is bad or not it will still not be a big deal because of the other amazing experiences you have had playing kinda outhsining the bad stuff for me at least.Anyway i would say that if you are okay with grinding and have time for it then it's a pretty solid game as you have both online and single player that you can mod to have everything online has and more but i will say it depends i just play single player right now cause i got perma banned for no reason and rockstar refuses to lift my ban.

review: This game is a 10/10 Masterpiece. I have been pl aying this for years on my PS3 and PS4 and now bought it for PC. The graphics are awesome tons of free content and realistic to some extent. From my experience I have never seen any hackers in the PC version yet nor I have gotten randomly banned. A huge difference from the PS4 and PS3 versions of the game which are generally full of hackers. I would though recommend waiting for a sale that includes game plus sharkcards since things are very expensive online but other than that its a great experience worth my money.

review: The game is horribly slow moving. Solo mode require a LOT of driving and by that I mean that over half of the gameplay is driving/flying around to the next objective. The actual missions themselves are still rather slow even the shooting as the fun action is short lived and then it goes back to the very tedious driving or boring parts of the game. As far as mutiplayer goes it isn't much better. Unless you have a group of freinds to play with or don't mind playing with people who don't much know what they're doing you'll be doing missions solo. These missions are not very numerous short rather boring and have an unsuprisingly huge amount of driving. the races meanwhile are worse. no one is ever doing races. Friends or solo. And then there's the fact that the most they pay is 11K and MAYBE enough RP that after 2 20 missions you can level up. In other words you will NEVER make enough money to buy and upgrade the good cars and money that is if you can even unlock them. After doing all 5 heists my friend managed to make about 2m dollars including the double money first time bonus the 1m loyalty bonus and having only bought guns and ammo to do the missions. that's enough money to buy a good apartment a couple good cars and that's it. So there you go playing all 5 heists with the same people MIGHT get you enough to get some of the stuff you want. Now to the only truly good part of the game mods. The mods such as superpowers shooting cars shooting money explosive bullets anti/moon gravity were the only parts of the game that I ACTUALLY enjoyed myself. and now you can't do any of those. Rockstar has made it impossible to use mods and if you find a way they are either instant of banning you or take over a month to do so. overall this game is not worth $60. I would not have bought it if I had known any of this previously.
