review: I will be only reviewing the single player portion of the gameSo i've just beaten the game around the 35 hour mark and i gotta say this is such an amazing game! Everything about it is just ing outstanding the voice acting the script the location the characters Rockstar knows how to not disappoint their fan base. The plot of the game is just great and how they used three characters to unveil the story was REALLY well done. Michael Franklin and Trevor have unique characteristics making them super unique and helpful throughout the game. Each one of them come from distinct places of San Andreas giving the player the feel that they are exploring at least a good portion of San Andreas. Their backgrounds are also pretty distinct Micheal is doing pretty good living at this huge house in Rockford Hills Franklin is trying to make some money and have a better life while Trevor... well Trevor is taking care of ''Trevor Philips Industries'' in the desert area of Los Santos. The way those three end up together is funny as hell and extremely well done and by the end of the game you will love the three of them. By the time I beated the game I got sad that they wouldn't ''meet'' anymore at least not in story missions.The city of Los Santos is just gourgeous the graphics are amazing theres absolutely nothing to complaing about it you can even go to Groove Street (important area of GTA SA). There would be times during a mission that i ended up dying because i would look at the great views the game just throws at you. I've played the previous GTA titles before and after beating those games I would end up playing them again only after a while. In this one I feel like exploring the entire world searching easter eggs doing the extra missions and etc. Maybe the reason is that the city feels so ''alive''. GTA IV felt like you were in a living city well GTA V makes that even better. Also I don't think I've run through many glitches maybe twice and that's considering the fact that it's the largest map in GTA historyThe gameplay is pretty standard and straight foward a third person shooter where you take cover with any object you find. Lets just say it works pretty well there are no moments where you feel like you had a unfair death and obviously it's FUN. Just don't expect anything out of the ordinary. If you have played TPS/previous GTA titles before you will feel right at home.The downside is how heavy this game is on PC. Some people are having the hardest time running this at the highest settings even though they might have high end PC's. Oh and its around 65 GB. Yeah you read that right SIXTY ING FIVE so make sure you have enough space for it and a good internet connection because this is taking a while. Also the loading times when you boot the game are really REALLY long but besides that the game works pretty well.If you plan on picking this up specially for the SP portion of the game GO BUY IT. I will guarantee that you won't regret it!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V Story Mode The story mode is long exciting and fun and it can give you a lot of funny moments.Been playing this constantly and is never tired of it.There is so much to do here some examples is to play golf darts or tennis.This is great for players that love to do sports in real life or those who are interested in sports.When playing for a while doing random activities that comes up I must say they really put effort in this game for us.GTA Online This is just like the story mode but much better.You can for example play with friends and play heists or missions that can help you rank up and earn money to purchase an apartment or cars.All activities works here as well so you can play together with friends or just random strangers from an online lobby.There is so much to do in GTA Online that I can't describe all of them but if you are interested in a fun multiplayer game to play with friends then GTA V is certainly the choice for you.No matter how long you play for you can still have fun playing.I rate this game an 9/10 for the reason that it is very fun playing with friends and just hang out.

review: I'm thoroughly impressed at how well they ported the game to PC. Much better than GTA IV. I like how the heists are handled but online sometimes feels not at its optimal because of connection problems. Luckily I haven't experienced any launching problems or errors. The other downside is that I am basically at the recommended system requirement however I still experience stuttering and loading issues online. Playing singleplayer on the other hand gives me little or no lag whatsoever. Therefore I recommend to be above the requirements to have a good experience. Minimum requirements will not even be close enough and will cause annoyances. Last thing to note is that the only long waits I have is when launching the game (about 5 minutes) but loading any other time in game isn't that long.

It loosing money from that but they get upset and send out letters and the project ends.....but then it continues months later and is great.Now that they see they can't stop them they go after OpenIV that allows you to easily mod the game as far as textures skins models and so on.All I have to say is that when GTA 6 is released and they see that it doesn't sell as many copies and doesn't continue to sell copies after the hype dies down maybe then they will realize the positive impact modding has on their sells and income produce by their games.They want to be anti modding then that's fine but say goodbye to the money you guys make after your game falls flat and gets boring.

review: Notice my playtime? Guess what? That's all the time I spent modding GTA V and all the time I spent playing LSPDFR. LSPDFR has been the heart of GTA mods since San Andreas released. But this isn't just about LSPDFR although I'm unimaginably furious. This is about modding in general. This is about a passionate community bringing people together with brilliant ideas and new innovative ways to play. I've been part of this community for many many years. At this juncture we dedicate our lives to improving the singleplayer aspect of a game that Rockstar's abandoned due to GTA Online. GTA Online has become Rockstars million dollar baby and they have done all they can to preserve their new cash cow. GTA isn't even about singleplayer anymore. It's no longer about ridiculous DLCs. They've abandoned their roots and I wouldn't be surprised if the next GTA isn't even singleplayer anymore.PC gamers have gotten the end of the stick for too long. Everything is destroyed now. review: Very boring game both single and on line just empty game. I'm very disapointed after all the hype. Not worth of full price. The characters are not exciting except Trevor. If graphics is the most important factor to you in games and you love excess shooting with poor aim then buy it.The missions are mostly the same shoot shoot shoot shoot fight against over helming mount of enemies. (For example the mission "Blitz Play #2" why they stay and wait for the cops and Swat to arrive why just run away to getaway car and have good car chase action). GTA V from the main missions point of view is a plain shooter game. Nothing intelligent in the missions no stealth action. The other thing which bothers me is why in Heist missions in which you need to collect gear for the Heist has some timed sub missions what's the point of rush (complete in few minutes)? Player should have the freedom spent all the time in the world if he wants to the Heist itself is a different thing. There is also something wrong with aiming and that's frustrating with most missions including plenty of shooting. Haven't found satisfactory settings for the mouse tried every possibility aiming still poor although your shooting skill is 100 %. I have wondered why enemies who don't have bullet proof vest need to be shot several times before they die even from close range doesn't feel right. Also the car damaging physics is strange.Flying a heli is frustrating (also with 100 % flying skill) luckily driving and flying planes works fine. Graphics are nice and the game runs nicely and smoothly. Just Cause 2 has much more reasonable touch for flying.I don't understand why there are statistics for every missions they don't tell you beforehand how many headshots or something else should be achieved during the missions no point at all. Most of the mission are so dull that you don't want to play them again. Why isn't it enough to complete all possible mission and find collectibles for 100 %? There is not anymore fast food restautrants you can go and eat. There is golf and yoga and many more activities which actually doesn't bring anything extra to the game for example there are many good golf games out there if you like to play golf. I haven't found a way how to abort ongoing mission (execpt exit hte game) is there any if not that's stupid.As a summary there is nothing new in the game overhyped. Too many missions from which you don't gain nothing just do the dirty work without any payment. The property income is extremely low in some cases for example from a restaurant you gain only 920 $ a week what's the point to spend excess amount money to buy that no logic at all (poor business). The storyline is also poor and lame.I prefer GTA IV much more than the V never had any problems with running the IV. Also San Andreas is my favorite (maybe the best GTA). GTA V is probably the worst one in GTA series (played all of them).If you like real open world games play Witcher 3. Remember manage your rig well since high end parts alone doesn't quarantee smooth gaming there is always unnecessary s**t running on background if you have Windows.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I guarantee it.

Oh not to mention the rampant hackers on the online service that they refuse to lift a god damn finger to try and fix. (No your t about OpenIV enabling online hackers is a flat out LIE.)I've put up with it all because the singleplayer was excellent and it was only strengthened by modders that much is undeniable. You know for a fact modders make your games BETTER EXPERIENCES and they add more longevity than trying to force people to play your multiplayer version of the game just for new features all while salivating at the idea of getting a new "whale" hooked on your product (THAT THEY ALREADY PAID FOR). off 2k and Rockstar A LOT of people bought your game on Steam just to mod it. You're already one of the top best selling games of all times stop ing double dipping into people's wallets with this t.Any respect I had for these companies is pretty ing lost at this point and you can bet your I'm not about to buy another GTA game after this you god damn disingenuous hacks. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: EDIT As Rockstar Games under direction from its publisher Take Two Interactive have proven themselves to be litigious reactionary and paranoid regarding user modification for Grand Theft Auto V IV and EFLC shutting down multiple user made modifications used for legal multiplayer purposes (and illicit purposes from a small minority of online cheaters) abrupt cancellation of multiplayer BAWSAQ stock trading and single player DLC of GTA V after Shark Cards launched retroactively revoking content from soundtracks of GTA San Andreas and Vice City constituting almost 20% of the total music selection without prior notice and other unsavory profit motivated behavior up to and including the glaring omission of the Red Dead franchise from PCs for no apparent reason I'm changing my recommendation to a negative one. The next genre defining installment in the Grand Theft Auto franchise Grand Theft Auto V straddles the line between familiarity towards the 3D and HD generations of the franchise and throws in some brand new mechanics for good measure.Launch/Performance Yes this is a category now I guess. Welcome to modern gaming. The game was delayed for months after the launch of the console next gen version itself over a year after the original game's launch on seventh generation consoles (Xbox 360 and PS3). The PC version as opposed to the state of GTA IV both on launch and throughout its lifespan is waaaaaaay better optimized. On launch day the online servers were running pretty much as well as they are now with the exception of a couple of lost connections to servers for scorekeeping and maybe one CTD (crash to desktop). That said two game breaking launch bugs on specific missions in Story Mode forced me to creatively use checkpoints/mission skipping to get through the campaign. I'm sure this must be fixed by now though.I was somehow able to get the game running at medium high settings at 1080p with an i7 3770K 16GB RAM and Nvidia GTX 660 Ti Power Edition from MSI at 40fps originally. Then tweaking the game towards more medium settings I was able to get it running steadily over 60fps. Nowadays probably since a title update the game runs way lower for me around 30 40ish fps on medium/medium low settings when slightly overclocked. There's an occasional framerate spike every 20 minutes or so where it straight up hits 60 fps for about 5 seconds and then drops down to normal so I know it can run better but it's a mystery as to what's going on.Although this may be due to a number of reasons which include my PC build reaching the two year mark where my Windows 7 installation and secondary hard drive are both kind of cluttered. I'm sure Rockstar probably also is optimizing a patch or two after title updates of which one just came out so the entire experience is somewhat fluid at the moment. It's very smooth overall and the stability of the game for me is on par with late lifespan GTA IV with a higher graphical fidelity and way less stutter.Story Avoiding spoilers I enjoyed it although I'm confused as to whether I thought it was too short compared to that of previous entries or if I'm not used to the game's pacing. It went quickly which may be a good sign of how much I enjoyed it. It's not without flaws the usual Rockstar brand of satire's here which some people love some people hate. With the increased fidelity given to the world though it reaches further extremes than I thought possible and I'm not entirely sure it feels exactly like every previous GTA game. This could be for good or bad reasons. The characters were less likeable than previous ones I believe again due to the approaching Uncanny Valley of the satire R*'s been going for for the past almost twenty years. Overall the game was more light hearted than GTA IV but more cynical and not as madcap as in San Andreas and earlier so it's a bit of an outlier.Graphics Well... many have considered this the swan song of the seventh console generation and they might be right. The graphical fidelity in GTA V set new heights not only for the franchise but for arguably all open world games before it. There are games out there which beat this one in terms of absolute #graffix but Rockstar's attention to detail in re creating Los Santos is readily apparent at any resolution with any graphics settings and it absolutely helps keep the game which is otherwise somewhat repetitive from moment to moment as someone who's played almost every game in the franchise as fresh as possible. Plus there's actually some color in this one at launch.Map design this fits in with the last criterion but overall the map is massive in both detail and sheer size. On top of this Rockstar seemed to pull almost every side mission activity or variant of same they've ever done and cram it into the map as one kind of facility or other. The main jarring omissions are Pay &amp Sprays car washes restaurants with interiors and casinos. Pay &amp Sprays have been replaced with LS Customs repair/customization garages strewn across the map and the latter three are physically in game just not implemented as something you can interact with. I believe overall new LS' map size was officially considered to be roughly equivalent to that of GTA IV RDR and San Andreas combined with some square footage to spare.Multiplayer As enjoyable as GTA IV's multiplayer modes could be they were vestigial at best I suspect tacked onto the story mode at a time when Microsoft was really pushing for everything to be on Xbox Live. (Could be wrong on the motivation there.) As a result only three missions were available for players to get involved with and this never changed throughout the game's lifespan. Hey it could've been worse in San Andreas the only thing resembling multiplayer was a two player recreation of the classic Rampage Mode and free roam.In V well... Rockstar must have been paying attention to the massive upswing of multiplayer's popularity since 2008 since they effectively made a stand alone title out of the online mode this time around. Your custom character basically flies into Los Santos in a stylish prologue reminiscent of both San Andreas and Vice City Stories' introductions and are herded together with a whole slew of other like minded criminal tourists like yourself into a crash course introduction to what is essentially freemode with a campaign and side missions attached to it. It works surprisingly well considering what it is and Rockstar has regularly added dozens of vehicles outfits and firearms to Online's and the base game's lineup of collectible stuff in the end.It's not perfect by any means just like in IV V's multiplayer is riddled with hacking idiots and general online shooter chaos and outside of mission grinding and the occasionally successful heist Rockstar effectively locked the most substantial content i.e. properties expensive vehicles etc. behind microtransactions. You technically can go through Online without spending more than the 60 dollars the entire game cost on launch but expect to spend a ton of time making money to do the majority of what there is to do in the game.Again doing this isn't all that terrible either. Online's missions on launch were somewhat limited but a content editor machinima mode and the quality of the world's design itself give plenty of opportunities for players to either have fun grinding missions for cash or to just goof off either by themselves or with anyone else on a server of which there can be a couple dozen people more or less.Overall I think GTA V's got plenty of room for expansion (with campaign AND online mode DLC) but it's been a thoroughly enjoyable experience and I'd be quite prepared to say it's got greater replay value than GTA IV and perhaps some of the 3D era games as well. It's worth the price if you can spare the sheer amount of time necessary to max it out.

review: While i would love to recommend this game i simply cannot for this review i am ignoring the obvious problems of Hackers/ Modders and such but its more to do with the direction that rockstar have taken the game. While the game in the early days was fantastic it has changed over the years. What was the major change that has changed the game for the worse ? Homing Rockts ...... Nowerdays in online mode sports cars and such have no place any more. Everyone is driving around in heavely armoured trucks planes and hover cars. These all have spammable lock on missiles which means it takes very little to no skill what so ever to kill people who are running Product/ Supplies with little chance of retaliation due to how easy it is to blow up said transports.Ultimatly Rockstar added to much easy to use fire power. For instance one of the most common runs are bunker runs. Most of the sale's missions for the bunkers involve trucks that only take a few rockets to destroy only one of the missions gives you a truck capable of dealing with Air Targets (which around 50% of vehicals on warstock are). This makes it increadably fustrating to do such things unless there are 3 or 4 of you working together. How ever when doing such things the amount of money you gain as an associate is pitifull and makes it not worth your while...Ultimatly rockstar have made the game to easy for trolls and almost impossible for grinders... all things considered its like ther hoping you get fed up of getting rekt trying to make money and just buy the shark cards to get the items instead.

review: GTA V REVIEW FOR PC FROM A LONG TIME GTA FAN I am a huge GTA fan. I have played all the gta games and almost every game by rockstar. This review isn't so much about gta as it is about the pc port. GTA as a game is already great and there are already enough review out there (for you to know its one of the best games ever) this review is about my experience as a returning player on pc. I pre orderd this for PC inspite of already have played the game on xbox 360. For those of you wondering weather to re buy or not let me tell you...its totally worth it! It is definitly worth buying a second time (from ps3. xbox360) but I'm not sure if it would be worth it had you already had it on ps4/xbone. The PC version is a huge graphical upgrade and a game like GTA online is meant to be played on pc with free aim and better community. Not to mention r* editor first person mode and when you replay the story it's twice as fun because you catch all the small details you missed before. Overall I really found my second playthrough of the story to be more fun and better. Also pc version has MODS!In terms of performance this game is great. To max out at 60fps you need a insane system but my $1 300 system from 2.5 years ago is actually making this run pretty well. I have 24gb ram Amd 8 core at like 4.2 and a 7970. I get about 60 fps walking around. and anywhere from 35 60 fps while driving. In shootouts i get around 40 fps. This is all on meduim to max settings which makes the game look pretty good (definitly far far far better than xobx 360/ps3). At times the game does look a little visually bugged when not on all max settings (jaggies flickering shawdows a little pop in for shadows) but most of the time the game looks great even when on medium max. Plus I experienced almost no lag even in the biggest of explosions not even for a second. Buy this game!ps. the pc version even on really good settings looks pretty similar to the ps4/xbone version. The major difference of course is the unlocked frame rate which is HUGE
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: When I first started this game I was so amazed by the scope and variety that I praised this masterpiece as the ultimate game to be ever created. Now that I finished the single player campaign while I still do see GTA V as an awesome game I also have some complaints which make this game no longer flawless and perfect.To those unfamiliar with GTA these are some of the things you can do in this game * Walk run stealth swim dive parachute* Bikes cars boats yachts planes helicopters* Fight hand to hand or with bats/knives* Pistols shotguns machine guns rifles minigun RPGs grenades bombs* Exercise to raise strength/health/shooting skill/driving skill* Play tennis golf and darts* Cop chase* Direct shoot and share videos* Lengthy single player campaign* Massive online campaign* Collectibles* In short anythingAnd here are some of the improvements over GTA IV * 3 playable characters instead of 1* Improved HUD that takes less space and shows more info* Ability to switch to first person viewpoint anytime* Ability to use the Internet or save your game with your in game phone* Ability to replay previous missions and challenge extra mission objectives* Ability to retry mission from checkpoint after failure or death* Ability to regenerate health when stationary* Ability to see where EACH police car is looking at during cop chase* Supernatural powerMy complaints with this game are mostly about shooting. One the reticle is too small just a small dot in the center of screen. For I cannot count how many times I got in a gunfight and could only shoot randomly because I couldn't find the reticle. This is adding unnecessary difficulty to shooting.Two the game is too easy in general. Because you can regenerate health in most dangerous situations you can just hide and regenerate to avoid death and then very few missions can stop you at all. For me only the very final missions felt a little challenging and I've always been not so good at shooting.Three I heard Rockstar prohibited any modding to this game. I'm not a modder nor do I play any mod so this doesn't really affect me but their attitude does seem wrong to me.In conclusion this is a very good game but sadly not so perfect.+ do anything in this ultimate sandbox+ 2 games at the price of 1+ various improvements over GTA IV unchallenging difficulty story wrapped up too abruptly all the problems just solved themselves all at once modding prohibited9 out of 10 marvelous.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have a Cybertron patriot with a AMD 6300 graphics card and 12 gigs of ram. My system isn't "top of the line" but it is very decent....yet it's not good enough to play GTA 5. This certainly isn't about money since the $50 or $60 (I don't know) that I spent on the game is a drop in the bucket but it's frusterating that there isn't a built in system in place that scans your system and lets you know "You will not be able to enjoy this game and will be wasting your time and money purchasing". Instead you are told this AFTER you buy the game. So the game has sat installed on my account for about 45 days now and I will be spending more money to upgrade my graphics card just so I can play the game. Would I reccomend this game to others? Of course I would.....IF I COULD ACTUALLY PLAY IT!! Until then I will warn you....If you don't have a "TIP TOP" system then do not bother spending your money on this game because you will not be able to play it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A big improvement from the PC release of GTA IV which left a sour taste in everyones mouth. GTA V not only is more fluid in its storyline it is also fluid in its controls and is well optimized performance wise for PC. Still enjoyable on a lower performance computer but breath takingly awesome on a powerful machine. The main story line is very linear but does not fail to be interactive and engaging. Overall for the single player game alone this game was certainly worth the purchase. I just can't wait for GTA VI now...

Every online session has some sort of 'mod' where if you him off he'll just kick you out of the session or screw with you. People get mad when you shoot them yet run around and shoot you the entire game. The UI has major issues. Nothing is consistent. Half of the menu's you have to press 'enter/return' to confirm(WADS plus mouse.... why would our fingers be anywhere near the enter button? Hello?) half of the screens you select using your mouse. When you get disconnected from GTA online it loads single player. Then you have to wait for single player to load then you can try to get back into online. Like seriously no retry logic? What is this the 90s?Just absolutely no thought was put into the small details. The small details ruin this game. What a game with such great potential only to be squandered.I could write a novel about why this game isn't worth it. Too many small things were implemented badly. I
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Everything is good
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: We ll start off with singleplayer and then go onto online. Singleplayer One of the main things in singleplayer mode is the storyline. The story is good certainly not better than the one in GTA IV but the characters are very well written. Each one of them has their unique personality. Each mission has it s unique feel because there s more action that makes you like the storyline even if it doesn t have a good story. That brings us to the good gameplay mechanics that makes the action possible meaning well timed actions which gives a realistic feel to the game. Physics for some reason are not better than the previous GTA IV. The game has it s own atmosphere but you can t really notice it but that makes up for the random actions that occur while you are not doing a mission. That s why GTA IV had better atmosphere that made the story a lot more realistic and serious. But that doesn t make it bad there s a lot attention to detail and various collectibles around the map that are science fictional or cause weird occurrences. When you get bored of singleplayer you go onto online. Online GTA Online feels like a different game that we know Rockstar Games didn t use to make. In that world you can have your own apartments businesses cars vehicles and let everyone know how rich you are not only in the game but in real life too. You have all types of vehicles ranging from Oppressors to Jets Deluxos APCs and a lot more that are equipped with top of the line machine guns and rocket launchers that make killing other players much easier than ever. But all come at a higher price meaning that if you want these without grinding for hours you ll have to hit for the wallet. Rockstar will be very happy and will keep adding more of these vehicles made even easier to control. That s where you ll find people in the game that won t be able to live anymore if they don t kill you at least once. Usually the type of players that use the most expensive equipment but still manage to get killed by a sniper riffle. But what if you don t want to spend any money in the game? Then you can play for hours and do a lot of missions and jobs till you can afford these and finally show everyone who s the boss in the lobby. Innocent players getting banned for no reason. GTA Online could have been a better game with less toxic community and painfully long loading screens.There's a lot more to be said about this game but at the end GTA V follows some of the original formula for making Grand Theft Auto games while still adding new features that we didn t have before.

review: This is a complete and utter money pit. The base price for the game is $60 but you are going to have to spend AT LEAST three times that if you wish to enjoy some of the new content Rockstar has been adding into GTA Online. On top of all this it looks like single player modding and enjoying the game "for free" (even though you have already spent $60 at this point) will be impossible in the near future with Take Two actively trying to take OpenIV down (so to speak the only software that allows you to edit the game files). There also really is no sensible way of going about making money in GTA Online even less so for the kind of money the new content requires (tens of millions of in game dollars)To sum it all up GTA V is a fantastic game in itself but at this point is too saturated and hindered by microtransactions to even be playable. To top it all off Take Two have now shown their true colours in trying to stop the only way their customers can make more out of their game without paying.Conclusion Rockstar and Take Two Interactive care a lot more about your money than they do their customers.

review: I do recommend the game but.. The online community is becomming more and more terrible and just a toxic community to be in/ a part of. I do very much enjoy the game but it does suck because people can control when you can and can't play the game. Meaning if you "ruin" someone else's gameplay expirence they report you for it and get you suspended from the video game for at least 30 days.. as I have had that happen to me recently Another thing i don't like is rockstar isn't the best at answering tickets. I get that they are a massive corporation but if you know that you are going to be making massive amounts of money on a video game then you need to hire as many people that is needed to answer tickets properly. I get the huge corp aspect but if you can't keep up with everything that's when you need to hire people to do specific and certain jobs. I was recently suspended from online because someone didn't like who i am friends with I sent in two tickets to rockstar and both of the emails I was sent replying to my tickets said the same exact thing. I was not told why I was suspended and i think that as a player you have the right to know why you have been suspended and or banned from online. Other than these little things the game is very enjoyable with friends I have a massive group of friends that I play online with and we have so much fun doing so this game could be loads more fun if the community was better and if things were run differently by the Corporation (Rockstar). Again this game is very enjoyable in playing as long as you have friends and ignore the rudness of the community as you have very rude people in every online video game/community. As someone with over 1 000 hours I believe that it would be a better game if it was run better and if the community wasn't so toxic.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For this I am going to break this review into two parts. Story Mode and Online. Story Mode has always been the bread and butter of the GTA franchise so I feel that judging this game solely for the Online section is rather unfair.Story ModePros As always an excellent story by Rockstar with an amazing cast of characters. Huge Open World to explore and filled with easter eggs and fan service. Ludicruous ammount of attention to detail put into the game even to the smallest parts. Multitude of side missions and activities to do even after you finished the main story. The AI make the game feel alive even with animals that fly around and run everywhere.Cons After you complete all missions and activities you feel like there is not much else to do. Some of the places you could access on previous tittles are now closed off. Sometimes the AI feel a little too dumb. No DLC to expand it as of yet.Over all the Story Mode is an excellent experience to have even if you're new to the franchise. It is the meat of this game and it delives and the negatives are mostly minor grievances that don't take away from the experience at any point. For the Story Mode alone this game is a must buy and I'd recommend it any day.OnlinePros Nice character customization that lets your character look how you want. Immersive system of buying property and vehicles. Awesome vehicle customization with tons of vehicles to own and customize. Free updates that always bring more missions and activities to do. Ability to play with others on public sessions or with friends only on private sessions.Cons Everything is very expensive and geared towards buying Shark Cards. Toxic community full of griefers and hackers that run amok in public sessions. Many missions are locked to Public sessions only severely limiting the ability to grind in peace. Rocktar support leaves much to be desired. Not much to do in private sessions.Online started as a sweet note but as time passed Rocktar let SharkCard money go to their heads and now it is nothing but a sweet sour after taste. Locking all big activities and missions to public therefore forcing players to play online with randoms as a way to prevent grinding even though everything is too expensive. Online alone infuriated me so much that I gave up on future Rocktar games. Don't get me wrong I have over 1000 hours put into this game and I did get my money's worth. But the direction that Rocktar is heading towards with Sharkcards is just not healthy and rather a fine recipee for a toxic community. But definetly do try out this game if only for the Story Mode alone or the ability to goof off with friends but don't expect a public online experience without getting extreme frustration from the community. And Rockstar did amp it up with the latest DLC which takes a big load off the shoulders of people who are trying to grind instead of taking the easy road. But everything is still expensive.

review: I wanted to love this.. wanted so badly. I even preordered day 1 on steam. My favorite game on Xbox 360 when it came out my favorite franchise and most coveted title as a PC master race member since the original GTA I played on a pentium 60. However Rockstar has royally messed up... for the first time EVER (I was ok with 4's DRM.. it never crashed!)The crashes! AHH! Both my friend and I have similar computers. I use a 4790K he has a 4690K. Both using MSI Z97 Gaming 5 boards. Both using GTX 970 cards. We've tried everything at stock clocked underclocked. Reinstalling OS drivers rollbacks facerolls the works. Oh wait you're in the middle of a heist? Enjoy this black screen and hard reboot to your PC's dome. Single player? GTAV.exe has stopped working.. Maybe the crash msgs will swap between the two. Maybe a GFX Init error? Maybe just a drop to desktop for the heck of it. Why not? I've been killed from crashes in SP more than I've died from natural digital causes.Sure this happens maybe once twice sometimes more a gaming session (night) but.. really? Its annoying and a game breaking experience. I don't even want to play anymore especially when I spend half of my time sitting at loading screens waiting for crappy pugs. Now I see RS is banning modders etc. I get the online mod banning but make a clear gap between SP and MP and let the SP folks go damn wild! Increase the craptastic FOV! Listen to your customers.. I'm going to make a ticket with Rockstar and I sure hope they help.

review: I hate having to write what I'm about to write but it's the truth.Take Two Interactive the publishers of GTA V and by extension Rockstar Games the developer have no respect for you as a consumer. They have no respect for their own product. They have no respect for the hard work anyone's put into GTA V and it's been made abundantly clear.The one thing that kept the GTA series alive on PC after even Rockstar stopped making content for them was Open IV and it was shut down. What's worse than that is that neither Take Two nor Rockstar Games have the decency to be honest about why they're doing it blaming the ability to hack their online mode using it. Now unfortunately both TTI and RG forgot that everyone else also has a brain and can read words since the one big thing about Open IV from the start has been that it does NOT with online. This is a vain attempt to squeeze more money out of one of the best games of 2015 and one of the biggest dissappointments of the past 2 years.

review: I love the Grand Theft Auto franchise and I have since I played the first one and loved it even more when III came out and you get the 3rd person view rather than the hellicopter view. If you like GTA you'll love V because it's the best of them all. The only thing that I can really say that I don't like about V is that the load times are super long online is spotty and most of the time you're spending time looking for a match for more than 4 other people in it. And if you're looking to do any of the heists you're better off finding 3 other friends to do them with because most of the randoms you'll get matched with will screw you most of the time. Other than that stuff V is great. The story mode is the best so far in the franchise and I highly recommend it the charcter development it awesome whether it's prodictable or not it's exactly what it's supposed to be and all the RockStar elements are the easter eggs the jokes and everything that RockStar has been doing the whole time with the GTA franchise. Also First Person View in this version is most definitly worth it I originally bought this for my 360 at launch and then bought this version because I wanted to see what it was all about and it is definatly worth it but the 360 version does have more online players and better servers but other than that PC &gt 360.

review: The game itself is extremely fun. Unfortunately you'll spend most of your time in front of loading screens. It takes forever to load into GTA online and once you're in you're greeted with more long loading screens when you try to play online matches. The game crashes every 30 to 45 minutes which means you'll start your loading screen life cycle all over again quite frequently.I have 20 hours logged on but I probably only got to actually play for 10 of those hours. It takes so long to load that I would catch up on Netflix shows while waiting to get into GTA online or an online match. 10/10 best loading screen simulation game I've played.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V finally hits the PC in a mammoth package of content. If you haven't already jumped on the band wagon it's time to do so.Gameplay Story and Presentation are top notch. Modest systems will struggle to make a pretty image but the level of detail scale and fluidity of the game in motion can make it easier to overlook.Online can be a huge time sink as lobbies can take a while to organize so best played with a group of friends. It can also take a number of minutes to transition between characters or lobbies so a quick bout of multiplayer is not possible during your lunch break in between bottles of mountain dew and dorritos.Price of admission is high but if you like the look of this game as a whole there is a generously filled package waiting for you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Great game we all know that.However be wary of the recommended hardware settings my computer has an intel quadcore proc 8GB RAM and 2GB graphics (equal to or more than the minimum settings) but even with all the graphics on the rock bottom settings in 800x600 it's so laggy it's unplayable. I've heard other people say that the game is so optimized that turning the graphics settings UP can help with lag/framerate but that doesn't seem to work for me. Just be absolutely sure your computer can handle it before you drop the $60.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is really fun. Story mode has interesting characters and awesome dialogues. You play 3 characters in the game that are very different than one another which sets this apart from the past series. The graphics are gorgeous but if you don't have a beast of system (Titan X i7 ect.) you should really turn off all the graphics options in the advanced graphics section. I have a GTX 970 i7 2600k 4Ghz and 8GB ram and I am just running everything on high with 2x MSAA at 1080p and I get a constant 60fps. There were issues with stuttering especially when going fast in a car in Los Santos. I called Rock Star custom support and the guy I talked to was amazing. I talked to him about a number of issues and we tried to figure out how to stop or minimize the stuttering in the game. After trying a lot of stuff he suggested I minimized the stutter pretty well. There is also an issue with owned cars disappearing the story mode. For example I went to start a mission in a modded car after I got to the checkpoint for some reason my default car you have at the beginning of the game magically appeared and told me to get in it. I was really reluctant but I had to get in that car because Franklin was in it so I had to leave my modded car there. I set a marker so I could find my car so I could go back to it after I finished the mission. After I finished the mission I went back and the car disappeared. I looked to see if it was at the impound by the impound icon on the map wasn't there. I went to my safehouse and slept to maybe see if it needed time to register or something but still didn't see the car impound icon on the map... So I pretty much lost a car that I spent 100k on mods for. The effort to try and not have your modded cars go missing is too tedious for it to be worth it. Online for me is fun when you find good team mates with headsets for heists miserable the rest of the time. I spend most of my time in the clouds loading the game and the loading times are horrendous. Unlike in single player there is a feature to save your car and know where you car is via insurance which I wish would be in single player as well.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V. Somewhere around the fifth installment of the Grand Theft Auto (GTA) series. Enter a world of criminals and murderers. Climb your way up the criminal ladder by cutting out competition all the while following a compelling well written story. The city and surrounding area are beautifully made and you'll find yourself driving around the countryside just too see what's around. While finding the idea of jumping into a armored car and taking on another criminal organization head on extremely appealing there is one issue that destroys all semblance of that "real world" feel. There are only 20 maybe 21 radio stations. What is this? 1922?! In order for too feel fully immersed in a "realistic" world set in modern time we should want no demand to have access to hundreds of stations many of which should be full/semi static. All of the work and time put into the game was merely thrown out the digital window along with the modern head unit and was instead replaced by a piece of technology that mostly likely is still using tubes too function.Still waiting on the update with my FM trasmitter and static channles.Great strip club sim. 34.7/41.1

review: Over 2 weeks and the launcher still crashes because my documents aren't in the windows default location (domain user). I submitted a ticket to Rockstar on the issue and what would be needed to fix it. It took days to get a canned response linking me to a forum post that had nothing to do with the issue. The only way I can play is with a local account on the machine when every other game I have works just fine.Now aside from that FUBAR'd issue that they refuse to fix I have another problem. Framerates in fullscreen 1920x1080 are garbage. My GTX 680 struggles on low the maintain a playable FPS. Skyrim 1920x1080 2K+ res textures mods and shaders up the ying yang 90+ FPS all day. GTA V low settings 15 20 FPS. But if I put the game in Windowed mode at some funky resolution below 1920x1080 I can get 60+ FPS no problem. Long story short poor optimization.So I spent $60 on this game for PC with the sole intention of modding it and dumping hundreds of hours of my life into it with friends. However Rockstar has decided to ban people for using simple mods in single player. Way to go Rockstar. As if your reputation wasn't already dinged from the launcher issue for the PC release you decided you need to ding it some more. Folks until Rockstar gets their head out of their butt don't waste your money on this game. You'll have trouble loading it poor FPS and you'll get banned online for anything you do in SINGLE PLAYER.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Dont waste your money for this game guys. unless you wanna play it with friends or play campaign or something.Personally I liked the game a lot at the start you can buy your apartment (almost every player has the same 2 ones though) having a lot of cars customizing them even customize your character!But....Hackers. Hackers everywhere. At the start there havent been that much but since ppl started to realize it s so eazy to hack in gta their numbers are increasing. And GTA doesnt do anything about it (How it seems).Pvp is open world (there are maps for pvp but usually nobody plays them) there are up to 30 players on a server and it s rar that there are fully 30 people servers where there is no hacker online.Because they wanted to let the single player be fully moddable hackers can do quite a lot in online gta.With 1 click they can give themselves (or others) billions of dollars. can blow all players in the whole server up (and even make the system say it s you who blow them up) teleporting all weapons and i dont know what else i dont care anymore anyway.Then they have a bad lobbysystem almost none existent report system and only chance to get other people in your coop or pvpmissions is to invite them per handy but you get spammed on your handy so noone really pays attention for their handy.When you played gta for a while played every mission and heists for eternity there really is nothing to do anymore but killing players open world (but try to kill hackers let me watch plz i m grabbing popcorn)They sure bring in some new features but it s mostly 1 new pistol 2 new cars and that s it. Plus maybe another outfit.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have played GTA4 both the original and all the expansions and to briefly describe GTA5 it is the most sophiscated and realistic RPG to date. But it is still far from perfect still have room for improvement. For example it lacks some of the social features such as making GF hanging out with friends call friends to reinforce and help or other things that would better simulate the social interaction of the real world.The multiple character system is another questionable factor at least at its current performing level. The transition between characters are sometimes quite annoying and disruptive especially in the process of a mission. May be R STAR should try to let player decide which character to play from the start and then progress each character separately therefore making the story longer and eliminating unwanted disruption from switching characters.Also I still think there should be more interesting things to do in the freemode. Currently it looks like we are lacking some interesting features in the freemode and wasting the surprisingly huge map.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For those coming fresh to the experience you re about to play one of the best games ever made. It s still very much the Grand Theft Auto you ve known and loved since the series transitioned to 3D open worlds in GTA3 but it has been enhanced and improved to dizzying heights. I recommend this game all the way. If there is one game you play over and over and spend 100's of hours on then GTA5 is your game.

review: TL DR at the bottom of review.I've loved this game for a long time. I started my GTA V playtime on the ol' Xbox 360 and had an amazing time on it. Using glitches to get into weird areas playing heists (after about 2 years hurr durr) and of course having a fokkin blast shooting my friends' faces in and defending myself in public sessions and all around wreaking havoc. Then one day the PC Nation attacked. It was prepurchasable on Steam so I sold my CSGO knife for it (it was worth it I tell you) and some other miscellaneous items and began the download. It was 50 GB. So I out a whole house. It took over 48 hours to download and I'm frankly surprised the PC didn't explode while being on for so long. Anyway I played the PC Online loved it and decided to mess around with singleplayer mods. Turns out that if you forget to uninstall scripthookv as well you can get banned. So I got banned when going online after uninstalling everything except scripthookv. Now I'm banned. Not permanently but just until September 30th 2015 I can wait. I'm not changing this because of laziness.TL DR Began fun times on Xbox 360 got PC waited 48 hours for download played. got singleplayer mods and failed to uninstall one got banned for a week.11/10 would get banned again

review: When I try and play online it says GTA Online saved data for character 1 has been corrupted. It asks me to overwrite so I use that option but then quickly prompted with Rockstar cloud save failed while deleting your character. Please return to Grand theft Auto V and try again later. I have contacted Rockstar support and answering all their support questions multiple times (steam files verifications DxDiag msinfo speedtests etc..) but they still don t have an answer. I have ran addition system checks for corrupted files virus/spyware cleaners and tweaks redditors has suggested.When the game released I went to online and was able to create a character but once I started the tutorial within seconds the game crashed. Since then I have this character corruption issue and unable to play online. Single player works though.

review: I got the game for console and i loved it when i saw it on steam i thought for myself itd be a super purchase... and so i did..After purchase i couldnt run the game turns out the game has not been patched for switchable graphics's users and thus a large number of people cant run the game properly and are forced to use the "lowest settings" (Issue with AMD/intel switchable card graphics its a code error in the game not driver update problem and most games this days are compatible with switchable graphics).What a letdown.. however...The real reason i dont reccomend this game for steam is Rockstar support they havent replied to my tickets not even a "we re sorry" or "get a better pc" (not that id need one) but the demeanor of their support system is DISGUSTING ever since release i was perhaps one of the first guys to ask rockstar support about switchable graphics patch.. its been nearly TWO months and they have ignored me my ticket status is still on OPEN and no rep has contacted me (mind that i update my ticket every 2 days asking for help and getting none) in the last 2 weeksyou re better off playing it on console never thought id get to see a support service worse than Ubisoft.. Rockstar takes the cake now.screw this i wish i live in the UK so i could enforce a refund down their throaths via steam

review: I love GTAV even though it has some flaws my best friend and I always have a blast playing it. If you get banned for mods that's just idiotic you got banned for something else you don't get banned unless you were changing things while you were online. Sorry people just don't get banned. The game is hilarious and fun. Messing with people online is awesome. The story has its ups and downs it isn't bad but it isn't amazing either(except some parts). There is a ton to do and you will spend hours playing. Between my friend and I we own the game 7 times on every system some of them twice. PROS Almost endless fun.Great graphics.Many cars guns clothes and businesses to purchase.Long story mode for SP.Tons of easter eggs and funny side happenings.Great to play with friends.CONS You can't steal certain cars in "Grand Theft Auto" while in online mode.Online missions are repetitive and grindy.Loading times are still a joke.The first person feels off for some reason.Microtransactions.Whiny self absorbed childlike fanbase.You can't damage other peoples cars online too much or you get put into special lobbies and have a dunce cap.You can't put whatever cars you like in your garage to save.Children with mics.

But overall I think that is okay because that is a typical GTA trademark and gives the violence a needed cartoony touch.

review: &lt b&gt Review Grand Theft Auto V (Indonesian Language) &lt /b&gt &lt b&gt Detail/Deskripsi Game &lt /b&gt game aksi dan petualangan yang dikembangkan oleh Rockstar North dan di terbitkan oleh Rockstar Games. Game ini diterbitkan pada tanggal 17 september 2013 untuk console Playstation 3 dan Xbox 360. Game ini adalah game kelima belas dari seluruh game GTA Dan juga Berita dari Rokstar Games katanya Games Grang Theft Auto V ini akan ada di PlayStation 4 Xbox One dan juga di PC pada saat musim gugur 2014Grand Theft Auto V berlatar pada bagian negara fiktif yakni San Andreas (Di dunia nyata California Selatan). Sebelumnya San Andreas telah menjadi tempat berlatarnya Grand Theft Auto San Andreas. Berbeda dengan GTA San Andreas kota di GTA V hanya satu yakni Los Santos Berbeda dengan GTA San Andreas yang ada 3 kota. Untuk pertama kalinya dalam GTA Tokoh Protagonis bukan hanya satu melainkan Tiga yakni Franklin Clinton Michael De Santa dan Trevor Phillips. Ketiga tokoh protagonis tersebut memiliki ciri khas dan kekuatan masing masing.Grand Theft Auto V mencetak rekor penjualan dalam sejarah berikut ini adalah rekornya Best selling action adventure video game in 24 hours (12 milion copies) Best selling video game in 24 hours (564 milion$) Fastest entertainment property to gross $1 billion Fastest video game to gross $1 billion Highest grossing video game in 24 hours Highest revenue generated by an entertainment product in 24 hours (including Hollywood movies) Most viewed trailer for an action adventure video game Most viewed trailer of an action adventure video game (800+ milion views)&lt b&gt Kelebihan&lt /b&gt + optimasi tekstur graphics benar benar luar biasa+ texture benar benar detail+ day n night anda tidak hanya akan di manjakan dengan pergantian waktu tetapi dimanjakan dengan bayangan benda yang membuatnya sangat nyata+ cuaca hujan juga adalah feature terbarunya yang dimana anda bisa melihat tiap bulir hujan yang jatuh bahkan percikannnya juga sangat detail.+ Dunia malam ini juga termasuk featurenya yang sangat diandalkan mengapa karena biasanya di game lain ketika malam pasti akan terasa sepi tetapi di game ini anda akan merasa kotanya semakin rame sama seperti di kota kota besar dimana orang akan berkeliaran di malam hari+ Modenya sangat banyak seperti Mengemudi membuat misi perampokan terbang berburu diving mengendarai pesawat kapal selam kapal golf tenis kartu nge ganja balapan bermain di pasar bursa saham. Anda tidak akan pernah bosan dalam game ini bahkan di Single Player Mode.+ Pejalan kaki terasa lebih hidup dikarenakan melakukan banyak aktifitas lain baik itu mengobrol masuk keluar toko membunuh pejalan kaki lain memanggil taxi ketawa ketiwi dan aktivitas lain+ Ada Banyak Populasi Hewan + Ketika Makan menggunakan piring dan sendok tidak seperti sebelumnya.+ Jika kita membunuh atau melakukan kejahatan di suatu tempat wartawan akan datang ke lokasi kejadian dan TV yg ada di Safe House akan menyiarkan nya&lt b&gt Kekurangan&lt /b&gt Yah seperti di comment pertama oleh ChickenNinja mengatakan bahwa game ini membutuhkan pc high end dikarenakan system requimentnya sangat tinggi untuk low spec cuman bisa di 64bit baik itu vista seven dan eight sehingga banyak orang yang melakukan instalasi ulang OSnya dikarenakan hanya ingin bermain game ini. belum support di mac ataupun linux Customer Support responnya lama (mungkin karena masih baru dan banyak yang melaporkan error sana sini) sehingga anda harus sabar jika ada error di pc anda Mapnya itu itu adja D maksudnya hampir mirip dengan seri sebelumnya&lt b&gt Apakah Game ini direkomendasikan&lt /b&gt yah game ini sangat direkomandasikan apalagi dengan harganya yang tinggi dijamin pasti anda mau mainin itu gamenya terus wakakakaka..maaf yah terlalu panjang lebar tetapi jujur ini game benar benar keren intinya anda tidak akan rugi membelinya dengan harga segitu.dan mengapa banyak yang mengatakan aq dibanned??? dikarenakan mereka meng install mods. mods diperbolehkan untuk dimainkan di single player dan mods tidak di ijinkan dimainkan di multi player karena itu tidak adil. jika anda ingin memasukkan mods backup dulu data gta v anda dan masukkan modsnya. dan ketika anda ingin mainkan GTA V lagi restore backupnya... mengapa demikian karena di GTA V belum ada tombol untuk mematikan mods yang anda sudah install sehingga bisa menyebabkan anda di banned. NB check system requiment sebelum membeli bagi yang takut di banned ane udah jelaskan di bagian "Apakah Game ini direkomendasikan"

review: UPDATE Changed my recommendation to negative because almost the best overall game ever created in the history of mankind became victim to the capitalist greed of developers over time. Connection system of the game was already wrong and badly designed (It allows cheaters to easily bypass protection systems if any) it is now totally obsolete. New vehicles are only added for the sake of more profit. Players as a small time gang members or street thugs are now using state of the art vehicles that are even expensive for the most wealthy of nations in the world! Capable of destruction that makes the game unplayable for peaceful or passive players. Also cheaters are totally ignored they are having hell of a good time over here... OLD REVIEW Altough it is older than quite many titles of the same genre. GTA V is the valiant king of 'open world' throne none the less. Rockstar did well with creating a universe that is too similar to ours but yet too different and far away from it. Also it is still trying to keep up the pace with regular vehicle or item additions from time to time (Prices and requirements to buy/use them are ridiculous though).Game is about mayhem destruction and money. Single player is interesting altough some may find it dull and repetitive. But what makes this game different is the GTA Online true representation of human nature and psyche. Everyone starts out as a hero and ends up as the evilest villain of their dreams.You will most likely rage quit a million times. But come back just to feel the same wrath again. Because... it is GTA!Buy it if you want to kill time but be warned both single player and online may become repetitive as the sole purpose of the game is earning/grinding money. Nothing else.

review: I have severe buyer's remorse for purchasing this game on the PC. I own it on the PS3 and the only reason for buying the PC version was for the mods. Take2 in a stunningly greedy avaricious and transparent attempt to sell more Shark Cards and turn GTA into a "Freemium" game that you have to still purchase at full retail price has officially pulled the rug out from under the modding community and sucked the fun out of the Single Player experience.Someone needs to explain to the Housers that you can't double dip. When you sell a game for full retail price you should provide that game in its entirety with perhaps some nominally priced DLC.However if your intent is to basically tap the Freemium market like most mobile games and make your killing that way then it is encumbent upon you to make your game "Free to Play" and add in all the freemium content you please to bilk your customers the way that Take2 is doing with GTAO bucks or Shark Cards.It needs to be explained to the Housers that you can't have it both ways.That said as a person who already owned the game on the PS3 since launch a major selling point for me buying the game a second time was the mods. Honestly if all I wanted was the vanilla game why would I shell out another $59.99USD for the PC version?Inherently console games are smoother run with much less issues tweaking and compatibility problems and do not force you into having a particular GPU in order to run it. But that is getting away from the topic of this review.The reality is that when you try to strongarm your customer base as Take2 is doing by their despicable Caease and Decist order to the creators of OpenIV what you have effectively done is cancelled out the benefit of the PC version over the console. Rockstar/Take2 if you really insist on making GTA a freemium game modeled after all those mobile apps by companies like Gameloft then fine. Stop selling the game. Make it "Free to Download" and "Free to Play" just as Gameloft Kiloo and a plethora of other Freemium devs do. But stop double dipping and ripping your customers off.Some of us DO NOT play GTA in order to be bilked by Freemium thuggery. We expect to pay a full price for a game and in the case of PC GTA we expect to be able to mod the game. If you want to increase Shark Card sales then make the game Freemium and be done with it.Idiots!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After about 121.6 hours of playing this game and around 100 hours of playing Online This is my opinion on Grand Theft Auto VStory Mode The story mode to the game is wonderful. It's very fun to get into and I enjoyed it the whole way through. However I assume you're here for the shooting random people on the streets and enjoying a stroll in your new Progen T20. Well you can do that! The story mode is your sandbox. Do whatever you like with it! Including modding. Rockstar currently is open to the modding community for story mode only. Once you have soaked up all the fun you can have in this game without mods (currently impossible) you can begin modding. There are several mods currently out that are fantastic and there are many more to the. In all this game is highly detailed and great for both new comers to the franchise and lovers of the Grand Theft Auto games. 10/10 would reccomend again for story mode.Online Grand Theft Auto Online is fantastic on the PC edition at least in my opinion. Many complain about the rampent hackers making life in Los Santos a pain. In my honest opinion the game can be fun with hackers. Do not make the mistake of thinking "Oh just because this guy said the game can be fun with hackers means that I will enjoy the game forever with hackers! Yay!" No. Not too long ago I got fustrated when trying to go to a Los Santos Customs while constantly being blown up by hackers along with the rest of the lobby. But when hackers who are looking just to mess around for a good laugh with a good sense of humor come around it's great. Online has lots of both Rockstar and community made jobs to earn you money and keep you busy. You can spend your cash on weapons vehicles houses garages and more! If I had to put Online on a scale of 1 to 10... I'd give it a 9/10 because of the fustration I get here and there for hackers in the Online portion of the game. Do not let this stop you from having fun with your friends or by yourself though. In all I believe this game is a lot of fun. I spend many upon many hours playing with my friends and strangers battling to the death racing or having weird conversations while driving in a limo around Blaine County. And I've played hours on end trying to complete as much as I could in Story Mode. But Online seems to have this grip on me to where I cannot stay away from it xD. I know this is not really an in depth review that's because I am not a professional reviewer or critque. I just wanted to give my personal opinion about this game. For my final rating this game should get a 9.5/10. And you can see why I came to this from both the Story and Online modes. Thanks for listening to my opinion.

review: This game is so ****ing bad. I thought it would be great and all yea get cool cars do some cool s*** mess around with a bunch of people but no. You get ****ed over by ***ks with homing missiles orbital strike cannons and lots more money than you. When you try to get more money by vehicle import export you get assaulted by a bunch of players trying to get your loot. Solo public sessions should help but no you have enemies that spawn right in front of you with ******** cars and smgs with the accuracy of about 100000. I was around 3/4 mile away it was a long straightaway and the stupid 2 enemies in blue cars still were able to shoot my car. I lost so much profit from that ****. You can play stupid heists with horrible setups and pre setups (yup setups for the setups) where enemies spawn in front of you you have to control horrible vehicles that barely work properly (doomsday) and the heist itself is more boring than the setups. Thats another way to get money. Keep in mind that you have to do ALL of the setups every single time you want to do a heist for like 300 500k per. Could be worth if you did them fast enough but highly unlikely. You could do cargo runs where you get a piece of cargo and you deliver it but its ing cuz police everywhere and you need a semi and and its just ing horrible. Not to mention other players can interfere too. If you plan on playing with friends then you would probably wanna do ****ty heists because thats the only way money is shared besides vip work which is extremely boring and doesn't get that much money for you or your associate/bodyguard anyways. If you wanna do import export your friends dont get paid anything from the 30 80k (per car imported) or 10 50k(from cargo) so its almost useless unless you play heists which is once again very boring. Find a better multiplayer game. This game is a huge grind and R* doesn't seem to wanna fix this.

review: Pros Massive and detailed open world to explore. I've been playing this game for two years on last gen and current gen and I still keep finding new stuff in San Andreas. Controls are responsive even when using kb+m. Also one of the best keyboard driving controls I've ever experienced. Would suggest to tweak the plane controls though when you are using a keyboard. One of the best console ports I've ever played on PC. Rockstar did a good job optimizing this game for PC.Cons The story is IMO not on par with previous GTA suchs as GTA IV and GTA SA. In comparison to IV the story is a little bit short and simple but feels like it was rushed whereas IV had a fully developed and complex storyline. The story is still good though. Fewer side missions compared to previous GTA. While the S&amp F missions kind of helped with the post game content I was a bit disappointed that the side missions were mostly races and property missions. Heck the property missions doesn't even work properly and glitches out on most of my playthroughs. GTAO is a of grinding and game breaking mods.

review: I decided to give this game a more serious review because there are some things I want to address.I see a lot of reviews for this game saying that GTA Online is cancerous and the worst of the worst. I have played over 1200 hours of this game on the PC and well over 500 on the 360 (i lost track) and I can say with confidence that those claims are a little exagerated. Now I understand fully that hackers are everywhere and the job payouts were nerfed to encourage microtransactions. In fact I think we can all agree these are terrible things. However people seem to think that GTA Online is a place where they shouldn't be bothered by other people. It seems that people have forgotten what this game is. So I'll put out a reminder for anyone whos thinking about buying this game.Grand Theft Auto is a game where it is every man for himself. It is a game that can be unforgiving and sometimes unfair. It is a game where killing people is praised and wars are encouraged. If someone kills you in GTA Online it is not greifing and if they keep coming after you then find another server to play on. If you start a fight with someone bigger than you then don't act surprised when they start to kick your If you do freemode missions like moving cargo everyone in the server has the opportunity to destroy what you have and get a reward for it. That does not mean that whoever destroyed it is greifing especially when the game is encouraging it. Like every other game there are obstacles and a certain level of difficulty that comes with it. GTA Online is no different. So please take that into consideration next time you play online.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Favourite game ever.First GTA game I played was GTA 4 which at the time I thought was fantastic (even though I was a few years late). I got GTA 5 on PS3 PS4 and twice on PC (disc version screwed up so I got it on steam). Worth all of that money x10 and then some. The scale and depth in the game is mind blowing.I've since played the 3D era GTA games too. 5 is the balance between the HD gritty realism of 4 and the arcade style laid back mayhem of say San Andreas.Story Doesn't come close to the dark realistic shady story of 4 but that isn't what Rockstar were going for. It's great in it's own right. It knows when to have a serious tone and when to kick back and let the player have fun. Characters are well done too having 3 protags was a great idea. It doesn't sound important but accessing the world from 3 different perspectives is a stroke of genius. Michael and Trevor are well developed interesting characters. My complaint would be what they did with Franklin arguably he embarks on a bigger journey than the other 2 but isn't nearly as well developed for some reason. It's still fun to play as him and he's a good character but I feel they could've done far more with him. The other shortcoming is the comedy. It's funny but at times it feels really lame and juvenile tbh.World Don't really know how to describe this properly. It's insane. It looks beautiful there's variety (cities/hills/desert/towns/sea). It feels alive which is the most important thing. Feels very real. It's also a very good replica of LA. Only been there once but they managed to really capture the feel and look of the city. Big step up from 4 while it had an amazing city there was no diversity and it all felt really grey and washed out.Online The less I say about this the better. It is toxic and awful pay to win has taken over.Full to the ing brim with absolute bellends screaming into a mic and deafening everyone in the lobby hackers and low life incels who have nothing better to do than kill everybody online on GTA all day. Sunk countless hours into online with mates on PS4 back in 2015/16 tried a few times on PC a while ago was From what I can tell it's only got worse. Enter at your own risk.I don't have time to play online anymore and even after beating the story and getting 100% quite a few times over the years I still play it. Install a mod replay a mission cruise around or something to that effect. Can't run out of to do. I will mention that I barely played in 2017 so I guess I kinda got the novelty of playing it back recently.10/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For the single player game the open world and the graphics were top notch probably the most impressive looking open world game I've played. Driving felt good npcs around Los Santos were really well done radio music was great as always and I also liked the fact you can play 3 different people and switch at any time. Lots of great humour and just an incredible looking game. What let it down for me was outside of missions there isn't really that much to do. I tried playing it more immersively taking my time checking out Los Santos and all that and staying away from missions. For the first couple of hours it felt great but once you've driven about played a game of golf had a game of tennis done a triathalon parachuted out of a plane punched a few people had a high speed chase with the cops it gets a bit boring and so you just end up following the missions. I would have preferred something to keep me gripped outside of the missions something that gave me a reason to go out and explore every inch of the incredible open world but I just got bored after a while. Missions for the most part were varied and exciting to do especially the heists. I did find some missions to be a bit arcade like on rails press this button press that button etc but overall they were decent. I might play it again it has replayability cos you can choose different options to do missions and heists and it is a great looking open world. Maybe i missed something i dunno.Great game but could have been better for the single player. An incredibly rich and detailed open world... that I didn't give a monkeys about exploring. I'd give a solid 8.5/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A complete masterpiece in terms of world design and singleplayer experience but I wouldn't get this for the multiplayer. It's a micro transaction shitastrophe full of hackers with little to no depth. I really really hope they re think the multiplayer experience from the ground up as the world/mechanics are incredible.

review: Greetings fellow Steam user and welcome to this installment of 'Bullcrap of the Week' the only news program dedicated to talking a bunch of trash about popular games and what better way to start than with the game that went from 100 to 0 real quick (pun intended).Our top story Grand Theft Auto developers Rockstar have decided to take action against cheaters and modders by removing millions of illegitimate dollars from modded accounts. Now that's what Rockstar would have liked to hear but in actuality their anti cheat system has instead chosen to remove legitimate dollars from innocent players without warning. The amount stolen is estimated to be between 100k to a staggering 20 mil! Everyone is currently outraged from this act but Rockstar as they are known to do have chosen to stick the middle finger up to players that actually tried to get their money back through Rockstar Support by sending their preset copy and paste 'we don't know what you're talking about' responses to those who questioned.Also in the news Smuggler's Run is now the 4th dlc to use the 'spend money to make money' feature by yet again having to buy a property and go on tedious missions to make a fraction of its initial cost. This scheme was used previously when buying office buildings biker clubhouses and military bunkers. Now however you can do the same thing again but in a hanger instead. Three cheers for uninspired 'free' dlc!Our final news segment is more of a reminder than anything ground breaking however I think it still has to be said. Sorry to break any diehard GTA players hearts but the singleplayer is most likely never going to get a proper dlc addition. Why you may ask? In the wise words of Shane McMahon 'Ching ching bling bling cut the cheddar. If you ain't talking money then your talking don't matter'. By that I mean that they are more focused on releasing the previously stated 'new and interesting' online expansions. Going back a few months ago the hype train had left the station with the GTA community onboard when dataminers found a supposed 'Agent Trevor' and 'Zombie' dlc file in the game's steam files. However like a famous internet personality trying to become relevant again through diss tracks this all didn't go according to plan as Rockstar were quick to confirm that they were never going to release dlc for the single player of Grand Theft Auto V. Who knew a game company could hold the world record for the largest party pooper on Earth?This will conclude this edition of 'Bullcrap of the Week'. I do hope this was somewhat helpful and please do your sad homeless starving self a favour and don't buy sharkcards no matter how tempting they may be. No I'm being serious there are still bright ones in the Steam community who actually think buying shark cards is the best way to spend their Maccas paycheck.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It was a fun run but this game has gone stale.Let's list some cons *Rockstar is very anal about selling Shark Cards (Shark Cards are basically the EA equivalent to loot boxes but Shark Cards award GTA dollars in exchange for real life currency).*Every update shows spikes in prices on new vehicles and other content (presumably to push Shark Card sales).*The Online community is riddled with hackers. It is quite common to join a session with at least one hacker playing with you. They can disrupt your gameplay experience and Rockstar hasn't been very keen on stopping them. (Except when the hackers give other players free GTA money).*If you receive money from a hacker there is a good chance Rockstar will find out and subtract the money from your Online balance.*There's a connectivity issue where your online session will randomly lag out showing all players leaving your session at the same time. *The customer support is garbage.Now let's see some pros *The story mode gives you a decent amount of gameplay. (It doesn't quite compare to the Online gameplay).*It's fun to screw around. (You can't rampage through town in a tank or harrier jet and expect to come out alive irl).*There's plenty of easter eggs to find in Story mode.I'd recommend this game if the newer content wasn't so ridiculously expensive. Because of the inflated in game prices it's harder for new players to get caught up to those who are more advanced. If I were to make a suggestion I'd say just stop making free content and make the content paid and full unrestricted access to those who paid for the dlc. But Rockstar isn't known for listening to fan suggestions.
