title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Amazing game held back by HORRIBLE microtransactions. Definately worth it if it's on a good sale but unless you're willng to pay hundreds to thousands on micro transactions are ok with grinding (which isn't "TOO" bad but frustrating nonetheless) have a modding friend or mod yourself then freemode isn't very enjoyable. The (albeit amazing) singplayer game is not worth it for $69.99 (canadian). CONS *MONEY*As stated above it simply is not worth the 70 bucks if you have no way of making money in freemode (getting 20k doing jobs by other people or stealing 2k from a store is pathetic). The freemode genuinely has enless hours of content with free DLC released years after original launch. The problem? The amount of fun you get depends on the money you have. DLCs cost money vehicles cost money weapons and ammo cost money everything costs money. I am lucky enough to have a modding friend and in turn limitless money (though I don't take too much.. that would just make the game pointless). Freemode is the crown jewel of this game IF you have the money for it. Otherwise it is an utter waste of time after a couple hours unless you find a good modder.*MODDERS*You've seen enough about this in the reviews... Some are s very few are nice and help you with money or with someone who keeps spawn killing you and most are annoying and spawn in random crap on you or turn on god mode aimbot etc. which just ruins any purpose of being in a multiplayer session.*NOTHING ELSE*I genuinely have not a single other complaint... it's just these two cons that ruin one of the best games ever made. PROS *SINGLEPLAYER*One of the best singleplayer campaigns ever. I'm nowhere near finishing it but friends of mine have player hours upon hours of it calling it the best singleplayer ever made. (being an RPG fan.. hard to say that but it's still great). With amazing acting interesting ways of teaching you the game genuinely great animation (considering how long it is) fun gameplay genuinely funny moments (if you're ok with dark humour) and a list that just goes on and on.*EVERYTHING (freemode only if you got money*It's a huge map with limitless possibilites of stuff to do. There are the smallest things that they created... tennis (which is pretty well done... like a $1.99 game on steam) golf (haven't done yet) shooting ranges movie theatres online websites (including a show that's like an adult version of what you really see on a morning on Cartoon Network) and so many small details and things to do. There are also thousands of GTA races and games to do... It's unreal.This is easily one of the best games ever made... Or would've been.... If micro transactions weren't so necessary to truly enjoy a huge portion of this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Overall I give this game 7/10. The single player is great. The story is well thought out and full of comedy scheming and bloodshed. That's all good and great but the multiplayer is horrendous. Every update they release is just more pay to win pay to win pay to win mechanics added. The amount of grind it takes to accumulate the ridiculous amount of ingame cash is overwhelming. When the game first released the online experience was something you could get lost in but now it is just full of cheaters and people who invest their whole paychecks into the game and is not profitable for someone who just has 30 minutes a day to play. With all that said one of my favorite parts of this game is the ability to mod. BE WARNED YOU CANNOT MOD THE ONLINE PLAY ONLY SINGLEPLAYER. It is unfortunate that Rockstar is very anti modder but the community has found ways around it. I enjoy daily playthroughs of doing the Lord's Work on a mod called LSPDFR. In this mod you play as a LEO and the community has put every last bit of thought into it trying to make it as REALISTIC to the real job as possible. I can't get enough of it. It makes it a completely different game entirely. From traffic stops to domestic disturbances LSPDFR is a buggy yet enjoyable LEO roleplaying/simulator that I will enjoy for years to come. In conclusion if you re into this game for the online experience get together a loyal friend group and be prepared to spend lots real world money for ingame currency. If you re in it for the single player modding experience I recommend visiting GTA5 mods.com or lspdfr.com for great modding tools. Enjoy

review: If you've ever played a GTA game before you know what you're getting here many hours of sandbox fun with lots of tongue in cheek story missions and side missions inside an impressive simulated city. Everything in GTAV elaborates on the prior games and then some the city is more populated the countryside grander the attention to detail is pushed further. There's even three main protagonists over the traditional single starring character giving you some interesting personalities to inhabit and wreak havok around the city.Whilst GTAV isn't subtle or particularly clever with any of the themes it explores it steers between parody and homage whilst still keeping an element of tension. The three protagonists are each interesting with their own plots that interweave together as the game progresses. Overall the story is slightly sloppy and overlong but studded with a few diamonds and builds to a satisfying ending. Certain missions really stick out as a highlight especially several of the heists new multistage missions that require planning and preparation including selecting a crew and a method of approach to the job stealing uniforms getaway vehicles etc.A 'director mode' provides greater freedom to play in the sandbox offering unlimited access to the weapons and characters that you've unlocked in story mode and a slew of settings such as pedestrian density time of day weather and many other variables. You can record footage and edit it together although I found the editor a little sloppy and slow I'm sure the patient will be able to stitch together something interesting whilst others will simply utilize software outside of the game for best results.Finally there's the online component. I've played very little of the online mode (due to time restraints rather than enjoyment) but in all honesty it's the icing on the cake. There are missions to complete apartments to buy and crazy players to run away from. It's more of the same but a little less controlled. I went in a shop to buy some clothes and came out to find a player flying a plane attempting to land in the street shearing the wings off and ultimately hurtling down the street as a fireball whilst I scuttled nervously back to my car. Fun stuff.GTAV offers the franchises biggest sandbox so far to get lost and go a little crazy in and there's plenty of fun to be had.

review: I will never understand why a company completely demolishes user communities that create content that people want. They C&amp D'd OpenIV and demolished a community that actively used and supported the game. It's not like people could pirate the game through this you had to already have a game to use this mod. The GTA Online product has become completely useless and unplayable by those not cheating. R* got good and was able to detect and ban users the used OpenIV however there are more sophisticated mods out there that the s are using to ruin online play. review: A fun game but I don't recommend it at full price.Story is entertaining however aside from the main cast the characters aren't as memorable as previous GTA games. Missions are mostly drive to x maybe shoot/hijack/beat up y then drive to z. Par for the course for GTA which isn't really a bad thing so perhaps I'm just getting tired of it since I've played every game since III gratuitously. Controls are tight and shooting is improved over GTA IV.Multiplayer was fun when I played it with friends but these days it's filled with hackers which can either increase your enjoyment (someone running around shooting ferris wheels out of their gun) or squash it. Rockstar bans people who try to mod in their own MP experience so you're limited in that regard.Pick it up if it's at $40 that's my recommendation.

review: Short VersionThe GoodDrivingThe charactersMoment to moment awesomenessThe soundThe worldThe MediocreThe plotFlying/Boating/Diving/SwimmingThe guns/shooting thingsThe BadCover mechanicsTime to complete (personal time) b 40hrs (just main story and some side missions not 100%)Final ThoughtsIf you like gangster movies and driving the singleplayer is awesome.If you have a group of friends (ideally 3+) who all have headsets the online portion is great fun.Rambling VersionThe singleplayer portion of this game is fantastic. Driving is a lot more refined than in GTA 4 and doesn't fling you half way across the map for bumping a fire hydrant when barely moving. Motorcycles are also much more lenient (almost rediculously so). It makes for a much more fun gameplay wise.NOS is sadly missing from cars though they go plenty fast without it. The feeling of sudden bursts of uncontrollable speeds will be missed but the driving feels much more refined and more than makes up for the bursts of speed.Shooting feels solid and the addition of NPCs falling over and continuing to shoot from a downed position adds an incentive to perform headshots (or blow everything up with explosives). However the cover mechanic is still finicky and feels 'sticky' in certain fights.There is so much detail in this return to San Andreas and a lot of throwbacks to previous games. The environment tells as much about a character as the story does so high textures are a must to get the full enjoyment out of things rather than staring at blurry pictures that often times contain Easter Eggs.The story is held up by the characters and the drive to learn more about them drives you on rather than the overarcing plot which is a bit cliche. Each of the characters are interesting in their own way and seeing their interaction with other is a hell of a lot of fun.In short it's fantastic but the world already knows that.The online portion is a separate entity. Online community asside GTA V feels very restrictive in terms of online play. Players cannot host their own custom servers with mods enabled or private free roam instances. They can only connect to a list of things choose from a list of things and play a list of things. While there is user created content it's a bit more restricting than normal.What's there is pretty fun to play but much like Payday GTA V's online is most fun when played with people you know and ideally a full team of friends who all have voice chat and have a tolerance for restarting over and over again due to silly deaths.On the note of deaths the load times are horrible between matches so failures can be punishing on patience. The syncing on the other hand is quite fantastic considering the ludicrous speeds you can go at in a sports car. Everything remains relatively sync'd riding shotgun in a car at high speeds (with a few lag spikes) with multiple people in a map.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I don't usually write reviews for games but I felt I had to for this one. I haven't even been able to play near as much as I would like to because of life and work and stuff but what I have played has been incredible. I was one of those people who were extremely upset about having to wait so long after this had been released for the consoles for this to finally come out on PC but comparing this to the Xbox One version that my son plays it was definitely worth the wait. The graphics are gorgeous even on my 5 year old PC. I can run this game at max settings and the game never even gives a slight hiccup. The absolute only thing that has bothered me with this game is when trying to go back to my house to save the game some missions just start when I get to the door. I wasn't a fan of having to go home to save the game and I had hoped for something different with GTA V. Maybe like the Saints Row games. Other than that I have yet to find anything to make me regret buying this game. I can't comment on the online portions of the game as I rarely play any games online and have yet to even try GTA V online. I do like the iFruit app that I have on my real phone that lets me train the dog as well as other things outside of the game. I give this game a 9 out of 10 because nothing's perfect but this game comes pretty close to it!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There is SO much in this game. So much to do so much to see. So much detail. The largest and most alive GTA environment yet. I haven't even tried the online part of the game yet. I just can't get into detail about everything here. If you are a fan of sandbox open world games like other GTA games and Saint's Row etc then you need to give this a try. Although not necessary I chose to upgrade my vid card from a GTX 770 to a 970 so that I could bump up the graphic details even higher than I was running. One thing I can explain with a little detail is the graphics settings screens. There is a video memory meter that shows how much GPU memory you are using with each tweak and setting change so that you can maximize your preferences visually. And then you can run a quick framerate test that is part of the game to see your FPS for your latest setting. Good stuff.

review: Honestly I haven't played much multiplayer as I didn't like it all that much.But the story.One of the best i've seen in a video game.If you only play the campaign the hours you spend will outweigh the cost of the game itself.Story takes around 40 hours to complete and there are a TON of side missions that are both intruiging and worth your time.Graphics are really beautiful on max and Los Santos is an extremely varied and detailed open world to explore.The three protagonists are quirky and I found myself relating to Michael quite a bit (maybe too much) but whatever.Franklin is overally pretty chill and a cool character to play as.Trevor is a d*ck but can also be funny.There are a lot of characters and I think the ending of the game tied things together well which seems to be lacking in certain games i've played recently. The campaign may be boring at first but after the characters are introduced things get a lot more interesting.One of the best open world games I implore you to get it for the campaign only as I have no buyer's remorse at all.8.5/10.

review: "Obvious Console Port"I wanted this game to live up to the hype in some way its does but major issues exist.Pros it was finally released on PC? largeish sandbox area to explore or is it? Somehow it feels smaller than the San Andreas title's map. there are no locked areas you can drive around immediately (compare to Vice City's locked bridges)Cons joystick support (which worked in Vice City) is lacking and the keyboard+mouse controls make attacking with the Little Bird gunship impossible while yawing uncontrollably. mouse aiming of weapons is not smooth making precision fire more difficult than it should be. graphics don't feel modern there is a lot of obvious stippling or dithering on most textures. the much bragged about first person camera mode lacks an aim down sight feature.Finally I have to say this plays more like a $30 title $60 is a real robbery vice a PC game one. Grudgingly checking "yes."

review: Playing this game since the first day it came out on the PS3 first day it came out on PC gives me enough time to fairly judge this game.I've been playing Grand Theft Auto for years I recall the basic missons from GTA London and the revolution of third person in GTA III. I can say without a doubt I loved Vice City the best but the game that kept me intereted for years after the release is GTA San Andreas with the multiplayer mod. Today thousands of people still play on SA MP roleplaying racing etc.I belive GTA Online brings along this same feel and is yet to be changed by the hands of brilliant modders. The thing that everyone wants is complete control of the game so that they can make the changes they want if it's to the map to the script etc.I have fun logging on everyday and playing a little bit but I only stay for long durations when I'm playing with friends on Teamspeak. The excessive amount of hackers and trolls today make it somewhat boring but this is expected for every game. Decisisons on how to ban hackers and who they gave an advantage to is difficult to make when it is possible half your player base is bannable.Single player is a fun branch of this magnificent release that brings new generation leveled material to the consumer. It brings back references from old games in the series while accomodating the new blood. I never had performance issues and my own rig is a pretty basic set up running it at ultraOnline is summed up as this if you have friends it'll be fun. Doing hesists with randoms tends to get boring when they die repeatedly because one person left the other behind or hit him with the car. Having /friends/ makes online win.I would suggest this game to others and getting any DLC they put out as Rockstar has been generous with content. This is now my go to game until Fallout comes out.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Alright how do I even begin?Grand Theft Auto Five is a game that was once loved and treasured by people worldwide. It had beautiful game design interesting characters and a awesome online. But notice how I m using past tense. Grand Theft Auto was once a good game but those days are long gone.It all started back when Rockstar noticed that more and more people were playing their game. Now obviously Rockstar took advantage of this and released some more DLC. The first one that really caught my eye was the Ill Gotten Gains DLC. It introduced the world of GTA to Yachts a giant boat that players could get. Now while this was all great for its time I would like to point out the fact that Rockstar charges people a minimum of 6 Million in game dollars for one! The most expensive being somewhere around the 13 Million mark. This is absolutely insane since Rockstar has a cash bundle that players can buy to boost their money. The most expensive one being 8 Million dollars for 100 real life dollars! I originaly bought this game at full price and im honestly shocked that Rockstar would even dare to make a deal as ludicrous as that since its basically a game of Who is richer in real life? The people who get this game for sale and recently will be bullied relentlessly by the richer and higher ups who have magic space cannons and flying cars taken straight from Back to the Future!Moving to more recent events I cannot ignore the outbreak of modders and their impact on the community of players in GTA. While there are people who have not relied on modding or external sources for money there are people who with just a few clicks can get everything you ve spent the last year on is pretty unfair. Especialy since those people can just blow you up for no reason just for fun. Basically Rockstar will turn a blind eye as players who have worked on their businesses for months will get everything ruined in seconds. Worst of all Rockstar takes advantage of people s anger and pushes the Microtransactions even further.In conclusion Rockstar created a monotlith of a game that has gone bad. Once it was a masterpiece now it will be forgotten buried under the greed that led to this. If you re interested in buying this game now I recommend you go to the pharmacy first and buy Headache pills and Anti Depressants.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Like many others I've grown up on the Grand Theft Auto franchise way back when it was just a top down game. If you've played GTA IV recently a lot of the major elements from that game are the same in this game. While I haven't played too much of the single player mode the new three character storyline is very cool and the ability to switch between different playable characters while on mission is neat as well. The biggest bonus of this version of the game is a much expanded online mode. Now with GTA Online you have a customized character (up to three) and a bank account which allows you to do jobs to earn money for cars weapons and apartments. GTA Online has a bit of storyline feel to it with the heist mode where your character and three of your friends help plan setup and pull off various heists for big cash.

review: I played through it on the XboX 360 2 years ago. Now I find myself playing through the story again I don't know what it is. It's not the graphics I'm not a graphics person and I could care less how good a game looks as long as it's fun. I started playing the PC version and lost track of time I couldn't stop playing. It was "Oh let me just do one more thing then I find myself in a chase then let me do one more thing..." Until about 4 30 a.m. This game will keep you going until it's finished and then some! As far as running on a PC I have a 3 1/2 year old PC and it runs the game on Normal video settings with an Nvidia GTX560 TI Direct CUII 1GB 950mhz 6 Core AMD FX Processor at 4.1 Ghz and I cranked up a few things to max which still left space on the video card 16 GB of ram. I am running the game between 70 90 FPS and no stuttering and is smooth no overheating or even coming close to the limits. It's watercooled with a corsair H60 as well which may be helping so I don't know as far as basic fans go. The graphics are still better than either of the consoles.

review: 1/10. Flip flops don't flop in GTA O. Rockstar plz. In all seriousness this is the best version of GTA yet less than 10 seconds to load into GTA O or GTA SP from either or and only about 15seconds to load into the game on first launch. 9/10 loading screens.Graphic settings is amazing you can control pretty much everything about this game. Only drawback is no matter how high it is reflects still look like in cars. Textures and grass/water looks amazing 8/10 graphics. Combat is so much smoother than peasent boxes way easier to aim while driving or just aiming in general is a hell of a lot easier 10/10. Keybindings can be a bit weird but nothing too off. Being able to do anything you want without having to move your hand off of WASD is pretty nice. All in all i give this version of GTA V 9/10 . WAY WAY WAY better than peasent box versions.

review: Gta used to be amazing. I used to play on a different account but I wanted to start iver hence my low play time. Anyway GTA was amazing but because of multiple horrible updates and modders the game isn't as fun. I mean the new Super vehicles just make it so much easier for griefers and try hards. I mean Ive been stuck in the same place for 30 minutes being spawnee killed before I could use my overpowered obliterate Cannon to kill them. Speaking of that everything is now way to expensive. I mean it costs 500k to use that cannon. Whatever. Luckily I'm rich. I'm not going to get started on modders because you could just watch any gameplay video and find one. It's ridiculous. I don't mind modders that kind their own business but the ones that just kill you over and over are just so annoying. Yeah it may seem like I've been trashing the game but it's still super fun. Although it takes a stuiped amount of grinding to get rich once your rich it's so much fun. Im not gonna explain the fun just watch some BEST WINS AND LOSES COMPLICATIONS videos to understand. Also watch some Doomsday heist videos cause that's a really fun thing to do. To conclude if you have time to spend at least 5 6 hours a week for like a month or two then buy it. If you only have like an hour or two a week this game will bore you to death. Gta is super fun and I DO RECOMMEND THAT YOU BUY IT but only if you have some time. Also get the app Gamerlink to find people to play with.

review: Adding my hours from Xbox 360 Xbox One and now PC I have somewhere around 600 hours in all. I love this game. But the DLC is getting worse and worse. Prices are going up on everything. It's obviously meant to encourage players to buy Shark Cards. I would be fine with it but even if you spent the max ($100) you still wouldn't even come close to owning every car from even just one DLC update. I've grinded out money to the point of insanity and after the release of the Import/Export update I just looked at the $2 million dollar minimum price tag on the cheapest vehicle and quit. The income produced by grinding just isn't enough and I'm not spending $100 on Shark Cards let alone $500 to actually afford everything. Now that they killed the Modding community for single player I've decided to not recommend this game anymore. It's just sickening.

review: Short version Storymode should be about the story not getting stuck in an endless police spawning mechanic loop making for an overly time consuming chase that kills any story progression. Shouldn't need codes to evade cops at 22% completion when it took way less before that point. (Note I am NOT talking about chases in missions I mean wanted levels from bumping cops or hitting someone.)...Having owned and played every GTA for the Pancaked first game till now I will say I do love the series.... BUT.... while playing solo story mode the police get to be a load of horse crap. Very early game (less than 6% completion) you can opt to litterally just outrun the police and a realistic number of spawned cop cars are on the map which is great and lets you use your skills behind the wheel to evade them. Now get to around 22% and every time you get a 2 star wanted level there will ALWAYS be a cop popping up less than a block infront of you regardless of where you are or where you are going or how often you hit side streets backroads or vross country.Frankly I find it completely crap mechanic that I had hoped wouldn't have followed from previous games (Which tended to abound in the console versions especially...).After an hour of said horse crap I finally said screw it and found the built in 'codes' to remove my wanted level after a mix of james bond and fast/furious driving skill couldn't overcome the crap mechanic... Which litterally screwed the entire experience for me.Do to this crap alone I would rate this a 3/10. No game mechanic should force you in to a never ending loop of crap.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After the long wait the game I always wanted to play is here. The Unpacking took a while for me but after that the game runs FANTASTIC. my system setup is a 3rd gen i5 8gb of ram and SLI 660 setup 144hrz monitor. The game runs over 60fps all the time. Kinda hovers between 71 low to as high as 95 fps in indoor enviornments. I have high shawdows high textures. I cant run the game on very high textures cuz I only have 4098mb of total video ram available and the game requires about 4300mb of video ram for that setting. Causing some textures to look a little blurry to me. but thats due to my dated graphics card. I have not played online yet. Want to get a better feel for the story. game is A+

review: GTA5 is a series that keeps tweaking and refining their formula to improve with each iteration. The latest entry is no exception. This game manages to put more of everything you ve come to expect from GTA and then fill it up with even more stuff.The driving has never been more fun and varied. The city has never been bigger. The shooting has never been more intense. To top it all off the characters and dialogue in the game are really masterfully done. The campaign is a mix of campy and serious action movies mixed with some heist movies with a dash of comedy. To add even more to the great campaign there are many extras that you may never even experience in the game. Aside from the mini games (darts golf tennis yoga) there are many side quests in the game some of which can take hours to complete! Some of the side quests are secrets to find!You don t have to be a fan of the series to enjoy this game. Unless you are offended by the content this title has everything any gamer could find enjoyable in a single player game. 10/10 Amazing

review: A Game not more not less1. The Singleplayer as such is a solid expierience though there exist some minor.Story You are playing 3 characters Michael Franklin and Trevor .Michael is a good written Character whose Life focuses mostly on his family life and his relation to Trevor.Trevors Character suffers greatly from being almost one sided crazy and hating everything. Franklin is the Character which stands for a bit of sanity starting with a "Ghetto" life and trying to escape this life.2. The biggest problem of this game is by far the so called multiplayer why so called you may ask well here is why i don't consider it a multiplayer though you can interact with others the multiplayer .Suffers of Major problems .First the grinding if you start of you soon realise you need to do heists to get some money and reputation .The problem is The levels are ridiciulos long after a certain point i would say 30. Also at the beginning you start with a pistol seems ok right no. It is not ok Gta Vonline is disgraceful to newcomers .If you are fortunate you will be killed after a few minutes into the Game if you are unfortunate after a few seconds.(If you are on a Full server this isn't rare)The houses itself are acceptable at price but the armored cars which alomst everyone uses are overpriced the first armored car you can get is the armored kuruma which only takes around 525k The next Problem is this is a PC game and rockstar seems to forget one thing about Pc gaming you are not bound to just play the game no.This Game suffers extremely due to easy access to hacking tools .A Gullible Ban system which doesn't even work since a unban tool is available for free if you do some research.This Hacking Problem is also strengthend by the ridiculous pricing of the vehicles. If you own an armored vehicle like the Insurgent with a cal 50 mg you have literaly no enemys except a few tanks. everything else does almost no scratch to this vehicle .The only good thing is that you can collaborate with your friends in online Games .This gets boring really Quickly. Or you can kill opther players and ruin their expierience your choice.The Community is as bad as in Battlefield or Call of Duty.3.The Gameplay is below average for AAA or Average if you count less well known companys.The Gunplay right something i want to point out an Ak has almost no recoil does less damage than a G36 a plastic rifle makes sense right? But gun balancing itself is OK realism is not existant first cars unflip themself if you press d or a .At this point i guess they wanted to make it a more fluent expierence and ignored realism fine that's ok.In case you fly during a Thunder Storm your aircraft is influenced by Wind a good thing.The controls for aircrafts are a pain if you play standard controls you will soon notice that one hand has to deal with the right Number Pad while the other uses w a s d to control the flying. Did i already mention the Cod like recoil? No? oh well then the recoil is non existant .Play a few minutes of Arma or S.T.A.L.K.E.R to have a realistic recoil.The weapon selection is basic most weapons have a similar purpose and are either a bit stronger have a little bit more range.Mostly Full automatic weapons and some Handguns no Bolt action rifles. ( I do not consider the Snipers rifles counting to normal guns )Rockstar considerd paying less money for licences of everything to be a good idea. Final resumeé the balancing of Online Multiplayer is awful not bearable for a AAA company like Rockstar. Average Gameplay Good Story Good Graphics This Game has a good Story acceptable Graphic fidelity and an Awfull Multiplayer.Story is easyly a 7/10Graphics 8/10Multiplayer 3/10Gameplay 5/10If you buy this game for Online you will find yourself cheating if it's just begging for money from other hackers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V has an amazing single player story worth playing through it was clearly meant to be more than it turned out to be as it feels like most DLC content to be released for it was shelved or released as online content instead which is extremely sad. As fun as the online can be it is always riddled with small problems and instabilities long loading times hackers and modders. I never expected this game to have so much going for it people even skip the story for the online part altogether missing what great story is there that would add to their online experience later knowing the characters and the world better. Without the single player the game world in my opinion is just a shell made of pretty graphics. Rockstar could easily have added a lot of the vehicles and content for online into single player for people that enjoy a more single player experience like myself. But it seems unlikely that Rockstar would do that at this point in time.If you plan to play the whole package I recommend getting into it. If you're playing purely for online just forget it and play something else that won't rob your time and money.I recommend it for the single player alone.

review: This game is worth the money for the single player alone end of story. Compared to 4 the story line is less... dumb. There isn't a lot to complain about with this game. But there are still some.The interface (menus controls etc) are very complicated and leave me wondering if the Rockstar devs ever spend any significant amount of time playing PC games before they set out to make this version.The online is pretty fun its admiteddly not exactly what I had hoped for but its still a good part of the game. The jobs and heists are a lot of fun when you have the right group setup. However that is the catch the community sucks. So predictably finding a group that isn't full of trolls or doesnt have at least one bad apple can be challenging. Thankfully though their is a pretty clever reputation system in place so hopefully the environment for "friendly" players will become more enjoyable.The online also has very long load times at the moment though its kinda sporadic. Sometimes your in a job in 30 seconds sometimes it can take a few minutes...Aside from all that for being about 3 weeks old the game is really good and will likely only get better.

review: I've had major issues with this game for a while and honestly didn't realize that I hadn't left a review but now I realize might be the perfect time since there's such an uproar and take two really needs to know they ed up.My main issue with this game is the banning system. These imbeciles had a 3 strike policy on bans (I believe it's now 2) that even though I had video proof of a hacker shooting money at me still got me banned (and I'm sure that the hacker didn't). By the way they also can't tell you why you got banned there is no logging system for this apparently so no way to figure out what might be happening and if their system is having issues so they assume their system is infallable. So banned once 10 days later started playing again because I thought it must be a mistake unfortunately not as a few hours later I got slapped with a 30 day ban. I was furious so I contacted Rockstar support to try and figure out what the hell happened and why I kept getting banned. Well let me tell you about the ing amazing crew that Rockstar hired to do support. The first thing you get in response to submitting a ticket is a copy paste response of the email they send you to let you know you've been banned basically saying you're a hacker and bans are non appealable. They then proceed to disallow you from making another ticket for 24hrs. So over the course of a few weeks I finally manage to get ahold of someone who actually listens to me and I show them the video and they wipe the hacked money from my account. Success right? Well no actually. I finish out the rest of the 30 day ban and as had been reading on forums that certain programs running in the background may be detected as hacks. So I turn off evga precision I turn off Shadow play I turn off Windows defender I turn off Logitech gaming software anything and everything I can think of. As soon as I load in. Boom perma banned. I was so done with this game.Fast forward to a few days ago when I just finished rebuilding my PC and decided I wanted to crank up the settings and replay the story mode. All was going fine but I noticed they stopped adding the dlc to single player so I looked for mods for the game to add them in and that's when I stumbled across this whole openIV thing and was thoroughly disgusted with Rockstar and Take Two. I can't recommend this game to anybody. I can't believe that one of my favorite games became this monstrosity. I will never buy another Rockstar game until they right their wrongs and something tells me it's gonna be a while. P.S. here's the video of the hacker shooting money https //youtu.be/XcinCFe9sC0P.P.S. I'm sure there's mistakes galore in this since I'm writing it on my phone so I apologize in advance.

review: GTA V seemed like a fun game when I got it. It was wonderful when I played it however there were many problems. Lagged out my PC. It was an efficiency build but I set the game to the lowest settings. It lagged the least when I was in buildings but when driving (the point to the game) it lagged HARD. Had what could only be considered junkware in it. After I removed the game Rockstar Social was still on it. It took up over half of my hardrive. Has terrible ethics. I played with mods sometimes and the Tsunami Mod was a blast. Rockstar takes away mods? I tanks away my trust for them. Also the iFruit app takes up so much space as well. Doesn't care about hacking. I haven't been banned by those hackers that teleport you around the map but there are hackers everywhere online. Don't even get me started about the scamming community.In conclusion stay away from GTA unless you like fat cats who expect YOU to charge $60.00 for a negative experience.

review: ***UPDATE*****************************************************************************************I take it back. While this game is incredible in a general sense they actually have banned many MANY innocent people. The support is nonexistent and they force you into public lobbies that are full of cheaters in order to do any of the new content. These cheaters can do everything from impersonating you to get you banned to taking all your money away. I have no incentive to come back because I could lose everything I've worked and paid for in one session due to the negligence of the people supporting the game.The decision to not have dedicated servers and therefore no decent anticheat has ruined possibly the best game I've ever played. Then compound that with forcing you to play with cheaters to do any new content and it becomes a heartbreaking mess.******************************************************************************************************This is one of the best most detailed games to come out in recent memory. It is definitely worth the money.I only really have two negative things to say about it. One is that money is slow to acquire in online play and vehicles/houses/etc are really expensive. This is of course intended to sell shark cards. Two is that online public servers very often have cheaters in them and R* did very little for a long time to combat them. However recently they have started to crack down somewhat at least on the money cheaters.Because of this crackdown many people have recently claimed to have been banned falsely from GTA online. While false positives may be possible I suspect some of these "false" bans are for legitimate reasons that the players may not have known about. Any number of bad behaviors can get you banned outside of using actual cheat programs. If you are on the fence about buying the game you shouldn't need to worry about a ban if you do the following (NOTE this is just my opinion after having 550 hours played I could definitely be wrong) Don't cheat. This one is obvious.Don't have people power level you or get you "quick" money. They will use cheats/exploits and get you banned. This one is also obvious.Don't use anything that modifies the game files while you are connected to R*'s servers. One common mod that got people banned early on was a mod that changed their FOV. While this seems innocent it is against the TOS. If you use single player mods you need to do some special things to keep from them being active during multiplayer. You'll need to google that and use them at your own risk.Don't purposely gain money/levels from someone who is obviously cheating. If another player is firing millions of dollars at you out of a chain gun instantly leveling you up etc leave the session and don't spend it. Report it to R*. I have a friend who had a hacker dump a small amount of money on him and he spent it. He got a two week ban months later.Don't exploit. If you find something in game that lets you gain experience or money at a much higher rate than normal methods don't keep using it. This includes player created game modes.Don't be horrifically offensive to other players. Blowing people up is fine but try to contain any bigoted tirades.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I apologize if my review is a little long winded but I had alot to talk about particularly my concerns about Grand Theft Auto Online. SummaryGrand Theft Auto V is the third installment (after Grand Theft Auto Episodes from Liberty City and Grand Theft Auto IV) in the HD Universe era. The story is about two bank robbers named Michael De Santa and Trevor Phillips. After a failed robbery attempt in North Yankton they seperate from each other and relocate to Los Santos. Events in the game unfold after Michael pulls down a Mexican Drug Lord's house and he is forced to rob a Jewellery Store with his new protege Franklin Clinton. Initially believing Micheal to be dead Trevor realizes that Michael is still alive and leaves Blaine County to confront Michael in Los Santos. The trio then build up their resources in order to do "The Big One" which is to raid the Union Depository.When I saw the gameplay trailers for Grand Theft Auto V the gameplay reminded me a bit of Max Payne 3 except you don't shootdodge and you don't have the ability to slow down time except for Michael being able to slow down time as his special ability. The narrative flows very well the vehicles are easy to handle and the three characters are very easy to connect to. My personal favorite is Trevor because of how bat crazy he is. Overall I believe the Campaign was enjoyable and I'd play it again in a heartbeat.The multiplayer aspect (Grand Theft Auto Online) however is completely ing poor. Granted I initially liked the idea of the type of concepts they put into the multiplayer you know being able to pay for your weapons vehicles and property but the idea of Grand Theft Auto Online and the features that came with it wasn't executed very well at all and as a result you have this big gigantic bloated mess. You have servers that you connect to that are very low quality and poor even when you have high speed internet. It should NEVER be a chore to find a fully functional lobby with low amounts of ping. Another issue I have with Grand Theft Auto Online is the "bad sport" system. What this does is that if you are being a bad sport you get put into a bad sport lobby and you would be unable to play with friends who don't have the bad sport status and if you blow up other players vehicles you are automatically labelled as a bad sport and you go to a bad sport lobby. I'm sorry if it's an offence to blow up the vehicles of attacking players then what the is the point of having anti vehicle weapons such as Rocket Launchers Sticky Bombs and Miniguns? Not using anti vehicle weapons against another player who is attacking me whilst driving a vehicle would put me and other players at a huge disadvantage. Not only that but blowing up the vehicles of other players was allowed in Grand Theft Auto IV EFLC and previous installments in the 3D Universe. Just the fact that you can't blow up hostile vehicles gives a very big indicator that a big componet is missing from the core game. I know this is something that Rockstar can't fix but the community is so polluted with toxicity. A lot of players would rather be instead of being cooperative. I also keep hearing talks about "Oh 1 m so going to haxor u" and people discussing how to hack the game. For those types of people I have a suggestion Play the game the way it's mean't to be played!. Other than those types of people a lot are antisocial and they also make death threats. Nobody wants a community this toxic but unfortunately it still happens. Next up is microtransactions. I strongly condemn any publisher or developer if they use microtransactions. The Microtransactions that GTA Online uses are Shark Cards. This allows you to spend real money to get in game money. If you are like me and you won't purchase any microtransactions you'll notice that you will have a very hard and long time to progress your character buy some cool and purchase expensive properties. I feel that Rockstar is putting a very strong emphasis on Shark Cards and it doesn't allow players who just want to play the game the way it's mean't to be to progress as fast as those who purchase Shark Cards. This is a toxic game development practice that needs to stop as it's not good for the game industry at all. Not only that but if you buy Shark Cards it can be easily manipulated by hackers and cheaters which leads to my next issue and this is the one that has stopped me from playing Grand Theft Auto Online all together. With a multiplayer that has microtransactions and has an MMO type of ranking system you would think that Rockstar would be able to include decent anti cheat software. But duh no! They didn't include anything to combat cheating at all. The only thing that they included was a report system and they encourage players to get a ticket with Rockstar Support and contact them. Most of the time these reports don't do much to fight cheaters who would exploit. They just continue doing what they are doing and go on with their merry day. At least Garry's Mod and other Source games have the VAC Anti Cheat to keep cheaters off of multiplayer why not include something like that Rockstar? The game has been out for three years and Rockstar still doesn't have anything decent to defend their own servers. Lately I've heard that exploiters can now manipulate other player's progress not just their in game money and weapons anymore. They can take away your vehicles your apartments they can also derank you and they can prevent you from leaving a game session. I feel that GTA Online is now unplayable and it is not worth it to play it but I don't think Rockstar seems to give a because they would rather profit from Shark Cards rather than create a multiplayer mode that is safe sustainable and fun to play on. I am so glad I stopped playing online.Pros+Nice Open World.+Story narrative flows well.+Interesting Characters.+Fast and Fluid gameplay.Cons No Anti Cheat system. The Bad Sport system is severely flawed. Microtransactions are included in GTA Online. The community is toxic. Poor quality game servers. Terrible multiplayer. Johnny Klebitz could of had a bigger role.ConclusionI will admit the single player is still fun to play and this is a great game and I am still going to recommend this but the multiplayer makes this very hard for me to recommend. Due to this I cannot in good conscience agree that this would be eligible to be a game of the year. I have heard that Rockstar is already in the process of making Grand Theft Auto VI. They better fix their multiplayer for the next installment if they expect to keep the franchise profitable and to keep the trust of their fans. I'd say buy this when the game becomes cheaper because at it's current price you aren't getting a very good deal.

review: Note I haven't played the online mode at all yet. This is simply for the single player.Are you white and want to play a black guy? Are you black and want to play a crazy white hillbilly? Do you like to steal Welcome to GTA V. The world is your oyster shell or there is a story in there some place. Do whatever you in want.The good + Good tutorials for teaching you the game. In depth tutorials and challenges for things like flying.+ A good cast of main characters that have some depth.+ A good supporting cast of secondary characters.+ A good variety of missions and things to do. Outside of driving things don't feel really repetitive.+ Good major missions that are challenging.+ Heists. They can be played 2 different ways so it gives a bit of replay value.+ Solid graphics.+ Rock solid performance. Don't think the game crashed once. No real issues.+ Lots of humor. Many LOL moments.+ Action adventure misfortune and triumph.+ Satisfying ending albeit a bit short.+ Good selection of music and great extra radio content.The bad Parts of the story are hit or miss. Some transitions are very sudden it feels like the game was meant to be much longer and cuts where made. Still took 35 hrs to finish one play though. The games controls can show you keyboard controls when using a game pad if for example on the Steam controller you set up your trackpads to be a mouse rather than a joystick. It creates a super confusing interface. Would be nice to just set what instruction set you want. Parts of the game are really only enjoyable after completing the last major mission when you have millions of dollars. If you use a car that is not your characters default car on a mission it will often simply disappear after missions. It makes you feel ripped off if you tricked it out. It would be nice to be able to just change the characters main vehicle on demand. Some parts of the game are just fluff like the stock market. It's a cool idea but it just doesn't seem to add much to the game except an occasional boost of currency. Awkward save system. World is smaller than it seems.4/5 rating worth the price of admission.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Will play a bit more to find anythig else but otherwise nice work Rockstar totally worth the wait.

review: Its a great game but its hard to say if i can reccomend this game and heres why The single player experience is superb. Filled with the right ammounts of serious drama comedy and much more. With beautiful graphics even on low to mid tier hardware the cutscenes make the game look like a movie. You'll enjoy the lengthy activities especially if you're a completionist. Mod support is decent but not needed at all to have a great experience. The attention to detail makes this game rival games of even other genres as well. Sadly however thats where my praise ends. The game's multiplayer is the wild west with pay to win microtransactons and pay to do anything at all honestly. 2k seems to put more effort into the multiplayer DLC rather than put anymore effort into the games single player. There was even once plans for single player DLC however 2k figured theyd profit off of multiplayer DLC. Normally I wouldnt be bothered by this but the multiplayer is a shared open world enviroment where if you spend money on these microtransactions mind you these are very very expensive microtransactions you wont have much fun especially doing the multiplayer co op missons. Theres plenty of other games like this that will give you as much if not more of a fun experience without these malicious microtransactions blocking your paths of having fun. To a dedicated gamer who's adapted to this kind of market yes i can reccomend it but thats a very small reccomendation. To the average consumer/gamer which is what this review is intended towards I would not reccomend it even for its discounted price even if you can find it cheaper elsewhere.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
